Title: I traveled here in August of 2019. I would typically fly every year of my 26 years of life to visit. This time, they lost ONLY my luggage out of 6 other bags (which happened to have a lot of new and expensive gifts for family members). I was stuck in morocco for 3 weeks wearing my brothers clothing and had to buy clothing for myself. (Which they never reimbursed me for). After a lot of time going back and forth to get them to acknowledge my lost luggage, agreeing to only pay $400 USD (well over 2k in my luggage). They have actually been completely ignoring all of my emails for the last 2 years. I am finally going to take them to small claims court and get my tiny $400. For me, it is the fact that they have been blatantly ignoring me, thinking that I will get tired of emailing and just forget about it so they dont have to pay me. Nope. See you in court! NEVER bring any checked luggage with anything of value on your flight unless you want it to disappear.

Title: I am so disappointed in the service I have received from Royal Air Maroc. They cancelled mine and 3 of my friends' flights from Malaga to Marrakech in March 2020. Despite having to chase them at least once a week we are yet to receive a refund of our plane fares as we have been promised for the past two years. The customer service whilst polite is unacceptable as all they do is send an email to their accounts team and nothing gets done. I have had no explanations as to why my funds have not been returned, it seems as if they are waiting for me to get bored and forget about the refund. When you are due over 600 euros it is just not going to happen. I would definitely not book a flight with this airline again, other airlines are much more responsive and helpful and don't try and retain funds that are not theirs to keep.

Title: My 1st flight sat on the tarmac for 50 mins, so I missed my connecting flight and had to wait in Casablanca for 24 hours. The agent at the gate took my passport and gave it back to the wrong person. I lost my passport for 3 hours. The agent at baggage service yelled at me because she didn’t want to do her job and retrieve my bags that were practically sitting in front of the room. I had to pull my bags out or else I don’t have any clothes and toiletries. I asked for her name or employee id #, so I could file a complaint. She refused and kept yelling at me even louder. Horrendous attitudes for someone working in customer service. Then they lost one of my 3 checked bags. All this in one trip. I missed an event of which I was the host and got in troubles at work because of this delay. Also no wifi onboard (not even paid wifi). No apologies from them so far. No compensation whatsoever. I’m a frequent flyer (15+ international  flights a year). I’ll never fly with them again and strongly recommend others not to. That was the first and the last. Minus -10 stars if this website allows. Title: I flied back and forth to Cairo in October and november 2022.  I was impressed by the quality of the flights.  On time,  service is the best I ever had on flights.  The  planes are new,clean and comfortable.  The attendants kind and helpful. The food is good.  They give cushion, cover and earphones. Title:
I booked our flights and THEN read all these terrible reviews, and I must say, I was petrified but our experience was not so bad. I will list Pros and Cons but first a few disclaimers: we did NOT check any luggage, so I cannot verify for this aspect, and we did NOT eat any of the meals, as we got to the airport super early and decided to pay for a lounge at the airport. I highly recommend this! Most airports have the option to buy in to the lounge for about $50/person if you're not a member already, and it's worth it. All the food and drinks you want, relaxing atmosphere and even showers. So we weren't hungry for the flight and it was a great start to vacation.

Pros:
This airline is the only one that offers a quick flight to Marrakech. All of our friends had insanely long layovers in Paris or Madrid from the States, and we flew directly to Casablanca with a 1 hour layover and easily made it to our 50 min. flight to RAK. This alone made the airline worth it.
All of our flights (JFK-Casablanca-Marrakech and reverse) left on time or within 15 mins.
The airplane was NOT filthy as other reviewers emphasized. I brought wipes just in case but did not use them.
The flight attendants were friendly enough. I've had way ruder on Lufthansa and Delta.
Our request for bulkhead or exit row when we checked in at the airport was accommodated each time. And thank goodness because.....

Cons
The seats are UNBELIEVABLY narrow. My husband is 6'5 and built like a linebacker and no way could he have sat in any other row. I was in the middle seat in our exit row and his arm was in my lap, as was the stranger in the aisle seat. I had 2 men leaning on me the whole time. There will always be a middle seat on these planes. You will have people touching you. I am 5'4 and 120 and I barely fit. BOOK THE EXIT ROW.
The bathrooms close to us ran out of toilet paper about 5 hours into a 7 hour flight. Both directions.
There is not a lot of service. I got up to go back and ask for water and the flight attendant told me "It's coming" only to wait an hour. Bring your own drinks for sure.
The other passengers were stressed out boarding and debarking, freaking out about connections, etc. I think this is just passengers flying these days however. The attendants basically ignored them, but I wish they would command more order and calm during these times.

So to wrap up, upgrade to first class if you're large or paranoid about touching others, but ABSOLUTELY get an exit row or the bulkhead. It will make all the difference. Bring your own water. Pack lightly so you're not stressed out (you don't need a lot in Morroco anyway...it's hot and just handwash your clothes)
The almost direct flight alone is good enough reason that I'd definitely book with them again.
crvsd: Daisy T. wrote a review Nov 9
qwuub: Not as terrible as these reviews!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were flying from Marrakech to Cairo through Casablanca on Royal Air Maroc (RAM). I read enough bad reviews of the airline to consider driving from Marrakech to Casablanca, just to avoid any problems with the first leg of the flight. But given that we had a 3-hour layover in Casablanca, I figured that we could tolerate a delay on the first leg.

Silly me. The flight to Casablanca was delayed about 3 hours, resulting in us missing the flight to Cairo. RAM rebooked us on a flight about 10 hours later, an overnight flight rather than the daytime flight that we were supposed to be on. We therefore missed (forfeited) a nonrefundable night in a nice hotel in Cairo at a cost of over $500 for two rooms. Furthermore, RAM didn't put out luggage on that flight, even though they had 10 hours to do so. We were in Cairo for one day then flew to Luxor for the next two. They wouldn't deliver the luggage to Luxor so we didn't get it until returning to Cairo. That's four days wearing the same clothes. Then it took 2-3 hours in the Cairo airport with Egyptair Baggage Services to get our luggage, just so we could have it for the last half day before returning to the US.

Avoid this airline. I'm sure that things go well most of the time, but they can go very badly more often than with most other airlines.
qwuub: Delayed flight, missed connection, and no luggage for 4 days
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Strengths:
-Usually you get a layover in Casablanca, and if you do, stay in Four Seasons. It will change your life.
-If business class isn't filled up, they charge ~$750 for upgrade to biz class, but you can only do it within 24 hours. Thats an amazing price compared to other airlines who charge thousands

Weaknesses:
-Their computer system isn't connected with their telephone customer service representatives. Usually you have to call an agent over and over to get the right answer. These people aren't trained properly, not to mention the constant static when trying to speak with someone.
-An agent will say biz class is full, but if go online it will say it is available -- and it usually is available
-My wife and I tried purchasing biz class (last minute). My wife got upgraded and even though I paid for my upgrade, for some reason it didn't go through. I asked agents at the ticket counter but they kept telling me it was full. Half of my family was flying business class. They told me they saw 6 empty biz class seats. What is 6X750? $4500. Now extrapolate that to the nth degree for all flights under RAM. Thats how much money RAM is losing daily because of their ineffective and inefficient systems.

Bottom Line... Will I continue to fly RAM?

Sadly... yes. The flight isn't bad. Some of the comments below are a little exaggerating. But at the end of the day, if I can pay $750 for an upgrade to biz class, compared to the thousands I would have to pay at United, its worth the gamble for me.
crvsd: Omar F wrote a review Oct 2022

Title:
What a shambles of an airline. A true score of 0. Our flight to Casablanca was 45 minutes late boarding (no real issue with that), we then sat on the tarmac for 2.5hrs. Little or no explanation and when any announcement was made it was first in Arabic with then a limited announcement in English, after 2.5hrs of waiting on the plane the flight was cancelled, reason - apparently that due to Gatwick airport issues, this had caused the pilot to run out of flying hours. Many of our fellow passengers mainly Moroccans told us that this was not an unusual occurrence with RAM. We then had to disembark, go through emigration, collect our luggage and head back to the check-in desk. We were then each given a food voucher for M&S Food and then had to wait to be allocated a hotel for the night. We were lucky, but some passengers were allocated rooms in hotels at Heathrow, while other passengers opted to sleep on the floor at Gatwick. Overnight we received an email advising us to be back at Gatwick by 5am for an 8am flight.

Having queued from 5am for 2 hours at check-in finally someone appeared only to tell us he was only there to issue vouchers for breakfast and knew nothing about the flight, so don’t ask. My partner put a comment up on twitter about the time we were waiting to check-in, which got a comment from Gatwick airport that check-in’s open 3 hours before a flight, totally missing the point.
The pilot and aircrew then appeared but just seemed to be amused by our predicament, even when some Moroccan passengers spoke to them in Arabic, they gave the appearance of not our problem. At 7:30am check-in started for an 8am flight, the boarding cards had no flight time and when we tried to go through immigration the barriers remained firmly closed, so over 150 passengers had to queue up to go through the manual barrier. By 11:30am we were once again sitting on the plane, but the luggage still hadn’t been loaded. While we waited the crew just ignored us, and no offer was made of even a drink. Finally, at 1pm the luggage was loaded and the flight eventually took off around 1:30pm. During the whole flight unless you asked, no food or drink was provided and then only water or beer and a bread roll. The toilets were dirty and smelly, no attempt was made by the crew to clean them, and the crew just sat up the back of the plane avoiding the passengers. The only passengers who were looked after were the 3 in business class. When we landed the crew thanked us for our custom and hoped to see us soon on another flight, you can guess the reaction that got……..

Since the flight we have had emails from their customer services team, the first to say they would look into any compensation claim and the second asking for a review of their service. I will update my review if we get anywhere.
crvsd: Peter R wrote a review Sep 2022
qwuub: An absolute shambles of an airline

Title: We have taken numerous airlines to Europe and back and yesterday we experienced one of the worst flights  back to the US.  It starts with the booking process. No order whatsoever. Everyone just storms the gate causing major delays getting on the plane. Next came the seats which were so close everyone was in pain most of the 8 plus hour flight. The seat cushions have little to no padding I ended up sitting on my pillow and blanket. Next, nothing on the plane worked. The USB ports for both us would not work, my wife's entertainment system did not work and the choices of movies and shows are 30 years old..  I could not put my seat back and the guy in front of me put his all the way back giving me even less room.  I saw one guy in the last row who could not recline his seat.  He was a tall guy whose head was higher than his seat.  His head had to rest on a piece of metal behind his seat.  He tried putting his pillow behind him and looked really upset. The food was horrible. Tuna fish sandwiches as a snack that most people didn't eat. The bathrooms were disgusting by the end of the trip.  No crew monitor their condition and toilet paper ran out and diapers were on the floor.  By the time we landed we felt as if we were beaten up with sore backs and pains.  Avoid this airline for long haul flights.

Title: I do not even understand how anyone can say this is a decent airline and why no one is talking about how filthy the planes are.  I flew them twice - from Cairo to Casablanca and then Casablanca to the U.S.  Both flight experiences were awful.  Both flights had planes that were absolutely disgusting.  There were visible stains, dirt, and grime on all surfaces.  The tray tables had visible stains and were not cleaned.  The lavatories did not look like they had ever been cleaned.  There was clear build-up of grime from what looks like years of not cleaning the interior of the plane.  The food was not edible at all.  On one flight, there was no vegetarian option at all, which didn't matter because the food was terrible.  On the almost 6-hour flight from Cairo to Casablanca, there was no in-flight entertainment.  On the flight from Casablanca to the U.S., the in-flight entertainment was not working in several of the seats (either not working at all or the sound not working).  The flight attendant said he would reset the system but that did not happen.  Also the seat pockets were all torn and you could see dirt and debris inside them.  Oh, and I cannot forget to mention that the ground crew in Cairo did not bother to put my luggage (and several other passangers' luggage) on the plane to Casablanca!  I had a direct flight with no transfers!!!  And of course, customer service was not helpful with retrieving my luggage, which eventually I did get.The planes need some serious deep cleaning.  I could not wait to get off the plane because it was so gross.  What happened to cleaning and disinfecting the planes for COVID protocols?!  I am giving one star because the staff were average - not exceptional but not terrible.  Otherwise, I would give RAM a zero.

Title:
This is honestly the worst airline to travel if you have kids. This is especially true for the return flight leaving Casablanca. It is already established that it takes so long between walking in through the aeroport doors (luggage scan queues) and reaching the boarding gate (security and immigration). But Royal Air Maroc managed to make this worse:

1- Once your reach the check in counter areas, RAM has a first passport checks to ensure you are a the right place, here people with their luggage have to form a long single queue managed by two employees only. This the first fail point because the line goes out into the open space where all the airport users are walking. It goes without saying that many people ended up cutting the line depending on which side they ended up approaching.

2- Once you clear this first line, you end up queueing at the checkin counters without possibility to leave or your have to go through fail point 1 again. Parents, like us, picked one of the 5 or 6 lines and settled our luggage and kids waiting for our turn. The wait is notoriously long but that isnt the issue. After 20 mins of waiting, the issue started when the RAM agent handling our line decided to cut the line in half and asked us to move to the other lines because "she was done for the day". The line was already long and people got obviously upset because logically it is easier to just replace the agent at the counter with one who is just starting their shift rather than move 20+ parents, kids and their luggage. This where we realized that other checkin counters where opened up and many people behind us ended up at the front of these new queues. This is all exacerbated because by kids becoming restless, neededing a snack or potty. This fail point 2. It is worth noting that this checkin was handling 3 US flights at the same time leaving within an hour of each other. We ended up waiting for an hour and 20 mins to get boarding passes.

3- After an emergency toilet break for everyone, we made our way through security and immigration, to my surprise this was the easiest part of the whole experience. It took us less than 15mins because they had enough staff and enough passport control agents to make the process faster. We stopped for a half an hour lunch and made our way to RAM fail point 3. We boarded at gate A10 which managed by ONE SOLE RAM agent. Only one agent was handling 100+ people. At this point we had to get rid of our waters (the notorious preboard security check for US flights) so between getting on the plane and being able to ask for water for kids took 1 hours plus.

4- This is not a fail point but rather some stupid decision. Because, of the delays with boarding and issues with seating configurations once onboard (there was one fight between two ladies about middle seats this middle seats that) the flight took off late and somehow they decided that it was better to get us to JFK 45mins early...now once we got to the US and we landed! There was nowhere for the plane to go because there was still a flight at the assigned gate. Bathrooms were closed a good 40 mins before landing and we had to wait on land for 30 mins without any access to bathrooms or water. Many kids were crying restless and everyone was super tired. It was the worst decision to make at that point in time to actually land early.

After arrivals, we had to wait a long while for luggage but that was nothing new or unexpected.

Bottom line, this airline does not account for the wellbeing of kids at any point during your interaction with them. It's one thing to treat grown ups as cattle but it is rather absurd to expect under 10 years old to be patient for something delayed because of sheer incompetence.
qwuub: Worst Airline If You Have Kids

Title:
How this airline can continue to operate is beyond me! They should be totally ashamed of themselves! The promotional videos playing constantly state they are customer service based, & that they pride themselves on delivering the best in the airline industry - this is laughable, & the polar opposite!

The flight from Fes to Casablanca was delayed for over an hour with NO EXPLAINATION as to why, & with no apology... Making the connecting flight to Tunisia impossible...

Upon arriving at Casablanca, the only flight on that day was 7.5-hours later! Again, with no explaination or apology, we were all simply pointed into a room, new boarding passes/tickets were issued, & that was that! It was not until another man asked about breakfast/lunch/or even a drink, that the remaining people like myself (who had not yet figured out what to do or where to go) waited for a response... Begrudgingly, the woman told him in Arabic to go to the Oasis Lounge...

Upon arriving at the Oasis Lounge, the same man had to argue our case to be let in!!! After a heated phone call, the sour-faced woman finally did let us all in... There was nothing but coffee available & a few lounges left to get some rest on...

The same man argued something in Arabic, & finally, the woman handed over our bit of paper to us, whereby it stated we were eliguble to get breakfast from a fast food place upstairs... This was to sustain us until our flight that night (that departed an hour late, again with no explaination!)

The 'breakfast' consisted of x1 VERY SMALL water, x1 small burnt coffee, & x1 dry tasteless croissant!!!
Since leaving Fes medina at 2am for the 5.30am flight departure that actually departed at 6.48am no food or drink was available at the closed Fes airport cafes... No in-flight food or drink was supplied either... So because we had no Moroccan money left (as we were leaving) & no one accepted credit card, we were left with NOTHING to drink until we arrived in Tunisia that night at 1am!!!!!!

Royal Air Maroc has absolutely nothing 'royal' about it to offer! They should be disgusted with their lack of customer service!!! Seriously, this is only the basics of how bad things were!

I would strongly recommend using any other airline in place of this mickey-mouse, shambles of an airline!!!

Title:
QUICK SUMMARY OF ADVICE:

Even if AirMaroc has the cheapest option for your travel, opt for a more reputable airline as you will not get your money back for years, if at all, even if AirMaroc cancels your flight!

HOW I LEARNED THE ABOVE:

I bought a flight from Dulles Airport in Washington, DC to Carthage, Tunis in early 2021. As I was gearing up to depart, AirMaroc sent an email saying that the second leg of my flight (layover in Morocco) was cancelled and automatically rebooked for me....3 days after my first leg arrives in Morocco. My 4-hour layover had turned into a 72-hour layover. This didn't work at all, so I called AirMaroc to cancel the flight. The Customer Service agent tried to convince me to keep the flight and "spend some time in Morocco and see the sights", but given COVID-19 I wouldn't really be able to anything other than hunker down in the hotel that *I* would have to book.

She finally let me cancel the flight, but said I would receive travel credit. If I didn't use that travel credit in 12 months, then I could get it refunded in cash. Fine, I said -- I'll wait a year and submit the refund (seems kind of crazy that they cancelled my flight and now want me to wait a year to receive my money back, but whatever).

A year went by.

I submitted my refund request in February 2022, and it has now been four months that I am waiting for them to give me back my money. I have jumped through a crazy number of hoops (***including giving them my banking information???***) and I have yet to receive my money. I have sent many emails to AirMaroc to which I never received any response. I then resorted to calling Customer Service, and by now have called at least 10 times to request an update -- every time I receive no information other than "it is being processed."

Simply put, four months is an unacceptable period of time for refund processing.

I understand that there is a lot of work, but I cannot accept that there has been so much work that a customer should wait four months to receive a refund. As such, the logical conclusion is that AirMaroc does not intend to return the money that rightfully belongs to me.

I highly advise anyone thinking of flying with AirMaroc to avoid the company. I initially booked them because they were the cheapest, but booking with them has turned out to be far more expensive than if I had just booked with a reputable company in the first place.

Learn from my mistake: choose to do give your business to reputable airlines that care about their customers.

qwuub: Complete Lack of Organization and Extremely Slow Administration

Title:
I booked a ticket (10/16/21) to see my boyfriends family for the holidays. I was set to depart on 12/23/21 and they cancelled the flight on 12/14/21 due to "covid" and did not offer any protection on another airline even though other airlines were flying. I had to buy a very expensive late purchase ticket on British Airways. I think they must not have had a full flight so they canceled and kept everyones money because refund they promised never came. When I called the 7-10 days turned into 30, then 30 more when I called again, and so on. By the time I realized this was a scam and called Bank of America to dispute the Visa charge in early April, the bank said it was past 60 days and they would not help me (slimy move on their part!)
The reservation line at Royal Air Maroc is not working (it cut the call when I press that option). The refund option goes to a "general mail box" that is full and the U.S. number for their Florida office is no longer in service. I think I'm screwed but don't let this happen to you!.
I paid $1055 for this ticket ~ no small sum for a teacher! I had to pay $2400 for my late purchase BA ticket so this has really hurt me financially. I really want to warn people not to use this airline.

Title:
Royal Air Maroc absolutely exceeded my expectations. Better than any US domestic or European airline I have flown.
Both ways the planes were spotless. Entertainment systems worked well. Only complaint was that natural English language for movies was very hushed so I felt it was hard to hear.
Where they excelled was food and drink service. Very efficient and the food was much better than normal airline meals. I ordered a gluten free meal in advance, I actually forgot I had done it, but it was delivered prior to regular meal service. Very quick service and I loved the tea and coffee service.
Economy seats were comfortable and, relative to competitors, pretty roomy. My only suggestion would be to offer a premium economy or larger leg room section.
Much better than I expected and I wouldn’t hesitate to fly with them again.
crvsd: Andrew K wrote a review May 2022

Title: After reading dozens for negative reviews about Royal Air Marco,  from lost luggage, flight delays, flight cancellations, poor service, lack of lounges and a hard to use mobile app, I was reluctant to fly with them.  Yesterday was either an exception or else Royal Air Marco gets very poor press.  Other than having to change terminals from Terminal 5 to 2 in London, things could not have been better.  Once on board Sara our cabin attendant was a dream.  She recommended Moroccan delights for our meal which was 1st class and to local Moroccan wines.  Our appetizer included perfectly smoke Salmon, with Moroccan Potato Salad.  Order the Beef Tagine if they offer it to you.  You will be amazed with the flavors.   My wife picked her brain about where to shop and for what.  Once again Sara was amazing.  This young woman made our 3.5 hour flight fun.  He eyes sparkled when she talked about Morocco and all there is to do there. Flight 3474 from LHR to CMN has 12 business class seats (very average 737).  Our flight was on time leaving and arriving.  Our luggage was waiting for us once we got through Passport control.  We parked away from jetways so we had to be transported to the terminal.  Business class had a very nice coach to take us to the terminal.  Everyone else took typical airport transport buses.  We had people help us with loading our carryon luggage while those in economy had to fend for themselves.American Airlines adding them to OneWorld at least for us was perfect.  I am writing today to help fix a very bad picture of this airline.  Sure there are language issues.  Knowing a little French helps.  Being patient and knowing these times for travel are still far from normal will go a long way.Cruiser Deluxe
qwuub: Unexpected Gem (traveling is becoming fun again)
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The airline itself is fine.  I had an ordinary budget airline experience although the price was much higher than other airlines, so I would consider other carriers next time.  Most of the staff is very friendly, professional and a joy to interact with.  I have no real complaints about customer service other than long hold time when I had to call a few times due to changes related to COVID (government mandated) flight cancelations last year.  The other passengers are what made it a challenging experience at times and I am always stunned by lack of basic manners from fellow travelers.  At any rate, that is not the RAM's fault, but it seemed like keeping the plane clean for example (aisles & bathrooms) were difficult for the RAM staff.  It was quite unpleasant at times as a passenger if you had to use the restroom.  There were also way too many people allowed to walk around and and also stand in your already limited space throughout the flight. Not my first choice, but would not be terrible if I had to fly with RAM again although I'd try to upgrade or at least choose a better seat and one closer to the front of the plane.

Title:
We understood COVID would strain customers and staff. But Royal Air Maroc is incomprehensibly terrible across all fronts. In peak times, the phone lines (there are multiple) will keep hanging up on you with no reasoning. We had to call dozens of times.

The representatives were mostly rude and unhelpful. If you make them angry they give up and refuse to offer service. We thought this was just the phone line, but when we finally flew, we found it was their attitude at both Fez and Marrakech. When faced with a problem they will send you anywhere else and do anything but help you.

The planes themselves are really uncomfortable. It was terribly hot both ways — sweating against my neck rest and unable to sleep hot. The TV’s across our entire section were glitched, and even after a reset, you had to spend the next 7 hours refreshing the movie every 3 minutes since it defaulted back to the Home Screen.

Several times, I clicked the button for assistance. Just water, all I wanted was water!!! All times, no assistant came; the blue light stayed that way for over half an hour and was automatically turned off after being ignored by staff.

Terrible airline run by terrible people who don’t want to be there and don’t want you to be there. Please save yourself the stress, it’s not worth whatever money you think you’ll save since if something goes wrong you eat the cost and pay extra.

I called during my lunch break one day, and the woman on the phone told me that our refund request had never been processed. My husband immediately completed the form again. It's been two weeks, and we still have not received a refund.

I tried calling the customer service number during my lunch break today. I tried calling 11 times. No one answered, and they kept ending the call. I've never had so many issues contacting an airline and getting a refund. This is the worst customer service/support that I have ever experienced with an airline.
crvsd: Emily O wrote a review Dec 2021
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Pure, literal hell. Unlike anything I've experienced before. Makes subsaharan African airlines look like Virgin Atlantic.

My itinerary was Barcelona -> Casablanca -> JFK. The flight itself was like a Marrakesh gypsy market. Seemingly unattended children coughing, crying and sneezing for 8 hours. Absolutely no masks worn and 0 enforcement attempts. The whole plane is a Covid superspreader event. Seats so small you couldn't stand up unless someone else did on either side of you. If the person in front of you leans back in their chair, your tray essentially collapses so you better not be eating at the time. Sound does not work on the entertainment system. No alcohol served, obviously. Terrible food. Rude/confused staff that throw things at you, like broken headphones, when you're sleeping. Limited ability for the crew to communicate in Spanish, English or French. The layover in Casablanca was supposed to be 50 minutes but was more like 15 so crazy running through the gates and then 3 rounds of security (the security being a teenager lazily unzipping your bag). Untrained pilot guaranteed a turbulent landing that sounded like we crashed into the ground.

Maybe this flight was a parody, a social experiment for how much abuse people are willing to take to save $300 on a Transatlantic flight. Never again. Do not punish yourself like this.
qwuub: Royal Air Morac is a descent into hell.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I chose to fly Air Maroc to Morocco because it is the only airline that flies direct from the United States to Morocco. I had a business class ticket, but the check-in was so incompetently handled that it took much longer than economy passengers to complete the process. The staff was unfriendly on top of being incompetent. There was hardly any service on board. You basically pay for the flat-bed seat, but the food and service were similar to economy class. There was no menu for the meals, no drinks when you board (not even similes), no blanket unless you demand it. The seat belt sign was on during the entire flight even though there was no turbulence, and as such everyone was told to never use the toilet. I think this airline has some kind of monopoly on the air routes to Morocco and hence they don't care.

Title:
After the COVID lock down ceased in 2020, I bought a ticket from Nigeria to Manchester, to attend my grandma's funeral. My flight was initially changed, which is normal, considering all that was happening, but later on I received an email that the my flight had been cancelled by air maroc.
I didn't have an issue with this, I rang several times to reschedule, but was told they had no flights. It took almost two months of calls, before I was given a voucher (EMD-1479800289386), but as I was supposed to be attending my grandma's funeral, I needed to travel to Manchester immediately. Title:
I was traveling back from Morocco to the U.S. I researched all the U.S. entry requirements well in advanced and had gotten a U.S. FDA authorized antigen self kit test with a telehealth representative to verify the testing results. This is accepted under the CDC website to re-enter to the U.S. I bought this test for $35 since I had researched in advance that a test in Morocco costs $70-$120.

When checking in we were refused to check in because they said the U.S. did not accept this test. I tried to show them the U.S. CDC said it’s aceepted but they refused to look. They said the U.S. only accepts PCRs not antigens (I called the airline once back in the U.S. and they told me the airline accepts antigen and PCR for the U.S.).

The thing is, a couple in front of us with the exact same test were accepted… they were in a different line than us and heard our conversation and told us they had the same test. When I told the staff this they denied it… so we almost missed our fight and had to pay $180 to take a taxi and go take a test outside the airport. Both the check-in clerk and manager need to educate themselves with the U.S. covid entry requirements. They were liars and said only PCRs are accepted and denied accepting the same test from a couple on the same fight as us even though that couple showed us their tests which were made by NAVICA and emed lab results.

I will never be traveling with them again. I’d rather pay a premium fee than travel with them. Also, their planes are the most old and dirtiest planes I have ever ridden on. If you wipe the seat, you will see a thick layer of dirt. The only reason I used this airline is because my flight with British airways was cancelled.

Royal air Maroc? There’s not a single thing that feels royal about the airline besides the fact it’s owned by the government…

Title:
I chose RAM to relocate from Morocco to France due to it having a direct, short flight from Casablanca to Bordeaux. I cancelled my previous AirFrance booking that did not have the direct flight and would have necessitated three hours to Paris, a 2.5 hour layover in the airport, and a 1.5 hour flight down to Bordeaux. During pandemic-travel, I chose the shorter route. Due to relocating and having two large and heavy suitcases, I chose to pay for business class for the baggage allowance. Being the "national airline" of a country where I had lived for two years, I wanted to show some support.

The flight : standard flight. Business class attendants were "busy" and really didn't want to be bothered with their passengers past the point of absolute necessity. Yes, it was a short flight and they had food to serve the few business class passengers, and covid forms to give out. Food offering was surprising since it was a short flight of just under two hours, but quality was "I guess something is better than nothing, since I'm hungry".

But to put it succintly...never again, RAM. Even if I have to choose between a short, direct flight and one with another airline that necessitates a longer flight and layover? I'll take the layover -- travel is stressful enough in these days, but after using various airlines and modes of transportation and companies for nearly 60 years, this was not one I ever want to repeat and was a very poor choice on my part.

Title: This was a code share with American Airlines. The seats are pretty cramped together, the food mediocre at best, and the customer service beyond awful. They lost my husbands checked bag and made us go through ridiculous hoops just to file a claim, including sending us to several different people each of whom took forever to write down the simplest information (we even had a photo of it). They were unresponsive to any inquiries, NEVER answer any phone number they give you, and when they did find it 5 days later notified us via email that we would have to pick it up in Casablanca even though we were traveling to other areas of the country. Our American Airlines itinerary from the US to Barcelona got destroyed due to weather in Miami, so AA rebooked us on Royal Air Maroc from JFK to Casablanca to BCN. Fortunately, we were in business class, so when we arrived at JFK we were able to check in with zero wait at the priority line, which was good, because the economy line was INSANE. The boarding process was a bit chaotic, but once we were onboard, we were delighted by the comfortable flatbed seats and restful design choices. The flight attendants were professional and cordial.

We were on RAM's new 787-9 and the seats were among the most comfortable flat-bed seats we've experienced. Many airlines have no footroom when you recline the seat into a bed--it's like sleeping with your feet in a bucket--but RAM's 787-9 gave plenty of room to move your feet and legs. Even better, and more important to me since I tend to run hot, the cabin temperature was reasonable AND there were individual air nozzles that blew cool air. Historically I have found that most non-US airlines keep the cabins warmer than most Americans like, and often don't have personal air vents, so I loved that RAM kept it comfy (and offered nice blankets if you got chilly).

Since the overnight flight is relatively short, I didn't watch any movies, but there was a large selection of TV and films available and the monitors were large and crisp. Dinner was a Moroccan rice dish with chicken that was very good and filling. I don't remember the breakfast, but it was fine.

Unfortunately we missed our connecting flight in Casablanca because a thunderstorm delayed our departure from JFK, so we had about a 6-hour layover. There was a lounge available, but it was somewhat grim, especially downstairs. The upstairs was much better, and the staff up there was friendlier. Downstairs the furniture was all terrible (chic design, unsuitable for human bodies), it was hot, and the staff seemed annoyed that customers existed. The terminal itself was quite nice, with lots of food options, and we passed an hour by getting chair massages.

We'd heard mixed things about connecting through Casablanca, but in our case it was speedy and easy. We had to go through a security checkpoint, but no passport control or customs. Some of the airport staff spoke limited or no English, but fortunately I was able to get by using my college French from 25 years ago.

The flight from CMN to BCN was on a 737 whose interior seemed ancient, but it turns out was only 8 years old. The seats in business were comfortable. There was no entertainment, but it was only a 2-hour flight. Again, the staff was pleasant. Our bags arrived safely in Barcelona.

We would definitely fly RAM again if we could fly business. If you're traveling from the East Coast of the US to Spain, Portugal, or France, a connection in Casablanca actually makes a lot of geographic sense, so consider them next time you're headed to that part of Europe.
qwuub: Business class is amazing; Casablanca lounge needs work
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: First, my wife is disabled, and needed to "register" the wheelchair and battery.  However, never had any confirmations that it was accepted, or even allowed.  On the trip going, my JetBlue fligt was delayed 35 minutes.  Since you can't get boarding passes at jet blue, you must recheck in at RAM, this created an extra step at the airport.  When checking in, they said, since we were late to check in (Really, I was on a connecting flight they booked) they gave up our seats.  We were randomly seated apart from each other, and my wife needs little, but some assistance.  Some nice people rearranged themselves to give us seats next to each other, no help from RAM.  Lastly, on way home, I presented my COVID tests as required by USA law, and they looked at it, told me it was not valid because it was 2 hours too early.  However, USA rules stated, that it's not 72 hours but whole days, starting at midnight.  So I was within 14 hours valid.  She actually told me to call the hospital, which by the way was 4 hours away, and tell them to change the time, other words, alter the test.  Wow.  I asked for a supervisor, and she said, she already asked, and I can't go.  I thought she went to get the supervisor, but she did not, she just left.  I found the supervisor, told her, she looked at my test, and said, she never asked me, and that everything was in order.  She did bring me to the next person, and had them check us in with no issues.  She just walked away form us.....and told us to falsify records.  If I ever fly to Morocco again, I will opt any airline but them.  Even if it means a longer layover.

Title: We had booked a flight to Morocco in April 2020.  As a result of the pandemic, all fights from the U.S. to Morocco were cancelled.  Starting in the spring, we have been trying to obtain a cash refund for our cancelled flights, which its website says is possible (with longer processing time).  For the past six months, we have logged calls to Royal Air Maroc multiple times per month.  A customer service representative says that we can receive a travel voucher, and we explain that we do not want this.  When we press for a cash refund, they say that someone will get back to us.  Ultimately, we receive an automated email response saying that we are eligible for a travel voucher, so we are right back where we started.  We have logged a complaint with the U.S. Department of Transportation, but needless to say, we are incredibly frustrated.  If you expect any type of customer service, avoid Royal Air Maroc.

Title:
NEVER USE RAM. AVOID AT ALL COST.
I booked a flight with RAM from New York to Casablanca, my flight was canceled, and I was never notified.
I had another connecting flight, I arrived at the airport and I was chocked that there was no flights to Casablanca planned for that day so now I am stranded in NY.

when they finally decided to talk to me, they didn’t offer any resolution, didn’t offer any alternative flights, no accommodation, all I got is “well you flight was canceled”.
I was required to bring a covid test that was taken within 72 hours of the flight, because of this sudden cancellation now the test is not valid anymore and I need to take a new one.
of course RAM doesn’t care they got my money now I am on my own and good luck getting anything from them.
Shame on Morocco for running such a scam.
save your money and time, book with a real airline.

Flight Cancellations Policy for U.S Department of Transportation:

If your flight is cancelled and you choose to cancel your trip as a result, you are entitled to a refund for the unused transportation – even for non-refundable tickets. You are also entitled to a refund for any bag fee that you paid, and any extras you may have purchased, such as a seat assignment.

Title:
I had a flight reservations with Royal Air Maroc March 22- April 1.

It’s been almost a month and not heard anything. I emailed them and the email came back saying permanent error. I called them and a recording saying the call cannot be completed. That was the same number I talked through with them. I normally don’t write reviews, but that is not very professional of them. One of the main airlines of Morocco.

I rated them a 1 Star here. They should have an opinion for 0, because I think thats what they deserve for this kind of service.

I would not or can recommend anybody to fly or use them or their services in the future.
I’m sure if it was a US ,European or Asian airlines you’ll be able to communicate with them and take care of this situation.

Title:
My wife had to fly on short notice to visit her father who fell terminally ill... The only available tickets that don't cost a fortune (this happened during the Chritsmas holiday) where with Royal Air Maroc, and having read all the reviews describing how horrible this airline is, I still went ahead and booked because I had no choice. I booked for myself, my wife, a five year old and a 1 year old. The flight from Montreal to Casablanca was not that bad, the flight attendants were all nice and the plane was ok. Then took the next flight to final destination Beirut. There i waited 2 hours for my bags which didn't show up.I made a claim for lost baggage at the airport and gave a phone number and an address. A week and a half later I get a call to go pick the bags from the airport. So, they loose my bags for more than a week, I had to buy baby food, diapers, clothes... AAAAND no compensation AAAAND I have to go pick up the bags. Great.
Vacation over, 10 hours before flight back home, i try online check in... That doesn't work. I google the flight and find that it is cancelled. No one called me, no one notified me, and its almost midnight we were leaving 4 am the next morning and now we are not. Awesome. The next day i call their local office, they tell me I will have to take another flight 3 days later and offer no explanation to why the flight was cancelled, They just "don't know". I waited a couple of hours and did not get any confirmation email. I call back and ask for the confirmation. They send it an hour later but its just for me and the wife. I call again and remind them that i have a 5 year old and a one year old. Finally they send those too. 3 days later I go early to the airport because i want this nightmare to end. First in line for check-in and what do you know there is a problem with the kids seats... although i got a confirmation, somehow there is a problem with the kid's seats. Had to stand there for more than an hour for this to get fixed (with a bored 5 year old and a crying 1 year old).
Will never use this airline again, it is an exercise in futility and torture.
qwuub: My most horrible travel experience so far
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Royal Air Maroc: London to Marrakesh via Casablanca. My worst flight ever. The second was just less than 4 months ago from Miami to Casablanca, with the same problems. First, don’t expect anything from flight and ground crews. They enjoy chatting with each other. All the time. Passengers? Entertainment? Good food, good drinks? Forget it. Second, delays, flight from Casablanca delayed, because we had to wait for other passengers. Hours of waiting. The flight itself took only about 35 minutes. Landing in Marrakesh was late. Third, luggage didn’t arrive. We were assured the company will bring it with the next Royal Air Maroc flight. They did not call. We had to go to the airport as no one picked up the phone. At airport, after hours of waiting. no one able to locate the missing pieces. We called our travel agent, who managed to get someone. Truth luggage on the system but not physically there.
For Miami Casablanca flight the insurance company did its duty. But personal things lost forever. It seems we’re going there again with the same drama. People in Casablanca told us that this happens every day. So avoid flying-overs.
The only thing that was good is that we felt safe and we had some great tea at the airport (fourth, not on board, it was disgusting). Lounge also: food was touched just after using the cellphone. I hope someone responsible out-there reads this and acts accordingly.

Title:
First of all, I would love to inform everyone who has the brilliant idea of flying with this pseudo airline be aware they don't have customer service, their ground-service in JFK is rude and unprofessional since they are so bad they cannot even look customers in their eyes when they answer questions.
I was denied boarding and my luggage at that point became a ghost, there are 2 desks in JFK and they both had different answers about my bags, one desk said my bags were returned to me (never happened) the other desk found my bags flying to Casablanca, nobody asked me to fill a form for my lost luggage, so you can imagine the nightmare when in Rome my bags where nowhere to be found.
I've called twice customer service in Italy and whoever answered had no clue of what customer service is about,
The first time the agent was rude, not even trying to help to fix my problem, the second time I've called the agent was kind enough to explain to me that their customer service in Italy doesn't handle problems with lost luggage, they gave me the number for bag handling in Casablanca, but no answer.
I've sent several emails and only one single answer is written actually by a human being, all the others just a bunch of automated emails saying always the same thing.
No-one answers my emails anymore, so I'm sure I will never get any money back for my lost luggage because they don't have what it takes to be a respected company.
Someone should realize and change the way they manage this business.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The ground staff at check in were very helpful so we thought we were into a good thing, being first timers on Morocco airlines. But, just before take off I watched out the window as baggage handlers must have decided the plane was heavy enough and proceeded to removed our bags from the plane and leave. We got our bags back 2 weeks later!!
The actual flight was full - everyone seemed to have at least 3 pieces of hand luggage so seating took forever. The state of the toilets was absolutely disgusting.
Our trip back to Geneva was even worse when ticketing told us the London staff had used the wrong ticket for the first leg of our trip and our ongoing one had already been used. It took an hour and a half of going through different people, almost having to buy more tickets before someone finally gave in and decided to just fix the problem and get us on the plane. At least we got our luggage this flight....

Title:
So I heard horror stories about this airline after I before I booked! I was pleasantly surprised upon arrival at Dulles. The check in was easy, the baggage allowance was fair and boarding was simple.

The meals weren’t stellar but it worked. Bring some snacks and extra water, if you are particular. The leg room on the flights was comfortable and I’m 5’11. Flight attendants were nice! It was a basic flight, no bells or whistles but got me there safely.. and that’s the most important thing.

No issue with luggage. We stopped in Casablanca for a 13 hour layover. We were offered two meals and a room at a hotel about 20 mins from the airport. We took an air conditioned bus to the hotel, checked in and had more than enough time to explore. Buses took us back to the airport with more than enough time to board the flight.

Long story short, I would fly them again but please don’t look for luxury!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
What a morning! Let alone that checking-in with RAM is slow going generally, but with extra luggage, you get treated like dirt. I was on flight AT 402 to Casablanca and further on with AT 936 to Zurich on 02.01.2020 at the check-in counter No 47 with Mme Assia in service. However it would have been better if she stayed at home in bed at all. She was so unfriendly and not helpful at all that I was close at shouting at her. First of all she did not want to accept my extra luggage. Only after making it clear to her that I am fully aware of having to pay for extra luggage and that it is permitted with RAM to bring extra luggage, she made an effort and vaguely directed her finger into the direction where I could pay for my extra luggage.
It is a shame that ground staff has such a poor attitude to work. Once in the air, the whole flight and service of the crew on the way to Zurich was not bad at all.

Title:
This is the second time I have travelled On this airline, the first time the flight was so late leaving That I missed my connecting flight to Benin and was therefore 24 hours late arriving and missed several meetings.
This time I was in transit to Niamey, Niger. Initially booked to go on a flight from Heathrow, which was switched to an earlier flight going from Gatwick at 11am. The layover in Casablanca was to be over six hours, so I booked to go into the lounge for a 3 hour rest. At 9pm the night before, I received a message to say the flight was put back to 2.30pm. Although annoying to get the information late on, my waiting time in Casablanca would be shorter. On arriving at the airport I discovered at check in it had gone back another hour. The person at check on assured me it was on its way so wouldn’t be any later than that. Checking the internet whilst waiting for the flight, I found to my horror that it had gone back another hour and an hour later, a further 10 mins. My layover time had therefore reduced from over 6 hours to just 50 mins. All without any explanation. As it happened it arrived in Casablanca a little early which gave me 1 hour before my onward flight, which should have been relatively comfortable as it’s not a large airport, but getting through security to the transit area was a nightmare and I ended having to run for my flight and was last to get on the bus to the flight.
Really try to avoid going Royal Air Maroc if you can, particularly in transit. It’s unreliable and they simply don’t seem to be bothered at all about inconveniencing passengers!
crvsd: Charles M wrote a review Jan 2020

Title: It started by our flight being delayed by 3 hours.  After boarding it became apparent that certain people would be given better treatment than others. They were offered water bottles, I had to ask for one for my kids.  Their kids were offered coloring books my kids were completely ignored.  After arriving in Casablanca we exited to get to the transit hotel.  Whoa boy!  We got to the hotel and proceeded to fill out paperwork... And then we waited.  For about 30 minutes in the lobby. We were all exhausted.  The hotel leaves alot to be desired, but it was a bed at least and a shower.  The next bit of our trip was horrid.  The plane was hot... And I mean really uncomfortably hot.  When we finally arrived in Monrovia we found out they had wrapped our bags in plastic, something we don't do because it breaks the wheels off bags... Which it had.  That's two bags now that we will have to replace because of this.  It seemed a good idea to go for the cheap flight.  DON'T!  PAY EXTRA AND FLY A BETTER AIRLINE.  IT IS NOT WORTH IT!

Title:
Travelling to or from Nigeria on air Maroc via Casablanca is a total disaster. The airline has lowered its standards on this route to the lowest it can get. Firstly,there are non existent queues through security for connecting flights. A mass of people competing for space on the floor. Like flocks of sheep..There is hardly any ground personnel to keep order.

They don't stick to the original gate shown most of the time. So passengers have to florick about up and down like yoyos.

Next, You are more likely to miss your luggage than not.My entire luggage of 9 pieces was missing and it took a week to find it. Around a quarter of the passengers were queuing up with me to report missing luggage. The ground staff in Lagos has bad customer service but mostly overwhelmed by angry shouting passages. I learned that the loss of luggage occurs very frequently.I met with passengers who'd lost theirs weeks ago and hadn't had a single phone call. Calling quarter the flight can be a hell of a job when dealing with angry mostly shouting passengers.

Needless to say that alot Nigerians flying this route have displayed a lack of decorum,rowdiness and loudness that leaves alot to be desired. They attempt to smuggle in extra luggage and scramble for overhead luggage storage. They are loud and largely inconsiderate to those next to them. The airline has followed suit and been unable to enforce discipline and become even more shambolic than the Nigerians. If you can't beat them join them.

My four small children and I Missed my return flight today at 6.35am because the flight was overbooked. The simple reason given at the ticketing desk. They had to use my phone to ring the airline to get this information. My airtime finished so a well wishers offered their phone. Are there no calling facilities at Murtala Mohammed Airport?They cancelled the flight and sold off our tickets, presumably at a higher price, my agent told me. No warning to me the passenger. I had woken my children at 1.30am to get them ready and had to turn them back all sleepy after spending hours on the airport floor. I will be surprised to hear of a personal apology from the airline.

My score is no star at all but there's no such option.

Title:
I would not recommend this airline to anyone even if they were giving out free tickets. From the start of my journey the plane was delayed due to technical problems therefore I was unable to get the connecting flight at Casablanca, leading to further delays. Eventually, we boarded a plane that was unable to take off due to technical issues again. Then we had get to off the plane and wait in the airport with no one informing us of what was happening or when we will be leaving. Eventual we boarded an aircraft and waited a little while then eventually we took off. I ended up getting to Banjul 3 hours late. On my return trip 05/01/2020, once again delays so ended up arriving back 2 hours late.

Some of the staff at boarding gate in Casablanca were extremely rude and conveniently or more so ignorantly did not understand English when it suited them. I was booked requiring special assistance (due to mobility issues) which they ignored and told me to stand and wait whilst they began boarding other people.

My journey back and forth involved four different aeroplanes with the exact same meal on each, with the only difference of the third one being dry (almost burnt). Fair enough although one of the air host told me on the last plane that I had to take what I had ordered (which I refused) a nicer air host came back and offered an alternative which was awful too.

In all my years of travelling this has been the worst experience to date. Royal Air Maroc never again no matter how cheap the ticket is.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The check in staff at the Casablanca airport for the Royal Air Maroc that was checking in my wife and I and another family couple was the most arrogant, the rudest, and the least accommodating that I have experienced in all my decades of air travel.  I happened to have a horseback ridding accident the day before flying, and had to go through multiple X-ray sessions at the local hospital to establish if I were fit to travel at all.  It was decided that while I was unable to walk, I could travel with assistance.  I called in the airlines to request special assistance from them, and I was told that I did not plan accordingly, as as per the airlines rules special assistance can be only arranged by phone or web if the request it at least 48 hours earlier, but that could request it personally at the time of the boarding.  That was clear and understood, rules and rules and the timing of the accident sucked.  We went to the airport the following day, I was helped inside by a very nice Egyptian Air helper with a wheel chair (totally random), as the Air Maroc would not provide me a wheelchair until I was pass the security and at the check in desk (I was unable to walk at all at the time).  While at the check-in I asked a female check-in clerk about the Special Assistance, and was told that it was not available as I should have requested it at least 48 hours prior.  I explained that I was involved in an accident that past day I could not possibly foresee ahead of time.  A male supervisor was brought in, and he started off immediately very rudely and arrogantly, without any motion whatsoever to even pretend to try to be helpful, asking me what I wanted.  I repeated again, that I was involved in an accident, rendering me unable to walk and with terrible back pain, and could I please be assisted in any way.  He started yelling that extra seat I would have to pay for, that it had to be arranged 48 hrs prior, and I finally realized he was suggesting that I was pretending to be in pain to gain extra leg room or a better seat.  I offered him my 4 sets of xrays from the day before, but that did not help.  I offered to pay for an extra seat, to pay for an upgrade to the business or first class, or at least for a seat where I could keep my legs elevated, but he at the top of his lungs just yelled “GET THE F...K OUT’ and stormed away.  All 4 of us were left with our jaws hanging low..... The female clerk just left us as well, and we were left by the check in counter being ignored for almost half hour.  No one would speak to us, we were getting desperate and terrified.  Finally another female clerk came, possibly senior, but acting as hostile and unfriendly, with a doctor and two nurses in tow.  She accused me flat out about lying and playing the system to get better seats.  I said I was more than happy to pay for an extra seat or for an upgrade to the first class, yet I was told I could only do it at a airline agency!  I asked why the doctor was there, and the clerk said he was there to decide.  I kept asking for a cleared explanation but with a smirk on her face she just ignored me.  The doctor, French speaking, and obviously educated and well mannered asked me about the circumstances, and diagnoses, xrays, which I provided him, he asked me to stand, and checked if I was able to move my legs, and then very nicely and politely said he was sorry about my accident, and he spoke briefly to the clerk, and wrote a note and handed it to me, and since that stage the attitude of the clerk has totally changed.  She still remained unhelpful and in no way even considering allowing me to either buy an extra seat or upgrade to first class, but she changed our seats she said to allow me to have my legs straight out.  She also apologized for the supervisor’s “get the f...k Out” comment, admitting he should not have said so... After boarding the plane I was wheeled inside only to find someone else sitting in the seat assigned to me, and the airline attendant telling me that I could not be seated in these seats anyhow, because they were exit row.... We eventually had been shown the second to last row, at the very end of the plane, and I endured the most unpleasant flight of the hundreds I had taken so far.  That said it was not the flight, but the check-in experience, the humiliation, the fright at not being allowed out of the country and back home, the feeling of being hated and shown hate.  It took us totally by surprise, and changed our entire attitude to Royal Air Moroc.
qwuub: Dreadful experience on flight back from Casablanca to NY
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Nice and efficient service from NY JFK direct to Cassablanca on a new Dreamliner -- but it went all downhill after that! The domestic side of Cassablanca airport is absolutely DREADFUL. It is like a small, regional bus station with absolutely no amenities. The toilets barely function and there was one small coffee stand. The place reeked of stale smoke though there are plenty of No Smoking signs. There were inadequate chairs for everyone and a general air of desperation and resignation hung over the entire place. To cut a 9 hour story short, our flight was cancelled but our bags mysteriously made it to Marrakech! We spent 6 hours in the airport standing in lines and pleading for information. The airline and its staff failed abysmally to communicate to passengers, protect their staff or manage the situation. At one point, some of the passengers became so incensed that RAM counter staff actually shut down their computers, picked up their belongings and marched off the job! I felt badly for everyone. But honestly -- how can you even take an airline seriously when they announce your flight's departure time as "??????? 20:45". I'm not kidding! There was a total lack of respect for staff or passengers and we really could have used someone with authority to organize lines and get answers to questions. Eventually we were placed on a bus at 2:15AM and driven down to Marrakech. We arrived shortly after 5AM. Upon arrival, even though we could see our bags, we were unable to claim them (even with our claim checks) until we'd found someone more senior and dragged him over to Baggage Claim. People woke up, straightened up, saluted each other and we were reunited with our luggage. Fortunately our return trip was uneventful, but RAM desperately needs to upgrade the domestic side of the Cassablanca airport and provide better support and management for its staff and passengers.
crvsd: Carolyn M wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: Good International Service; Appalling Domestic Service

Title: I've been on a big heap of bad airlines. But by far, the worst airline I've ever flown on is Royal Air Maroc. This airline is so bad, it tops WOW air (that airline that went bankrupt a while back). The customer service was far from good. The staff were rude, unsystematic, and put themselves over their customers.      When my vacation to Egypt came to an end, I got a big surprise at the Cairo airport. Some idiot thought it was a good idea to overbook the flight. So now the staff began kicking people off the flight. THANK GOD I wasn't one of the people who were thrown off.      But that's just the beginning. On the flight to Casablanca where our layover was, the toilet backed up and was closed. So then there was a giant line waiting in front of the one remaining bathroom. The dinner that was served on the plane was mediocre at best. And let's not forget about the obscene sanitary conditions of the plane.     Once we got to Casablanca, we left the plane via stair truck and were packed like sardines into a waiting bus. Once the bus was full, I expected us to leave shortly after. But we sat there for a good 10 minutes before leaving.     The flight back to my home, New York, was about as good as the first. Except I slept most of the time because I was exhausted.      Overall, I would NOT recommend this airline. If you are going to Egypt, or other parts of the Middle East, fly Turkish Air instead.

Title: First time I ever purchase flight without reading reviews. I almost passed out when I read about lost luggage afterwards. Must clarify our flight was MIA -> CMN -> AGP 12/22/19 AGP -> CMN -> MIA 1/3/20. I couldn’t risk loosing luggage. Thankfully our luggage made it to Casablanca and back to Miami perfectly.. To the ones that are missing luggage’s I would recommend calling airport directly since I saw tons of luggage’s on the side ( A huge amount ) With that said I would definitely fly airline again and pack light just like we did.  Btw. Preorder your food before leaving by calling airline directly.. Bon Voyage..

Title:
Only flew with RAM once from Brussels to Dakhla and back. I didn't need customer service (which by the looks of it was a good thing) except to get my miles accredited to my frequent flyer account, which they did within a week.
The flight itself was eventless, legg-room is OK (for a 737), meal is included (which these days is starting to become an exception within Europe). The food itself was OK, nothing out of the ordinary, but nothing too bad either.
The terminal for the local flights in Casablanca must be one of the smallest I've ever seen with barely a place to sit, so luckily it was a short layover (the international terminal you access on the way back does has all the bells and whistles you can expect from a modern terminal).
If you're a kiter on your way to Dakhla, you're also in luck as you can take your kite equipment with you for free, as long as it's below 23kg (so you get a checked luggage of max 23kg AND a kite bag of max 23kg included in the standard fare).
With the experience I had, I would consider flying them again.

One tip: if you want in-flight entertainment, make sure you install the SkyRAM player before your flight, there's no other way to access the in-flight entertainment on their Boeing 737's.
crvsd: Ben B wrote a review Jan 2020
qwuub: OK flight - transport of your kite-gear for free

Title:
This is the worst airline I have ever taken. The staff are extremely rude, unhelpful and incompetent.

They made me miss my connecting flight to London Gatwick from Lagos Nigeria because one of the incompetent staff member placed me in the wrong queue when it was time to board my final flight.

When looking for help, they were completely and utterly useless. I literally went around the whole bloody airport seeking for help because none of the staff could provide any real proper help. When I explained my situation, all they told me to do is wait and they will come and see me. Guess what? I waited for such a long time and nobody attended to me.

I got fed up of waiting for these idiots to attend to me so I chased after several staff workers and demanded for help, until I was then told I had to go the RAM agency. I was told that if I go there I will NOT have to pay for a boarding pass, guess what? When I got there, the cheeky lady had the nerve to tell me to pay for another boarding pass. Lol! You seriously want me to pay for a boarding pass? I explained to her that I will not pay for a boarding pass because this was not my fault. She then said I need to speak to the supervisor and that they don't deal with these kind of problems.

And as you can guess, locating the supervisor was a nightmare as nobody knew where he was. I asked the guys at the check-in point, who were to busy playing on there phones to call their supervisor and apparently NOBODY was able to do this because they didn't have the facilities to do so. So then again, I had to chase several staff members to locate their supervisor so I could get the heck home.

Finally, I managed to chase a guy who was like a supervisor and he managed to get me onto another flight to London Heathrow.

Oh! It doesn't end there! When I got Heathrow to get my luggage, SURPRISE SURPRISE, my luggage wasn't even there. In fact it hadn't even left Casablanca at all, despite them telling me that my luggage WILL arrive at Heathrow. Eventually, my luggage arrived 2 days later at my home address.

I should of listened to the reviews I read online because I wouldn't have gone through so much stress. This is the WORST experience I have ever faced with an airline and I will NOT be using this ROYAL AIR MAROC ever again. My advice to anyone reading this is to only stick to UK based airlines because I know the customer service and staff will be A LOT better.

AVOID ROYAL AIR MAROC. Do not use even if your life depended on it.

Title:

Title:
Did not deliver our checked in luggage. No correspondence or airline staff to communicate with/ provide an explanation.
Flight 1: no temperature control, no blankets, poorly cooked chicken, stale bread and one drink.
Flight 2: No entertainment system aka NO TVs for a flight almost 5 hours.

Staff members practically tackled and bullied passengers at the door of the plane to check in their hand luggage. Yet on arrival over half the passengers' luggage had not arrived and is tracking to "Morocco". No one was informed of this prior or after - the conveyor belt just stopped and airport personnel informed us that was all the bags the airline had sent.

A truly and honestly horrible experience.

That is clearly not an isolated incident as people from flights days prior were coming to the airport daily in hopes of retrieving their bags.

In my honest opinion, a dreadful, barely legal, incompetent airline staffed with rude, deceptive, incompetent personnel. I can't prove that this despicable treatment is in part related to the fact the majority of the passengers were Black Africans, but it is very strong impression.

To date, I still don't know how I'll get 8 of my 23kg checked in bags back, and the airline has been nothing but obstructive.

I cant stress enough - that you should avoid this airline. It is not worth the money, the positive reviews are misleading. I write because I wish I had known before booking. A lot of things can be forgiven for a cheap flight (bad food, rude staff, bad temperature control, no entertainment) but I ask you, can you sustain your trip without any of your luggage? Is the price worth that risk?
qwuub: The WORST airline I have ever flown with.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
If you are checking in with Royal Air Maroc- get there very early- the lines tend to be extremely long but they progress at a reasonable pace.

The service onboard was ok- they served two meals on the 7hrs flight and coffee, tea and water were made readily available at your request. However, the wait for the restrooms onboard were interminable as despite the numbers onboard, two of the restrooms were kept locked.

My biggest disappointment with Royal Air Maroc is that they lost a piece of my luggage and 8days later no update has been provided. The representative I filed my claim with assured me I would receive the claim information via email but I have not, and without a claim number you cannot track lost luggage.

I am still at a loss on how to recover my property. RAM really needs to place more priority on securing and maintaining accountability for travelers' luggage entrusted in their care.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Paid to upgrade to business (after waiting 1 hour in line because no one was working at the ticket booth) and was given an economy ticket. Saw the mistake 20min before boarding. Talked to a second employee who first tried to convinced me that I never paid for my upgrade despite me showing him to different receipt (yeah I probably imagined waiting for an hour and then being charged 900$). He then proceded to mention me I should file a claim against the airline when I get back to Montreal...like really? And then told me he couldn't do anything and I would have to go back to transit (which was before the security check point). So had to go back there, talk to security to let me cross the checkpoint and then ask for a manager who asked me again if I was sure I paid for it (like really?). Finally got my business ticket that I paid for but god it wasn't because of the efficiency of the employees who litteraly don't care about their customers and would never lift a finger to help. Title:
A normal flight is already just bearable, when a problem occurs prepare for the worst travel experience.

I flew from Montreal to Beirut via Casablanca with royal air maroc. After landing in Casablanca I was shoked to learn that me and the 24 other passengers on my flight headed to Beirut were removed from the next flight. We watched with disbelief other people board that plane while we had to go to the counter to get another flight.
This is when our nightmare starts. They put us on a flight that departs in 30 hours. We asked to fly earlier with another airline, but they lied to us and said there are was no place. We had to search online and show them that yes there were flights with Qatar airways and Turkish airlines.
When we called their lie they agreed to put us on Qatar Airways (even though the Turkish one would have been 5 hours shorter trip). However bad relationship between Qatar airways and Royal air maroc (which turned into a fight between the staff of both companies) lead to a long delay and eventually they refused to board us.
We had no alternative but to take the flight that takes off in 30 hours. Those who were lucky enough to have visa or a Canadian passport were able to go to the city for the night. The rest of us were stuck in this terrible airport. The airport "hotel" was more like a prison cell, the food stamps they gave us were terrible. I dont have my bags so no fresh cloth or toothbrush.

I am miserable now, and there is still 8 hours to wait. All I want is to leave this airport that I wish I never flew to in the first place.
crvsd: Peter M wrote a review Dec 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
