Title: Please, be advised that if you are returning to Nigeria with Royal Air Maroc, the chance that you will have your luggage, after a stressful and less entertaining flight, is 15%. They will put the passengers in a small vessel (airplane) that can only take 15% of the total luggage. They then retain and accumulate luggage in Morocco until they will be adequate in numbers to fill a cargo flight. This may take between 7 to 14 days.  Most worrisome is the fact that nobody will attend to you to give you proper information on the status of your luggage. As a result, you may wander in the airport for more than six days before you receive your luggage. In the middle of it, if you can display a little bit of rascal scenario, then you MAY be lodged in a hotel (Stop Over Hotel). Please note that the mandatory 150 USD need allowance that must be paid to the passenger experiencing a delay in luggage delivery will not be paid as you are on left your own. The antics work so well that they have employed Nigerians in the name of NACHO to scam Nigerian passengers on their behalf ...Members of NACHO will tell you it is a normal occurrence not to see your bags that you can travel to your destinations without your luggage. This is a ridiculous and shameful scenario which  occur day in day out. Air Maroc is the worst I have ever seen!!
qwuub: Worst Fight Ever especially while Returning to Nigeria

Title: We had the misfortune to be on the Sunday evening flight from Brazil - Casablanca - Malaga with what, after 40+ years of flying is simply the worst experience ever.  The check in, security, passport control and loading was brilliant, but not because of RAM, rather because the Brazillian government decree senior citizens should have the same priority rights as disabled, families with young children etc.  There it all ended, the plane, a Dreamliner (used them before) was poorly maintained internally in that one of our chosen seats had no recline and the other the seat back entertainment was not loading.  We requested twice that the screen be reset, twice the request was ignored.  On the third request I was told to change seats if I didn't like it!  Eventually, after an hour and it was a midnight take off, drinks trolley came round - I requested a beer, the other of us a glass of wine - the answer?  A snarling water or juice!  Can you believe the attitude, no sorry we haven't got, no smile, just a take it or leave it attitude.  The meal?  Well the chicken fillet broke my plastic knife trying to cut it, the veggies ok, the yogurt the best part.  4 hours into the flight I went to the galley for some juice only to find the only on service attendant asleep in the jockey seat - would he awoken if there was an emergency I wonder?  Never ever in the years of travelling by plane have I encountered such surly, rude, uncaring, uncommunicative and disinterested cabin crew - not just one of them but the whole bunch need to be educated in customer relationships.  I finish this by wondering how Royal Air Maroc even stay in business?  Give me Ryanair or Easyjet anytime over this dreadful airline!

Title: If you don't mind having to stop and change planes once in Casablanca, Royal Air Maroc is a good choice for an affordable coach ticket from the US East Coast to Europe. Traveled on a late model 787 Dreamliner from MIA to Casablanca with a late departure time of around 10 PM EST and the flight was relatively empty, had the entire row to myself. Food was tasty and hot and in flight entertainment was OK. Crew was very cordial and polite and outbound flight arrived on time. Changed planes after an hour and was on the ground in Paris in just a few hours. Return flight was a bit delayed from Casablanca back to MIA and flight was full, meaning others have caught onto the deal which this airline is offering if you don't mind a stop over at its hub in Morocco.

Title:
Ok so... when you are flying to and from Africa in economy, you want to get there on time and in one piece. Thats generally the limit of ones ambition. Most flights to North and West Africa arent that long and a simple economy seat that gets you where you want to go in a reasonable time is altogether fine.

Sadly Royal Air Maroc cant seem to manage this. Notwithstanding that most of the planes themselves are tatty in the extreme (the fleet consists of a a few modern 787s which ARE decent but the bulk of their transport is antiquated 737-800s and AT7s) their notion of timekeeping is relaxed to say the least, and when they do get it wrong their customer service is nothing short of disgraceful.

Title:
I travelled with air maroc in july and had 4-5 hour delay in Gatwick, so when I reached Casablanca to connect to banjul, the Gambia. They said my flight is gone and have have to wait for 24 hours in casablanca for the next flight. They put us in a camp/hostel accommodation in the airport so called the Airport hotel...were people share one toilet and showerroom. They gave us lunch voucher to get from airport shops. Food was disgusting.. Breakfast (Piece of cake with hot soar milk) Lunch ( Half small baguette with can of fizzy drink). Cannot slept whole night as two big rats were running around my room. Complained to the reception but he seems less interested. Came back home to the UK and claimed compensation which air maroc accepted in Aug and said they will pay between 3 to 6 weeks but till now I have not received a penny. I tried ringing them every week but all they do is lie to you... That they are different to the compensation team and can only teach them by email. And my payment it's on it's way to my account.

Please be careful and avoid this poorly run airline.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Here is the email I wrote to Royal Air Maroc, which they still have not responded to.

Good Day,

We are writing this letter to share our experience after flying your airline for our Moroccan vacation.

While our stay in Marrakech was wonderful, the journey to get to Morocco was downright terrible from start to finish. Approximately three weeks before our trip, we had received notification that our return flight was cancelled, and rebooked for two days later without any consideration for our input or issues arising from a delayed departure. In the cancellation email, it was clearly stated that it was possible to rebook us on another flight to get to our original destination. Your policy in your legal notice states:

“2.2 Except as otherwise provided for in the Convention, and if a Passenger has a single Contract of Carriage (as defined by Convention) that is the subject of a Reservation: - if the Carrier cancels a flight or - operates a flight with excessive delays compared to the planned schedule or - the Carrier causes the Passenger to miss a connecting flight, or - if the flight does not stop at the Agreed Stopping Place or the point of destination, or - if the Passenger is refused embarkation due to overbooking, The Carrier must, in agreement with the Passenger: (a) Carry the Passenger on the next flight with an available seat, without surcharge and, where applicable, extend the Ticket validity commensurately, or (b) Reroute the Passenger to the destination shown on the Ticket within a reasonable time, in whole or in part on the Carrier´s own flights or those of another Carrier, or by any other means of carriage agreed on with the Passenger. If the fare and charges for the new routing are lower than the refund value of the Ticket, in whole or in part, the difference will be refunded to the Passenger, or (c) Refund the Ticket, in accordance with Article X/2.”

However, when we contacted the customer support center, we were told there were no other options to get back to Boston on our original date. We problem solved on our own to find the solution, and after doing our own due diligence we were able to identify several different options to get us home. After four different phone calls, we were finally able to get home on our specified date, even though the agreed-upon solution was less than ideal. Instead of quick layovers to get us back to boston by 7pm, we were routed through New York, and our scheduled arrival time was after midnight, which interrupted our work schedules (one of us works in finance, and the other two are tenured educators).

Our experience on the plane was poor as well. We had a delayed departure because the crew was waiting for passengers to make their connection to our plane (more on this later). The flight was uncomfortable: the seat did not go back, entertainment system was broken. No actions were taken by flight crew to rectify this.

Regarding the point of delaying the flight: our flight was held in Boston, because the crew waited for others to board the plane from a connecting flight, as stated above. Concerned, we alerted the crew that our connection from CMN to RAK was only 50 minutes, and we could miss it. The cabin crew told us they believed they would hold the plane in Casablanca, as there were a number of us also scheduled to make the same connection. As we deplaned, the cabin crew member confirmed his earlier statement; they were in fact holding the plane. However, this was untrue. When we arrived at the gate, we were told the plane had left and we had to go to the customer service desk to arrange for the next one, leaving in an hour. At the ticket counter, we were told that was not an option, as it was full, and our next options were to take a flight at 10pm (which would have taken away a whole day of plans in Marrakech), or to take a bus, and we had to leave right away. These instructions were given with little to no direction, and we were left wondering:

- Where to find the bus and how we would know it was the right bus for us;

- What time the bus was departing;

- Where the bus would be dropping us off in Marrakech;

- Where to find our checked luggage (This led to additional issues, see below)

A wild goose chase ensued. Luggage was not on the belt, and we were told to go to the baggage counter at belt 5. After waiting for 30-40 minutes to get to the front of the line, the woman at the counter completely brushed us aside and told us to go to the luggage office at belt 1. The woman at belt 1 also quickly and rudely brushed us aside and sent us back to the woman at belt 5. That woman told us to go upstairs and speak to someone in the RAM customer service office outside of the security gate. That man told us that he did not officially work for RAM, but did tell us where to wait for the bus. That was the first time we received concrete factual information. So one person waited for the bus and the other 2 in our party walked in circles through the airport trying to find answers about where our luggage actually was.

After going back through security, we tried to engage with the customer service representative back at belt 1. Again, she was quick to brush us aside, and rudely walked away mid sentence, pretending she could not hear us. It was appalling, and egregious. Customer service like this would get one fired in America. She blatantly ignored us, and we felt hugely insulted during this vulnerable time. We tried to get someone else to help us, and he brought her back to the front of the counter.

She finally took photos of our baggage tags and said her colleague would look for them and they would come out on belt 1. After waiting 20 minutes, bags started to come out. Only one of our 2 bags showed up. We went back to the counter to ask about the remaining lost bag and she said keep waiting. After waiting again, we went up to confirm that it would come, and she said her colleague had sent everything out and I had to go back to belt 5 to the original counter that had sent me to belt 1 to get a claim ticket.

Back at belt 5, the woman refused to provide me with a claim ticket, stating the sticker given to me at check-in back in Boston would be sufficient. As noted on your banner (see attached photo), we are entitled to the claim file reference, baggage recovery guide, and inventory letter. The woman outright told me no and refused to provide me with anything at all. She said I had to complete all of this in Marrakech, which made no sense to me as the bag did not make it onto our connecting flight to Marrakech and we knew that. At this point, we were so frustrated, one of us began to document this problem. Her photo is provided for your reference.

Ultimately, at this point, we wanted to get to Marrakech, so we left without the bag. There were a bus full of people waiting for us in the heat. We knew at this point that this was also a complete waste of time because customer service so far had refused to service us, the customers.

We boarded the bus, which was a fine ride. However, when we booked the ticket, we wanted a flight because one of the people in our party gets carsick, and we also wanted to make the most of our 4.5 day trip and take a short flight. We were supposed to get to Marrakech at 10:40 am and instead we arrived closer to 4pm. It should be noted that according to google search results for “cost of a bus ticket from casablanca to Marrakech” states it should cost approximately. 85dhs. A plane ticket costs approximately 889 dhs according to Google Flights’ search engine. We are due the difference per your policy referenced above.

-The next morning, the member of our party went to the Marrakech airport to see if the baggage ended up there. She almost did not get through security because she did not have the lost baggage claim, but the security guard saw she was in distress and directed her toward the baggage claim office. She waited in line for over 30 minutes and was finally able to file my report. Sure enough, the suitcase was in Casablanca. With driving time, there was approximately an hour and a half lost of the vacation.

That night, she received confirmation that the suitcase arrived and went to the airport to claim it the following morning. This took approximately 1 hour with driving time, as there was no line at the baggage office.

As you can tell per the details of this letter, this was not an enjoyable nor relaxing experience, which we had paid for. We lost more than 8 hours of our time, which we, in our profession bill at an average of $80 per hour. 80 per hour for 8 lost hours for three people would mean a loss of $1,340. While we all love Morocco and can’t wait for our next trip, at this point, we would neither recommend or consider flying Royal Air Maroc going forward without serious hesitation, even though one of us signed up for a Safar flyer membership, anticipating further travel.

We hope you take the time to review the details of this letter and take the proper actions to rectify the situation. We look forward to speaking with a representative of your team. We appreciate all of the hospitality the Moroccan people offered us during the trip, and we hope your airline can do the same.
qwuub: TERRIBLE SERVICE, TERRIBLE DELAYS, HOURS WASTED WHILE BEING BELITTLED
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Update about BOS-CMN flight that was supposed to leave on November 3rd...
20 hours later, there is still no information on when this flight will leave Boston. I called RAM customer service several times (per their request to “check after an hour’”). My last call was at 11:30 am on November 4th and no one has an answer besides “the airplane that’s supposed to leave Casablanca hasn’t left yet and that is the plane that will be used for BOS-CMN flight”.
This is mind blowing! I’ve never experienced this or heard of such a thing before. The ONLY Moroccan airline is struggling to follow the guidelines and operate properly, yet, they get away with this nonsense. RAM employees are condescending and incompetent. They address passengers as if they’re doing the world a favor. They have 0 customer service skills and they are very unprofessional. It also seems that they treat passengers the way their superiors treat them. Passengers are entitled to little to no information and they just have to sit and wait. Even if it means waiting for days. They just don’t care. According to other reviews, this is routine.
My questions now (besides when is this Boston flight going to leave?) are:
1) Why is this airline company still in business?
2) Who trains RAM employees?
3) Is there only one airplane that operates between BOS and CMN?
4) If I want to send a complaint, does it need to be addressed to RAM CEO or the Moroccan Dept. of Transportation?
5) Will my complaint be considered or disregarded? (maybe the latter based on my experience).
This is a serious issue that needs to be handled and if the people in charge have the same attitude as their representatives (across airports), the issue will never be resolved.
RAM is inconveniencing passengers and their families. There are people who need to get to a funeral, to work, school, maybe have a surgery scheduled. Passengers pay for their tickets and they need to receive the services that they paid for, not get treated like a mule.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My flight from Boston to Casablanca on November 3, 2019 at 8:20 pm got canceled without advanced noticed. I arrived to the airport 3 hours prior to his flight to find RAM employees that had no information whatsoever about the reason for cancellation or when the next flight will depart. They asked me to try again in the morning. I contacted RAM customer service to find out why they didn’t notify their passengers of this cancellation and to get information about the next flight, but no one seems to have an answer. They asked to try calling again after an hour. It’s been 7 hours now and every time I call the representatives ask to call again after an hour.
RAM hires the most incompetent and unprofessional staff. They could care less how inconvenient or unpleasant the passenger’s experience is and treat people with a high level of disrespect. This company needs to either shut down or hire some ethical employees that hopefully will help clean their reputation.

Title:
Having flown from Manchester to Gambia (Banjul) via Royal Air Morocco - I cannot exaggerated any more what an awful experience it was. I arrived midnight on the 18th October only to find my baggage was lost. After a frantic few hours I managed to find airport staff who where able to tell me my bag was delayed and would arrive the next day (after midnight on the 19th). I was given a number to call to check.
I called on the 20th after 3am (only to get a rude answer about how the luggage was still missing)....the employee sounded half asleep and could not give me straight answer; apart from try again on the 21st.
So I rang Royal Air Moroc direct. Totally incompetent is all I can say. No sympathy, no help and no way of tracking down my lost luggage. I was told it would be found by the next flight. So yet again on the 22nd I rang Banjul airport - still no sign of luggage and was informed there had been no flights that day (words failed me - so they lied)!!!!

So I rang again after midnight on the 23rd to find out my luggage had arrived and they would not be sending it to my hotel and that I had to come and get it myself (having told me when it first went missing that they would deliver it to my hotel).

NEVER fly with this airline. Another angry passenger told me on the first day of this debacle this this airline does this all the time. They are well known for this. So to avoid what I went through - please avoid flying with them. Not once did they mention compensation. I'm still waiting to hear back on this. They totally ruined my 8 day holiday (with 4 of those days without my clothes or medications).
qwuub: Outraged - Ruined my Holiday - Lost Luggage

Title:

Title: As I have traveled on other primarily government-owned airlines, LOT and Turkish Air, I thought that Royal Air Maroc was very good. In fact, I was quite skeptical of flying this airlines, it was arranged for me. Royal Air Maroc adhered to the flight schedule, had an endless array of entertainment available (with a seat screen vs. using your own device), accommodated my vegetarian request adequately-- multiple meals, continuous drinks (wine included) and snacks were provided throughout, a small personal convenience package and blanket awaited on each seat, seats were comfortable, boarding process was reasonable and relatively swift, and the plane was so new in design that the windows had a gradient design for adjusting outside light. The bathrooms were the largest I have experienced, aside from Korean Air, really spacious for an airplane...and relatively clean throughout the flight. My only negative comment would be two males flight attendants on our ( traveled with husband) outbound flight who were seemingly dismissive to women. Curiously, male attendants were the majority on my flights to and from the U.S. in contrast to domestic and most international flights.

Title: I just flew IAD to CMN then returned RAK to CMN to IAD without any problems or significant criticisms at all.  It was a typical international economy class experience.  RAM staff on the ground and on the plane were organized, professional, and polite.  The boarding process was orderly at each step.  The planes (a 787 for the international leg and a turboprop for the RAK to CMN leg) were clean and functional (including toilets).  The food on the two international legs was unremarkable, but hot and edible.  All flights arrived on time or early (two left late but made up the time in flight).  My luggage made it both to and from Morocco (including the change of planes on the return trip).  I didn't have any problems so I have no insight into their customer service; maybe that is where the wheel really falls off.  I understand from reading other reviews that some passengers have had truly horrible experiences, but mine was great.  The inexpensive ticket and direct flight to/from CMN and IAD really worked for me.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Good website - easy to purchase tickets and check-in online.
Getting from the airport entrance to the gate includes going through multiple inefficient and redundant security and documents checks, which are not under the airline's control. Under the airline's control are:
- Check in: Online or at machine kiosk, where baggage tags are printed out. Tagged bags are then taken to the check-in counter, and the process is fairly efficient.
- Boarding: Terrible. It took nearly an hour to board a 200-seat flight. Boarding zones not observed, no clear line, passengers boarding with multiple carry-ons (only one should be allowed), very slow boarding pass and ID checks.
- On board experience: Average legroom, no entertainment, no USB ports, meal served. Multiple unruly kids (not infants) throwing tantrums under the eyes of their oblivious parents, without the crew saying a word.
- On time arrival.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Having read the reviews here I went into this flight with pretty low expectations.  I actually bought a new carry on bag that fit their dimensions, packed lighter than I ever had so as not to have to check a bag, and even bought two $60 backup flights from Casablanca to Lisbon on Air Arabia, in case we should miss our outbound connection.Given that the flights were actually pretty pleasant, my expectations were exceeded.  I was on the 737 Dreamliner across the Atlantic and, apart from my seatback screen not working, I would say the flight was similar in service, aircraft, etc. to transatlantic flights I've taken on United or Delta.  Plenty of food, service, etc.  The flight to Lisbon was similar.On the flight back, I will mention that you are not allowed to bring any water onboard the plane when boarding in Casablanca.  So the water they provide on board becomes pretty important.  Be aware that there is plenty of water for you but they don't necessarily come around with it more than once or twice, but it is always available in the galley for you to get yourself and the flight attendants don't object to this.  (Maybe getting the water ourselves was easier for us because we both had aisle seats.)We didn't check any bags on the way out, having read the horror stories, but we did check them on the way back and they both made it to JFK.Given that we paid less than 50% of what United or Delta would have cost, which saved me $2k, I'm happy with our experience.  Now, maybe I was just lucky, and I'm aware that what you really pay for with United or Delta is the support they give you when something goes wrong.  But, with not checking baggage, and with the backup flight on the way out, I felt we were pretty well insured against having our vacation ruined by any shortcomings in RAM's lost luggage or flight rebooking abilities.
qwuub: Not as bad as I've read here
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I recently flew on roundtrip flights from JFK to Casablanca. On both flights, there was not a great deal of organization on the ground before departure. You had to guess when boarding would proceed and was not given a great deal of instructions. Whether this was due to the airport or Royal Air Maroc personnel is not known. Nonetheless, the flights were really okay. The airline staff was personable and responded if a problem arose. We had two meals on both flights and they were tasty and a decent size. The bathrooms were kept generally clean with no problems noted. The In-Flight entertainment system was good and provided a great deal of options and choices to view. As usual in economy class, the seats don't provide the most ample amount of legroom. When a passenger in front of you sets the seat back, you feel that you are ready for a lap dance, Nonetheless, I was generally pleased with my two flights on Royal Air Maroc. I would use this airline again if flying to Morocco.
crvsd: Paul E wrote a review Oct 2019
qwuub: Decent Experience on Royal Air Maroc
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Me and the 3 friends who traveled with me are extremely disappointed with RAM onboard service. We all previously ordered kosher food for our flights Madrid-Casablanca-São Paulo and for the 3 meals we had (1 in the Madrid-Casablanca flight and 2 in the Casablanca-São Paulo flight) we were served exactly the same food, with not one single difference from one to another. Although the first time it was good, to be forced to eat exactly the same food, for 3 times, in less than 15 hours, is something that no PAID service should force a client to experience. Not to mention how un-nice the flight attendants are (in all flights). Are they trained not to smile? They were extremely mechanical, unfriendly and looking like they were being forced to do their jobs and that we should be thankful by the mere fact they were there, going up and down with their frowned faces. Although we saw that some ordinary "chicken or pasta" meals were left after everyone was served, they refused to swop the repeated meal we were served. The attitude of the flight attendants were noticed in all our flights, including the Brazil-Spain ones. Finally, although RAM uses a new 787-9 aircraft in the São Paulo-Casablanca-são Paulo routes, the aircrafts they use in the Casablanca-Madrid-Casablanca routes should really be retired. They look old, dirty, poorly kept and unsafe. I have been working in the travel industry for almost 20 years and you can be sure of my experience in the field. For all those reasons, RAM will really be our very last option when we have to choose an airline.
crvsd: Osmar Maduro wrote a review Sep 2019
qwuub: Poor onboard service and unfriendly staff

Title:

Yesterday I was at the Cairo airport AGAIN to search for my own bag in their storage rooms, it wasn't found. And a new information arised, that the ground staff of Egypt air and royal air Maroc in Casablanca are actually operated by Royal Air Maroc themselves.

Title:
Royal Air Maroc is an airline that lacks customer focus and service. The story is long but here is a snapshot. I booked in to British Airways First Class gates at Heathrow. For whatever reason my bag did not make the flight to Madrid - I was then connecting on Royal Air Maroc to Casablanca. When I arrived there was no bag. After queuing for an hour I was told the bag was in Madrid and would be on the 8pm flight that night and would be delivered to my hotel. I was despatched to another desk and was given a computer print out and was told by the rudest woman in the world the bag would arrive sometime and I would need to collect it. I was travelling around Morocco and leaving Casablanca the next day. In short my bag arrived after I left Casablanca. My tour guide made ~50 phone calls asking for the bag to be sent to either Fes or Marrakech. This didn’t happen! After buying and borrowing clothes I picked up my bag 9 days later at the airport. I encountered the same exceptionally rude woman again. I asked why it wasn’t forwarded as asked. The answer the bag was in Madrid - rubbish I said. Her response was to shrug her shoulders and say email it. I asked to see her supervisor and she said “what is your problem” - my answer Royal Air Maroc and you.

There is lots more detail to the appealing service but I can’t fit in the words.

I strongly recommend everyone avoid Royal Air Maroc - they are HOPELESS
qwuub: Royal Air Maroc the worlds worst airline

Title: Like many others, i ended up having to take this airline because it was the cheapest one available and i was running out of time to book a flight to connect in Casablanca to Valencia. My first flight was delayed nearly 2 hours due to some mechanical problem.  But it was safely fixed and the flight was fine (just some regular turbulence toward the end). They served dinner and breakfast on our flight from Washington and had inflight entertainment available. I had beef and mashed potatoes for dinner and some pastries, a roll, and yogurt for breakfast. I don’t mind airplane food so it was okay to me. They also have the USB chargers available but it should be noted that the one on my seat wasn’t working. Eventually we landed, but unfortunately, we experienced what seems to be a common occurrence on this airline: they left our bags in Casablanca. So on our second flight, we had to fly to Valencia without any of our clothes or toiletries except for whatever we happened to pack in our carryons. We had to end up buying extra things we were missing while in Valencia. In addition, the second flight didn’t have proper A/C and was quite hot to sit in while waiting for departure. Anyways, we had to wait 2 days after we arrived to finally retrieve our luggage from the airport. Luckily, it was shrink wrapped (probably to keep it safe from theft). But dealing with customer service to help us get our stuff back was an absolute hassle. They kept saying they would contact us when the bags arrived but we never heard back from them. We had to just go to airport ourselves to find them. Overall, i absolutely wouldn’t recommend Royal Air Maroc to anyone unless you want to deal with poor customer service and don’t mind retrieving your luggage days after you’ve arrived at your destination. Plan your trip as early as you can so you can invest in an airline that won’t  make the travel experience more difficult than it already is. There’s a lot of extra money we had to spend to fix the inconveniences that Royal Air Maroc caused us and i doubt we’ll ever get any type of reimbursement for any of it.
crvsd: Mabel M. wrote a review Sep 2019
qwuub: Should’ve listened to the reviews lol

Title: My transatlantic flight on Royal Air Maroc was average compared with U.S. and European airlines that I've flown, except for the dirty cabin and absent crew.  The reservation and check-in went smoothly (although leave extra time to go through several security checks at the airport).  Food was good for economy class, even if portions were small.  In-flight entertainment was a limited.  However, the toilets were the dirtiest that I have ever seen on a flight.  I tried several toilets halfway through the flight, and they were all strewn with toilet paper, wet, and somewhat stinky.   In addition, aside from distributing blankets and meals, cabin crew were invisible, and the crew area in the back was a mess.  The flight was inexpensive (especially considering a generous 2-bag allowance in economy), and there are many connections from Casablanca, so if cleanliness is not a priority, Royal Air Maroc is as good as another airline.

Title:
I often have to go to Rabat - Morocco as my family leaves there (3 to 4 times/y). Unfortunately there are not many choices from London but travelling with the national company Royal Air Maroc.
- DELAYS
I can’t remember once the Royal Air Maroc has been on time. Every single time I had to travel with the RAM for the past 4 years (around 15 times), the arrival was delayed by approximately 30’ to 2h. This almost looks like a standard for the RAM.
- DISORGANIZED CREW
Secondly, I am always amazed by the lack of organisation of the crew. It looks like they have no clue of what they are doing and prefer doing things free style instead of planning. I have a few exemples. The most recent one is dated from the 10/09/2019 when we have been called for boarding and had to wait 1h standing because the staff didn’t manage to call passengers by groups as they should do.
The Company has to check all passengers bags, this is an obligation from the British law. However, even if the RAM knows this very well, they never plan this way ahead in order to avoid delays. Because the Royal Air Maroc is constantly late, they miss their slot at the security and that ends up to long waiting hours (2h in average).
- SECURITY & UNSKILLED CREW
Thirdly, the crew doesn’t respect the security basics. As soon as they land, people start to stand up and take their luggage while taxi. Adults as well as children are walking in the corridor and the crew is not even there to remain that basic security rule.
- RUDENESS
Overall, they are quite rude and unskilled, there is no excuse when they are late, they give wrong information, they is no smile and they are not helpful.
- AFTER SALES SERVICE
I have reported all those things every single time the Royal Air Maroc asked me to complete the “satisfaction survey”. However, nothing has never changed and the only thing that RAM could tell me was : “it is passengers fault” which gave me a sour laugh.
As a frequent and regular customer, I believe my review is quite accurate and reflect the reality of this company, I definitely recommend you to avoid flying with the Royal Air Maroc.
qwuub: Avoid the Royal Air Maroc: delays, unskilled & rudeness crew
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The personnel at Royal Air Maroc at JFK and onboard were extremely pleasant and easy to deal with. They actually believe in sorting out problems the best they can, instead of treating passengers as nuisances, as has sometimes been my experience with other airlines. The seats are as comfortable as any these days, but the food is definitely better than what I've had with other airlines flying between the U.S. and European countries, with stops along the way. This time I stayed at a hotel overnight provided by Royal Air Maroc near the airport. it didn't have wi-fi but that's not the end of the world. It was perfectly clean. It had a pool. And free breakfast. I do wish it were easier to find the Accommodations Desk at the airport, since there was no clear indication about where to go at the airport proper, but asking got me there, and one kind person who worked at the airport actually walked me to it. My luggage was waiting for me in Lisbon, and in fact my suitcases were among the very first to come out onto the conveyor belt. So overall, thank you Air Maroc.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I have flown numerous airlines: Kenya Air, Kalula Air, Emirates, Delta, JetBlue and a host of other airlines and this is the worst airline ever! In August, my friend and I were scheduled to fly from JFK to Dakar. Our flight was scheduled to leave at 8:55. Our flight left more than 2 hours late. The sad part is, there was no gate agent or anyone else to inform passengers that the flight would be delayed. We only knew the flight was ready for boarding when we saw passengers lining up, again no announcements. I thought it was a fluke until it was time for me to return to the states. The exact same thing happened. We were scheduled to arrive in Casablanca at 11:00 p.m, but did not arrive until 1:00 a.m. Again, no announcements or apology. You only know it is time to board when you see others standing in line. They know when they finally see someone in a Royal Air Marco uniform. When we arrived, the passenger seated next to me was so upset because he had missed his connecting flight. The next flight out for him would be 24 hours later. In addition to being late, they literally destroyed my luggage! What damage they did not do going over, they did on the return flight. At JFK on international flights you have to retrieve your luggage and then recheck it for connecting flights. When I retrieved my luggage I knew It would only be good for storing out of season clothing or the garbage bin. It is in horrible condition. I would advise anyone considering traveling this airline to reconsider your choice.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Royal Air Maroc is by far the worst airline I’ve ever flown with. We had four flights with them. All of these flights were delayed by at least 1h 30min, wich lead us to not reaching out connecting flight. The rude and incapable staff were finally able to arrange our onward journey. However they will not look for the quickest way to get you to your final destination, they will just put you on their next flight (which can be a while). This meant we had to spend a night in a horrible Casablanca Airport Hotel. Also they did not release our bags overnight, so we were left only with our hand luggage. The next day we left Casablanca with another delay but finally made it to our final destination.

Also their onboard product is terrible. The food is basically just rice and broccoli and the restrooms are the dirtiest I’ve ever seen on a plane.

The only plus side to Royal Air Maroc are their cheap prices. However tickets are not cheap enough to make up for all the stress a trip with Royal Air Maroc will cause you. So don’t do it!

Title: The flight was ok. Service on board reasonable and we got our luggage without a problem.  My issues started after the flight when I contacted Customer Service about the watch I bought from Sky Shop, their on-board duty free shop.  Bought it end of October, gave it to my daughter for her birthday early January. It didn't work. Had my jeweler check it out and it was faulty.  I contacted the watch company, Hippie Chic, and they directed me back to Royal Air Maroc. I was disappointed that Hippie Chic wouldn't just send a replacement since the watch would be coming back to them either from me or from the airline.  I then contacted RAM via email as instructed on their website.  I received an electronic message stating that I will hear back within 60 days.  Well, that was February and I still haven't heard back from them.  I have written a few times and have called their office in Montreal who have twice told me that they will forward another message to the Customer Service Office.  It is now 8 months later and I have given up.  So, for a $30 watch and what would have taken someone 10 minutes to resolve,  they have lost my future business and are subject to another poor review.  After reading the numerous negative reviews and my own experience with Customer Service, the other negative reviews are warranted. Customer Service emails go into a 'black hole' and are not dealt with.  I know that if I were to fly again with them (which I won't) and something should go wrong I would never get any support from Customer Service.  Not worth the chance.

We connected through Casablanca. With the business class seats, we also had access to the business class lounge. Title:
This is the most terrible airline I’ve ever flown.

They took off almost 2 hours late for a connecting flight through Morocco to the US. We were rushed through two security checks to make the connecting and then they promptly left all of us.

Staff in the airport was rude! I was trying to explain that my medication was in my luggage and I needed it and didn’t want to die. The desk agent said, “We all go sometime.”

They sent me to two different desks to pick up my luggage to get it, but then wouldn’t allow me to do so. It took me 3 hours of wandering around to get to the desk to get my voucher for a hotel.

The hotel was DISGUSTING. Threadbare towels, dirty room, disgusting buffet of undercooked and unseasoned chicken. Someone else had a key to and entered my room!

I filed my complaint from the hotel on July 7th, was told I’d receive compensation after multiple follow-ups via email, Twitter and calls over the next week.

Still have received nothing 6 weeks later and it appears this happens quite frequently and other folks have been waiting MONTHS. No way this airline should not be heavily fined.

Oh - and my luggage that I hadn’t seen for over 24 hours came off the plane shrink wrapped with my designer bag broken in it.

You’d be better off swimming across the Atlantic than getting on this airline’s planes.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew more than 150 times all around the World with a lot of airlines but I've never had so many problems as I had with Royal Air Maroc! Apparently there has been a lot of issues with luggages in the past month (according to a Royal Air Maroc employee).

Everything started in Casablanca airport, when we checked 3 luggages. They should told me that they probably wouldn't go with us in the plane and I wouldn't check the luggage and this claim would be avoided. The flight was delayed 2 hours but that was the least of our problems. When we arrived at Ouarzazate airport 0 passengers received the luggage. The cargo was empty! We had to fill the claim at the airport so we had to wait for 3 hours since there was a lot of people in the office. I contacted the airline for at least 20 times and they always said the same thing "We don't know where your luggage is". After 3 days without clothes and most important my brother medication (which put his health in serious risk) , the luggage finally arrived. When we saw the luggage it looked like it went to the war in Syria, as it was completely destroyed. The handler was broken in 2 of the luggages and the surface was completely messed up in all of them, with thousands of scratches.

They lost our luggage, ruined our trip to Morocco, put my brother health in risk and returned the luggage destroyed!

They never apologized and they didn't give us a refund. Stay away from this company. Just travel by train or bus. Takes long time but it will take you a lot more with the delays and the trouble this company will cause you.
qwuub: Worst airline in the World! Lost my luggage, give it to me broken, no refund, no apologies
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

The flight was at 11:10 am and one of the group staff informed us that they will be a delay and we accepted, at 11:00 am they have started the boarding under the name of Errachidiya and my friends informed that they hear that the name of Agadir I approached the lady I asked her what time will be the flight as we got it will be delayed, she surprised me that this is the flight going to Agadir. When I arrived to agadir my two luggage’s were lost, I’m made the claim and I received my client number on the next day to follow my luggage’s as the poor agent was writing the claim manually.

Title:
Need to vent.
Made the mistake of traveling on Royal Air Moroc.
First of all they canceled my return flight and rescheduled it without sending me the new ticket. my husband had to call 6 times to try to reschedule it again.
Long story short, we arrived JFK on August after an hour and a half delay at Casablanca only to find out that non of our luggage has arrived! We were advised to make a claim at the airport, which we did. At the beginning, we thought it was a mistake and that it was only us who lost our luggage but at the airport we found out that almost 30 other families didn’t receive their luggage, we were also told by one of the airport employees that it is a customary for this company to lose passengers luggage! I Googled it and to my surprise I found out that it is true..
Air Maroc acts as if it is not their fault and it is only the ground service’s fault. Which is completely absurd . Air Maroc took our luggage while they knew they had a problem going on since June. They knew very well that our luggage won’t be safe in their position, yet they kept thier operation going as if nothing is happening! It is a systematic problem that they don’t do anything about to solve. Now I can’t feel but robbed by them!
Who do I turn to to help me with this? How come this company can get away with this kind of irresponsible attitude against their clients?
My advice, STAY AWAY for your own sanity and your own belongings safety's.

Title: flew with wife and 2 kids from athens to JFK via CMN.  ATH to CMN was on an older 737-700 that was in decent shape, but showing it's age.  the SKY-RAM feature to stream movies on your phone didn't work.  the attendants were kind and helpful if needed.  the vegetarian meal was awful - truly, inedible.  the regular meal - chicken - was decent and well seasoned, but dry (i guess typical for airplanes).  we had an overnight layover in CMN - immigration is painstakingly slow - took 1 hour at midnight.  we stayed at the airport onomo hotel (see separate review).  next morning we arrived at the airport at 525am for our 720am flight.  upon entering the airport, all your luggage is screened.  we checked in and proceeded through immigration and security and were at the gate roughly 1 hour after arriving at the airport.  additional security at the gate (likely on applicable to U.S. bound flights) didn't allow any liquids, even if bought in the airport.  the flight was conducted on a very new 787-900 - was very clean and still had the "brand new" smell.  leg room was good.  the IFE screens were responsive and had a good selection.  the attendants were efficient.  the regular meals were fine, but the vegetarian meals were again awful - by far, the worst we've ever had in 42 years of flying.  for those who may be interested, the cost to upgrade the CMN to JFK sector from economy to business on our particular flight was 850 euro.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This is the first time I’ve flown with Air Maroc and I am traumatized by the experience. I flew into DC with 2 luggages for a permanent move. Those 2 luggages were basically all I had- my most important belongings and they never showed up. And it’s unbelievable but I am being given 0 hope that they will ever be found. It’s insane, I’m in a new country with nothing left. It’s so cruel and I am in shock that people can be so awful and we can be so helpless against them.
So please don’t do it. I know their flights are cheaper and I personally didn’t have any problems with the in-flight food or entertainment. But I arrived at the airport to see lots of people filing claims for luggages that didn’t show up. Since then, I’ve been asking social media, and air maroc itself for an example of someone with a happy ending and I get nothing. It’s not just that my favorite, most important belongings are gone now. But the feeling that someone can pretty much steal from you and that you can’t do anything is horrible.
It’s not funny. It’s not like all the other airlines where the luggage shows up a few days later and we think the airline is terrible for it. People are writing about lost luggages since November.
The people who are saying it’s not Air Maroc’s but the ground service’s fault is ridiculous. I gave my luggage to Air Maroc with the belief that they would keep it safe. I would happily carry it in the plane with me if I was allowed to, but that’s the rule, the airline company says we’ll take those off your hands and give it back to you when you get off the plane. So if they’re not giving it back, it is their fault. Plus, the idea that they know that they won’t be able to keep the luggages safe (given that this is a systematic problem) but still promise you that they will is criminal and cruel and disgustingly irresponsible to me. I didn’t know there was a strike in casablanca. It wasn’t my responsibility to know, it was the airline’s responsibility to notify me. To know that luggages are systematically being lost and to act like nothing is wrong and just continue to take people’s bags is absolutely horrible.
Please don’t fly with them. Or at least take whatever reviews you’re reading here very seriously and make sure you’re prepared for the worst case scenarios.
crvsd: Gizem A wrote a review Aug 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I am an experienced traveler who rarely writes reviews and has never written a negative review. I am making an exception for my trip on Royal Air Maroc because I feel a duty to warn other travelers about this airline.

We chose Royal Air Marocbecause the tickets for a three-leg trip from Washington DC to Marrakech to Paris and back were significantly cheaper than any other airline. We paid just over $1,000 per person and the next cheapest price we got from any other airline was almost double that amount. Unfortunately, sometimes you get what you pay for.

First, due to a schedule change in our first flight, our connecting flight in Casablanca was pushed back, resulting in a 7 hour layover. Royal Air Maroc notified us of the changed flight itinerary but whomever input the changes made an error that caused ripple effects throughout the remainder of our trip. At each leg we were forced to watch as helpless RAM reps made baffled looks at their computer screens, only to be told that our reservation was not confirmed. Each time I had to show a print-out of the email I received stating that it was, indeed, confirmed. The email was apparently enough to get a boarding pass for each flight but not for the subsequent connection, nor could our bags be checked in through their final destination. This forced us to go through the same check-in process again at each airport we passed through. For our Casablanca to Paris leg we were told by airport reps that our reservation was lost but the RAM customer service desk would open at 9:00 a.m. to fix the error. Our flight was scheduled to depart at 7:30 a.m....

We were eventually able to get on each of our scheduled (or rescheduled) flights but not without jumping through frustrating hoops at each airport. The flights we worked so hard to get on were the worst I've ever experienced.

Bad food.
3 of 6 flights were delayed by at least 45 minutes
The boarding process at Casablanca is chaos that involves a bus and a tarmac boarding, each of which require checking boarding passes and passports. Boarding took over an hour.
The bathrooms were so filthy that on the Casablanca to Dulles leg two of the bathrooms were unuseable by mid-flight. The bathrooms were not cleaned, nor were they taken out of service. The passengers just refused to use them because of their poor condition.
Then, the best part of all was the lost luggage. Both of our checked bags failed to make it onto the plane from Casablanca to Dulles. It has been 9 days and we have no reliable information about where our bags are. Depending on what RAM rep answers the phone we are told they are in Paris or in Casablanca or at Dulles. When we arrived in Dulles the lost baggage attendant showed us a row of 34 bags that came off our plane. They were bags that had been lost and were now being redelivered. The attendant said some had been missing "for weeks." No one can tell us where our bags are or when we might be reunited with them. The only saving grace is that since the RAM lost baggage office at Dulles only operates from 2pm to 10pm Wednesday, Friday and Sunday (???!) we only go through the frustration of talking to these people three days per week.

If you are thinking of booking a flight with this airline, I would strongly advise that you consider booking a flight with any other airline at any cost. Royal Air Maroc is without doubt the worst airline I have ever flown with.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: alright, I admit I ultimately chose to fly Royal Air Maroc because it was cheap and flew the large Boeing plane (so no big fear of crashing).  However we were completely entranced by the staff, the ground personnel and our fellow passengers.  The flight left on time, the plane was roomy and the number of happy staff were a pleasure after flying on U.S. airlines to California and the Caribbean.  We also enjoyed watching our fellow passengers  who seemed to represent the Islamic world, Sub-Saharan Africa and the Mediterranean.  It was really a treat to see, hear and talk to such a diverse passenger base.  We had to transfer to a slightly smaller plane to travel from Casablanca airport to Lisbon and the layover was almost exactly one hour, as promised, and fairly seamless.  The return trip to JFK was more of the same and just as enjoyable, with a longer layover which allowed us to take in the wide variety of people traveling from the hub of Casablanca to the middle east, the Persian Gulf, Africa and even, I think, Indonesia.  The reality of special waiting areas set aside for women only, the provision of special areas set aside for prayers, and the "similar but slightly different" travel experience made this airline an integral part of our travel experience.  After all, the "same but different-ness" is an important part of what we look for in travel.  All in all, it was a wonderful experience, and if they could have done a slightly better job in announcing the gate or dealing with the usual issues that arise when moving a few hundred travelers from the U.S. to other parts of the world, well that's part of travel too.
qwuub: "I'd fly them again in a quick minute"

Title: ﻿Today I was supposed to fly to Casablanca with Air Maroc. Initially the plane was a little late in boarding however once on board several things occurred which meant the plane could not depart. During this time there was no update from the captain and crew regarding the cause of the issues nor did the crew provide water to the full cabin of passengers. Three hours later the crew provided several pieces of information 1. There was a technical fault with the plane and no engineers were available to fix it 2. The captain was happy to fly the plane regardless of being told by ground staff that they wouldn’t sign the plane off 3. The crew were running out of hours and an extension had been sought. It seems the captain was quite happy to fly a plane that had a technical issue and for which the crew were out of flying hours. Eventually the passengers were irate from not having information and from very little care from the crew regarding water or snacks while waiting. We were told we could get off but we’re immediately asked to sit and wait longer as no ground staff could be found to receive us. Eventually we off loaded and were directed to return to the check in desks where we would get more information. Nothing! We waited for several hours while one member of gatwick staff sorted hotels and transport. At about 11pm the staff started to say they couldn’t find any more hotel rooms in the Gatwick area and we were sent to wait outside at buses. I was told which hotel they had booked me into and sent off. The hotel I was sent to had no rooms left and it is now 1.20am and I have had to organise taxis to other hotels and organise and pay for my own room. This is incredibly expensive! The service all day from Air Maroc has been rude and trying to get rid of us. Their planes are old and tatty and no inflight entertainment. I have no idea if I will be reimbursed. I really recommend that you do not fly with them as this is truly the worst flying experience I have ever had.
qwuub: DO NOT FLY ROYAL AIR MAROC

Title:
To whom it may concern:
I am extremely upset and disappointed with the way Royal Air Maroc has treated my lost baggage claim and the way they have taken me as a joke, therefore I request full compensation for the lost bag, the days with no clothes, all of the clothing in the bag, the time lost, and the terribly upsetting experience I have had.
Let me take you through the story:
On Friday July 26th, 2019 I was moving from Barcelona to Williamsburg to start a new phase in my life. I applied for a full time MBA as an international student and got in. This was the day I was moving from one place to the other.
This date let’s remember it (July 26th, 2019) I took Flight 965 from Barcelona to Casablanca. A pleasant flight no issues, service was great, flight was on time, everything ok if not perfect. After this I took the 4:35 pm flight from Casablanca to Barcelona. Again, during the flight the service was good, the flight was on time, and overall the experience was fine. This was my second time taking this flight. So far the first time had been good and now the second time it had been good so far. Even though I had heard their client flight services were not very good, so far it had been a good experience. Why not try it again?
I arrived to Dulles international airport that night at 8:00pm Washington time. This was when it all started, after immigration I went to baggage claim, all the bags had already been taken out of the baggage conveyor belt and they were lying on the floor. At this point I started looking for my 2 bags. In a few minutes I spotted my first bag, a grey hardtop bag. I spent the next 30 minutes looking for my other bag, asking around, looking in different conveyor belts, walking, and nothing was to be found. At that point I went to the RAM (Royal Air Morocco) claim desk. When I got there, as soon as I got there a front desk worker asked me “is your name on this list”. Indeed it was. At that point, I thought to myself why not tell passengers to look if their name was on the list at first rather than tell them to keep looking. But sure, no problem there was a lot of people, something I could understand. I said “yes, my name is here. I am this person”. Therefore the front desk worker said “your bag never boarded in Casablanca, please fill out your information so we can send you the bag as soon as it is here” sounded like everything was under control, I said ok. Followed, by filling out the information sheet. Gave it to her, I asked, “Is that it?” she said “yes, we will send you an email confirmation with the information, here are 2 contact numbers, and that would be it. You can leave.” Before leaving thankfully I took a picture of the information sheet so I could have evidence of it. And proceeded to go home. This was Friday night.
Day 2) - July 27, 2019- I woke up Saturday, looked at my email, and nothing. I thought it was a bit strange so I decided to call them on the numbers that appear on the attached sheet. Surprisingly, no answer. I later read, the claim desk only worked Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday from 2:30 pm to 10:30 pm. So, Ok, no problem.
Day 3) - July 28, 2019- I woke up on Sunday, and no email, no contact, nothing. Now I was starting to get a bit concerned. On the first call no answer, on the second call, no answer. I had a bad vibe, so l tried the other number the (1-800) this time they picked up. A client service woman picked up, and as I was describing my problem. The phone call shut off. No problem, I called again. This time, it was a man who helped me. At this point I described my problem and the man asked me for a claim number. Saying they should have given me a claim number, confused, I said no sir, the baggage claim front desk did not give me a claim number on Friday. I asked “can we look it up with my bag number?” he said yes. I gave him my bag number and he insisted this was not my bag. At this point, I was starting to get very frustrated, As I had my baggage tags and the person on the line said these bags did not belong to me. He followed by saying I had to do a new claim because there was no information about myself in the system and I had to go online to make a new claim. I said this makes no sense I don’t understand, but if that is what you say I will try doing it. He hung up. Obviously, I had no idea how to do the claim. I called again, can you help me with the claim. He said it is on the website and was trying to hang up again and aing. We ended up hanging the phone 4 times!! Because he was never willing to stay in the line for more than 2 minutes. Thankfully all these conversations are recorded. Around my 5th call, a different person picked up. Explained it to her, and this time I gave her my bag numbers and she said my name. I said yes that me, I felt a bit relieved she said yes there is a claim it was input on the 27th of July .The claim is number IADAT11070. Huh? That made no sense, I came in on the 26th, on the 27th no one picked up, and on the 28th the first person said there was no claim for this bag. Something sketchy was going on. She said “we have no additional information about your bag, no data has been updated” she kept on saying this. Are you kidding me, this is the 3rd day with no clothes, and the first person is trying to hang up on me, telling me I have to make a new claim. And the second assistant is telling me there is no data, and that I can keep calling to see if there is any additional information. That same day I called during the late afternoon around 6. And I got the same response, there is no additional information for claim IADAT11070.
DAY.4) - July 29, 2019- That morning I called again, surprisingly. No answer at first. Again once they answered they said no information. No additional information. At this point it’s the 4th day and that all I get. No information, no help no nothing not even an email or a call!? It would be better if they say your bag is lost! Or what is going on rather than keep on leading you on. At this point I have one pair of clothes! All of my clothes are in that bag! I was very upset, I have no information about my bag, they keep on trying to lead me on and hang up on me every time I call. They show zero responsiveness towards the client. And they say I cannot contact the claim department. Only by email. Hence I am writing this email.
Day 5) - July 30, 2019- I called again and this time Abda received my call. I gave him my claim number IADAT 11070. He was very responsive, however again he said, “There is no additional information on the claim. For the time being there are no new updates. There is a flight today from Casablanca to Dulles. You should try calling again after 19:59. If you buy any cloth you should have an invoice, and make a claim with these invoice so we can refund the purchase of clothes”. Again we are in the same place we started.
Therefore, at this point I am not even angry anymore. But let’s remember it’s the 5th day with no responsiveness by Royal Air Maroc towards his client, not one single email, not a single call on their side. Therefore, I am expecting a full refund for the lost bag, the clothes in the bag, the days with no clothes, and the terribly upsetting experience I have had. For this I have attached the sheet I filled in the first day, all of the receipts from the clothes that were in the bag, and the receipts for the clothes I have had to buy for every day I have not had any clothes to wear.
Thank you, I will be expecting a response as soon as possible.
Best regards,
Fernando Rochi Borgo

Title:
RAM offers the cheapest tickets Montreal-Accra but it comes at a cost: The flight schedule which you lose a night of sleep each way, as the plane arrives and leaves Accra in the middle of the night.
Food and customer service were OK.
The plane used for the Accra-Casablanca leg is probably one of the oldest on the fleet, with very little leg room and no individual TV screen. They show a common movie, like they did in the old days. They also offer an entertainment system on your own device but the choice is extremely limited. I recommend downloading Netflix content before heading out on your trip.
The girl at the check-in counter in Montreal argued with me about my African visa, although it was not expired. I think she was reading the date wrong...

Title: Royal Air Maroc has some of the most incompetent people and incomprehensible policies we have ever seen. My husband was flying in from Bangui, CAR and his flight had been delayed. I was flying in from NYC and we were meeting in Casablanca before heading to Senegal. But because his flight had been delayed, he, and 8 other passengers, had been "flagged" and were no longer allowed to board the plane to Senegal. We were shocked. Being told you can't board right before boarding. And they couldn't give us any valid reason. They forced these 8 innocent people to leave the terminal. I boarded the plane and immediately contacted my husband to let him know his seat and at least 7-8 other passenger seats were empty. I pleaded with the staff to let him on board but that because he wasn't at the terminal anymore he would have to board the next flight (5 hours later.) They did mention that the "supervisor" would come and resolve this issue. So here i am, left alone, given conflicting information. The workers inside telling me "why isn't he here at the gate" and the people at the gate telling him  "please leave the terminal". IT MADE NO SENSE AT ALL!! I told him the "supervisor" was the only chance for him to board. So he demanded to be taken to the "supervisor" by the plane door because he was being expected, which was a total exaggeration of what i had tried explaining to him. But the lie worked and he was miraculously allowed to board the plane. MIRACLE! is the key word. All the other passengers that had been denied entry were forced to take the following flight even though their seats were empty!!! I have never heard of any airline allowing empty seats just because the passengers previous flight had been delayed. Apparently this creates a conflict in the computer system for Royal Air Maroc and their tiny brains can't seem to use logic to figure out what is wrong. TOTAL INCOMPETENCE. DO NOT FLY WITH ROYAL AIR MAROC.

Title:
The present review is based upon 8 flight legs, in April and July 2019. The short of it is, the airline's operation manual is not up to international standards of service.

The fleet is mostly from Boeing. Transiting via Casablanca is close to compulsory (the new terminal is quite messy, with gates indicated on boarding card different from the ones indicated inside the terminal, gates D not to be found even between gates C and E, and staff fed up to be asked where are the gates D).

Let us pass on a failure to check passenger visas, which is a major failure, resulting in fines by IATA. Issue management was performed with absolutely no concern for passengers.

A few items of quality that would not cost much to fix are the spellings, in the website as well as in the in-flight magazine (even on the cover page, Morroco instead of Morocco). This is a good starting point as an indication for the airline's low level of self-respect.

Invariably, the check-in and boarding procedures are quite slow and utterly inefficient: several queues with no indication of which is which, people asked to stand in queues for much longer that necessary, etc. At some point, the plane was not coming at the boarding gate, but the crew knowingly waited as much as they could before telling the passengers that they have been waiting in vain. In one occasion (a check-in and boarding in Madrid), an employee took on himself to manage the queues, and it worked wonders: passengers were directed, luggage sizes were checked, queues were minimal, and the boarding took place with no delay.

The food was ok. The small sample of trout from the Atlas mountain (apparently some local speciality of smoked river fish that resembles salmon) deserves a special mention.

On-board service shows a few mistakes, such as toilets being cared for haphazardly.

In our opinion, it would take little energy to improve boarding operating processes. Management of delays and passenger communication will probably take longer to fix. In the meantime, we will take this airline only if no viable alternative exists.
qwuub: Poor standards of operations and service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I would like to like Royal Air Maroc. As a Moroccan, there is a certain amount of national proud and so many memories associated with this airline. RAM has some undeniable qualities. Food on board is generally good. Service, while not world class, has a nice Moroccan warmth to it. Pilots seem to be competent with very smooth landings often met with applause. But when RAM let’s you down, it let’s you down in a spectacular fashion. When they overbook the flight and can’t find you a seat, when they cancel a flight, when they lose one of your luggage, you gotta use some powerful prayers, a well funded credit card and a dalaï lamaesque patience to get back your normal human life. For RAM, a customer that is undergoing RAM generated issues....has no existence on this earth. No one is supposed to hear their problem nor solve their problem. It is a limbo where you lose any detectable level of human dignity. You are warned. And RAM, if you get your s***t together, I may come back one day and be delighted. But I have been 3 times one of these angry lost souls meandering with no help in your airports...It may take me some time to give you my trust and my hard earned dollars...

Title:
We, along with the other thousands of RAM passengers who have “lost” their luggage in recent weeks are understandably upset about not having our luggage and having trips ruined. However, what makes RAM so horrible and criminal is that at each of their airports that connect to Casablanca, they are knowingly, KNOWINGLY, allowing passengers to check-in their luggage without any expectation that they will be able to get their luggage at their destination. Entire planes are landing without any of the passengers luggage onboard. Not only do that not tell passengers but the airports know as well but don’t warn passengers. They are complicit and criminal. Furthermore, RAM won’t answer their phones or correspondence. After we returned to Casablanca to get our luggage in person, they denied that it was even there, stating that it was still in Lisbon, even though their own electronic tracking system and our luggage GPS clearly show that the luggage made it to and was still in Casablanca.
Never have we seen an airline do everything it could to sabotage their customers plans.
The root of this problem is that they don’t care about passengers and they let their internal issues between management and the luggage handlers result in this catastrophe.
They have had four luggage handler strikes in recent weeks and neither RAM nor the airports feel that it is in their interest to let passengers know when this happens. Their pilots had labor issues recently as well. Do you think RAM will let you know when they start putting unqualified or otherwise dangerous pilots in the sky? What about their mechanics? How long before their planes start falling out of the sky? How can anyone trust them?

I have been flying extensively since childhood, since 1979. Over the last 10 years, I've averaged about 400,000km a year. I have flown most airlines in the world. Royal Air Maroc is by far the most egregiously horrible airline and if you're reading this and still fly with them, you've gone forward knowing full well that what they are capable of doing and may God be with you.

Title:
Unbelievably bad airline. I’ve flown at least 20-30 airlines, including plenty of low-rated ones. I always choose the cheapest option because I am not picky; I don’t really care about the food or even the service. However, I’ll never fly Royal Air Maroc (RAM) again. Where to start? My family flew RAM from the US to Italy (connecting through Casablanca) because it was the cheapest option. They lost our luggage on the way to Bologna. I understand it happens. No problem, except that even after six days there was still no baggage, no information, and no apology. They just told us to stop calling because they would call us when they found it. Good thing we speak some Italian because nobody on the other end spoke any English (or French...). (I don’t expect anyone else to speak “my” language, but if you work for an international airline you should really speak a couple.) We got back to the US two days ago, and no luggage again. The number we were given to call has an answering machine saying their mailbox is full. I’m not holding my breath that we’ll see it anytime soon. I understand that baggage goes missing for many reasons, but other airlines take responsibility, provide information, and sometimes provide a clothing/toiletry stipend.

As for the flights... we're easy going and don't need to be treated like royalty, but on one leg the attendants seemed to go out of their way to be rude, and didn't seem to like their jobs very much. Worst of all was the check in desk agent at the Bologna airport. I had selected seats 3 months ago so our family (including 2 kids) would be together. Before printing the boarding passes, the agent informed me that she “had changed our seats to better seats.” I asked her to change them back, but she claimed she couldn’t. I insisted, showing her the e-ticket with the seats I had chosen. Then her story changed and she said she hadn’t changed them. Long story short—our family didn’t sit together on either homebound leg. I could say more (the boarding process for one flight involved everyone on the flight standing in a weird stairwell lit by one fluorescent light for half an hour; every flight was delayed, simply because they don’t know how to board a plane with any sense of efficiency, etc.), but will just say my experience with RAM has convinced me that sometimes—even for people who aren’t picky—the airline does matter, and this is one to avoid at all cost.
