Title:
I recently had the pleasure of flying Royal Air Maroc for 4 separate flights (Washington DC to Casablanca, Casablanca to Amsterdam, Lyon to Casablanca, and Casablanca to DC). The day before I left, I came on Trip Advisor and started to panic when I saw such negative feedback for the airline. I've flown a lot internationally but never before with them, and I have to say, I need not have worried. My experiences were BETTER than most flights I've taken on other major carriers.

Luggage (my biggest worry after reading the reviews): Bags arrived in a timely fashion with zero issues. Meanwhile, friends who traveled separately on Air France and Brussels Air both had their bags lost and had to spend days without their belongings. Many years ago I learned (the hard way) that whenever you have a connecting flight, make sure the bag tag is marked for your final destination and not just your connecting city. Sure, bags can still miss connections, but I have yet to get burned since I started religiously checking the tags.

Timing: Two of my flights were minimally delayed, but I consider that par for the course with the current state of the airline industry. One of the delays was in order to wait for some connecting passengers, which they clearly appreciated!

Comfort/amenities: All 4 planes were more comfortable and with more leg room than I've come to expect from U.S. economy flights. The transatlantic flights have outlets and USB ports, fancy screens with lots of video content, and high-tech window dimmers. The Africa-to-Europe planes were smaller and older, but still great. I appreciated that one of these shorter flights showed a silent movie on the communal above-aisle TV screens - not disruptive and a nice touch!

Food: Wow, a full hot meal for a three-hour flight? Unheard of! I had complete meal service on all four of my flights, and the longer flights came with two meals. None of the meals were repeats and they always had at least two options. I find my taste buds don't respond the same way when I'm flying, so to me it just seemed like standard airplane food, but it made me very happy. In addition to cold drink service at the start of the flight, they offer tea and/or coffee at the conclusion of each meal. I highly recommend the tea - I'm not a huge tea drinker and I nonetheless enjoyed this small taste of Morocco!

Service: Staff were friendly, impressively multi-lingual, and helpful.

Boarding/airport experience: This is where I suspect some of the negativity may be coming from in other reviews. If you fly U.S.-based airlines a lot, or are a novice traveler, some of the procedures might be different enough to confuse you. I was absolutely fine, however, just paying attention to what was going on and following directions accordingly. Just because it was different does not make it bad or wrong.
- The line to check bags in D.C. was very long, and it appears they have a short window to check in bags (if I remember correctly, 1-3 hours before the flight). If you have a connecting flight, make sure to get both boarding passes at your departure airport, so you won't have to wait in line again in between the flights.
- Boarding is no-frills - everyone forms a single-file line and boards the plane. No boarding groups or anything. This makes the line appear longer, but really it didn't cause any problems. I think I might actually prefer the simplicity? I am also pretty sure the flights boarded a little earlier than I'm used to. Just arrive early and pay attention.
- Casablanca airport was a cool place to stop over! Modern airport with ample food options, etc. We had to take buses to/from the gates, but I've done that in so many airports; it's not unique to Royal Air Maroc. Personally I really enjoyed stepping foot in an "extra" country on my way to Europe.
- Entering Europe and Morocco were no problems, but the final leg of my flight had an extra layer of security. For a U.S.-bound flight from Casablanca, we had to be patted down again before going to our gate. They also took away water and other large liquids that had been purchased in the Casablanca airport. This is NOT the fault of the airline, but rather due to a U.S.-government policy requiring the extra security. So I refuse to hold that against them. They were very polite about it.

Bottom line is, bad experiences can happen on any airline due to all sorts of factors outside of their control. I almost never write reviews, but I wanted to add my voice to the mix and suggest that there's also a great possibility of having a wonderful trip with Royal Air Maroc, like I did. I would absolutely fly them again and recommend them to my friends. I feel like I came away with a great deal, superior flight experience, and tiny cultural exchange (was fun to chat with Tunisian seatmate, see the Arabic writing all over the airport, etc.).
qwuub: Wonderful experience - I don't understand such negative reviews!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The flight from JFK airport was one hour and a half late, original departure 8:50, we didn't leave until 10:30 local time, no reason was provided.  One on board the flight, no reason was given for the delay. The flight was full of kids, some of them crying throughout the flight. The service was horrible, and the food was not eatable.  Once in Casablanca, we missed our flight to Marrakech, we had to wait for the next flight which was another 2 hours waiting at the airport.  We final y made it to Marrakech airport and our luggage was missing, we had to wait 3 days before our luggage surfaced.   Vey bad experience, will not fly RAM again.

Title:
There is nothing "Royal" about Air Maroc, and this is coming from a Business Class passengers:

1. We flew to Barcelona with a leg in Casablanca, each one of the four flight was delayed, no kidding, and not by 2 minutes, serious delays. If we didn't have a loooong layover, we would probably missed our flights on both directions. One of them was actually due to a passenger on board with NO BOARDING TICKET. The whole plane had to sit and wait until they will figure it out while the flight attendant and ground attendant were puzzled on how it happened. Yes, they arranged a ticket, passenger stayed.
2.You have a pre-checked security? Can't use it, they are not "participating", so add at least an hour for your airport arrival.
3.It might sound like a bad joke, but the pilots are actually smoking on flight, Sitting in Business Class we could have smelled it and the flight attendant was not too shy to explain where the smell was coming from.
4. You want your luggage back? forget about it! It happened to us once before with United, you go to the desk, get a claim number and an hour later you can check your bag location online, and get the suitcase within 24 hours, easy, right? Not with Air Maroc: We filled in a piece of paper, and then we had to call for a follow up, but pay attention, we could only call 3 times a week for a 5 hours window. We did that, after hours of calling, someone asked me to give him 30 minutes to put the claim in the system. It took me 2 days to catch him on the phone again, just so he could tell me he is doing it right now.... Claim number was useless, because the status was "unknown" , we could not talk to anyone that could provide more information, and when we wanted to escalate, the customer service representative said that "her manager does not take calls"....
We got the suitcases eventually after almost a week. No apology, no explanation, status is still "unknown".

Lounge in Casablanca was very unimpressive, and don't get me started with the strangest chairs set up (the window bed is significantly higher than the aisle bed, something like a bunk bed, no way to get out to the bathroom).
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This was our first time to fly RAM, and overall, it was a great experience. The best part were the transatlantic flights from JFK to Casablanca on 787 Dreamliners. Wow, what an amazing aircraft. If possible, I'd fly on a 787 all the time! The flight attendants were wonderful, and service was first rate.
The short (approx. 1hr) flight to and from LIS were fine, on smaller aircraft.
Where RAM could do a bit better is in providing timely updates regarding flight delays. We had a few delays, but nothing serious, and at least one was clearly weather related. Also, the RAM website is not at the same level that other airlines have. We ended up having to call in to their call center to purchase our tickets, and this was also a bit less streamlined a process than with other airlines. However, in the end the value and the service were great. If you're on a budget, and not on a particularly tight schedule, you should definitely check out Royal Air Maroc.

Title:
Last 3rd June I flew from Lagos, Nigeria to Madrid, Spain. My flight should have taken off at 6:10 am from Lagos but due to the great amount of extra suitcases, bags & luggage in general many passengers had with them; we left 45 minutes later.
It was astonished for me to see personally there, how the crew from this airline at the airport accepted money in cash from the passengers when they had overweight of their baggage. Bribing most of them!!
However, this wasn't the last remark, when flying the catering was ridiculous & the crew wasn't very friendly at all. There were suitcases everywhere, up & down the seats, in the corridors 🙄
My transfer was in Casablanca, 5 hours!! But guess what? The flight was delayed 90 minutes longer, it was crazy to check the screens. From time to time they changed the boarding gate & we were all the time checking it not to miss our flight.
Once in my way to Madrid, nobody in the flight spoke a word of Spanish, just French, Arabic & a kind of English. And nobody gave a reason for the delay...
And the same inside the plane, luggage everywhere!!
Obviously, the prices on this airline to fly from Europe to Africa & on the other way around are cheaper. But for God sake if the plane is overloaded under previous bribes & the food is awful, the transfer takes 6.5 hours:
Better to pay more & fly safe & sound!!😊
qwuub: Flying with Royal Air Maroc uploaded of extra luggage & hours of delay.

Title:
I have mixed emotions about this airline. I had to take two flights out of the US to Europe with the change of planes in Morocco. On my way to Europe my first flight was late for about 2 hours and then in Morocco for another hour. The airplane was old and dirty and service was just alright. Not to mention that the whole process into walking to the terminal in Morocco is out of this world... takes like a lifetime. On my way back, both flights were delayed as well but at least the plane was newer and cleaner. Food is not that bad for "plane food."
Another issue is that they share counter space in Miami so you have to wait until it is their turn to check in and leave your suitcase. If you have a long layover you are stuck with your luggage until they open I thought that was a pain.
I do not think I will use this airline again, the price was not worth all the inconveniences.

Title: I flew from Washington Dulles (IAD) to Malaga, Spain through Casablanca on Royal Air Maroc (which is not so royal).This airline should go out of business before there is a crash.  And if there is, the complacent flight attendants will abandon ship first without helping others.First flight (RAM219)  from Dulles to Casablanca was fine.  The second flight (RAM984) was delayed.  We were given very little information.  “You will receive information in 10 minutes.” Followed by the same announcement 3 times.  1 hour later, we boarded a bus where we sat for 20 minutes.  Got onto RAM984 – a propeller jet – which was very dirty, smelled of fumes, and had insects crawling on the interior window.  The plane sat on the runway for a long time (well more than an hour); attempted to take off and failed (no momentum to get in the air), and returned to the airport.  "Technical difficulties." We were disembarked and waited another 2 hours for a new plane (with no information from rude staff).Flight from Casablanca to DC (RAM218):  I wanted to purchase an upgrade.  Was told that “we don’t have a machine and we don’t take cash.”  (the woman in front of me had been overbooked and was given a free upgrade.)  The gate area was very crowded.  They made a boarding announcement and there was no organization (see photo).  No one told passengers where to go or what zones to use.  One of the zones was written on a piece of cardboard with a sharpie.  ....Then, we waited.  We were given the same RAM-standard statement, “You will receive information in 10 minutes.”  This happened 2 times.  People were getting very angry.  Ground staff called security who came and stood at the counter looking menacing.  Boarded the plane.  Stayed on the ground for more than an hour with no information from flight crew.  (Later learned from other passengers that it was a problem with the wing, "Technical difficulties.")   We could see mechanics staring up at the underside of the wing. NOT reassuring and most of the passengers around me were fearful to fly.  We finally took off 3 hours after flight time.  Heavy landing in DC:  They should check that wing again.ALL the staff was rude and unhelpful.  They didn’t speak. They turned their backs when I (and other passengers) asked questions.  One flight attendant even poured water (by mistake?) on a passenger, and then rolled his eyes as if it was the seated passenger’s fault and walked away.  Another passenger got him tissues to dry off.I ate one of their snack meals (breakfast) and think I got food poisoning.  NEVER AGAIN.  This whole experience has actually put me off of Morocco in general (and I wanted to travel there.)  If this is any representation of their country as a whole, I don't want to go back.
crvsd: Meghan M wrote a review Jul 2019

Title: Sadly this airline does not yet have the infrastructure nor the training to join other carriers. Large delays, zero info to passengers, indifferent staff on the ground. We travel internationally every year and yes when you travel, delays always occur. I've just never been subjected to this type of poor customer service. We flew the DC to Casablanca to Lisbon route RT. On our outbound we were delayed (with no explanation) 2 hours from Casablanca to Lisbon. On the return trip, it was a nightmare. An hour delay out of Lisbon to Casablanca. Then an almost 4 hour delay leaving for DC. I do appreciate that they did not take off until the plane was fixed but there was so much to be desired in how passengers were treated. In flight entertainment is good. Seats are pretty comfortable and recline pretty far. The food is not very good and while they provide blankets and pillows to everyone, they also collect them from you an hour before landing! I felt terrible for the people who had connectors on the ground in DC as repeated pages for RAM staff didn't appear to ellicit anyone to help them. Overall, they have a good conceptual product but the support is not yet in place. Their customer service staff is gruff and unresponsive in any way to help passengers. If they get 5 star customer service (like Qatar or Emirates), they would be excellent. The attractive pricing was not at all worth the aggravation. I will not be flying them again and will certainly not recommend them to anyone else.

Title: Do not fly Royal Air Maroc. They are not ready for prime time yet, which is a shame because they have a decent in flight product, particularly on their 787's. Title:
Actual flights - from IAD to CMN, then CMN to BCN (and return) were perfectly fine, decent food served, can try out Moroccan wine even. For that Royal Air Maroc gets a bonus point.

Now the ugly - everything in between is terrible. The one star reviews are all spot on. All our flights took off late. The leg from CMN to BCN was late over an hour because the gate crew couldn't figure out how to get the gate to connect to the airplane...so we ended up having to change gates, and take a bus for what could have been a simple 20 yard walk to the stairs of the plane.

Casablanca Airport - they check and recheck your tickets/passports over and over and over and over....we probably had 6 checks on our passports/tickets (airside - never left the airport - all international travel).

Trip from BCN to CMN was over 3 hours late - which caused a minor panic as we had a 2 hour connection for our flight home to IAD. Called Royal Air Maroc - they were useless and said we'd be fine we had over an hour to connect, said that's impossible as we hadn't even taken off for a 2 hour flight back to CMN and the next flight from CMN to IAD was supposed to take off in 2 hours....all good - any other airline we'd have missed the flight but this being Royal Air Maroc our flight back to IAD was over 3 hours late so we did end up with plenty of time for the connection.

Heed the warnings - do NOT check your luggage. We met countless people who had their luggage missing on all legs of the journey. RAM may have generous checked luggage policies but that's pointless if your bags are missing. We heeded the warnings from TA (ty guys!!) and never had to worry about losing luggage.

Only take this airline if you have to, if prices are MUCH lower than competitors, or you want to experience a truly kafka-esque system at work. Do not check your luggage and allow for a LOT of extra time between connections.

Again the flights themselves were decent, everything else...no.

Title: Now that we received our luggage, this morning at 1am, from our Royal Air Marco (RAM) flight (Friday June 28th), I can tell you about this horrible experience.Avoid this airline, please!It started with our check-in at Gatwick, London last week.  The reason we decided on the flight was because it was cheap and offered us a short stay in Casablanca.  Big mistake.  After checking in Gatwick, we were told that the gate would be announced at 10:35.  We waited by a display board and watched as 10:35 past.  The next announcement post said that the gate would be displayed at 10:50.  This worried us since the flight was 'scheduled' to leave at 11:35.Well, 10:50 came and the gate was posted.  A mad rush of people pushed their way to the gate, checked-in and waited and waited.  At about 11:20 we began the boarding process.  Well, at the scheduled departure time we were still boarding.  At 11:50 the door was closed and we remained parked at the gate.We stayed there for one full hour.  The aircraft didn't even pull away from the gate.  We sat on the tarmac.  We were all fastened in our seats, no refreshments or entertainment for that hour.At 12:50 the pilot announced that there was a long line for take-off and he had been authorized to move into position.  We pulled back from  the gate and ever so slowly moved to the runway.  30 minutes later we were at the runway.So, to recap thus far:  1) delayed gate announcement 2) one hour wait at the gate in a hot plane, and 3) 30 minutes to the runway.  Relatively non-eventful flight, though we were an hour and a half late, with only a one and 40 minutes lay-over.We landed in lovely Casablanca and we ushered aboard buses that took us to the terminal.  We followed the signs that read "flight connections" where, with 20 minutes to catch our plane, we had to go through security again.We made it through this security check and ran to the gate.  At the gate they separated the male and female passengers and had set-up yet another check-point.Now, this would not have bothered so much, and I'm all for added security, but my daughter was in a line about six deep, where as I was the only one in my line.The male at the check-point asked for my nationality, I replied, "United States" and he let me in without checking my carry-on.  My daughter was still stuck in a line, female only, with attendants opening bags and pulling out items.  Let me point out, there were two female attendants in my line, who could have easily checked women passengers.Finally through we walked to the bus and were driven a rather circuitous route to our plane.  We rushed on-board, got settled, and yes, you guessed it, we waited.  Not the full hour, as was in Gatwick, but close to 30 minutes.   The safety briefing was a multi-language video, while the flight attendants sat in the galley.  The long flight was comfortable, with our safe landing at Dulles.Through Customs were made our way to the baggage claim and waited, and waited.  After the conveyor belt stopped, with no luggage, we went to the RAM baggage handler.  She had a list of bags that didn't make the flight.  That's right, both our bags were either in Gatwick or Casablanca, she did not know for certain.  We filled out the proper paperwork and were assured that the bags would be on the next flight.  Well, this being Friday, and RAM does not or did not have a Saturday flight, that would be Sunday.  We waited Sunday,  no calls or bags.  We waited Monday, no calls or bags.  Oh, did I mention that RAM has no listed telephone number at Dulles Airport, and there U.S. - based number is bounced to Casablanca.Tuesday we drove to Dulles and found the RAM baggage office closed, but it did open on 2 p.m. on flight days.  This was a flight day.  We waited until 2:15 p.m., no employee appeared and left.  I did copy down the telephone number posted on their office door.  When I called it a couple hours later the attendant asked how I "got this number".After a long and heated conversation regarding a claim number that had never been issued, I was given one.  With the claim number I continued to call Casablanca who advised that the our baggage had, not been found or already been sent to Dulles and was in storage.  They did not know for sure.Phone calls to the Dulles RAM office went unanswered, and the prospect of another drive to Dulles was in the works.Which brings us to the 1 a.m. pounding at our front door, and the surprise delivery.  Luggage has returned a week late.The moral of the story:  Cheaper is not already better.

qwuub: RAM:  Avoid it, not worth the heart ache

Title: I have NEVER written a bad review!  As a travel agent, I think there is at least something good or acceptable about most service providers and I stay factual and balanced.  HOWEVER....my blood is boiling now!  I will NEVER fly nor book any client on Royal Air Maroc EVER AGAIN!!!!!  Under NO circumstances!!!!!  The level of services is reprehensible!!!!  When we (21 people) arrived in Marrakech, our bags (23 pieces of luggage) were not there.  No big deal; this has happened before. We went to the luggage office and they provided us a form with all of the luggage numbers and told us that they would call when the bags arrived.  Fast forward to day 3 and no calls, I decided to call the airline after using the app to track our luggage.  I explained that I had been trying to track the bags via the app and it looked like they never arrived in Casablanca (our layover).  The representative asked me for a reference number.  I gave them the number on the form.  They told me that that was not a reference number; that I should have obtained it from the rep at the airport; and without a reference number they could not help me.  The rep told me that I would just have to travel an hour to the airport to check on the bags. 🤬 So, I and another member of our group got a car, travel 1 hour to the airport and the bags had just arrived moments before we got there.  I checked the app and no change....the tracker still showed the bags had not reached Casablanca.  At the airport we learned that there was a luggage handler’s union strike and that was the cause of the delay.  After going thru security and customs several times to get 22 of the 23 bags on the van, we had to LITERALLY fight off the guys from wanting to assist us.  The problem was we had too many and needed to secure them while getting g them to the van.  If we had too many then we couldn’t manage if something happened.  Also, I didn’t have a bottomless pit to tip.  That was A MESS!!!!!Side note....the service on the plane was horrible too!  The seats were extremely uncomfortable; all flights were delayed but the boards always showed “on-time”; they are one of a few airlines that do not do TSA Pre-check; they have no co-share partners; the food was ok but it was like pulling teeth to get a soda or ice; etc!Back to the luggage...Now on the return...a member of the group returned to Miami from Marrakech.  1 of 4 bags didn’t make it.  The airline told them that the bag was still in Casablanca.  That was on June 24th!  As of today (July 5th) the bag still has not made it!  As of yesterday, the airline LITERALLY said “We don’t know where the bag is.”  To further add insult to injury, they said that they would have to wait 21 days for someone to call them and talk about reimbursement.  As a travel agent, this is GREATLY disappointing that my client had to deal with this disrespect and disregard for their property and overall customer experience!  Besides never patronizing this airline, I have learned that insurance is a real consideration when traveling and NEVER put ANYTHING of value in your checked luggage!
crvsd: Jerome J wrote a review Jul 2019

Title:
To begin, we should explain that we have never made a complaint or have never written a negative review about anything before.

We were meant to fly with royal Air maroc from Marrakech to London Heathrow via casablanca. When we arrived in Marrakech we were NOT informed that our flight to Casablanca was cancelled. They printed the wrong boarding passes for a flight that would take off after our connection from Casablanca and refused to believe that this was their mistake. Rude customer service from the get go, supervisor was sent for and would arrive in 'a few minutes', 45 minutes later she arrived but did not even come and speak to us. We asked again and were told we would be getting the bus to casablanca to get our flight. We explained we would not make the flight as it departed in 3.5 hours and the journey was 3 hours, but they assured us that the connection flight would be held for us. This turned out to be a blatant lie. The bus left with 3 hours to go until departure. Of course in Casablanca, the flights were not held so we were simply told 'your flight has left'. To add to this, none of the staff at casablanca had even been informed of the bus load of people coming to supposedly held planes to get us home. We were palmed off from person to person, via various closed royal air maroc agencies, until eventually a hotel was booked for us by yet another rude staff member. 24 hours later we boarded the next flight but even then the customer service left something to be desired. We will not be taking this airline again. Would not recommend.

qwuub: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO A FRIEND!

Title:
I've flown with RAM a few times now and I've always had a fairly pleasant and good experience with them. The planes are nice and clean and also fairly new. The service provided by the airplane staff is great and they are very attentive to passengers.

The flights themselves have been very pleasant and the pilots are very professional when addressing passengers through the in-plane tannoy.

The food on the flight is average but what can you expect from an in-flight meal? Can't expect it to be 5 star Michelin chef cooking!

Overall I'm satisfied and pleased I fly with RAM and I will continue to do so in the future.

Title: This is one of the worst airlines I have ever traveled.  Flying from Dulles International to Marrakech through Cassablanca with this airline was the worst mistake of my life. I traveled with a friend.  Going to - we were delayed in Cassablanca without explanation for 2.5 hours. The flight attendants during the flight were rude and indifferent.  Trying to get additional water and coffee was a challenge.  I ate the free meal because I was starving but it was worse than hospital food.  The saving grace was the in-flight movie list.  Was able to watch a few great movies on the way. When we finally arrived in Marrakech, our check-in luggage did not arrive along with a few other passengers from the US.  Apparently, there was some kind of strike at the airline and airport with the workers so our luggage wasn't transferred during the delay.  Needless to say that we were without luggage for two days (thank goodness I packed emergency items in my carry-on).  We were finally able to retrieve our luggage from the airport after two days.   Returning home was a similar situation.  Coming from Marrakech to Cassablanca we already had an 8 hour layover.  So my friend and I toured around the airport and came back to our boarding area.  To add insult to injury, the flight was delayed 4 more hours while passengers stood around fumming with no explanation from the airline workers as to why there was a delay.  RAM didn't inform their workers of what was going on so they were unable to give any of the passenagers any information.   They kept delaying the flight and telling us they would provide us with an update in 30 minutes.. 45 minutes would pass and nothing... Folks were trying to get on their phones to find to find out when the flight would take off but couldn't get any good updates from the actual airline website.  Eventually there was speculation that another strike occurred and that the luggage from one flight got mixed with luggage for another flight to Miami so they had to switch back and then sent the Miami flight out first while our connecting flight to IAD went into limbo for 4 hours.  Once we finally were able to board and leave, same deal, service was poor and food was horrible.  At least for the flight home we got through customs seamlessly and our checked luggage arrived this time.  The other thing is with each flight transfer in Cassablanca, we had to be transported by a bus/tram to the planes and then walk up lots of stairs with carryon luggage in the heat to board the planes and down to get off.  For anyone with poor joints, you can only imagine that this was difficult. That was my first and last experience with RAM.  I will plan FAR IN ADVANCE to avoid taking this airline, I don't care how low their fares are going forward...
crvsd: Songbird AMLF wrote a review Jul 2019

Title:
The title already says it all… but hey… I am going to let lose.

I must admit that this company does have competitive pricing, and for certain destination (especially within Morocco), the choices are limited. So… every now and then, I must fly this airline. So, yes… prices are decent.

Staying on a positive note, I must say that on most of the flight I have taken with this airline, staff on board are friendly enough. Nothing to write home about… but friendly enough is enough said.

Now we get to the bad… and this is the reason why I only chose this airline as a LAST choice, when nothing else is possible…

Planes (especially domestic flights) are old… REALLY OLD. Seats are uncomfortable, and in many cases, coming apart. Leg space is on the smaller side. Food options are very poor, I must say. I would just prefer a little warm cheese sandwich… rather than the meals they serve on flights under 2 hours.

Now worst of all is their “claim solving” division. They lost my suitcase in December last year, and I was told that I needed to wait 21 days to see if the suitcase would arrive. It didn’t… and will never turn up. I was travelling on business, so needed to buy clothes and toiletries for my 5 day stay in Morocco – again – ON BUSINESS. I kept the receipts, and 22 days later, I made a formal claim in writing. It took over a MONTH before I got a simple reply, asking for more details. I immediately answered (within 3 days), with every single detail informed – with copies of everything, from tickets to baggage tag… invoice copies and a valuation of what they lost.

I sent dozens and dozens of mails asking for information about my claim… NOTHING. I phoned every contact I could find to get information… NOTHING. On a recent trip to Agadir, I passed by the lost luggage, and threatened to take this to European Travel Agency… and I received their reply yesterday… 6 months and 7 days later. The offer they made me was about 50% of what I claimed…

Ridiculous in every sense of the word…

Again… I ONLY chose this airline, when there is nothing else.
qwuub: DECENT PRICES – OLD PLANES – LOST LUGGAGE
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
If you must fly with Royal Air Maroc, travel with the knowledge that if they lose your luggage, there may not be anyone to assist you at the arrival airport and no clear way of how to address the matter. Now we understand why so many people were flying with 2-3 suitcases in the cabin. By the way I had to fly the entire flight with me and my wife's carry-ons on my lap because other passengers insisted on squeezing as much as possible into the overhead bins (we had fragile items in our bags and couldn't risk damage). In all due fairness, the flight attendants of Royal Air Maroc have to be some of the most patient in the business, as they had to manage copious belligerent passengers on this trip.
I am not sure that there is a good way to get to Cape Verde, nor any excuse to ever trust an airline such as Royal Air Maroc. All of our emails have been met with promises to get back to us with 30-60 days. The phone charges on our phones here in Cape Verde are $3.50 per minute/$19 per MB so as we are trying to find our luggage we are getting a rapidly increasing phone bill.
See our TripAdvisor profile, we do 250-400,000km a year. Trust us, don't ever let yourself be in this position- there are other less risky flight options and destinations.

Title:

No one is able to tell me whether the problem was either on the way from São Paulo to Casablanca or from Casablanca to Cairo and I haven’t heard a single word from any of these airlines.
I had to buy some clothes and toiletries and was told by an Egyptair officer at Cairo International Airport that I have to wait up to 40 days to get reimbursed (they are supposed to contact me by email to get my credit card info to proceed with the reimbursement).
I would never recommend either Royal Air Maroc or Egyptair.

Title:
In 5 flights with Royal Air Maroc, departure is almost always delayed because of disorganized boarding and baggage loading. Delayed departures mean missed or tight connections and lost bags. Sometimes one is allowed 2 carry on bags and other times the agent is adamant about only one. This greatly reduces your protection when your or bags don't make connections.

Poor organization also continues in the air. On a recent 5 hour flight from Cairo to Casablanca, it took the cabin crew about 3 hours to distribute and clean up meal service on this single aisle aircraft.

Sometimes it is hard to avoid Royal Air Maroc, especially west and north Africa. But Turkish airlines services many of the same destinations, and it is a far superior carrier. Most experienced fliers among my friends try to avoid Royal Air Maroc, and with good reasons

Title: Our recent trip to Morocco was fabulous, EXCEPT for our flights on Royal Air Maroc. The personnel at the ticket counters are unfriendly and provide no information. But the worst thing is boarding and debarking from their planes.  You have to walk to a bus, which takes you to many steps to get on the plane.  I witnessed a mother with a toddler and an infant in a carrier who was not helped or given priority boarding, so she struggled to get up the steps with much difficulty.  If you are disabled and need a cane, forget it.  This is NOT the airline for you.  Another problem:  Their website encourages you to print out your boarding pass, but when you get to the airport (we left from JFK and returned from Casablanca), you have to wait in line to get your boarding pass from an agent. Several people who had printed out boarding passes waited in security lines, only to be returned to the ticket counter of Air Maroc.  Their food is the worst I've ever experienced and of course, there is no alcohol on the airplanes.  So think twice before you fly Royal Air Maroc.

qwuub: Don't even try to fly Royal Air Maroc if you use a cane or other mobility aid

Title: Wow, after many years of travelling a lot around the world I can easily say this was the WORST AIRLINE EVER.  what an awful experience, from check-in to disembarking.  The check in was painfully slow and disorganised.  was glad I wasn't a priority boarding ticket cause that line was even slower.  staff were not very helpful was only a few moments before boarding that I finally got to the front of the line, seemed every person checking in was in some kind of complications and staff were backwards and forwards... the plane itself had a shabby feeling about it but it was the toilets that were the worst, they were frankly disgustingly filthy, smelly and unhygienic.  the service was average at best and the food below average.Arriving in Casablanca for a stop-over was hideous experience.  from being shoved into an over crowded shuttle bus from the plane to then being dumped into a metal staircase leading up to a bridge that went into the airport. they had one security guy checking passports at the other end of the bridge which seems to go very very slowly, why they couldn't at least make space inside the airport was ridiculous.  inside the metal shed it was like an oven as was the enclosed bridge.  nobody explained anything there were no signs.  the airport itself was awful I think I showed my passport a total of 6 times in there and the staff were cold and uncaring, especially the security.  entering into the waiting area there were not enough seats and paltry shops and food options.  all I could do was pay $50 for the air morocco lounge which was strange and the food was poor and some of it been there fora long time but at least there was somewhere to rest and wifi that didn't work well.  I will never ever travel with this airline again.  and now I have big doubts of ever travelling to morocco.

Title:
I booked my trip from Miami to Lisbon with a stop in Casablanca for a really price $450. I didn’t care to review the ratings of Royal sair Maroc because it was such a good deal and I always fly when I have a good deal and never had an issue before. If you are reading this review it is because either you are considering or you just booked a flight with them. If you are considering, it is not worth it! Pay a bit more and fly with a different airline. If you already booked it....I hope you have a better experience than mine.
We had a 1.5 hour lay over in Casablanca that turned into almost 7 hours. We didn’t know what was going on, all we heard were rumors but no communication was given from a member of the airline company. Everyone on the flight was demanding an explanation, we asked for a supervisor or manager and didn’t get any response. They left the poor ladies at the gate and they were clueless and helpless plus, they didn’t understand English and nobody on my flight spoke French or Arabic. The agony was unbearable. We didn’t know if we were going to stay in Casablanca for the night, we weren’t provided vouchers for our meal....nothing! To top it all, when we finally were let into the plane, there was no AC and we had to endure 1.5 fly in a sauna. The return flight was better but they still left 30 minutes late from Lisbon and then another hour delay in Casablanca. They employees are super disorganized and it left me wondering if the pilot knew what he was doing. Luckily, I’m here to tell the story and give my review. Hopefully, in time for you to change your mind.
qwuub: Do not fly with Royal Air Maroc - deserve no stars

Title: Royal air Moroc is horrific! They not only stole our precious vacation time, sanity, energy — Royal Air Moroc as my husband and I attempted to fly from Casablanca to Paris on June 12, 2019 the airline RUINED OUR HONEYMOON. We were supposed to fly out on a 1:40PM flight and after sitting on the plane with no instruction just noise about a ‘technical’ problem hours went by. We finally left the aircraft only to be trapped on a bus when passengers lost their patience — protests, shouting horrific scenes of angry passengers banging on the glass because we were trapped on the bus. Still no apology, no explanation.... nothing. We finally left the airport at 10PM after zero help or guidance just dismissive air Moroc employees who are EXPERTS on having ZERO empathy, ZERO care, ZERO explanation they are good at literally turning their back towards us and running away. After literally running around the disorganized airport for ‘this stamp’ and ‘that ticket’ for a hotel for the night we almost missed our flight today since the bus that they arranged for our pickup decided to take a detour and pick up an airline flight attendant. As I sit on the back of the plane now, after being offered just FISH because the beef is OUT we finally hear an apology, “WE ARE SORRY ONLY FISH!” 😕 shame on this airline, their horrific customer service, their attitude, their complete lack of empathy, their unwillingness to assist elderly and screaming babies. DO NOT FLY THIS AIRLINE! DO NOT FLY THIS AIRLINE! We don’t want anyone else from NYC having their vacation ruined.

Title: Ruined our honeymoon to Paris. Had a flight from Casablanca to Paris. First plane didn’t work, we sat and taxied on the runway for about 90 minutes. Then we were going to get on a shuttle to another plane. We sat on the transport bus for another 30 minutes. People started yelling and knocking on the doors to get off. Another 15 minutes, and we were brought inside the terminal. We were stuck there for 5 or 6 hrs with no explanation or solution. Our flight was at 1:40pm, and we were all still there at 10pm. People were yelling, screaming, protesting. We were supposed to be off to a romantic suite in Paris. Our hotel in Paris said they couldn’t refund us the night. We had a tour booked for the Louvre this morning. Finally at 11pm, they drive us 40 minutes to the city center to stay at a hotel, and rebooked a flight at the same time today. They didn’t seem to care at all about our situation. Horrible. I hope we get to Paris today. We only had so much time, and now lost an entire day of our honeymoon in Paris.

Title:
My wife and I flew with this airline for our morocco trip. To marrakech with a transfer in casablanca. So 4 flights in total. Not one of them departed in time. Minimum 2 hours of delay. To top that, there was also schedule change for 2 major flights. It was emailed to us but when we arrived at the airport all the screens were showing the old schedule and we were shocked. They did not even care to correct the screens in the airport.

It’s not over...

They lost our luggage in casablanca transfer and we waited for 2 hours for it to arrive in the next flight but we could retrieve it 2 days later. Called the customer support 10 times, nobody had any idea about where it was. I had to go to airport and ask everyone to find my luggage. They called me back 5 days later to see if I found my luggage or not. The trip was already over! On the return flight from marrakech to casablanca, our luggages were delayed for 1.5 hours. We contacted the customer support but they did nothing. Told us that there was a strike in the airport. I found some ground transportation guys by peeking through the curtains on the luggage belt to outside and asked them. Fortunately they found our luggage (90 mins after we started waiting for it.

In conclusion, avoid this airline if possible. Or else, be ready for delays and don’t check in any baggage. Take them in your carry on.

Title:
We arrived at our destination safely, which is most important, correct?

Even though we booked flights on the Fareness App four months in advance, we (two people) were assigned separate seats. Luckily we checked in early, we were able to change seats with the representative at the counter.

The flight attendants rarely shared a smile, especially given the length of the flight. I felt uncomfortable even asking for some water.

The cabin smelled funky. The restroom was dirty.

The food was awful. They served the same two items on four flights we had to take w/ long layovers in Casablanca, Morocco en route to Lisbon, Portugal.
Lesson learned: I will pay extra for direct flights🥴

None of the three USB ports were functional. If I was able to hold it just the correct way, it might have charged my smart phone. Thank goodness I didn’t require the ports for any devices, however. My headphones helped to plug-in and endure the long trips.

Title: I was very skeptical to book with Royal Air Maroc after reading the reviews.  I took my chance book the flight because the other airlines were so expansive.  I was going to Lisbon, Portugal with a stop in Casablanca.  I flew to Casablanca without any problem.  Flight left on time from JFK, the service at the counter was smooth.  The service on the plane was outstanding, food and snack were very good.  In Casablanca to Portugal our flight was delayed for 2 hours.  I traveled a lot I wouldn’t have any problem with the delay if we were informed about the delay.  The sign stayed at the gate has the same departure flight time.  When questioning someone at customer service the answer was:  the plane is leaving soon.  Two hours later we got on the plane and had a short and wonderful trip to Portugal.  I received my luggage when I got off the planes in Portugal without any problems.  On the way back both planes were on time.  I received my suitcases at destination again.  The service at the counter in Portugal were superb.  The only problem I had was with the travelers, they don’t want to line up to wait for their turn to board, that’s not the Airline fault.  I will definitely traveled with Royal Air Maroc.  Hopefully they keep doing the same great service all the time.

Title: We flew Royal Air Maroc on June 2, and our troubles began at the gate.  First, our departure was delayed by two hours but there was absolutely no communication about this while we waited--in fact, the screen at the gate still showed our original departure time even two hours later when we finally boarded, and the flight tracker on their website actually showed that we took off and landed on time.  Just before boarding, we were told by another passenger that the delay was due to an issue with the baggage handlers, but she only discovered this because she overheard an angry passenger questioning the airline staff person covering our gate desk--but no announcements were made to the group, just as with the departure delay.  When we arrived in Casablanca we discovered that NO ONE'S LUGGAGE had been loaded onto the plane--and we learned from Marrakech airport staff that this had been the case for all Royal Air Maroc flights arriving in the last two days!  Like other reviewers have posted below, we got the runaround when we tried to contact the airline to find out where our bag was, when it would arrive, and whether it would be shipped back to the U.S. if it didn't arrive soon (our flight home was just two days later).  We are seasoned travelers and completely understand that delays, weather, strikes, malfunctions, etc all happen from time to time--but the complete lack of communication by the airline (at check-in, at the gate, in the air, and via phone to customer service afterward) and what seemed to be an overall attitude of "not my problem" by the airline staff made the experience much more stressful than it needed to be.  We certainly won't be flying with them again.
qwuub: No luggage + No communication + Poor customer service = Unnecessarily stressful experience
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Arrived at airport more than 2 hours in advance. Tried kiosk check-in. Kiosk would not allow check-in for our flight - please see agent. Now, get in line with the 100 folks. Finally get to counter (30 mins) and agent says we have been "bumped" from flight. How? and Why? Royal Air Maroc allows for a 10% oversold. OK, makes sense, I am a multi-airline million miler, I get it, however, why am i not provided a boarding pass to complete my journey through security and customs? No Answer. I was now shuffled to supervisor, who informed me, my partner, and another SIX American travelers, we did not have seat assignments, and would have to wait until 59 minutes prior to departure for seats to be released, therefore providing upgrades to frequent travelers to business class and we would then get their seats. ABSURD! So, 8 Americans waited another 30 minutes to get seat assignments, providing us less than 50 minutes to venture through security, customs and get to our gate...this was a nightmare. If not for the plane being delayed 1.5 hours (never communicated to the passengers from anyone at the ticket counter of at the gate) we would have missed our flight. The title of my post is "BEWARE - US Citizens Targeted" because all of the people (8) who were not provided with seat assignments were American, coincidence? Doubtful. I don't believe coincidence comes around 8 times over. We were all tourist who were traveling with Royal Air Maroc on a single time basis, to fly from Africa to Europe and therefore we had no "value" to the Royal Air Maroc system. I would avoid Royal Air Maroc at all cost, choose the European carrier who services your European destination, not the host country airline of your departure.  Horrible customer service, stressful travel experience!  AVOID Royal Air Maroc.

Title: Literally the worst flying experience I have ever had I almost thought I was being punked. A connecting flight from Casablanca to JFK after originating in Marrakech, never in my wildest dreams did I think I would have such a stressful experience home. To begin, we sat on the plane for 2 and a half hours before take off because the luggage workers were on strike so it was taking an extremely long time to load the plane. After 2 and a half hours of sitting on the Tarmak, an announcement is made in severely broken english that "the hole is now closed, you will be leaving with no luggage", a literal riot on the plane ensued. No further information was given, no representative came out to talk to the people, we just sat their and and freaked out. For 40 minutes the flight staff refused to speak to anyone, and people had absolutely no idea what was going on with their luggage. Then, the captain comes on the loudspeaker and says "we are now taking off, also 40% of the bags made it on board". Like what?!?!?! Who says that to a plane full of over a hundred people with no further explanation? What is this a social experiment? It was so unprofessional and downright rude. The staff treated us terribly and basically hid from the cabin so as not to deal with angry questions. THAT IS YOUR JOB. When we landed they gave no one information on how to collect their bags or what the next step would be. I was lucky to have had a connecting flight so my luggage made it on. Unfortunately, others were not so lucky.

We received notification that this flight was cancelled in advance, with no explanation and the only alternative we were offered was to spend 31 hours in Casablanca and then return to Heathrow on the 30th, instead of LGW. We accepted this change as we had no other choice. However, in doing so resulted in us losing extra money as we had already pre-paid for our travel from Gatwick back to home, and then had to fork out even more so to travel from Heathrow. We arrived at the airport on the 29th of May to fly to Casablanca on flight AT578 only to be informed our flight was delayed until further notice. We were sent to a hotel with no contact information or new flight details. During the day at the hotel no representatives of RAM were present nor did they provide any information to hotel reception. It was only by luck we were passing through reception to be told our bus was on its way and to collect our bags quickly, resulting in us nearly missing the bus, and in consequence our flight because of very poor communication skills from RAM.

When finally arriving into CMN at 01:00am we had to wait 90 minutes for ground staff to come to the transit and lodging office, then a further 25 minutes before we were given a hotel room for the night.

We were then at the airport at 10:00am on Thursday the 30th for flight AT800 to LHR, we checked our bags in and collected our boarding passes, cleared security and attempted to board the plane only to be told there was a change to our booking and we were now flying the following day. I had no prior notification to this and the ground staff were extremely unhelpful, offering no explanation as to why and making out as if it was a fault of our own which it most definitely was not. Your ground staff were incredibly rude, nobody willing to take the blame sending us round in circles for 2 hours before we even had a slight idea as to what was happening. Nobody knew were our luggage was, your baggage services team told us it had left on the AT800 without us, which is a major security risk, check in staff were saying it was still in the airport but they didn’t know where, the transit staff didn’t want to help at all. So with no luggage we were left in Morocco with nothing but the clothes on our back.

We arrived back into LGW on the AT802 on 31/05/19, two days LATER than planned, out of pocket for having to spend money that could have been prevented by yourselves, only to be standing around the baggage carousel to find out our luggage hasn’t arrived. One of our bags in still in Casablanca and the other bag can’t be traced. There is a substantial amount of value in those cases and we were promised that those bags were on our flight this morning by YOUR check in agents.

So not only was our original flight to LGW cancelled and altered to LHR a day later, we were stuck in BJL with no communication from your staff as to what was happening other than 1 email saying the delay duration was unknown. You then changed our flights to LHR whilst we were in the departure lounge, extending our stay for an extra day. Our checked luggage was tagged for LHR but we ended up flying to LGW. All in you have cost us 2 days wages at work, extra spending costs in Morocco, pointless train tickets as we then couldn’t use any we had previously purchased and no luggage to be seen. There hasn’t been a single member of staff who has apologised for all the inconvenience you have caused us, and we have spoken to at least 20 members.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Any concern previously generated in order to fly by Air Maroc was just changed for a sequence of wow moments.

The airplane: 787 Dreamliner. Modern. Huge. A very tasteful catering. Much more generous than well know US companies.

They provided accommodation for 1 night, shuttle transfer and meals for 1 night as my connections took more than 8 hours. Easy and very friendly at Casablanca Mohammed V International Airport.

Luggage is headed to final destination. Good to have a clothes change in the carry-on, specially if you intend use the gap to visit Casablanca.

I not only recommend but also I'm looking for another trip to Europe use their services again.
qwuub: A sequence of "wow" moments with Air Maroc
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flew roundtrip D.C. to Rome by way of Casablanca.  Check-in was fine, onboarding was not organized.  Check-in staff was happy to accommodate my last minute seating requests. On all four flights, boarding started late (usually 30 minutes late) and it was never clear what groups were suppose to be boarding.  Flights were great- a lot of meals and an attentive crew.  There was a decent selection of media/movie options.  We carried on our luggage to Rome and there was ample space in the overhead bins.  I recommend flying with RAM with the expectation that onboarding is not seamless/without some confusion.
qwuub: Nice planes and attentive crew, unorganized boarding process

Title:
I write this review not to disrespect, escalate racial diversity or even to tarnish the image of this company, rather want to push for a proper training of personal and learn to discipline them.

For some reasons, my connecting flight from Casablanca to Moscow was canceled a day before my trip.😲🤷🏾‍♂️
⠀

I arrived the airport and went to the accommodation department at the airport to get accommodation voucher, cos i could not hang-out in the airport for two nights!
⠀
I have meet some Africans 🤷🏾‍♂️ that were stuck in the airport lobby for 2 DAYS!!, 😭😭🤯😱 because thier flight was cancelled and they where not provided accommodation due to the fact they are AFRICANS (black Africans) that may want to over stay the transit grace in Morocco !!! That is so crazy !!!!🤬🤬
⠀
So back to my horrible story ! 👎🏿👎🏿👎🏿👎🏿👎🏿
I meet a young man ( who never introduced him self) and i asked for voucher
He told me that I did not pay for my flight and I have no flight to Moscow.
⠀

I tried to explain to him that there must be a mistake! it can't be that i don't have a flight.
I just flew from Lagos to Casablanca !
⠀

He kept on insisting that i don't have a ticket and that he can't do anything to help and that I should leave his office.
⠀

At this moment, he started acting rude and raising his voice, because i told him there is a mistake, it can't be that I don't have a ticket.
⠀
I showed him my payment receipt, but he ignored me and started speaking to someone else in Arabic neglecting my presence.
⠀

I asked, what next to do, and He said i should go to the agent and fix it. ( Talking off his shoulders)
⠀

I told him that i will report to the administration about his bad and unprofessional manner of communication, of which he answered, that I can do whatever i want and go to where ever I want and he does not care! Literally telling me off. 🤯

I felt racially discriminated of both colour of skin and because I did not speak Arabic. I could tell from the way he attended to some white Arabian who walked up to interrupt us. I told him to please finish talking to me before switching to another costumer, but to no avail.
⠀

I got a confirmation from the agent and a prove that my flight was cancelled late, a day before the scheduled departure .(Not by me but by the company, because they could not Provide a flight on the scheduled day they sold me the ticket 🎫 )
⠀

I went back to him to get my accommodation ( cos could not hang around the airport for 2 DAYS)
⠀
I told him to give me his name so I can lay my complaint and dissatisfaction of this particular employee and He refused to disclose his identity.
⠀
After i managed to take a picture of him, he threatened he will call the police to arrest me.
⠀
A different personal ( I think his boss) came and then gave me the voucher for accommodation.
⠀

I asked for the identity of that particular Personal, but He said i should just forget it.
⠀

I made it known that i will post this online if i did not get a personal apology from that personal.
⠀
He now told me that I will get into trouble and arrested !!!!!
⠀
I told him what had happened and he did not even confirm from that personal what exactly happened !!
⠀
How can you trust a company that does not in anyway respect ✊ their clients ?
⠀
So if you want to be insulted, racially discriminated, unscheduled flight cancelation, then this company is the best you can count on.
⠀
I hope this will fall to attentive ears and we all will learn to make people step up, get educated and learn to communicate with respect, gratitude and improved customers services.

Title:

Spend a whole day of my vacation on the phone trying to get the airline to un-cancel my flight back home. They refused to do it. I had to buy a brand new ticket to get back home.
Basically I had to pay extra $500 because of their horrible exchange policy and ANOTHER $500 because of their absolutely insane "no show policy".
Will never, never use this airline again. Worst airline experience of my life.

Title: My sister and I traveled from IAD to FCO with layover each way of the round trip through Casablanca CMN. First leg of our trip went as planned and all went well. Easy check in and a comfy night flight with good food and service from all attendants. Unfortunately the return trip was a disaster. Our FCO flight was delayed 4 hours- our connection in CMN missed to IAD. We were sent back and forth to different office to collect our luggage, get help for a new flight and obtain accommodations for the night. No one was helpful, no one was kind. Only after threats were we allowed to get our luggage except my sister's bag was lost. The tracker stated it was at CMN. CMN couldn't find it. Had to threaten in order to get placed on another carrier since another RAM flight to IAD would be in 3 days. After about 4 hours at the airport, we were finally given flights with Air Canada. Our hotel was a place to sleep, but was as expected based on poor treatment and service at the airport. My sister's bag is still lost and no one has helped her. Even Air Canada opened a case to help and they never touched her bag. Shameful. I will not travel with RAM again. I do not recommend the airline. I don't even want to travel to Morrocco again. So thankful that our entire trip to Italy was marvelous which helped us calmly handle a bad ending to our travels. Shame on you RAM.

Title: It is a three hour flight in the middle of the night, so nobody is going to enjoy it, but the cabin staff were among the grumpiest I have ever seen in Africa. Perhaps they disapproved of me drinking in Ramadan, but all I wanted was a quick couple of glasses of wine to go to sleep - not the full meal service they were trying to give everyone at 2 in the morning! Seats were OK - hard to sleep in (didn't recline very far), but nice and wide and plenty of leg-room. Arrived in Casablanca and spent almost an hour locating the hotel room which they offer to people with over eight hours' stop-over, only to discover it was a horrible, smelly, hole-in-the-ground room that nobody except the truly desperate would use. So I went to the new "VIP" lounge, which was very nice - except no alcohol as Ramadan. Not very international, I would have to say.
qwuub: Middle night flight not met well at Casablanca

Title: We flew back to London after a vacation in Morocco which was great but this airline is one of the worst we have ever flown on. We had seats booked near the rear of the plane as that was all that was available when we booked. When we tried to check in online it wouldn’t let us. When we got to the airport we asked about upgrading to business class. We were told that we would first have to check in so we did. We then went to the counter to tag our luggage and asked about upgrading and what it would cost. They had no idea how to check or do this and told us to go to a different counter. We did that and we were told that we couldn’t upgrade as we had already checked in!! We told them that we were told to do that but they didn’t care. We therefore sat in our assigned seats which had the least amount of legroom we have ever encountered. We also noticed that there were empty seats in business class that we would have paid for so the airline lost revenue as a result. The in flight service on the flight was also poor.

Title: I was initially a bit nervous about this airline because I hadn’t heard of it and because I had seen a decent amount of negative reviews. However, at least in my experience, all of these concerns were unfounded. I had a wonderful trip with this airline and they had top-notch customer service. Plus, it was at least $300 cheaper than other flights - including other non-direct flights. The departures were orderly and on-time. There were no luggage issues. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Great entertainment selection. And even the food was really good! We had two meals for the longer leg of our flight and even one meal for the shorter leg. For a great value internal airline, I’d recommend Royal Air Maroc!
qwuub: Great value, great service, I recommend!

Title: Warning! Do not use Royal Air Moroc!I have used them twice,both times there were several major problems.Here are the honest facts the last time I flew with them in April 2019.First,my original flight was cancelled,but then they only re-booked the first leg of my new booking with them.I was fortunate to notice it and get it completed.Then they lost my bag for 14 days! First my transit flight was delayed for more than two hours at Mohamed V airport and an extra hour on the plan until taking off which ruined my first day in Lisbon without reasonable explanation and every time I ask the gate flight attendant for the delay reason she replay with an unreasonable answer like the plan is still under cleaning then they sent me an Apology email saying admiting so.

The major problem was with my flight back home i went to the airport early as I received an email from Iberia stating that the airport security are having a strike so to finish on time i need to be there early i checked in my bag and finished everything but I didn’t know my gate they announce at Madrid Airport that we have to check the boards every now and then because they don’t announce gates or changed flights i checked and i went to my gate and when boarding time come i went to check in to find that im at the wrong gate and that my flight is not Royal Air Maroc but Royal Air Maroc operated by Iberia i went to the other gate and the flight was already gone so i went to the customer service to tell me that they can do nothing for me i have to contact Royal Air maroc which have the worst callcenter line that is very hard to reach and the hot keys always don’t comply with the choice they told me after so many attempts and lot of roaming calls about 200 euros international calls to your call center only that they will rebook me on the next flight to Casablanca and then the next transit flight back home to cairo and that they will book me an hotel as the flight to cairo will be the next morning but first i need to be cancelled from cairo flight which they cant help me with as it is operated by EGYPTAIR not Royal Air Maroc i wasn’t able to reach them and badly lost in from Casablanca to cairo to takeoff to be able to Rebook which also was delayed an hour from taking off at its original time i called the call center again and he told me that he will rebook me at the next flight to casablanca then the next morning to cairo but i have to pay 201 Euros as a penalty and there will be ni hotel for me it will be on me desperately i accept as my visa was going to expire in two days and my bag was boarded to cairo and me and my family back home were in panic to get to the next problem that he booked me the flight but i cant pay the penalty through the call center i had to pay it at Royal Air Maroc office at Madrid Airport i went there to pay to find the girl there barley speaking english with no experience telling me that she will not be able to take the penalty money from me and give me a flight number to travel back home she only make new booking even though she had my ticket on her system and i have to do it though the call center which refused telling me that he only take penalty money 48 hours before flights i spent more than two hours begging the girl in the office or the call center to take the money and let me go home with both of them refusing after losing a lot of money time and effort i decided to get back to madrid book the next day flight on my Home Airline EGYPTAIR and go home to find that my bag is still in Casablanca at the Iberia Title: This was our first and last time flying Royal Air Maroc. We left JFK the evening of 4/22/19 with a connection in Casablanca to Marrakech. When our luggage didn't arrive on the carousel, we got in the very long line at the claims desk, but were told nothing. The next two days we went to the airport morning and night in hopes that our luggage was among the luggage that was piled in a few corners near the claims desk...no luck. However, we did hear from others that the baggage handlers in Casablanca went on strike 4/21/19. On the third night, we waited for the last flight to arrive from Casablanca (11:30pm) and was told by an airport employee that more luggage was arriving, the strike was over. Our luggage finally arrived at 2:14am 4/26/19, 2.5 days after our arrival. The name/luaage tags were torn off all of the arriving luggage and we walked around like everyone else hoping to spot our luggage, which we did. There was no system, no scanning, no monitoring. People simply walked up the luggage and picked-up a piece. We were so lucky that the people looking for their luggage were honest. It is now 5/7/19 and we haven't received any notification, but we have our luggage. Based on other reviews, this is not uncommon. It was my first and last time traveling Royal Air Maroc, My husband and I paid for extra leg room, aisle seat but when the time was changed by 10 minutes they changed our seats to the very last row, with no explanation or compensation. DON'T DO IT!!..

Title: Flight attendants (2 males) were the worst I have ever experienced and I do a lot of international travel.  They served a meal with a cup for a hot beverage and told passengers they would be separately serving the coffee/tea.  They came around with tea but when asked for coffee said that would be forthcoming.  After more than an hour of wait (and my traveling companion is someone who needs her coffee!) my companion went to the back of the plane and demanded coffee which they gave her.  I continued to patiently wait for them to serve, but eventually went back to seek coffee myself. One attendant was asleep and the other playing on his electronic device  I was told they had no more coffee!  And they tried to say they had come through with coffee service, which was just a boldfaced lie. When I expressed outrage one attendant found and brought me some coffee. The other folks around me then started clamoring for coffee (they too had been patiently waiting), and were told there was no more. One other point to add is that during the entire flight (over 5 hours), the attendants never responded to the call buttons - they would just ignore them and then turn them off from the back of the plane!Incidentally, Royal Air Maroc does not actually want customer feedback.  My friend and I were anxious to give our feedback after the flight, but the survey link that the airline sent us never worked.  Even after I called them to complain about the survey link and to request a working link, they never followed up.
qwuub: Airline absolutely cares nothing about its customers
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I had flight from Cairo to Santiago de Chile with layovers in Casablanca and Barcelona. They didn't let m check in and kicked me out of the airport and I have never heard a word from them after all of my complaints. There have no thing such as customer care. They are robbery not an airline.
Detail:
The check in staffs didn't let me check in with the reason as a Vietnamese I need transit visa for Spain. I had a carry on bag only, boarding pass from Barcelona - Santiago de chile printed, layovers is less than 24 hours and both arriving and deoarting flight from the same terminal (terminal 1) and I did not intend to leave the internationl transit area. As I confirmed with the Embassy of Spain in Vietnam by email, I DO NOT need a transit visa for Spain if I don't leave the international transit area. It is also written on the official website of the Embassy of Spain. And the Vietnamese embassy in Cairo confirmed with me once more. I attached the screenshot of the website and the email. In their website aslo written that "passenger can transit with out visa through Barcelona and Madrid arriving from a non-Schengen member State with a confirmed onward ticket and travel to a non-Schengen member State

Therefore I got denide boarding wrongfully by Royal air Maroc.

After that, they wrote a paper and send a person to escort me through security gate. I followed him, didn't know that they are sending me out of the airport. At the security gate, I refuse to leave. The staff pointed at the gate and said "go, go, go. Out". What kind of customer service is that!

Title:
We had bought a direct flight from Casablanca to CPH.
The departure was changes twice, and when we had to go the plane was overbooked, so we couldn't travel.
it took us 6 hours before we at a minimum got a hotel to the day after, and a new flight.
The personal was NOT serviceminded at all, and we had to call the manager who didnot care to show up. Nothing happend in those 6 hours, and we didnøt even got a bottle of water and we had to flex from the checkin to the office - back and forth because nobody took the responsability to help os.

We could easily find new flights on the internet with depature on the same day, but they didnot want to use surgestions at all and kept delaying ANY form for solutions.

At last we got a flight of 13 hours to go home - 24 hours after the original flight (which was 4,5 hours direct flight)

I really do not understand how a firm can be so indifferent and not serviceminded at all. Im horrified that this can happen in 2019. Never have I seen such bad behavior to customers acctually having payed for a flight and not even get the obligated service to help to solve the problem ...

Who in the world turns the back on you when you ask for help - or water ...

Never EVER would I use Royal Air Maroc.

I really hope we get the obligated compensation for getting back to CPH 24 hours later than planned ....

This review is only minded at the service at the airport - getting a new flight - not the plane where everything was fine and serviceminded.

Title:
On paper, Royal Air Maroc sounds great with luggage and a meal included in the airfare. However, the good things seemed to end right there.

A group of us are travelling to Marrakech from Milan airport. The MXP - CMN sector was fine, there was a hot meal included and our luggage was checked in straight for Marrakech airport.

At Casablanca airport however, it is where the airline failed to deliver on the fundamentals. The boarding procedures were messy. Screens were not updated and boarding agents are sometimes unsure of what flights are boarding or not. We had to figure out if our flight, AT413 is boarding or not at one of the gates.

Our flight was also delayed by about 45 minutes.

On arrival at Marrakech, there was no assistance or information provided as to what to do or what happened to the delayed luggage. The baggage claim counter was overwhelmed by passengers from our flight and other flights and the online baggage tracker was outdated.

Eventually, the unhappy crowd at the baggage claim managed to come up with a form in which we filled up our luggage details and lodging to be submitted to the counter.

We left the airport without our luggage and tried our luck again that evening to get some information at the airport as there was no updates or notification from the airline about the luggage. Eventually, we found our luggage outside the baggage claim and it took us a while to get them to indicate the time of collection.

An email inquiry we sent out on 22nd April was eventually answered to on 2nd May. The airline apologized, said it was due to customs officers strike and gave a list of instructions on what to do and denied responsibility for what has happened.

I have experienced delays and delayed luggage incidents before with other airlines. In those cases, there was information and assistance provided on what to do next on-ground and online: solutions. Unfortunately, Royal Air Maroc seemed more concerned about denying responsibility was what that convinced me to give it 1/5 rating instead of a 3/5 (because the MXP - CMN flight was actually okay). The airline seemed to not get it that all we wanted is information, solutions and updates when such things happened.

Royal Air Maroc uses RAM Handling as their baggage handler, most other airlines such as Lufthansa, Ryanair and Vueling at RAK uses Swissport which has a better reputation.

As such, I strongly advise getting another airline with a more reliable baggage handler. This airline didn't get its priorities right. If nothing bad happens then it is good, if it does, you are pretty much left in the lurch like the many passengers we encountered at RAK with their missing and delayed luggage.
qwuub: Did Not Get the Fundamentals of an Airline Right
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were supposed to travel home from Casablanca(Marocco) to Copenhagen(Denmark) with direct flight.
Got an email 10 hours before departure that my flight was cancelled and i was rebooked to another flight with transit in Berlin.
When we arrived at the airport we were told we didnt have seats due to overbooking.
For 6 hours we were stranded in the airport. The company refused to book another flight to europe, even thought there were plenty of available flight to airports with connections to Denmark.
We asked for water and food but the airline refuses to give us anything.
We asked to talk to the manager, but the manager refused to speak to us / show up.
After 6 hours we were put into a bus and send to the nearby hotel. Got a voucher for a crap-meal.
The day after we spend 13 hours on travelling because the airline send us to Turkey for a connection to Denmark. Our original booking was a direct flight of 4,5 hours.
So far we haven’t seen any kind of compensation.
We came to Marocco with Norwegian. Norwegians tickets were much cheaper but had much better service.
I will never ever travel with Royal Air Maroc again.
Worst service ever. The company are not worthy calling themself Royal...
Use another airline or take your car.. Or stay home...
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: After booking the flight RAM sent e-mails roughly every two days that my flight was shifted to a day earlier or later, making planning a trip impossible. Finally I cancelled and booked again. Arriving in Agadir it turns out that ALL the luggage of the plane was missing. We had to queue up from midnight till 3:30 am to inform the one working employe in charge of luggage claim about our contact details. We got no confirmation about our lost luggage and neither does RAM send the luggage to your location. After 6 days they finally let us know that the luggage was not lost and that we can pick it up. There was no excuse whatsoever, I am just glad we had a luggage insurance. Hearing about that story, our local host ensured us that this was business as usual with RAM.
