Title:
If you are looking for expert customer service, and attention to detail you will not find it with this airline. Only book this airline if you like being lied to, being laughed at and being told some how it is your fault.

First they left my bag in Geneva even though I was assured it was on flight AT933 to Casablanca. I even asked the women at the desk before i boarded. She checked the system and assured me it was there.
I get to Casablanca and the reception for baggage is rude and put the wrong description for my bag. I was leaving for Fez the next day so I could not wait for them.
I called multiple times to ask them to transfer my bag to Fez. They said no worries, it would be one the plane on the next flight.
Called to follow up, then was told it was not on the flight to Fez, but in Casablanca.
So I told them to leave it in Casablanca and I would come get it on the 28th of April when I was coming back to go home.

On the 28th of April I went to the baggage area. THEY SENT IT TO FEZ!! Even though I specifically told them not to.

Now I am back home waiting... Still waiting... Still no update. I have call Several times, asked them to send it back home to Canada. The last conversation I had with them was about 7 minutes ago. I do not trust that this woman I spoke with actually sent an email to get my back home.

Do Not book with Royal Air Maroc if you are looking for good service. You wont find it here.

Title:
Royal Air Maroc, was all round pathetic.

We had a flight booked from Marrakech to Dubai via Casablanca.
It had a 90 minute lay over in Casablanca. Then the flight changed with a 20min layover, which I thought was not enough time to make it to my transfer.
I spoke to the staff at Royal Air Maroc 27 Hours before my flight at the airport trying to explain the situation and they just said “it’s ok” “it’s ok”. How can a staff member think that, that is ok, even worse I went to the supervisor and they said the same thing. (see photos for flight times on tickets)

Then our flight was delayed (surprise surprise) Landed in Casablanca, and the gates where closed and we missed our flight.
No one could help, I can’t explain how lazy, unhelpful and un professional the staff of Royal Air Maroc are.

We tried to speak to someone who could help. No one would help us. Spoke to staff at the counter and they just looked at me blankly and said “10mins”. 30 minutes later, nothing, 60 minutes later, nothing. This man at the counter was Hassin Ismail. He told me he would call when the supervisor came.
I man arrived at the counter, sat there for 20mins, I then went up and spoke to the new staff member, he was the supervisor. Hassin Ismail, did not even bother to tell me, whilst I stood in front of him all that time waiting.
Seriously don’t understand how the staff can be so incompetent.

After a long 5 hours, we got a new flight the next day via Paris! We where told to get our bags to go to our hotel, went to the counter and they said they can’t get our bags at the baggage handlers. Then spoke to another assist in the transit office, and she said it will take 2 hours to get our bags, the bus to our hotel was leaving in 15 minutes that they organised for us.

Then our hotel was a 70 minute Drive away from the airport. Which was not a safe feeling drive, with the driver going 120km/h in a 60km zone as well as constantly speaking on his mobile phone. (see photos attached)

Other people had similar problems with their flights and they where on the bus with us and had been dropped of at 5 star hotels (locals) whilst we where we given a dingy hotel in a side alley.
In this hotel, they served us a set Royal Air Maroc set menu, without telling us what it was and asking for any allergies or dietary requirements and no drinks provided. They said breakfast was provided, which we did not get from the hotel, they said ti was to early.

Then was told to wait downstairs at 4am for 4:45am pick up. I asked why wait so long, they said don’t know when the driver will come.

Went to the main counter of Air Maroc which was supposed to open at 6am, did not open till 6:15am, they staff that was supposed to be there to open was sitting in the coffee shop across having coffee and chatting with a colleague (see attached photo) while we had 4 other customers where waiting outside the door.
We asked for our breakfast voucher and he then sent us to an area that was closed, and I said it was closed and he just said I cant do anything. No one takes responsibility or helps you with Royal Air Maroc, why bother having staff like that.

They did not give us a boarding pass to our connecting flight from Paris, so we had to go there to get one, with no baggage tickets. Go to Paris and we had 60 mins to get of the plane, clear customs, catch a train 5 stops to another terminal, find our check in counter to explain our situation and get our tickets. We just made that flight.

My food on the plane was frozen (see photo attached)

Arrived in Dubai and our bags where lost.
It took 5 days to receive our bags. We where stuck in Dubai with know luggage and only received our bags when we went back to Sydney. After 2 days and 8 calls, I got through to someone at Royal Air Maroc asking if we can get remuneration for cosmetics and clothes we had to buy, and they HUNG UP!

Tried to contact Royal Air Morroc for remunerations and explanations for everything, via email and they said we will get back to you within 60 Days!

There is a lot more, but it is not worth going on.

Try your best to use another airline, we flew a few other flights with them around Morocco and all where delayed with issues, with boarding gates etc...
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
On April 9th,2019 I flew from Casablanca to New York,flight #AT 200. I purchased my Airline ticket, over 2 month ahead of time, through Orbitz, and selected my seat. About a month later, or so, I received an Email from Royal Air Maroc, saying that they changed my plane. I went on line to check for my seat, but I found it all gone, and not replaced. I contacted a Royal Air Maroc Agency in Essaouira, Morocco. The agent informed me, that I don't have any seat assigned. He then, assigned me a seat all the way in the back. I wasn't happy with that!!!
Came April 9th, at the Airport, my boarding pass says "Group C." We were lined up according to our groups, A,B,C, etc... for more than an hour. Elderly women and men were so tired, that they sat on the floor and read their books. A middle aged man started to talk loudly complaining about this situation, and no Royal Air Maroc representative came forward to explain, or apologize to their passengers. Half an hour later, they let us in our plane, but not in groups order, like we were assigned in our passes. Up in the air, the pilot announced, that he was sorry for the long delay, that was beyond their control. While we were flying, about midway, I was very thirsty, and since I had a window seat, I didn't want to disturb an elder lady next to me, so I touched, on my TV screen the sign of the crew member, to request a cup of water, but no one responded. I repeated the same request every now and then 11 times, but no one ever came to check on what I want. Anyway, I ended up by going to the back of the plane, and there were 3 flight attendants seating and busy on their cell phones, playing games, or looking at their photos. I mentioned to them that I could've been dead of thirst in my seat, despite the fact that I rang their bell so many times. One of them said, they respond to those bells, because people play with them, and I was told to help myself with the water bottle. This was embarrassing and ridiculous. I wish that, the Royal Air Maroc was better managed.
crvsd: Mohammed E wrote a review May 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: My flight was delayed for a few hours because a person had gotten sick. They took her off the plane and they also had to take her luggage off. To take her luggage off, they had to take some other people’s luggage off. But because of the Porter Strike, the rest of the luggage was not put back on the plane. When we reached Dulles from Casa Blanca I waited an hour for my luggage, but found it did not come. Over half of the people on the flight were missing their luggage. Unfortunately, I was one of those unlucky souls who were missing their belongings. I had come to Maryland to see my sister who was in the hospital and spend time with her, but I had to spend time searching for my luggage. I went a week without clothing or my personal items. I tried to find my luggage by calling customer service, but they kept asking for a claim number that we were not given. Days later, I went back to the airport to retrieve my luggage with my nieces because I had heard that it would be coming in on that day’s flight. When we got the luggage we realized that it was drenched with water and was soaking wet. All of the items in my suitcase were ruined. Other people also got their suitcases back. Some suitcases were ripped open, others had rust on them, some of the locks were broken, and most were drenched with rain. I assume that our suitcases had been out in the rain for multiple days hence the rust. What made it worse was that I brought wedding clothes for my niece’s wedding in my suitcases. I had also sewn a suit for my mother. The clothes were completely wet and wrinkled. My hard work and money had gone to waste. We managed to salvage a few pieces of clothing. We also made a claim, but have not received anything in response. I strongly recommend that you not take this airline if you don’t want to have to deal with the many inconveniences that come with traveling with this airline. There is poor communication with passengers and many problems with finding luggage. I definitely will not be traveling with this airline again. I had bought my ticket on short notice as I had a family emergency. This is just a warning to future passengers on account of the trouble I had on my trip with Royal Air Maroc.
qwuub: Delayed Flight;Lost Luggage Found Soaking Wet;INCONVENIENT!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I travelled last week to Casablanca from NY's JFK airport.  Our flight was delayed by 45 minutes, but were told we were still on time.  By the time we dealt with the disorganized, chaotic boarding, we were already past our scheduled departure time.  The flight itself was just as disorganized as the boarding.  My entire row was skipped during the dinner and drink service.  I finally got some water after 5 hours of flying.  I sent a whatsapp message as well as an email to customer service.  When 2 days passed and I hadn't heard back, I called customer service only to be given an attitude and told there is nothing they can do.  I was concerned that this would happen again on my return flight.  When I asked to speak with a supervisor, I was put on hold for 15 minutes (it was 4:50pm when I was initially placed on hold) and when the person came back on the line I was told that the supervisors finish for the day at 5, so I'd have to call back tomorrow.  This is the WORST airline I have ever flown and DO NOT recommend that others have to deal with the same aggravation.  In retrospect, I should have paid a little more money and travelled with a reputable airline.  The service on board made easy jet, ryan air, and other low cost carriers look luxurious!  I AM STILL WAITING TO HEAR BACK FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE (it's been 11 days!!!).

Title: Recently back from a tour of Morocco on Royal Air Maroc. It didn’t always have the best reviews so I was skeptical but it was the airline used by the tour company. Title:
We booked this airline to and from Casablanca for its convenience. The airline seats are well spaced and comfortable. The plane was fairly new as well. The check-in process was painless and we took off on time.

The first meal served was really delicious. After that they served nothing until just before we landed.

Whoever assigns seats needs to be better trained. My hubby and I had selected a window and an aisle seat with a vacant seat between us hoping it would stay vacant. The flight was not full, yet a gentleman connecting from a neighboring country was assigned the middle seat. There was a vacant aisle seat right next to my husband!

The seat right in front of my husband was occupied by a large older man who smelled just awful. His wife had a window and there was a young girl between them (not related to them). We could smell him three rows behind and three rows in front. I cannot imagine how that poor girl endured 7 1/2 hours of that smell.

Flight attendants were not very attentive. Towards the end we had some trash to dispose of and asked one of them to take it. He said to put it in the seatback pocket!

That should explain my rating of 6. I think I am being generous with it.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My flight from CMN-IAD was delayed for over 2 hours though we were never informed there was going to be a delay nor did they inform us as to why its getting delayed. Finally after they took off, pilot announced that they got delayed to load the luggages due to porter strike. Once on the Air, we came to know our Special Requested meal was not there(though our reserved says we requested). More than 10 hours and hardly anything to eat because of our special meal request not honored. Finally after 10 horrible hours we reached our home airport and after our immigration, we went to the baggage collection area. Waited waited and waited over an hour for our bags to arrive & after 1 hour an agent(Royal Air Morac) came to inform us that our bags were never loaded onto the flight due to porter strike and will arrive in the next flight which is after 3 days.
We were asked to fill a form saying our bags did not arrive and the airline refused to give us any proof or claim ticket saying our bags were delayed.
3 days later received a call finally from the airline representative to tell us that our bags are not coming in that days flight as well.
Now I don't know when I will get my bags and I don't even have a claim ticket that says my bags did not arrive. Neither did the Airline ever spoke about the compensations or give us anything as the law requires.

Title: plane arrived late at casablanca and was not cleaned.  they had everyone lined up standing for 1hr before boarding.... no communication.  we board... they tell us the baggage handlers are on strike and we wait another hr.  some elderly person gets sick and faints (due to low blood sugar from standing in a line for 1 hr to board).  they are removed from the flight and their baggage is removed (wait another hr). Title: We flew 3-20-19 from JFK to Casablanca and on 4-7-19 from Marrakech to Casablanca to JFK. The airplane is like every other one, not enough room for too many people. but both going and coming, the flight was not completely full, so people moved around and we were lucky enough to have 3 seats for 2 people. Title: When Icelandair completely lost the luggage for myself and 2 friends, then lied about when it would arrive in Marrakech on RAM, I went to the lost luggage department. He gave me his PERSONAL mobile phone number and stated he would try to find the luggage.  That night when I called he had managed to locate 2 of the bags in HEATHROW!!! He arranged for the bags to be sent to Marrakech then to Oazazate so my friends got their luggage after 10 days (they still had 13 days of trip left) ONLY due to this man's actions!!!

Title:
I arrived safe and sound with my family, my children to whom I brag about Morocco all the time. Severely disappointed when we were waiting to get through immigration, we wanted to join a queue like we did many times in Marrakesh without problems. I do not understand why they could not man all the desks in anticipation of arrivals, surely they know amount of passengers disembarking on any given time. I am talking here about business class and fast track, normal channels were worse. I am astonished that we don’t have simple belt system so people can be processed smoothly through immigration. Again I am not complaint about how busy it was but about the non existant queuing system, if we have it in Marrakesh and Rabat why not CASABLANCA?? The busiest airport !!!!!!!!!
The desks should all be manned and there should be officers making sure no queuing jumping because this determines how civilised we want to be, what we experienced was total chaos, very embarrassing indeed!
qwuub: 3 hours to get out, no queuing system just horrendous experience

Title: MOST DEFINITELY THE WORST AIRLINE THAT EXISTS. There is zero accountability. Currently waiting to hear about the holdup in my flight to Paris. So Royal Air subcontracted the flight to a low cost airline (an unknown airline...the plane has no logo no name nothing) After boarding and buckling up, we were told that there was a technical problem with the plane. We sat there for an hour and a half before we were finally told to leave the plane while they fixed the problem. Of course they didn’t fix the problem but rather suggested that we take the plane to Casablanca (another city in Morocco), fix the plane there then either fly in it to Paris or take another plane there. Yes, get on the plane with the technical problem and fly in it in order to get it fixed before flying to our actual destination. Needless to say that this is happening at 9 pm, and the scheduled flight from Casablanca would be at 5 in the morning tomorrow...so far, no ROyal Air responsible in sight to update us on the situation, while the customer service on the phone told us to pretty much ‘get lost’ and ‘figure it out’

Title:
When my flight out of Casablanca to JFK was delayed, I knew I'd miss my connection home to Portland OR. Royal Air Moroc sent me an email with the delay info, and the gate agent assured me to not worry about my connection. ("Sure," I thought.)

At baggage claim at JFK, prior to customs, a pleasant Air Moroc representative met me with the paperwork for my rescheduled connection the next morning, and directions to the shuttle to the hotel where there they had reserved me a room.

I travel a lot, and I've never experienced an airline making such arrangements while I was in flight. Amazing customer service.
qwuub: Customer service that no U.S. airline provides
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My husband and I went to Morocco for our 50th anniversary. Business class was luxurious- the food was excellent as well as the service. I cannot rave more about the personnel who were all so warm, friendly and helpful.
The entertainment system was fantastic. We got to see several movies which we wanted to see but were too busy to get around to see them previously. A real treat.
Royal Air Maroc offered the shortest flight times from JFK to RAK and lucky for us-all flights were on time. I was especially struck by how secure and efficient the airports in Morocco were-we here in the USA could learn a thing or two from them.

Title: This was honestly the worst airline I have ever flown with. First the flight from Venice to Casablanca was delayed. We arrived to Casablanca late, there was a very long line at security for my connection flight to New York. I informed your representative that it was 10 minutes before boarding, he wouldn't let me get ahead of the line and said don't worry they won't leave you. We were on the line for almost 1 hour. We arrived to our gate and the Aircraft was taxiing out of the gate. No one is around had to find the information desk, then my family (son 8 months old, daughter 6 years old, and wife) and I had to walk all over the airport to coordinate rebooking and hotel. At rebooking we waited 1 hour because so many people missed their flights, to have Air Maroc to book our hotel was even worse. We waited 4 hours between getting our hotel booked, waiting on transportation, being bused to the hotel (which was a 2 hour ride between dropping 1 group of people off before us). By the time everything was all said and done, it was a 6 hour process from when we landed in Casablanca and we got to our hotel room. Next day, I realized they put down 14:00 pick up from the hotel. I called the Airline to tell them we need to get picked up earlier. Our flight departs at 16:20 and boarding starts15:35. To make that would be impossible it takes 45 min from our hotel to the airport, we still would have to go through security, and customs. I informed the operator and they said they didnt have any information for me. So I asked them to transfer me to the appropriate people. She said the person who booked my hotel and pick up knows what they're doing and to trust them. I heard that before from them and obviously that didnt work. Then she hung up on me because she said I was being rude after I patiently explained 3 times the situation and I lost my patience.  Customer service is terrible the only helpful people and what help me not stress out was the front desk at Hotel Golden Tulip Farah Casa. They tirelessly called after for me and made sure we were picked up at 13:00. I just hope our luggage makes it to New York today when we land.
crvsd: Masaud W wrote a review Apr 2019

Title:

Title:
After a 7 hour wait for connection, was told 15 mins delay. Waited at gate for ages, business boarding line not obvious. Once on plane, waited and waited - apparently for connecting passengers. However, when I spoke to the crew re the delay, they said there was nothing they could do. When I asked a member of the flight crew if he would arrange to call forward and tell LHR of my late arrival, he ignored me! Later, the purser said he would speak to the flight crew when I reminded him, but only sent a junior flight attendant to tell me they had got nowhere! End result was that we landed 1.5 hours late, and I missed my connection. Thanks to BA, I got transferred to the next available flight which was nearly 3 hours later. despite being told to the contrary, my luggage went missing! I arrived home at 11.30pm (over 3.5 hours late) and after spending lots of time on phone chasing my luggage, eventually received it at 7pm the next night.
Whereas I accept circumstances do happen, I don't accept the abysmal customer service Royal Air Maroc gave on the day. I was given the impression that they were looking after their joining customers, but couldn't care less about those with further connections at LHR (cynic in me suggests because they were then out of the loop!?). Now one week since I complained to them in writing (another difficult procedure) and surprise, surprise - no answer! I am travelling the same route again at the end of this month - funnily enough, on a different airline!
crvsd: Bob S wrote a review Apr 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
My husband and I went to Marrakech for vacations last week, and choose this airline as we thought it would be efficient.
Unfortunately we did not read the reviews before booking our tickets.

Even if our first flight was ok! the second flight was changed several times before our trip. We first booked to leave Marrakech the latest possible and take advantage of our last day and the flight was modified to depart very early on the last day. At the end the time was again modified and this time also the company. They informed us that we would be travelling with Avion Express which is a leasing aircrafts company that work with them.
When we first contacted them by facebook, the asked us to pay in order to modify our departure time and to move to a different flight!!!!

At the end, our flight that should leave at 10:25 departed at almost 1pm and in the meantime no new or information was given to us and the other people waiting in the terminal. When we got to enter to the aircraft, no excuse word came out from the mouth of any operator or cabin crew member (even though from the only lady that was representing Royal Air Maroc airlines). We were very dissapointed.
The food was horrible and the attention almost inexistent.

We will never travel with them again and do not recommend this airline.

Title: My travel group and I are in Morocco at the moment. I flight to Morocco was different than any other flight I have ever taken. Lets just say that RAM has lived up to all that I have read about them.       Our plane pushed back from the gate with no prior announcement while people were standing and walking in the aisles as well as in the overhead compartment. This followed the playing of the safety video which the the flight crew ignored while “they went about their business “.         I have never in all my years of travel seen flight crew that was so rude and miserable. My friend who I was sitting with asked for some orange juice with her breakfast and was rudely told “We are done serving drinks”. The good is just ok which is to be expected these days but the breakfast is a carb fest. It consisted of a roll, a pastry and muffin.       I should add that some of us had selected seats ahead of time and were moved around  prior to the flight. My friend and I had selected two aisle seats across from each other and ended up with an aisle and middle seat. Married couples in our group were separated by rows as well.       The plane is turned around from the inbound flight in less than two hours and it shows because it was filthy. We flew a 787-9 which being a relatively new plane had issues. My USB port was broken and the the flight attendant seemed annoyed when I reported it so that they would know to fix it.

Title:
We flew Royal Air Maroc for the first time with some concern having read the less than positive reviews. We were very pleasantly surprised and pleased with the flight - both the plane and the crew.
Having flown to London from Boston on another airline and landing at 6:30 am at Heathrow, we were TIRED. Our flight on RAM out of Heathrow had been cancelled several days before our Boston departure and we booked a flight to Casablanca (then onto Marrakech) out of Gatwick. The layover in London was 9 hours and we were road-weary and overwhelmed when we boarded our business class flight to Casablanca. That being said, the crew was pleasant. There are some quirks inherent in Moroccan service... they seem unwilling to go the extra mile. They do exactly what they are trained to do but don’t do more. Once dinner was served and finished, we didn’t see them unless we tracked them down for more wine, more water, etc.
However, the food was GOOD! The funny thing is they brought out menus then were completely non-plussed when we requested our choice from same. The starter was supposedly smoked duck - it turned out to be smoked salmon (a plus). The entrees offered were salmon or chicken stuffed with spinach. These turned out to be grilled beef and chicken tagine.
The food was tasty, we didn’t get sick so all was good.
Bottom line - if heading to Marocco, don’t hesitate to fly RAM. They apparently have taken previous negative feedback to heart and are stepping up their service.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

The difference in diameter is not big (20cm shared by 6 chairs in the row) still in B737 I felt restricted and in the A320 not so much. All in all I value the space more than the better service.

I must admit that my perception is biased: in one case I sat next to a not too tall woman at the window while in the other in the middle between two men.

Title:
My wife and I had just finished a wonderful tour of Morocco and were on our way back home. Our international flight departed from Casablanca but our tour ended in Marrakech and as such we booked a domestic flight to get back to Casablanca. After arriving at the airport at 4am we made it through security and waited for our call to board that never came. We waited and waited, checking the departure board and Royal Air Maroc (RAM) website, both of which said everything was on schedule. Our departure time came and passed with no information coming our way. After hounding several employees we were first told that the plane had not yet arrived to Casablanca due to bad weather. Another employee told us the plane was on the tarmac from the previous night (which it was, they showed us) but that the flight could not leave due to poor weather / fog at Marrakech airport. However, we watched and heard every other major airline takeoff that morning without issue but RAM was unable to. There were only 7 customers in the terminal waiting for the flight. We then saw on the departure board that there was another RAM flight to Casablanca at 10:00. I began to wonder if RAM was using the fog as an excuse to cancel an empty plane. Two hours after our plane was scheduled to depart, we were given the word that the flight was cancelled and that we would be put on the next available flight. By this time the fog had cleared, not that it stopped any other flight, so why could our flight not depart? This 4hr delay caused us to miss our connecting flight in Casablanca. As such we had to pay out of pocket to rebook another flight home, hotel for the evening and all associated meals. When I requested to speak with a management representative of RAM at Marrakech airport I was denied. I asked the employee who we were speaking to for his name and badge number, at which point he declined and hid his badge from me. Another representative offered us free breakfast due to the inconvenience which was a coffee and croissant. A follow up compliant via email was dismissed by RAM stating the incident was not their fault and was due to weather. However no one could answer my question why no other flight was delayed or cancelled due to weather that morning.

In summary, the event took place (in my belief) because the airline wanted to save money. The employees were dishonest, deceitful and when asked for support became defensive. They took no responsibility for their actions. If you choose to use RAM please consider this as an example of what may happen to you.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

There were no delays, the personnel was friendly enough and quickly answered to any requests from the passengers and the food was really decent on all flights and all planes were clean. My bag was safely delivered even with a long connection between flights.

One thing that went wrong for me was the online checkin, which failed all the time when I chose that I have some liquids in my carry-on bag. Not sure why that happened because this question wasn't even mentioned during the normal check in.

Title:
I read many reviews about lost baggage and did not check my bag flying into Morocco (I prefer carry on anyway). However I did check my bag on my return flight and held my breath while checking my bag status on RAM's website often. No problems with my luggage.
On my return flight from Marrakech, I had a layover of 13 hours in Casablanca. FYI RAM only gives you free transit accommodation for a long layover if you are arriving from an international flight. Since I arrived from a domestic flight, no free hotel for me. Luckily I have Priority Pass and was able to hang out in the lounges.
Your ticket might have a group number on it but it's really only a difference between business and economy class and business doesn't even necessarily board first; they just have a dedicated line.
The planes were okay. The bathrooms were generally clean but for some reason they had only tissue and toilet paper, no paper towels. Also the toilet seat cover would not stay up so I usually had to hold it up with my hand or use the diaper changing table to prop it up. I would not say that the flight attendants were friendly but not nasty either. The fish was very bland, no seasoning at all. The beef fish was much better but small portions. They do give you bread, yogurt, and a small dessert with meals.
I chose RAM because it was the cheapest to Marrakech but I'd consider paying a bit more for a different airline next time.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Once again, I had a lovely experience with Royal Air Maroc RAM and Mohammed V airport travelling from london heathrow to Casablanca. This review is based on both flights outbound and return. All staff from the Airport to the Aeroplane staff were welcoming and helpful. No long queues or issues. Depending on the time of your flight there may be a short queue at the lower ground entrance if your get the train from Casa Port station to the airport (train take 30-35 mins and has two stops) as police check your passport and scan your bags. This time the airport was slightly busier with a flight time of 13:30. I have travelled before on the first flight of the day and the last flight of the evening and all were fine with no  queues. Ensure you leave yourself enough time and you will be fine. I normally arrive 3-2.5 hours before my flight time and give myself time to relax by the gate and have a hot drink and food. No long queues at check in and all were organised efficiently. Smooth process through security and again at the boarding gate. Great service on board the plane, food was delicious. Loved the lentil dish with sultanas as a cold salad and the beef with artichokes and vegetable tagine with bread, the custard flan for desert was also amazing. Previous meals have been breakfast for morning flights of an omelet bread butter /cheese a salmon and a yoghurt with hot and cold drinks served / a side salad chicken and potato dish with a yoghurt bread butter/cheese. Thanks Royal Air Maroc RAM and Mohammed V airport Casablanca for not failing my service expectations. I am now a frequent flyer with RAM flying direct to Casablanca and collect air miles.
crvsd: Honestreview no issues experienced wrote a review Feb 2019
qwuub: 4th experience with RAM Royal Air Maroc and Casablanca Mohammed V airport. No issues and will use again.

Title: AT217 from Doha to Casablanca on 28 Oct 2018.  No boarding nor a single announcement.  Status shown on flight information display board had been "gate closed" from well beyond boarding time to time of departure.Once we landed in Doha we checked the flight information display board and headed to the gate shown.  Status of the flight was shown as "gate closed".  We reached the gate 30 minutes before boarding / 80 minutes before departure.  We checked the flight information display board again, and the status shown was still the same "gate closed".  The counter had been boarding passengers of other flights, but not AT217, since we reached the gate.  We checked the board frequently and listened to all announcements to ensure we would not miss.  Throughout the time there was never a single announcement about the flight, and the counter never boarded passengers of the flight.  We checked with some ground staff and were told that the flight had departed.Complaint to the airline got me an accusation of late presentation.  No response from the airline since then.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flight down was fine.5 days before our return recieved an email saying our 7.30am flight was cancelled and we had been placed on the 9.50am flight from Agadir to Casablanca with a connecting flight to Gibraltar on a through ticket. This would have meant we would miss our connecting flight.
Went to Air Maroc office in Agadir and they would rebook our flight but would not pay for a hotel for the night. To minimise the inconvenience wee took a flight at 0005 hrs on day of departure. It meant being in transit for7 hours. We were direted to the Oasis lounge where you have a place to lay down. It meant we could get a little sleep.
Had some breakfast we paid for finally boarded our flight and got home.
Because this flight left and returned to an EU airport they are required to pay us each Euros 260.00. Their is a case out of the European Court of Justice involving Air Maroc that they have to pay this money.
We made a claim and they said they did not have to pay because they are not an EU based airline. They refused to pay the compensation. We are looking at court action in Gibraltar and if we win get a court order to seize an aircraft and get paid that way.
Stat at Agadir told us that this happens all the time. If they have two flights leaving within a short time of each other they will cancel the first flight and put every one on the later flight going to the same destination. From what they said this happens a lot and it is done to save money. To hell with the passengers.We will not be flying with Air Maroc again and urge all persons to be careful in a similar matter. Morocco is a beautiful country. I even wrote an email to the CEO Adbou Hasim but nothing happered.
qwuub: Air Maroc does not give a DAMM
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: When flying to Casablanca from Barcelona the flight was delayed. They offered no reason as to why they did not start boarding the plane but it appeared as though the plane had just arrived with passengers and needed to be unloaded. It seemed like they booked the departure time too close to when the arriving flight would be coming in. This was a minor issue though and we were not too late leaving. Unfortunately my return flight to Barcelona was a much worse experience. Once again it appeared as though the airplane arrived full of passengers with not enough time to unload the plane for the scheduled departure time. Once again no one informed us what was going on. Finally after waiting an extra 30 minutes with no instruction they began to scan boarding passes. You would think we would have been boarding the plane but that was not the case. Instead they scanned everyones boarding pass and let us go down the escalator into a small area where the doors were not open to actually get to the plane. They continued to let everyone through thinking they were getting on the plane when we were actually being jammed into a small area. Eventually they had to emergency stop the escalator because there was not enough room for a whole airplane of people to be jammed into such a small space. After another 30 minutes of being crammed in that area one staff member came and opened the doors. Instead of just letting us on the airplane she proceeded to once again check every single passengers passport with the name of the boarding pass as if it had not been checked already. Because of this it took close to another 30 minutes to board the plane. The passengers were offered no explanation as to what was going on. After another 30 minute wait on the runway we were finally able to take off. I was sitting at the very back of the plane in the aisle seat and trying to sleep. For whatever reason even after the meal was served the flight attendant continued to open the cupboard for the food cart and slam the doors into my seat. This happened around 7 times. We finally landed in Barcelona late and i will never take RAM again.

Title:
On January 9, 2019 we flew flight AT201 from NYC(JFK) to Casablanca. Seeing all the negative reviews I was compelled to add my pleasant experience. The only negative thing was that the flight was delayed about one hour due to security issues. From the first call to board to our backing away from the terminal was about 30 minutes so they certainly tried to make up for the lost time.

All interactions with RAM personnel were professional and courteous although there were no problems that called for any other behavior. Food service was quick and efficient. There was a good quality dinner and later breakfast. I manage my expectations so I am usually satisfied with airline food.

Over the head ear phones, cabin socks, and sleeping mask are provided for each passenger

Seat back entertainment was good, quick load times, etc.

We flew on a 787. Overall the plane was very clean. The seats were firm and not as soft from use as many airline seats seem to be. They were covered in a fake leather type vinyl which I prefer to the cloth variety. When the seatback reclines the seat bottom slides forward which is less intrusive on the person behind you.

On January 16th was the return flight. Everything was pretty much the same. There was an additional security check at the gate which slowed boarding a bit but passengers began boarding about 2 hrs. before the flight. Carry on was searched by hand and we were patted down. We were ready to depart on time but departure was delayed by "military" activity or something like that. Our landing was at JFK was about 20 minutes later than scheduled.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I experienced something on this flight one normally reads about only on the news...but more on that in a bit.

I arrived at Casablanca Airport (CMN) with about 3 hours until my 11:30 am flight to Brussels. As is customary in most Arab countries, one must go through security before actually checking in. Have your passport and flight docs ready to present to the guard.

CMN is Royal Air Maroc's (RAM) hub and operates a huge check-in area in Terminal 2. I checked in the day before, but used the kiosk to obtain my boarding pass. I proceeded to security/immigration and an agent directed me to a line (it's nice there are people to direct instead of passengers wondering if they can approach or not). All in all, it took about 15 minutes for this process.

Once past, I made my way to the Pearl Lounge (accessible with Priority Pass). My boarding pass indicated boarding would commence around 10:50 am. After a final sip of coffee, I made my way to gate A2. Note A-gates use jet bridges while B- and C-gates use buses. The majority of RAM flights use A gates.

Once I arrived at my gate, I noticed boarding lanes for different groups. I was in group B and decided to join the fray. Our agent began to board families, people who needed extra time, and folks in business class. Then, things became heated...

As she continued to board people, a group of passengers (from a canceled Bordeaux-bound flight) ran up to our jet bridge door and staged a sit-in. NO JOKE. They stood in front of the door and demanded RAM do something for their canceled flight. In fact, this group was one of many that blocked other Europe-bound RAM flights. A family (from my flight) tried to board and almost got into a fight with one of the protestors.

Confused and alarmed, we all looked around and wondered where the police were. Fast forward 30 minutes and the protestors were STILL in front of the door. Police finally arrived, but DID NOTHING. I suppose they were just there to ensure no actual fighting broke out.

A RAM Manager finally arrived and started yelling at the protestors. One of the passengers from my flight then confronted the manager and those two started yelling.

Didn't I tell you? It's a situation you only read about...

50 minutes later and everyone is becoming unrest. I then hear a passenger from my flight yell that there's a new gate (in the C area). So we all run down to the new gate only to be chased by the protestors. Once we arrived at the new gate, the agent said our flight was not departing from here. Everyone is angry at this point when someone yells to go back to the original gate.

We all haul back to the original gate where they finally boarded all Brussels passengers. To my relief, I made it on the jet bridge, but everyone kept looking back to make sure the protestors didn't usurp the bridge.

Finally settled in my seat (to a full flight, no less), we taxied and departed an hour late for Brussels.

Service was fine, if not robotic; though, one flight attendant always had a smile on his face. They served a hot meal and I ate a chicken/rice dish along with tabbouleh, cake, a roll and water.

There's no entertainment so BYO, but the flight only lasted three hours. The interior has seen better days, but we made it safely and were only 45 minutes late into Brussels.

I paid USD$420 for this flight (including a connecting flight from Brussels to London).

What happened to me and us Brussels passengers is, in my hope, a one off. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend RAM, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to fly them again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I chose Royal Air Maroc because they had the best flight times based on my travel plans, but I would not recommend it. The plane was super old and it was dirty. My tray-table was disgusting. When I put the tray-table down when they were serving dinner there were crusts of spilled food all over it.
The worst, however, was the customer service. I wanted to upgrade to business class or first class, but no one would even try to help me. The guy at check-in said he couldn’t do it, handed me my boarding pass and told me to go to the sales counter. There was no one at the sales kiosk. I went to the kiosk right next to it and asked the attendant, who by the way was not busy at all and was just watching a video on her phone. This attendant told me she only handled excess luggage and couldn’t help me. I asked if she could get someone who could me help or if she knew when the sales kiosk would open, but she again replied with “I only handle excess luggage”. Asked at the check-in counter if I could upgrade (I’ve done that at other airlines), again I got a reply of “I only do check-in”. Stopped at customer service desk in Casablanca during my connection, and they said they only handled passengers with missed connections. Finally someone showed up at the sales counter in Casablanca, but the attendant was super rude and wouldn’t pull up my flight on her computer to take a look. She kept saying it was full and I couldn’t upgrade. She wouldn’t even look at her computer. Business class was definitely not full, because I saw lots of empty seats when I boarded the plane. She was just being lazy and unhelpful.
I’ve never seen this kind of behavior with another airline, where employees just do one single thing and won’t help you at all unless you need help with that very specific thing they do. They won’t even try to get someone else who might help.
qwuub: Awful customer service and old air planes
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
In a nutshell, this was the worst airline I’ve traveled with, period. We decided to use RAM to travel to Banjul (JFK - CMN - BJL the return same way). Heading out there was a delay and nine of the gate agents gave us a reason why or could answer questions. Then they tried seating us apart from one another. I insisted and they finally obliged. Inflight food was not good at all, the meat tasted funny. Getting water took an act of Congress. When we got to Casablanca we had a 13 hour layover so they put us in a hotel ( Hotel Washington) downtown that was so filthy my kids didn’t want to use the bathroom. Our flight to BJL was on time.

The biggest issue was on the return. Heed this warning because apparently this is something they do often. On 1/4/2019 we checked in in BJL. When we got Casablanca they gave us a room at Relax hotel, nicer than Hotel Washington, but staff was awful an there were no towels. Next morning we go to check in and the ticket agent said we weren’t shown on the flight. That we needed to check with RAM reservations department, and that the flight was overbooked. I walk all the way to the reservation department (to a lady named Lola yelling over the phone). Before I could finish asking my question she cut me off and said, “you never confirmed your seats, so your tickets were canceled.” What?? The she wrote “system error” on the back of my boarding pass and said I should go back to the check in counter and ask for the check 8n supervisor. They were so rude. Then sent me back to Lola. At this point the room was packed and Lola was helping someone, but I walked up to her desk and insisted she fix this.

She was babbling in French and never looked at me. I said we are getting on this flight or I will sue this airline. She said, let me see your passport, are you Americans? Because it was apparent they treat the sub Saharan Africans that travel with them poorly. I added, I don’t care who you need to bump but my family and I are getting on this flight and out of this country. She yelled at someone over the phone then asked us to follow her to check in. We made the flight, but our final destination was California and our bags didn’t make it until the next day. I’m baffled how this airline is allowed to operate in the USA. They overbook every flight. They are so rude and dismissive. When our flight landed at JFK a flight attendant bumped into a passenger and she said, “ look, we’re in the US now. Your rude behavior stops now.” And everyone clapped. I WILL NEVER USE THIS AIRLINE EVERY AGAIN.

They rest of African and black people that were there, were asking, what's happening, why are we here, but nobody listens, and to be honest I don't know how that ended.
And for us that followed the red line, we end up in farah hotel, that's another story for different platform.
In conclusion, I was well informed about the bad experience received from Royal air maroc (RAM) but I wasn't convinced because I believe things do happen its not all the time, but after this!!! No no no RAM no more. Royal air maroc is no go for me.

Title:
I had my worst ever international travel experience just last week with Royal Air Maroc. The problem wasn't the flight itself, which was perfectly fine. The problem was the customer service, which was almost aggressively unhelpful and generally useless.

I was flying from Rome to Washington DC on Friday 21st December. RAM had a really well priced deal and I'd never flown with them before, so I thought I'd give them a chance. The plan was to fly from Rome to Casablanca and then catch the RAM Casablanca to DC flight. Things started going wrong early. After checking in at Rome, the first flight got progressively more and more delayed until I was certain that I would miss the connection. However, RAM didn't have any staff in Rome (as far as I could tell), and all the airport staff could tell me was that RAM would sort my connection out in Casablanca. So off I go to Casablanca.

The flight to Casablanca was fine, though they didn't explain why it was three hours late in leaving. When I got there I had indeed missed my DC connection (several other passengers had also missed connections to various places too, including one other person going to DC). Not only had RAM made NO provisions to help me or the other stranded passengers (even though they must have known that we existed), but the staff at their transfer desk were (with one exception) utterly useless. When I was finally able to speak to someone, she offered to put me on the next RAM flight to Washington - in two days' time - which wasn't an option. Then she told me to go to the transfer manager's office. When I finally managed to get the transfer manager's attention, he literally faked a phone call and left; I later found out that he had just gone on a break, leaving about six stranded passengers in his office! Finally someone got hold of a policeman and told him to make the airline staff help us, which (to my surprise) he actually did.

Long story short, they finally rebooked me and the other DC-bound passenger on Air France for the next day. The whole rebooking process took FIVE HOURS, during which we had to just sit and wait. Then we had to collect our bags so that we could re-check them the next day. That took another hour. Only one of my two bags showed up. The employee at the baggage service desk gave me a claim slip, though I later discovered that the claim number that she wrote for me wasn't a real claim number.

They did put me up in a very nice hotel for the night, the Sky Atlas. Sadly I was only able to enjoy it for five hours, since I got there at midnight and had an early flight to Paris (and thence to DC). On checking in for the Paris flight, the Air France people found that RAM had made a mistake with my rebooking. The Air France employees were mercifully more helpful though and fixed it for me.

It took me a week to get my missing suitcase back, which I had to go to Dulles to collect. The baggage employee in Casablanca certainly didn't help by giving me a claim number that turned out not to be a claim number, and the fact that the RAM baggage office in Dulles wasn't open on the day that I arrived didn't help much either. Calls to the RAM New York number evidently went to a call centre in Morocco, where I could barely hear the voice at the other end. The people that I managed to speak to basically blamed me for not getting a valid claim number in Casablanca (which was their own airline's fault). Even though I had a bag tag number, they couldn't find it in their system. What's more is that their online baggage tracking system was buggy and refused to work, consistently telling me that I had entered an invalid date.

I did eventually manage to speak to one good RAM employee. When the Dulles office opened, I managed to get through to a guy on the phone (though you have to call every few minutes, as he's rarely around to pick up). The guy at Dulles managed to get my bag back for me. The airline's official channels, though, were completely useless.

To sum up: the flights may be ok, but I have never had worse customer service from an airline. Heed the bad reviews. I will happily pay more in future to avoid flying with them.
crvsd: James M wrote a review Dec 2018
qwuub: The customer service is as bad as they say

Title: We needed a flight from Chicago to Casablanca and our travel agent couldn't find a good flight for us without having about 3 or 4 different stops in it so a friend of mine who is a tour guide in Spain suggested Royal Maroc Air because he has used it..I never heard of it before but I took a chance and glad I did...We flew from Chicago to Madrid on Iberia, which was fine and then took the 1 hour and 45 minute flight from Madrid to Casablanca.  Everyone was nice, the flight was smooth and we even got a MEAL on that short flight.  When we fly from Chicago to California, like 4 1/2 hours all we get is a soda and some pretzels...so we were pleasantly surprised by a full meal and drinks.  We didn't have to deal with luggage because we had it sent all the way through from Chicago to Casablanca so we didn't have to pick it up in Spain and then check it in again...our luggage arrived safe and sound in Casablanca.  Since I had a good experience I would definitely take them again...I would say the airplane was just as good as an American Airlines plane if not better

Title: United States air travel has degenerated over the years to the status of a clip joint where the economy traveler is charged for luggage, carry on luggage, beverages, snacks, in air entertainment, pillow, blanket, every little thing!. Thus, I was surprised and delighted with the great service provided by RAM. The experience stated with the ability to check TWO bags at no extra charge! (Just like it used to be in the United States). Meals, snacks, beverages, socks, eye covers, headphones, entertainment, all complimentary (Just like it used to be in the United States). The seats were clean and comfortable, spaced far enough apart to recline, and  to not have ones knees pushed up against the seat in front.The inflight staff were courteous and managed to seat all persons quickly and efficiently. Luggage was not lost.The only little issue,  very delayed departures to and from Marrakesh Menara (RAK) airport.  On the return, the delay at Marrakech caused a small group to miss the return flight from Casablanca to New York. After seven hours, a plane eventually left for Casablanca. On arrival,  the Casablanca airport was filled with grumpy pilgrims who for some reason or other needed very many (okay, it was all) of  the luggage carts.   It was difficult to find the correct office to in order to sign up for a hotel room for the night. The staff acted as though this had never happened before. After much explanation  our group was eventually placed on a bus to very nice hotel in Casablanca. The next morning we all caught a very nice flight, courteous and efficient service, comfortable well spaced seats, headphones, entertainment, meals, snacks, beverages, and arrived in New York, approximately one day late.

Title: After missing a connecting flight at Lisbon, I was routed onto Royal Air Maroc, connecting in Casablanca to get to Marrakech.  After the Lisbon flight was delayed, we eventually arrived in Casablanca and shuttled into a room for domestic transfers that had far too few seats for the number of passengers accommodated.  Monitors posted a "gate" but no announement was made about the flight.  People lined up in anticipation but the boarding time passed without even an attendant at the gate and no explanation whatsoever.  About half an hour past the time the flight was to have left, some kind of announcement was made (in French and Arabic) and I heard the word "Quatorze" (Fourteen) and everyone in line moved over to Gate 14, where nothing, it turned out, was actually happening.  There was an agent there - who had no information - passengers were shouting.  When I finally got up to ask, he sent me back to where I was waiting before.  Finally an agent showed up at that gate, but she was on the phone, seemingly trying to find out what was going on - nothing posted on the monitors, and no announcements.  Through the glass doors we could see the lights of several buses (you had to take a bus to the plane from these gates) who would pull in and mysteriously leave, with no indication of which flight they were taking.  Finally, as I sat in another part of the (extremely dirty and noisy) room, charging my phone, I heard a cheer and people started to board the plane.  No explanations were ever given.  I'm not sure how much to blame Royal Air Maroc and how much of it was the Casablanca Airport, but it was a thoroughly miserable experience - and at the very least there should have been something told to the passengers who were waiting patiently (or, eventually not patiently) just wondering when - or IF - we were going to board.  This was late in the evening and if I did not arrive in Marrakech that night I was going to miss the start of a group tour that departed the city the next morning, so I was on tenterhooks the same time.  Absolutely awful experience.   (btw, the flight to Marrakech, for all that waiting, was only 25 minutes long).

Title: Worst flight experience ever. Worst customer service ever. I went to Casablanca for a layover on the way to Spain for Thanksgiving (US holiday in November) I had a 4 hour layover going to Spain, and on the way back I had a 30+ layover and chose to stay in a hotel near the train station and attempt to learn more about the country and the country. Casablanca is thee worst. Now, in terms of the airport, I have CLEAR to speed up airport transit at the security line. I don't have enemies, but when I do have enemies, I will steer any enemies clear of this airline. When you leave from Dulles everything is great, and you feel like you're going to receive standard basic customer service. The minute you step foot in Casablanca, Morocco... all those notions, dreams, and impressions go away very quickly. Every agent is rude. Maybe there was one check-in agent that had manners, but the vast 99% do not, and I don't think they link their customer service to continued business (money for their salaries). Stay away. While in flight...I pressed the blue flight attendant button and I took pictures where 30 minutes passed... 30 minutes had gone by without any acknowledgement, can you believe it? what if it were a real emergency? Title:

I called and took us over 45minutes to be answered when the staff came on I informed her of what happened took another 40 minutes she came back and said you can pay panalty fees I said that is okay and she said to hold on for another 20minutes came on to say it’s £93.95 I said that’s okay can I pay

I suggested to but a ticket from London to Casablanca and join the flight to Gambia which is just over 12 hours she categorically refuses to take my payment and advice I can only do it on Monday as they cannot take it from there side as that’s there policy. I advice her that am going to a funeral and need to be in Gambia before 1400hrs no sympathy at all. Advice to speak to a supervisor by the name of Fatima who came on to the phone after me waiting on the other hand of the phone for an hour

She advised me to call them again and the lady call Maria said I needed to paid 3 hours. Before departure I advice her a I have tried to pay over 9 hours ago and your colleagues refused to take my payment

Title:
So I am not the kind of reviewer that will make a generalization of a service or company based on one negative review. This could be an isolated case. Right? But I need to share my experience traveling to Washington with this company. I had a two-hour layover in Casablanca, which should be actually a one-hour layover since the place from Barcelona to Casablanca delayed. However, on the time we were supposed take off, they made us stay on a 30-40 minute line like we were going to board, only to give us vouches for a meal and say that we could stay in their lounge because the flight would be delayed for 5 hours. Mind you, this is no lounge you would care to go. You can have a (plastic) glass of water or tea and that's it. Then, you can going back and forth lost in the airport where no one speaks English while they will point you in different directions for the lounge.

My main complaints are about how inefficient and condescending the staff is. Do not treat your clients like we are kids. Do not make us stay in pointless lines and please use of effective communication. There are so many easier and stress-free ways to make this experience better that would cost NOTHING to the company. Why wouldn't you just give the lounge and the restaurant a list with the passengers from the flight so we could just check in? Why make us stay in all those lines? Why don't you explain what is going on? Casablanca airport already is the airport I most detest in the planet, and mind you I travel a lot. It's hot, the staff treats English speakers very badly.. don't make our experience worse when traveling!

In monetary terms, I would rather pay $100-150 more to fly using another company now then going through this again.
qwuub: Will avoid it from now on
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flight delayed for more than 4 hours. No explanation given. No food or beverages provided.

Back in Doha, we complained for the delay and the bad service, they answered within 2 months and agreed to pay us back as per the European Convention and mentioned it would take 4 to 6 weeks to get the refund as soon as we provide our bank details. We have to contact them every 3 days, and every 3 days we get the same answer "we will check the problem and get back to you as soon as possible". And nobody gets back to us.

A lot of time wasted, service isnt good either. I was told today that there is no Manager in charge of complaints... so it is whenever the employees decide to process your refund....(!!)

Airport is below average. I was supposed to fly again with them next March, but I will find another airline instead.

Shameful.

Title:
We booked this flight/trip to Rome because our son saw the excellent price and options to overnight in Casablanca with Royal Air Maroc.

Very fortunately, we did not have any of the negative experiences we read on TripAdvisor.

Our suitcases were checked at IAD to FCO. The bags were shrink-wrapped/plastic wrapped and despite TSA not replacing our suitcase lock at IAD, everything arrived as packed in FCO.

The Boeing 787 was super comfortable. Casual boarding. Lovely flight crew, plenty of food and liquid refreshment options. A bit of confusion with the time changes (Daylight Saving Time?) but not a big deal.

Return trip, Royal Air Maroc changed our return plans, but provided accommodations, transportation to/from the hotel, food. Again our suitcases were check through to IAD, plastic wrapped and arrived as expected. The crew was professional.

Very positive travel experience.

Title:
Check in was a nightmare - the counters opened 3 hours early but there were only 2 in use. It took a long time but that wasn’t really the airlines fault as half the people had ridiculous amounts they were trying to have as carry on. Some actually got through. The seats were cramped and some were broken, there was excessive luggage not put in compartments. But what really showed them up was there was no safety feature. I’ve never ever been on a flight that doesn’t have this- surely it’s a legal requirement!
One of the attendants had obviously been rushed as her buttons were all open - I don’t know why this matters but that simple act of unprofessionalism really says it all and makes you query whether they take other shortcuts. Food - didn’t see any but coffee was available. I did think the attendants were friendly though when we saw them.

Title:
I flew two legs of an open jaw ticket to Europe with Royal Air Maroc (Marrakech-Casablanca and Casablanca to Dohar) on 1 Nov 2018, with the majority of my flights being on Qatar. RAM is a Qatar program partner, and the airline combination produced a great price on Skyscanner. Well, folks, you get what you pay for – and I didn’t read the reviews of RAM prior to booking. Flight AT402 from Marrakech to Casablanca was fine. At only 50 minutes, the plane went up, flew at cruising altitude for about 15 minutes, then landed. All fine there, apart from having to walk across the tarmac and up a flight of steps to board. Same deal landing in Casablanca in reverse. Then the nightmare started.

Separating of passengers connecting to international flights and those terminating in Casablanca was done outside the rear entry doors to the arrivals terminal. Passengers were jammed up against the side of the building standing in puddles of water (as it had been raining) waiting to have their passport and ticket examined by one of two officials who told them to go through either the international connections door or the domestic arrivals door. It actually started to rain lightly while I was waiting which wasn’t much fun. Then another bus of disembarking passengers pulled up and there was no room for them to get off the bus and stand safely out of danger from passing airport vehicles. It was slow-moving mayhem, and I’d imagine that people with tight connections missed their flights. I had a 3-hour layover, so once inside the arrivals terminal, I settled down and waited for AT216 to Doha. Luckily I checked the departure gate several times as it was changed without notice or announcement shortly before boarding opened (from Level 1 to the ground level). Again we had to walk across the tarmac and climb stairs to board.

Everything seemed fine as we taxied down the runway… then sat for about 20 minutes. Eventually an announcement was made that we were going back to the terminal, and we taxied back. A hoist/lift was wheeled out to the right-hand wing and several mechanics peered at a central flap which was elevated (the other flaps were all lying flush with the edge of the wing), and made calls on their mobile phones. So we sat… and sat… and sat… for 3 hours 45 minutes! No announcements were made, no refreshments were given, nothing! Eventually I went to the galley to get some water and asked one of the male flight attendants what was happening, and was told there was a “technical services” problem, but that we should be leaving within 15 minutes. Well, that never happened. By that stage, people were getting tired and irritable. The two very small children in front of me were going beserk, screaming, jumping up and down, crying, running up and down the aisles, etc – understandable, as they were bored witless (as were we all). Luckily it wasn’t a hot day as the plane’s air conditioning wasn’t running, but it got really stuffy and uncomfortable. People started sleeping across three seats if they had a row to themselves. Eventually we were told to prepare for takeoff. The flight attendants who had been sitting in the galley for most of the previous 3 hours 45 minutes appeared and made a cursory check of the cabin. The man behind me was still sleeping across three seats as we started taxiing down the runway, not strapped in or anything! I was about to draw the attention of one of the bored flight attendants to this when he spotted him, shook him awake and told him to sit up and buckle up. No safety briefing was given as we were just about to take off.- unbelievable!

As we took off, I had a clear view out the window of the wing – and the flap WHICH WAS STILL ELEVATED! Nothing had changed. I just crossed my fingers and hoped for the best, reassured somewhat that several people had been taking photos with their mobile phones which I thought would at least be found if we crashed. So it was a nerve wracking 6-hour flight to Doha. We made up about 45 minutes in the air, but I still had to run through Doha airport to make my QR900 connection to Perth as boarding had commenced at the same time as the RAM flight landed.

I would never fly RAM again. They’re disorganised, don’t apparently maintain their aircraft adequately and pay scant regard to safety. I felt less than confident on a 6-hour flight with them as the “technical services” issue did not appear to have been rectified. In addition, we were not kept informed as to what the problem with the aircraft was, nor given refreshments on board while we waited for the problem to be fixed.

On the plus side, however, my luggage magically appeared at Perth airport, despite the extremely short connection time in Doha. However, I suspect that was Qatar’s efficient service, not RAM’s.
crvsd: Vicki M wrote a review Nov 2018
qwuub: Questionable safety standards, lengthy delay and total lack of communication

Title:
I was on a flight that got cancelled and it was crazy. Our plane apparently had technical issues, so I’m glad they didn’t send us on it, but the lack of communication was astounding.

When we were supposed to be boarding, there was no announcement, then after a while, they told us that we going to board in 20 minutes or so. We then were told it would be 40 more minutes, then 15 minutes, then an hour. At some point they started giving out food vouchers (with no announcement) for $20 (which doesn’t go far at JFK). Shortly after that, they said our flight was cancelled (this is around midnight and the airport forced them to either board the plane or cancel the flight).

Here is where things start to get crazy. They made the announcement that the flight was cancelled and when people started asking questions, all they said was “go to H” I don’t think anybody knew what H was, but the people at the desk started power walking out and everybody (about 150 people) was following them out of the secured area of the airport. I felt bad for the older people, people who didn’t speak English, and people with young kids, because it was like a race! Once we got out to the ticketing area (which I assume is what they were referring to when they said to go to H), we walked in an entire circle around the perimeter of the ticketing areas. This is about the time that I started to wonder if we were being punked! Most of the people working for the airline seemed to disappear and with the exception of one very nice, very patient woman. She was trying to help explain things to everyone, but she didn’t have all the answers herself, so I felt bad for her.

After about an hour sitting there in the middle of the empty ticketing area, they brought some busses and took us to two hotels on Long Island. We were told that we would fly out in the morning. By the time I got into my room, it was 2am. We had no idea what time we would be flying out and no idea how we would be notified.

The next morning, I didn’t wake up until 9am (I was on California time and was exhausted). When I went out to the lobby for breakfast, there was no new news. Most people hung out in the lobby because it felt like that was where we needed to be to get any news. There were a lot of theories going around, but no actual news other than the fact that anybody that was continuing on beyond Morocco was put on another flight so they could get where they were going. People were saying that it felt like we were being sequestered.

Around noon, we were told that we would be picked up from the hotel at 3:45pm. But that is all the information we had. That at least allowed us the freedom to leave the hotel to go get lunch.

At 4pm, we finally left the hotel and went to the airport. We still didn’t know our flight time and nobody actually told us until we got the ticket desk and got rebooked for the same flight we had booked for the previous day.

Finally, 24 hours after our originally scheduled flight, we boarded the plane and flew to Morocco.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: My trip was from LHR via CDG to TNG. A bag that I checked in never arrived at my final destination. RAM informed me after a month that the bag was permanently lost and so I put in a claim with them for the value of the contents. They only offered to pay only a tenth of the value. I initially declined this but, having been beaten by the whole process of dealing with them, I accepted. However, 14 months later, I'm still waiting for my claim to be paid. There is only one email address that RAM give out for claims and all that results if you mail them is an automated reply and little else. If you try social media (Facebook) to get a response, one gets a 'An urgent notice has been sent to the department in charge to get back to you as soon as possible' as a reply. Guess what, nothing happens after that. Judging by other peoples comments on FB, RAM make a habit of losing bags. I would suggest that if you fly with them then take hand luggage only. Better still, don't fly with them.

Title: This was a very long trip involving an 11 hour stop-over in Casablanca.  However, what could have been a horrendous journey ended up being quite pleasant and relaxing thanks to the stop-over service provided by RAM.  Any passenger with a stop-over of 8 hours or more is offered a hotel room close to the airport, including free shuttle service and meals according to the time of day.  The hotel was pleasant, the room comfortable and the food reasonable, so all in all it was an excellent service.
crvsd: Christine M wrote a review Oct 2018
qwuub: Excellent transit services in Casablanca with RAM!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Overall, I had a fine experience for the lowest cost flight without frills. The food is remarkably terrible - worst I’ve ever encountered on a flight. Stock up before you board! The plane was nice enough, if a bit old, and the entertainment options were fine. The staff was quite disinterested in passengers - drink service was very limited and pressed call buttons went unanswered for 30+ mins throughout the cabin. Check in was smooth, boarding happened early, and my flights were on time. Legroom was average, and neither of my flights was full. It was worth it for me to save $200 over another airline.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
If you want your vacation spoiled then choose Royal air maroc.i'm not going to talk about the bad customer service, but I just want you to avoid all the drama i experienced with this airline.
they took our carry-on basgs from us at JFK airport and they told us we will receive them when we get to Casablance. And since we have to little kids we gave them the carry-ons and that was a big mistake.
When we landed in Casablanca we were told that the carry-ons didn't make it to here and they will send them tomorrow. I opened a claim and the lady was not helpful at all. When I asked her why the bags never arrived she answered that the pilot can decide to leave the bags behind if the plane is full.
We were told to call and check if the bags arrived and if yes we have to go get them because in Morocco they don't deliver lost luggage to your home. Even we live 120 miles away from Casablanca we agreed to that and after a week a got a call that our bags arrived.
unfortunately, It was just one bag, the one with no valuable belongings.The other bag which has all our valuable stuff disappeard apparently.
the most funny thing is that we were told to pay $150 because the bag was overweight.We tried to complain and talk to somebodyand nobody seems to care.
We left that bag to them since the value of what was inside it is under $150.
We kept calling them about the other bag for 2 months in vain.
We've never got any call or email from the airline to give us any update about the bag.And when we were heading back to the States our flight was delayed 4 hours because the pilots were on strike.
Our saty in Morocco was spoiled. My wife was in tears every time we had to call the airline.
qwuub: Horrible Sevice, Delays and luggage lost
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I returned to America from MorRocco yesterday and was treated well enough by the royal air Maroc staff but their horrible quality food and lack of water has left me sick this morning.  Everyone who had bought water and drinks in the terminal, and he tried boarding the plane with their drinks that they bought specifically for the flight, had their drinks taken away before boarding. They gave us water once, only once, And I asked for two glasses of water instead of one and they gave me one and told me no more. They gave us a meal and then a snack before we landed and neither was edible. I was very hungry and tried to eat some of the fish on the meal, and as a result of that I contracted food poisoning.

Title: I fly a lot and I have flown on a lot of different airlines. This year I have taken over 26 flights with RAM mainly on routes to Europe. Overall my experience has always been good.
