Title: I didn't really have a choice in airlines when this was booked, and I was very nervous about using them as they have a terrible reputation. First off their boarding area was tiny and basically nonexistent. there was nowhere to sit,  unless you wanted to sit on the floor! It was packed and miserable and we were there  hours early. The airport is dirty and nasty, ripped seats etc. It was also confusing because where we boarded was not labeled properly. THEN the worst part took place, or so I thought. we were put on a tiny terrible bus , so packed you had to stand up against everyone  The bus jerked so bad you would unsteady and unsecured. There are also no bars  to hold onto at that capacity so you are constantly smashing into everyone surrounding you (since you're touching anyway). Horrific experience! It was so hot you could barely breathe. Then you are standing on the tarmac trying to board the place which involves climbing straight up steps into the plane, which is not always easy when you are carrying so many heavy bags. By the time we got on the plane, it was exhausting. Once on the plane we sat on the tarmac FOREVER in a million degree heat inside the plane and out. Everyone frantically fanning themselves and gasping for air. I felt like heat exhaustion was setting in! and no one cared one bit about the people having a hard time. Why they wouldn't turn on the plane is beyond me. Never have i ever experienced a flight like this and I will surely never go through this again! I could not wait to get off. The flight overall was smooth, and they did serve us lunch even though the flight was about an hour in duration. We got a drinkable yogurt, a chocolate chip muffin top and a cheese sandwich which considered of thick dry bread and a hunk of cheese. They did come around with drinks but you could only get juice or water.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I traveled with this awful airline with one stop via Casablanca where I saw flights cancelled and people wondering around like headless chickens as no one informed them of what to do... our flight was delayed for an hour also.

Once we arrived at Marrakesh menara airport the passport check had 2.5 hour queues.. asking my friend strange questions like “where is your dad from?” by then I had lost the will to live.

Then the cherry on the top: I stood by the baggage reclaim carousel for an hour until it was turned off next to another women who was crying her baggage was also missing. I went to the baggage office and was given a lost bag receipt and sent on my way. I spent 3 whole days without my luggage- I had nothing but my purse, keys and phone on me. I borrowed off of my friend the whole holiday which was stressful enough but customer service did nothing to help, if anything the women took a frustrated tone and told me I have to wait as there’s nothing she can do: “madam, just go to the airport and check if it’s there”.... thanks a lot Fatima.

I got my luggage back the day I flew back to London. Thank god.

All in all a terrible experience, I don’t think Iv ever been so stressed on a holiday in all my life. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
crvsd: The Lo Down wrote a review Oct 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We flew Royal Air Maroc to and from Rome, connecting through Casablanca, their home airport. In flight service was good on three flights, excellent on the CMN/IAD leg. In flight moivies did not work on the second long flight. Food was delightful and paced well. Boarding was a challenge on all four legs. Business class was either not queued separately or simply overlooked. With the exception of the initial IAD/CMN leg all boarding required waiting on a bus for carriage to the airplane, then climbing the stairs into the plane. All deplaning, except IAD was done in this fashion. It was especially bothersome as we deplaned and boarded in the rain while connecting at Casablanca. Terminals at CMA and FCO have jetways, but Royal Air Maroc chooses not to utilize them for many flights. Until they do you may want to consider another carrier.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were travelling from Marrakech to USA with connecting flights at Casablanca and then at Amsterdam.
Royal Air Maroc is extremely unreliable and our flight was delayed at Marrakech for over 3 hours without explanation or any customer service. As a result, we missed our connecting flights at Casablanca and at Amsterdam. This delay costs us over a $1000 to rebook our flights and hotel and it took us over 3 days to come back to USA from Marrakesh.
The worst part is that the Royal Air Maroc staff has no intention of helping through out this flight delay situation, not even letting us to use their land line to rebook our flight at the Casablanca airport as our cell phones are blocked there.

As an additional note, the plane was dirty and uncomfortable and I had diarrhea after taking the airline meal.

Avoid going to Morocco.
Peter Lee
Oregon USA

qwuub: Royal Air Maroc Unreliable and Bad Service - Avoid going to Morocco.

WORST FLYING EXPERIENCE EVER.

Title:
I had a trip planned out from Montreal -> Agadir connecting in Casablanca. On the way back I was to go from Agadir -> Casablanca (22 hr stay) -> Montreal. The 22 hr stay was to allow me to leave the airport and do a bit of sightseeing. Before purchase and at the airport in Montreal before leaving, I confirmed that my baggage on the return trip would be taken care of and I would not have to lug it around for 22 hours.

However, when I was leaving from Agadir to Casablanca the check-in attendant very rudely dismissed my query if the baggage would be taken care of, saying it would be not and he did not care that I was told it would be when I left from Montreal. He told me to take it up with their office in Casablanca.

In Casablanca, I was moved from office to office (at 12AM), with each official claiming it was someone else's responsibility. Finally, I was denied my claim and when I asked what I am to do with my baggage (I had no hotel plans or money) I was told it is my problem. He rudely dismissed me and told me to figure it out (again, 18 years old, no money, alone).

I lugged my baggage out that morning a few hours later and was carrying two big bags with me around Casablanca, completely ruining my experience.

This doesn't even cover the fact that Royal Air Maroc has terrible in-flight conditions, bad entertainment, and rude service at every turn. Complete joke. DO NOT RECOMMEND.
crvsd: Hikmat J wrote a review Oct 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Not all of their tablets were working properly. The plug in connection also didn't work properly in a couple and I was constantly adjusting it so I could properly hear whatever I was watching. Frankly, the only entertainment in a 9h flight and it's faulty.

I was lucky to meet ONE very polite and dear flight attendant who was very nice and compensated for the indifference of all others. Unfortunately, he explained to me they travel all over the globe and I cannot remember his name, or I would definitely praise his service. All the rest of the flight attendants didn't care much about hosting the passengers or even treating them friendly, but I guess that seems to be a pattern when it comes to international flights in general.

The food is average, but somewhat plenty. There's a lot to snack after the small meal. I'm a pescatarian and tried their vegetarian meal yet didn't like it. They opt for things too hard to digest and I felt extremely under the weather through half of the flight. I changed it online for the return flight, but when I got to the plane, no change was requested and they wanted to serve me the vegetarian again. The nice flight attendant I mentioned was very kind, made no big deal about it and offered me the regular meal instead.

The seats are as usual - never too comfortable when you're traveling for 8-9h straight. They give socks though, which helps when it gets too cold.

Now, as most people, I had to get a connecting flight to/from Casablanca. Everything there is quite messy and I didn't like the experience. Going to Rio, we had to RUN to board our flight because we hadn't even landed and our next plane was already boarding passengers. There's no AC and it was extremely hot. Coming back, we also faced a huge queue and had to wait in the sun for about 15min for the bus to take us to the plane.

Flight attendants change to the extreme when we're on short flights and the flight from/to Porto was quite pleasant.

I've had better experiences.
crvsd: Patrícia F. Contreiras wrote a review Sep 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I received a survey for my flight from Casablanca to Washington on August 27th that never happened, I got stuck in Morocco from August 27th until Saturday, September 1st, missing a week of work and a week of school for my three kids.Our flight was scheduled at 4:30pm August 27th, 2018, we arrived at the airport around 01:30pm, checked our luggage went through the customs then to the gate, my kids needed to use the bathroom, on our way back I was not allowed to board, I was told the plane already took off, I was stopped by the police/security by the gate!!!! I said that I already checked my luggage, he said “your luggage is downstairs by the arrivals”I felt like I was going to have a heart attack!! I asked what would I do now, was told I have to go to RAM agency in order to take the next flight to DC,Once at the RAM agency, I see many families with crying kids, crying moms, upset dads!!! I was shocked!! Went to the RAM agent, explained my situation, I asked why it was not any announcement, we would not miss it because we are four passengers, eight ears, and the announcement should be in  three languages, she said that RAM do not announce by names!!! she said that there is nothing RAM can do,  and that I have to go to the counter number one to talk to A supervisor! I waited at counter number 1 for more than one hour, no one showed up!! Asked the agents , they did not have a name of A SUPERVISOR.They kept sending me back and forth from RAM agency and counter number 1 for hours, but no help!!! Finally I sat at the RAM agency and watched for hours, there was passengers missing several RAM flights, I think they do it in purpose to sell the overpriced stand by ticket, I do not recommend RAM, WILL NEVER FLY RAM, ALL STAFF WAS RUDE ON BOARD AND AT THE COUNTERS. I had to buy new tickets to get back to Washington a week later, I know they ripped me of, but I had no choice.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I flew Royal Air Maroc from New York to Casablanca on a business trip. When I arrived in Casablanca, my luggage was not there. It was extremely difficult to file a claim as it was very hard to communicate with the Baggage Service Person had very little English.  For the whole week that I was there, I kept calling and they could not give me any information. After 3 days with out clothes, I was forced to purchase a few clothes and a bag as I was travelling to different cities.  When I returned to the States I contacted their Customer Service in Casablanca. I ran into agents who said they did not speak English and refused to talk to me. When I did finally get a person who could talk to me, she called me a liar as she knew I picked up my bag when I arrived. I stopped dealing with them and for the next 27 days I only talked to JFK customer service who searched for my bag. Finally after a month, it was found in Morocco and sent back to JFK where it was finally delivered on the 34th day.  Then began the attempt to get back the $248 that I had spent for supplies and a year later nothing, they just stopped talking to me.  I have traveled over 2 million miles, mostly internationally and have never had as bad service as I have from Royal Air Maroc

Title:
Me and my boyfriend flew with Royal air Maroc at the start of September and were very pleasantly surprised. We were quite weary initially because the reviews are so poor however we can’t fault this flight at all plus it was the only flight from MAN to CASABLANCA we could get.

The flight was three and a half hours and we were surprised we got a meal. Ryan air or easyJet certainly doing five meals or for short haul flights! My boyfriend had chicken and cous cous and it was excellent and we were also offered a free soft drink. I don’t have the food on planes but the air host told me if I wanted anything at all, to press the call bell and he would get me something later on if I wanted.

The seats were comfortable, not like the plastic ones you now see on short haul airlines. They had plenty of leg room and the staff were all very polite.

We were both very surprised given that the reviews were so bad. I would fly with Royal air Maroc again. The que for checking in was short and there were no problems with bags like most of the reviews say.

Thanks!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Ha! I read reviews like ‘bad service’ and ‘flight delays’, and although I agree with all of these, we almost died on Air Morocco! We were travelling on flight AT997 on 6/9/2018 from Porto to Casablanca when the left engine literally exploded whilst we were flying. The aircraft dropped, the screens went up (so we couldn’t see how quickly!) and passengers were left panicking. The crew had no idea what was going on and did little to calm passengers who understandably were freaking out. Passengers were crying, praying and panicking. Several things were said over the intercom, but few were translated to English or Portuguese, leaving many passengers unaware that the plane was going to have to execute an emergency landing back in Porto. Thankfully we had some kind Moroccans nearby who translated for us.
To the pilots credit he managed to land the damaged plane. The only positive thing about the airline, we did have a competent pilot.
When safely on the ground there was NO information provided around what was happening. They left us stranded in an empty terminal with no water. Many people were crying, including myself and swearing never to get on a plane again. Finally (after approx 1.5 hrs) they told us the flight was ‘cancelled’ (well duh) and then we were told to line up at the upstairs counter where 2 customer service reps who were both EXTREMELY RUDE sorted out the 120 or so passengers who were left stranded. The lines were long and the staff rude. Many people waited hrs to be given no resolution. As for us, well there was no way I was getting back in one of their dodgey planes. They stated I would have to send an email to my original booking agent to get a refund and would not provide any written evidence as requested for our insurance company. They are in clear violation of passenger rights (information sheets provided by airport staff to the passengers). But I’m just glad to be alive!!!
We never got to Morocco, and I am now terrified of flying.
So do yourself a favour, don’t fly with them if you want to get to the other side, and if you have ever had a flight cancelled by them because the aircraft never arrived, it’s probably because the aircraft was unsafe to fly!!!
crvsd: Yolly J wrote a review Sep 2018
qwuub: UNSAFE AIRLINE. Engine Failure whilst flying, almost died.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have flown the worlds best airlines and until now, I though that I had experienced the worst - wrong - only post my Royal Air Maroc experience to and from Casablanca this month have I finally traveled on the world's worst (of course this is MY opinion) airline.

Boarding gate changes.

Filthy Aircraft.

A very UNPLEASANT crew. Now I know that you could hit a bum crew on any one leg of a journey but in BOTH direftions is highly improbable. Not with Royal Air Maroc. Just miserable and unpleasant uncaring crew. I am also well aware that crew are there primarily for SAFETY issues and NOT serving .... but since you do serve, and sonce you were not forced into your position by gun point, at least do it with a smile - or try at least.

In-flight, aircraft do become dirty from uncaring passengers but usually the crew does a light clean - particularly in the lavatories. Not on RAM - the toilets are filthy 60-minutes into the flight and so do they remain until you disembark.

Audio (for PA announcements) is not good at all and the hold of English is not at all audible (again, my experience) - then get a recording for goodness sake.

The seating is shocking thanks to Boeing trying to cram more passengers in than is necessary.

Overheating in the main cabin is the norm.

And I could go on and on .... but suffice to say Morocco is a MAGNIFICENT country. It is just a great pity that their national carrier leaves much to be desired.

I'll say this. "Thank goodness they stay up in the air."

If you're heading to Morocco (and yes, you should be), try another carrier via an intermediary point if you must or "grin and bear it."
qwuub: Nothing Dreamy about the DREAMLINER - well at least RAM
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title:
Let me start off with saying, you get what you pay for. This flight was way cheaper than the other ones to the destination

We have four legs- DC to Casablanca, Casablanca to Rome, Rome to Casablanca back to DC.

DC to Casablanca- no complaints, food was actually kind of good. Great start.

Casablanca to Rome- There is no decent food options in this airport but whatever, we are on our way to Italy- no biggie.

Then we boarded the plane. 1. We were in the exit row and this row was so large is was the most comfortable flying experience of my life. Twice the size of American exit rows, hooray. However, even though my purse was all the way under the seat in front of me, they made me and the people in the row move their bags. Flying to a foreign country I wasn't wild about having my passport, money and important personal belongings in a shared bin.

Then the flight attendant walks up and down the aisle spraying something. (I think air freshener?) It was like a production, multiple people on the flight were laughing at this.

Then we received the food, I could not tell what it was and took a bite and decided to pass. I ate the dinner roll they served with cream cheese. (on all future flights)

Rome- Casablanca-
Flight there was fine. We were running late because someone forgot to account for daylight savings time and everyone's flights had been adjusted two days before. We land with about 30 minutes before our next leg. Our plane was about 50% people flying to DC, we ask the flight attendant to call ahead and make sure they hold the plane. He laughs at us and tells us it's a small airport and we are being stupid.

We were not.

You get off the plane and you have to get in line for security again. There are about 250 people in line. Then over the speaker they list three flights that are departing soon to come to the front, low and behold EVERYONE in line was going to those flights so any line system was out the window and it was just survival of the fittest to get through first.

So we get through the line with at this point about 10 minutes until our flight. We then have to get into ANOTHER security line at the gate. Here they took water and items that people had just purchased from their airport. It was insane.

We were able to board but WOW was that stressful.

The mystery food was terrible on this flight, my tv keep cutting out but luckily I found some work around. My friend had a really uncomfortable exchange with the flight attendant on this flight that I wasn't apart of because I had to run (literally, see notes about time between flights) to the bathroom once we boarded the plane before take off.

Overall, I would probably never fly this airline again or if I did I would 100% bring a TON of snacks because the only food I ate after the DC to Casablanca leg was dinner rolls. It did save me a lot of money so I guess if the price is right, do it, just expect to get what you pay for.
crvsd: Jennifer M wrote a review Sep 2018

Title: I am writing with regards to my recent experience flying with Royal Air Maroc. On August 4th my friend and I had flights booked from Tangier to Porto, Portugal with a connection in Casablanca.  When we arrived at the airport in Tangier and checked in we were informed that we were too late to board, our plane had not departed but the gate was closed.We were directed to speak with a clerk at the Air Maroc office at the Tangier airport. We waited for a few minutes for the agent to arrive at their office. We explained that we unable to board our flight and asked if there was a way we could catch our connecting flight out of Casablanca. We asked if a train or bus would get us to Casablanca in time. He suggested we take a grand taxi to be sure we made it.  He said he would email someone at the Air Maroc office in Casablanca to tell them we would be there to catch our connecting flight. We gratefully thanked him and ran to find a taxi.After a very expensive four hour taxi ride we made it to the Casablanca airport with plenty of time to check in and go through security. When we tried to check in the agent at the counter said we were not confirmed for the flight. We explained what had happened in Tangier and that an agent was going to email to confirm our connecting flight. The Casablanca airport agent directed us to go to the Air Maroc office.  We waited for about 30 minutes for an available agent. When it was our turn to speak with an agent we were told that we would have to pay a penalty for missing our first flight. I felt that missing the flight alone was a penalty; and the four hour taxi ride also penalized us, and the added expense of over 200 euros for the cost of the taxi was also a penalty that we had to endure. When I was told that we would need to pay an additional 1132.00 MAD per person, or 2264.00 MAD in total I was in shock. There was no understanding on the part of the agent of what we had gone through that day. Perhaps the agent in Tangier had not followed through with the email he said he would send on our behalf, again there seemed to us that there was no sense of understanding on either of the Air Maroc agents part.In a subsequent email that I received from Air Maroc customer relations we were thanked for our understanding when our flight AT996 from Casablanca was delayed:  We hope you have enjoyed flying with us. On behalf of Royal Air Maroc, please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused to you resulting from the delay of your flight AT996 of Aug 04th, 2018, due to operational contraints. Thank you for your understanding and look forward to having the pleasure of welcoming once again aboard! Royal Air MarocAs Air Maroc passengers we were asked for our understanding when our flight was delayed, yet we did not receive the same courtesy when we were not able to make our flight.  We were imposed with a very heavy penalty - how is that understanding??  I am extremely upset with how the agent treated us, his lack of understanding and by the harsh penalty that we had to pay.  I feel that the penalty we had to pay should be fully refunded.  In all my years of travel I have never been treated with such harsh measures by any other airline. I have sent Royal Air Maroc my concerns and received a reply that stated because I had purchased my ticket from a website other than Royal Air Maroc's that I was directed to contact the online agency I used to purchase my ticket. I replied by stating that my concern was not with the purchase of my ticket through the website other than Royal Air Maroc. My concern was with the harsh financial penalty imposed on me in order to catch my connecting flight by the Royal Air Maroc agent at the Casablanca Airport.
qwuub: Harsh penalty for missing a flight
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I was notified by mail that my flight back home had been canceled due to operational reasons. I was offered a flight 2 days later.
So far so good, normally an airline will support you now by either offering an connection flight or accommodation.
So I called the hotline hoping to get some support, because I had nowhere to stay. Only option offered was a flight to Berlin one day later. A connection to Munich is „not our problem, we are just the hotline“. Asking for a hotel to stay the two days in Morocco they again replied „not our problem we are just the hotline, you can send an email to customer support“.
So I sent an E-Mail:
Answered one day later: „thank you for your mail, we will try to respond to your mail in the next 60 days“
This means RAM is not interested in any customer support, not even a compensation was offered.
I had to book a hotel by myself and pay for it.
I will definitely never fly again with RAM.

Title:
There are very few options that fly direct from Barcelona to Casablanca, and Royal Air Maroc is probably the only one. The flight itself was very basic (no entertainment system, snacks but no hot meal, older plane) but the experience itself was a smooth one - no major delays, no lost luggage, no major turbulence.

Lines at immigration in Casablanca were relatively short and the wait for luggage to arrive at the carousels were reasonable. There are a few places for you to buy a SIM card and exchange money but very little dining options at the airport. All luggage is put through x-ray search prior to leaving the restricted area.

Title:
I wouldn't rate anything better than an average 2, but I Loved It !
Checking was chaotic, the few western travelers were extra searched. So I got a feel for how it feels for many in North America. Then one simply follows the que, where you are then bused out to a large 747 - one of the very few that still cross the Atlantic.
Inside,seats don't really adjust, the reading lights are burned out or off, there is no onboard entertainment ( at least not the type that we are used to).
It wasn't a cheap flight either. That said, I booked very close to our travel and there were no other flights home on my travel day, even through Europe.
That all said, it was highly enjoyable.
There were so many kids on board, it reminded me of a kids birthday party. And they were wild; running around, jumping on the seats, crying.
It was the human experience. The conversation was open with the other passengers - strangers quickly became friends.
And there was full service, when there was turbulence, service continued - none of this " sorry we need to put everything away and not serve hot coffee"

I loved it and given the right state of mind, you will too!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Flew with RAM for the 1st time as they had the cheapest price by more than $400 on similar flights from YYZ /YUL to FIH. Plane was on time,took a bit of time to board as plane was full families with younger kids. Plane had just landed from Casablanca and in less than one hour we were boarding that plane so cleanness was not up to standard and had to clean my seat and tray using wipes. You receive socks and sleep mask. For the food ,I wish they could have food items that are more appealing to their diverse customers. LuggagesI heard of the horror stories of the company losing their passenger luggage . I was even more nervous as I forgot to lock of one my suitcases. The Casablanca layover was ok , I was given a room since I had 11 hours until my next flight. Room was only use  to refresh myself to go explore the Medina. Please keep in mind that it takes almost  1 hour train ride each way from the airport to Casaport. (Cost is close to 6 Cad each way). I only had a 1 h 30 min to shop and make it on time back to the hotel to get my stuff and head back to the airport using the hotel shuttle. Arrival at destination,both my luggages were wrapped and not done by me. I was already freaking out that my suitcase was unlocked so maybe items were removed before being  wrapped. Some of my fellows passengers noticed that their suitcases which were locked were open and the lock was missing but they too were wrapped. One told us that on his way to Europe some of his items were stolen and he was going to file a complaint and wanted to have the contact of other fellow passengers who had experienced the same thing.  Final verdict I don’t think  I will fly with this company again unless the price is extremely extremely low and I am not carrying items that I will miss if they get stolen. Staff was nice and polite
qwuub: Would I fly with them again ???? Uhm ....
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I am not an airline expert but I have used 10+ airlines in the past 4 years between major ones and budget ones. RAM gave me one of the worst experiences by far.

I have to mention the pros first, however few. Courteous cabin crew. They were very polite compared to other airlines. They handed out toys for kids and were kind to replace my son’s toy as it was for younger age group. Above average leg room. Frequent water and drinks. Sky RAM is a WiFi service to run multimedia entertainment on your laptop or so. However I failed to run it on my iPhone. But still is a very good idea if the plane has no built in entertainment facilities.

Now to the other side of the story. I booked CAI-LHR flight with 1 hour transit in Casablanca. First of all, they told me the first flight will be handled by Egyptair and they are not responsible for online check in for the first flight. Fine by me!!! Got the first boarding pass in Cairo and the flight was smooth (20 minutes late) in a standard 737 narrow body aircraft with usual EA service (I will review EA on their page as well).

Landed in Casablanca to the chaotic RAM desk. They were astonished we had 5 bags (me, my wife and my son!!!!) and that they need to transfer them from the first plane to the other. Anyway, I received the boarding passes 35 minutes before the flight and managed to catch it to find myself and my family in nothing short of a dirty 737 narrow body aircraft with questionable stains all over the seats and the walls, very noisy aircraft (remember I was on another 737 just 50 minutes earlier) and CRT Monitors!!!! (for those born in the new millennium, that’s the ancient large TV version before the LCD era).

We survived the trip to find half of our luggage missing at London Heathrow airport.

I booked that flight since it was cheaper by 300 £ compared to a direct one and since RAM had very good ratings among African airlines but I couldn’t be more wrong.

Definitely not an experience I would like to repeat or recommend for anyone. I am still waiting to hear about the rest of my luggage.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Curious about the service and choice of food I found myself wondering about the way things are handled at Royal Air Maroc... No consistency in serving the meal on the left and right side, the choice only chicken or beef, no vegetarian option ( which I was looking for), coffee or tea is served walking with the pot in the cabin crew's hand – like in old times...where is the milk or sugar ? You have to ask for and it is brought in a big plastic bag from which it gets distributed to those who are claiming it.
Water !! On Royal Air Maroc one cabin crew comes with a pile of cups and a big bottle of water and serves those who claim. I always thought water and hydrating yourself on a plane is one of the most important things! Well, at Royal Air Maroc is is a luxury.
The snack which was served in the second part of the flight was on a wet tray, no drink was on the tray, nobody passed by with a trolley to offer any drink and then the cabin crew disappeared.
When rolling their carts through the alley they could not manage to roll them straight and bumped into the passengers sitting on the aisle seats every time they passed.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Saturday afternoon we arrived to Casablanca where we found the worst treatment ever from RAM management to the customer service and even the baggage service. No one had any lists of passengers names and schedules. No communication was done internally between Montreal and Casablanca to inform them about the situation. We were forced to stay for two nights in a hell of a hotel until Monday morning. Vacation ruined, stressful situations for three days and bad treatment. Title: They love the euro currency, in fact it starts at Customs after the passport control they ask you if you have euros with you even when you live the country, what's that supposed to mean? The duty free it's all in euro and you won't believe this but the prices of cafes and restaurants are even more expensive then in Europe! Let's get back to the airport, when you get in the country you have to fill il the custom form, exactly the same if you live the  country, this is ridiculous because the forms are exactly the same and is just wasting time, they increase airport prices and flight tickets but they cannot invest in better systems nor in english speaking personnel ?The customs forms are available once you get off the plane in the passport control area, why not in the plane in order to avoid CHAOS? This is what we call a 3rd world country, not only for the poverty, corruption and more but also because their systems failures. Title: RAM took off delayed 2hours from Marseille making us miss our connection. I was travelling with my 5yo child. The moment we arrived at the airport I approached the help desk to inform them my flight passed already. Not even an apologetic word, all I received was a question of what do I need from her. I asked for their procedure as it was the airlines fault. The lady told me to go outside - proceed pass the immigration and to find an office  “Hébergement” which will handle my case. This was quite worrisome and doubtful as no document whatsoever was given. I asked if they will provide a place to sleep & meals. She told me yes all will be provided. Again, I arrived at the office and the man on the desk was on the phone. Not even a hello, he just gestured me to pass him my boarding pass while continuously talking on the phone. Gave me a printout and told me to go out the airport to take a bus that will bring us to a hotel. No polite words given. No greetings, no sorry, no goodbyes. It’s like you are ordered by your master & the fact you are there in front of them irritates them and you have to leave fast with their hand gesture. In the hotel provided (Relax), the bedsheets were unchanged. No pillowcases. You still see the remnants of the one who used the bed before & also some hairs. No towels too. And no drinks. Apparently they don’t offer drinks. I was told that this is the agreement between RAM and the hotel and nothing can be done. Apart from the poor customer service, the plane itself is okay.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
On a recent visit to Morocco, I received an email two days before my departure that Royal Air Maroc CANCELLED my return flight. The only option they gave me to rebook was to leave at 5AM the next morning.

As someone who carefully plans and looks forward to a vacation once a year, I was infuriated when I had to end my trip two days early in order to get home! To make matters worse, I was in Marrakech when this was thrown at me, and had to spend the rest of that day scrambling to take a 3 hour/$200 USD taxi to get to the airport in another city, not to mention the hotels for two nights I had paid in advance that I didn’t even get to stay at.

Good luck seeking any sort of retribution from them - what a JOKE! I have tried to ask the airline to compensate me for some of the costs accrued as a result of this cancellation - if you do get to speak to someone they’re horrifically rude and condescending. If you aren’t lucky enough to reach an actual person you’re redirected in an endless maze of dead ends and suggestions to “file a claim online.”

I will never ever ever ever ever book or allow anyone I know to ever ever book with this airline.

Title:
We were not notified of a six hour delay in departure when we checked in online. When we checked in at the airport we were informed at that time, but too late to have been able to stay at our hotel without wasting time at the airport.

We only received an email apologizing for the delay after showing up at the airport many hours earlier than we needed to. No apology was given.

The wait at the airport service counter was interminable, and the desk staff were rude, inconsiderate and uncaring. We were told we could get a hotel voucher, but when we went to the place designated to receive it, they denied that such a service existed.

Despite empty gates at the terminal, we were forced to take a bus and carry our luggage up stairs into the aircraft at boarding time. I suspect that the airline placed its plane on the tarmac, as often done in Third World countries, to save money on airport fees charged to use a gate.

This was a great inconvenience to us older passengers who found it difficult to carry the luggage up the steps. Of course, the airline offered no help in that, either.

In the air, flight attendants were uncaring, rushed through their chores so that they could talk with each other, and offered little service to customers in the overcrowded plane. For example, only once during the long flight was water offered to passengers.

The airplane bathrooms were filthy, and were not cleaned during the flight. Only toilet tissue was available to dry your hands after washing.

The food, like most international airlines nowadays, was barely edible. This is the one area that Royal Air Maroc equaled other carriers.

In summary, this airline offers Third World services fitting for a Third World country.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have never faced such an improper way of treating passengers!
I'm staying in KSA and my Family staying in Jordan, we planned to spend Eid Holiday in Istanbul together, I booked their round-trip tickets from Amman / Jordan to Istanbul Departing on August 17, 2018 returns in August 24, 2018 in order to arrange my flight accordingly and then reserve a car and make a hotel booking as well, I received a confirmation email from Royal Maroc then I executed my plan.
The flight ticket for me was very expensive so I reserved a non-refundable ticket to save some money which cost me $891 then I proceeded with car and hotel reservation which was as well non-refundable.
I have done my 5 family members reservations through Expedia paying the total amount of $1088 and received the confirmation on August 3, 2018, as It is high season these days and prices increases every minute.
August 7, 2018, I received an email for each ticket mentioning simply that tickets for these flights are not valid any more due to computer bug!!! I tried immediately to contact Royal Maroc call centre but they are not answering!!!
I contacted Expedia call centre which is located in the US discovering that they have no idea about this!!! I spend 2 days between the agents and supervisors until they confirmed for me that the trip is cancelled and that they started already the refunding process and they can’t do anything about it!!! I tried to find another flight but the price becomes more than triple. So, I had 2 options: either I cancel the whole plan and lose my non-refundable ticket + Non-refundable Hotel’s reservation + my calls to Expedia call centre ($891 + $853 + $133 = $1877) or to reserve expensive tickets for my family and lose almost the same amount.
I need to know, what this site can help me with? Is it possible to hold the Maroc airline responsible for these amounts? What can I do to get back my money?

Title:
My mother and I booked flights on RAM, and then my mother found out she had cancer a week later and thus couldn't travel. RAM refused to refund her 200 Euro cancellation fee, even though she had a letter from her doctor verifying that she could not fly. I still took the trip, and had a terrible experience with this airline. I do NOT recommend it.

Pros:
-- I made it there alive
-- They did not lose my bag

Cons:
-- Absolutely everything else
-- Flight was delayed three hours but the staff did not communicate why at any point
-- Long lines at every step of the process
-- Inefficient boarding process causing further delays
-- Missed connection because of delay and staff in Casablanca were frigid and unhelpful
-- Flight attendants rushed through service and simply ignored customers
-- Flight attendants ignored call buttons
-- They will wake you up to try to give you meals
-- The plane was dirty, but the plane bathrooms were Filthy
-- Casablanca airport has about 10% of the chairs that there are passengers

Title: Our flight from JFK to Casablanca (#201) was excellent.  The 787 is quiet and comfortable and the food service is very good, with dinner and breakfast, although quite starchy.  We arrived at 8:50 am, and asked and were told we were given a downtown hotel for our wait.  That was fine, and we could walk to the mosque and through the old market.  The problem was the flight to Lome.  We expected it to leave at 02:40, so we knew we had a long layover.  We arrived before midnight, and were told the flight was delayed until 7 am, so sent to a closer hotel for the wait.  We arrived before 5 am and were told it was delayed until 2 pm.  At 1:30 there was no sign of any staff to board us, and no other flight to subsaharan Africa were departing.  We started to appeal to prayers back home, and to search for  a way to get to another city where other airlines were flying to Lome.  Suddenly there was activity and we boarded.  The power of prayer!The return flights from Lome to Casablanca and to JFK were very comfortable without any surprises.
crvsd: Ed L wrote a review Aug 2018

Title:
Royal Air Maroc used to be one of my favorites. I flew with the company for the past 8 years or so, and I noticed that the service is always getting worse and worse.

Few years ago, it was one of the cleanest and relaxing airways. Whenever I wanted to go to Morocco, Royal Air Maroc was my first option, but now it became my last.

I think it can still be one of the best by improving the following aspects:

1) Train its staff to communicate better
2) Make sure that the airplane is always clean
3) Make sure that the technichal and mechanical condition of the airplane is clear before welcoming the passangers on board.

Other than the above mentioned issues, Royal Air Maroc still remains one of the most powerful airline companies.

Finally, I would like to conclude by mentioning that Royal Air Maroc is still one of the best companies when it comes to food.
qwuub: I used to be a big fan..
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I purchased a plane ticket through the Royal Air Maroc website from Barcelona to New York-JFK with a layover in Casablanca. My first flight departed July 29th at 19:10. I arrived at Barcelona Airport (BCN) at 15:00 – 3 hours prior to my flight as suggested via Royal Air Maroc website. Upon reaching the check-in desk, I was informed my ticket had been cancelled and I would not be able to board.

Upon further questioning, I was told by the check-in desk the flight had been overbooked and my flight itinerary had been changed. Royal Air had moved me to an earlier flight the same day, one that departed at 13:30 - five hours earlier than my original flight. I never received an email nor an SMS of this change in schedule. The first time I heard of the change was at the check-in desk around 15:15, at which point the rescheduled flight had already departed.

I called costumer service office, asking to be rescheduled to another flight. However, I was informed that the airline was not responsible for the flight change and that the airline would not pay for another flight. They then blamed the airport, stating one of the agents at the airport changed the schedule. So if I wanted to get a new ticket, I would need to speak to the airport.

I did. No one at the airport could help, as they all stated the flight change could not be their responsibility - they do not have the authority to change someone's flight without the passenger’s direct request. I even questioned how the airport was at fault. If I booked my flight through Royal Air Maroc website, why was it not the responsibility of Royal Air Maroc, the carrier, to contact me of a flight change? And wasn’t Royal Air Maroc admitting to the flight change by saying the airlines agents changed my flight itinerary?

Royal Air Maroc refused to claim they made a mistake. The agents at the airport claimed to not have the power to make such a mistake. And I was left stranded without a flight back to the US.

I spent two days at the airport on the phone, talking to airport staff trying and failing to get rebooked or even refunded.

Honestly, I cannot understand how a paying customer can be so mis-treated. I paid for my flight, I was ready and at the airport 3 hours before I was originally scheduled to fly. And then I am informed that someone – unknown who - had changed my flight time, and that I had missed this new flight. This was completely out of my hands. Someone, please explain how this okay? How a passenger’s flight can be moved up by 5 hours without any notification? How a passenger can be expected to rebook and repay for a flight as if the mistake was her fault? How costumer service can provide little help to rectify the situation?

What I do know per the EU passenger rights and Royal Air Maroc own legal notice, I should have been given notice of a change. And as I was not, my passenger rights were violated, and I should have been compensated. I never was.

If I’ve learned anything from this ordeal, is Royal Air Maroc does not care for its passengers, they will violate passenger’s rights. All Royal Air Maroc cares about is money. The airline may appear cheaper, but the cost is not worth it. In fact, if this is the behavior they have, I do not believe Royal Air Maroc should even continue as an airline company. Please learn from my experience do not book a trip with this airline.
crvsd: Vanessa R wrote a review Aug 2018

Title:
I just got off my RAM flight. I will say there was a lot of legroom.

However, the service was extremely slow on the plane. The only flight attendant I saw working was a lone woman, the three men didn't seem to do anything. So it took forever to get a meal and the tray clean up was such a long wait I started to feel claustrophobic.

The meal was very bad. Not a single fruit or vegetable. Even the "mango" yogurt had no fruit, only "aroma".

But the real problem was the heat! I usually freeze on airplanes, so have lots of layers. This was flight was so hot I felt nauseous (the food didn't help), light headed and worried I might faint. I rang the bell multiple times but it took 10 minutes before anyone came and another 10 minutes before they brought me a glass of water. Which was lukewarm like all the other drinks, but did help.

I k ow the airplane had air conditioning because they turned it on 20 minutes before landing!! Only then did the cabin become bearable.

Title: This was a miserable flight. There were way too many passengers flying with babies and/or small children. I understand that people have children and want/need to travel with them. I do not believe that children should be allowed to scream and carry on so loudly that it disrupts the experience of others. I also do not believe it is ok for children to kick the seats in front of them or to use the tray tables as a drum station as the child behind us was doing over and over and over. Flight attendants did absolutely nothing to improve the quality of the flight experience for adult passengers. There were several passengers who did complain and nothing was done, nothing. It was impossible to rest or to even enjoy the in-flight entertainment. Try sitting down to watch a movie and every 5 seconds, someone kicks your seat from behind or some child is literally screaming as loud as he possibly can. Our initial flight departed late from Rome - not sure why. Nothing was ever communicated to passengers. We nearly missed our connecting flight since their passport line was very long and moving way too slowly. Thankfully, the connecting flight was also delayed. Again, not sure why. This airline communicates poorly or not even at all. Food was decent, but nothing to write home about. Touchscreen was obviously new, which was nice since that meant it was quick and very responsive unlike many older models. Variety of entertainment was adequate but not great. I suggest this airline do one of two things: 1 - limit the amount of passengers flying with children per flight to maintain an enjoyable atmosphere, or 2 - seat all passengers with children under 6 in an area together, possibly with some noise barriers between them and other passengers. This was one of the most miserable flight experiences I have ever had and I have taken many long, international flights on different airlines. I cannot say I would ever choose to fly with this airline again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Thanks to the strikes by Air France I was put on a flight from Paris to Casablanca on Royal Air Maroc (RAM). I had no choice having missed all other flight options.  My experience in getting between terminals was horrendous.   Once I got to the right terminal I used the lounge that was available for RAM.  It was acceptable but not great.  I was treated poorly by the RAM agent at the gate.  I was told by Delta Airlines back in Detroit that my bags would be transferred in Paris to my RAM flight.  The RAM agent told me I had two choices because my bags were not transferred and were never going to be transferred in the first place.  My choices:  get on the plane without my bag and deal with it in Casablanca or don’t get on this flight (the last one of the day) and go find my bag at Air France.  She was rude and made me cry.  I was traveling alone and I was traveling Business Class.  Her supervisor observed what was going on and stepped in and said he’d check on my bag.  No luck.  On the flight I was one of only two passengers in First Class.  The flight attendant was very pleasant and we struggled a bit to communicate as I do not speak much French and she spoke no English.  But no big deal.  I was the foreigner.  She served me a glass of nice French champagne albeit warm.   The dinner was awful but for dessert I had the most wonderful French cheese course.  Once I landed in Casablanca I had to go thru the process for lost luggage with the airport representative who was not a RAM employee.  In the end I was just happy to finally get to Casablanca!
crvsd: Deborah T wrote a review Aug 2018
qwuub: Unplanned Flight from Paris to Casablanca due to Air France Strikes

Title:
My family and I flew Royal Air Maroc on our way to Rome for a cruise. We had a layover in Morocco. It unfortunately was not an enjoyable flight and caused stress. The flight was delayed three times prior to travel. It was an overnight flights, but they kept the lights on the entire time and the passengers were unruly. Flight attendants could not be bothered to help you, even if you put your service light on. When they did (if they did) they were short and rude. The plane was not clean, especially the bathroom, with no paper towels to dry your hands. Trash was thrown all throughout the aisles. I'm not sure if this was attributed to the passengers or the crew, but regardless, it was filthy. Two women got in a screaming match for about 15 minutes and with 5 flight attendants present, it didn't seem like they did much to quell the altercation. After our lay-over in Morocco, the flight was again delayed and the boarding process was incredibly disorganized and again was staffed with unkind crew members. Needless to say we were kissing the ground when we made it to Rome!

On our flight back to Washington, D.C., we went in with an open mind, hoping it would be a better flight. The passengers were much calmer this time, but the staff were once again poor representations of the airline. Asking for a simple cup of water was met with huffing and puffing and eye rolls. I turned my service light on, because my screen was not working and it took them an hour to come. This was after trying to get several crew members attention and being deliberately ignored. The seven hour flight was spent sitting with nothing to do as the flight was fully booked. The aisles were once again filled with trash and the bathrooms left uncleaned. I truly hope others have had a better experience- hopefully we were met with a bout of bad luck! Best of luck to future travelers.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
THIS AIRLINE IS A COMPLETE SCAM.

Don’t fly Royal Air Maroc unless you want to be screwed over at 10 o’clock at night and get trapped in Morocco.

Was checking into my flight from Casablanca to NY JFK when the woman at the counter said I had a standby ticket (which I 100% did not). I explained to her that I had a real seared ticket, to which she said she was going to call a manager and print out my boarding pass.

Fifteen minutes go by and a man walked up to me to inform me that the flight check in has been closed and I cannot fly home to New York. The woman at the counter waited until the time ran out to check in so she wouldn’t have to bother getting me a seat on the plane. I was told that I missed the flight and I needed to reschedule my trip back to NY. She didn’t take the responsibility for trapping me in this country and now I’m probably going to have to pay for another flight to New York.

This airline is a TOTAL SCAM. DO NOT FLY ROYAL AIR MAROC.

Title:
Being a moroccan, I have taken Royal Air Maroc my whole life to go visit from Montreal to Casa. Personally I am not fond of this company but I am used to it.
Just to sumarize my point of view of this airline:
Cons:
1- Bad customer service, you have to ask 2-3 times before you get something from an attendant (they are often rude)
2-Food doesn't taste super good (worse than hospital food), and it is often repetitive between the different meals.
3- Plane ALWAYS late! whether it is in the leaving or return flight..
4-People on the plane are often loud (families with their kids) and people always ask you for stuff (whether to hold something for them or to switch seats, which is okay but several times is annoying when u wanna travel solo and calmly).

Pros:
1- You have tablets with movies, music etc.
2-The food is free
3- You get to have 2 registered luggages of 23kg+ a small cabin luggage
4-The aircraft pilots are usually reputed

But at the end of the day you get to morocco... Lol

Title: This 6AM flight from Fes to Casablanca is a SCAM, be aware.  Mine was canceled after getting up at 3:30AM and arriving at 4:30AM in the morning with no prior notice.  Weather was fine, there were other flights leaving around the same time. They cancel the flight often, the local person told me this was the 3rd time they canceled this flight on him.  They put everyone on a bus to Casablanca and did not offer you a refund.  Just so you know, a bus is 10 times cheaper than a flight and takes 3.5 hrs to the Casablanca airport.  I asked for a letter stating that they canceled the flight for my insurance, but this couldn't be done after waiting for 30 min.  The system never shows the flight being canceled.  There you go, a scam in the making.
qwuub: Fes to Casablanca flight is canceled often, they put you on a bus, and offers no refund.

Title:
Firstly, I would like to mention that I am not one to write reviews. I must be completely wowed and the service must exceed my expectations or I must be extremely disappointed with the service. In this case I have never experienced service that was this awful. I am amazed that an airline such as Royal Air Maroc is still in business. I have traveled a lot in Europe, Asia, North & South America and I can confidently say this is the worst airline I have ever used. They lack the first principal of an airline company, customer service. When I traveled from JFK (NY) to Fes via Casablanca I was only given my boarding pass from JFK to CMN. When at Casablanca I had to search for assistance as to wear I could get my boarding pass from Casablanca to Fes. We finally found the area and were quickly amazed by the chaos. There were 2 customer service reps for about 25 people. Yelling quickly began among passengers as many of them were about to miss their connecting flight. After waiting about 1 hour in line we finally got our boarding pass. It become quickly clear that the staff we not eager to assist and also lacked training. We finally arrive in Fes but my bag stayed in Casablanca. We quickly found out that Royal Air Maroc has no reps in Fes, therefore we had to deal with a third party airport service company. The customer service help was once again poor. We asked when the bag would arrive and he said probably tomorrow around the same time we had arrived. He then pointed to a bunch of lost baggage that had just arrived from Casablanca from other passengers. Once again we quickly noticed that losing customers bags were a frequent thing for Royal Air Maroc. I then proceed to give them our hotel info so that they could drop of our bag, but he stopped me and said that I would need to return to the airport and pick up my bag because Royal Air Maroc doesn't have any employees at Fes to drop of the bag. I found this extremely unprofessional as I once had a bag lost from another airline and they delivered it to my home the next day. This is actually standard for airlines to do, but not with Royal Air. Extremely disappointed I left the airport with only the clothes I was wearing. The next day I had to purchase all new clothes and all hygiene products as I was told that my bag would be available for pickup the following morning. Two days after my arrival and about 4 hours commuting to and from the airport (I had to pay out of pocket for my taxi ride) I pickup my damaged bag. On my return to the airport for my flight back to NY I tried to talk to someone from Royal Air Maroc about the incident at the airport in Marrakech (but no luck), in Casablanca (but no luck) and in NY (but no luck). In Casablanca they literally pointed me to empty offices and had me running around for over an 1 hour before telling me that no once could help me. I demanded to speak with a manager and they informed me that because it was a weekend managers do not work. 1. If that is true, then that has to be the worst company policy and a disgrace to a customer service company and 2. if that was a lie, well then, that is disgraceful. I can't stress to any fellow traveler how terrible this airline is. Do not use them, you will regret it. After reading many of the other terrible reviews for this airline I quickly noticed that my situation could have been a lot worse. I also spoke to other travelers in Morocco and they too shared their grief about flying with Royal Air Maroc. All of the comments are the same. The sad thing is that this company is not doing anything to correct the ongoing issues. The same negative reviews from years ago are still present today. Reviews are also a great way to provide the company feedback about their service and for the company to correct issues. This is non existent with this company, they do not care about customers. Please do not be drawn to Royal Air Maroc by their low cost fare, trust me that traveling with them will cost you more money, will give you aggravation and time lost during your holiday.

A few other minor things worth mentioning; in flight entertainment was intermittent throughout the entire flight from Casablanca to JFK. It worked properly for 3 hours out of the 6 hours. USB port for charging cell phone did not work. The meals were terrible, the bread was ice cold hard and the beef had more fat than meat. Staff is unfriendly and lack problem solving skills.

qwuub: Unprofessional & Lack of Customer Service - Worst Airline

Title:
IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOURSELF OR YOUR LOVED ONES DO NOT TAKE ROYAL AIR MAROC. Even if you hate the person your traveling with, STILL do not take Royal Air Maroc. My friend and I decided to book with this airline to save a couple hundred dollars. Little did we know that we were about to embark on the most stressful, irritating, outrageous journey of our lives.

I travel all the time, I have never had as terrible an experience as this one. What was wrong with our trip you ask? Buckle up, let me tell you a little story.

We fly out of Dulles (Washington DC) and have a layover in Casablanca before we go to Lisbon. We make it to Casablanca fine, yeah the plane had 0 entertainment options, terrible food and smelled kind of weird but whatever, we were saving some money! We have 3 hours before our next flight so we settle into a cafe to wait. We decide to go to the gate 30 minutes before boarding even starts just to find out that our flight has already departed. WHAT DO YOU MEAN OUR FLIGHT HAS DEPARTED? WE ARRIVED BEFORE BOARDING EVEN STARTED. They briefly say something about how they follow a different time zone because of a special day light savings or something and how our phones have reverted to the wrong time. We thought it was 3:30pm but it was really 4:30pm. Confused and shocked we asked how we fix this and of course no one even gave us the time of day. As my friend and I start to panic we go to information to see how we can book a new flight. First off, I'd like to say there is maybe one SINGULAR clock inside of this airport and our phones reverted to Casablanca, Moroccan time so of course we thought our phones were correct. It felt like a twilight zone, as we're rushing around trying to figure out our plan we hear other people being confused about the time/missing their flights. We were bounced from person to person trying to figure out how to get new tickets. We finally realize we are going to have to exit the airport to get to the Royal Air Maroc office to book new ones. We also don't have any service and the wifi has timed out on us.

To exit we have to go through the immigration line, we get into it. 2 hours later we are still not close to the front of the line. At one point people are so frustrated with how slowly the line is moving a small riot breaks out and I think about how I don't even have service to text my loved ones to tell them I died in an airport mob. By this time, we had missed all other flights flying to Portugal that day. Fantastic. A nice guy in line, looks up with his wifi that there is a flight leaving from Casablanca to Portugal tomorrow morning at 9am and that it is $115.

Once we finally make it out of immigration we get to search for the Royal Air Maroc office, how fun! An hour later, we stumble upon it even though everyone has directed us 800 other places. We step in line, we hear everyone saying they've missed flights etc etc. A girl comes up to us from Zambia and tells us she's been stuck in the airport for TWO DAYS and they won't let her book a new flight home. I felt like we were in a Zombie Apocalypse movie. Once we get to talk to someone they say that our new flight will cost $300 completely trying to rip us off. Confused since we had just looked up the price, we argue with the person "helping" us but we don't have service and can't pull up any proof. He basically says to us "this will be the only way you leave Casablanca". So yes, we bought the flights.

He tells us, we can't check in until 3 hours before our flight but if we wanted we could leave and stay at a hotel and come back but we'd be paying for a room for only a couple hours. That's right folks, we slept outside the check in area on the floor of the Casablanca airport. He mentioned we should go look for my checked in luggage at the lost baggage office. We asked why and where and he refused to answer either question.

We finally get to lost luggage area and there is a group of people collectively FUMING. They tell us to wait and that they'll try and locate my luggage. After a couple of hours of going back and forth saying that it made it to Lisbon or that it is still here in the airport they finally pull my bag out of who the f knows and give it back to me. Shouldn't they have known where my bag was the whole time? Isn't that the point of having the bar code and tracking number? Im sure some of those poor folks never got their luggage and I was one of the lucky ones.

My friend and I make camp outside of check in and begin to wait. As we are laying there, many others start to join us. Have we all been stranded here in Casablanca? I felt like we were beginning a community of squatters.

Fast forward, we make it to Lisbon. On our last day we decide to go to the airport with 4 extra hours to spare. Good thing we did because when we got there the line for checking in baggage was 40 people deep and there was NO ONE WORKING ANY OF THE CHECK IN DESKS FOR ROYAL AIR MAROC. An hour later, we are still in line. My friend and I have checked in using one of those stands for our first leg but there is an error checking in to the second leg from Casablanca home. Terrified and traumatized from our first experience we decide to book a completely new, direct flight with a direct airline even if it's going to cost us so much extra $$. Good thing we did because our flight from Casablanca to Dulles got delayed by a FULL DAY for "operational constraints".

I feel bad even complaining this much, after reading other people's reviews I now see we could have had it even worse.

Moral of the story, unless you are masochistic do yourself a favor and take the better flight.
crvsd: Sidney H wrote a review Jul 2018
qwuub: If you have any self-respect or self-preservation instincts DO NOT take Royal Air Maroc

Title:
So many terrible experiences with Royal Air Maroc. We had issues with both our flight from Dulles (Washington DC) to Lisbon and back. We were stranded in the Casablanca airport for over 24 hours with very limited/expired WiFi service and no international data capabilities. Royal Air Maroc staff was nonexistent, with empty service desks all over the airport, and when you do find a staff member you receive inconsistent responses on how to do simple actions like find luggage or reschedule a missed flight. I feel as though I was robbed by Royal Air Maroc, forced to pay $310 after missing my connection flight, missed the first few days of a non refundable trip, and felt unsafe being locked out of airport security over night. DO NOT FLY THEM.

Because of the issues we had arriving to Lisbon, for our return flight a week later we got to the airport 4.5 hours early just to be safe and ensure everything would go smoothly. When we went to check into our flights (LIS - CMN) and (CMN - IAD) we had a very bad feeling when we were unable to check in and print our boarding pass for the 2nd leg of our trip, CMN - IAD. This worried us because we only had a 2 hour layover and knew that the check in area to print boarding passes would be impossible to get through plus security and make the layover flight.

We had such a bad feeling that while in the Royal Air Maroc luggage check line, we decided to buy a $1200 TAP Portugal direct flight into JFK. Thank god we did because it doesn’t seem like the second leg of the flight had ever planned on departing on July 1st and was moved to July 2nd due to “operational constraints.” As I’m writing this review my original plane has still not landed in the states.

I fly frequently for business and leisure and have never had strong feelings against any airline (everyone can understand an occasional lost bag or cancellation.) I am actually shocked that Royal Air Maroc is still in business and will make sure I do not let anyone I have ever met fly with them. They consistently are unresponsive in person, over the phone, and online with issues and are unprofessional, rude, and disrespectful. In CMN, they do not use a speaker system to announce flight changes or updates, do not have working clocks with local time around the airport, and do a day light savings time that is not consistent with the timezone that causes many people to show up for their flights an hour late.

All in all due to complications from traveling through RAM my original $1,100 round trip flight With Royal Air Maroc from IAD to LIS cost me about $2,700 when all said and done.
qwuub: Avoid at all costs- will likely get stranded in Casablanca Airport
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have flown Royal Air Maroc for a couple years and I fly them every 2 to 3 months. I joined their frequent flier program and after about 7 or 8 flights, I was up to Silver and zoomed up to Gold within a month. The IAD-CAS Dreamliner is a good flight - good plane, usually not full so you might be able to lie down, and the food is fine. The only problem is the in-flight entertainment - they seem to only rotate the selection every 6 months, so for me I need to bring other forms of entertainment. Also note, you can get wine even though it is not shown on the cart - just ask for it and they can get it. The shorter CAS-TUN flight is OK, but for 2.5 hours it doesn't really matter. I've never had a problem. The only hiccup I've ever experienced was my suitcase was left in CAS and when I arrived in IAD it was not there - I panicked but it did come to me after 5 days and the IAD baggage fellow was very nice.

I also fly business by upgrading each time, which I do recommend for the IAD-CAS Dreamliner flight. This is their highest tier and you get a flat bed with a full meal service (cocktails, hors d'oeuvres, cheese, etc.). They aren't the world's highest trained flight attendants, so it's a bit hit or miss, but generally good.

Once in CAS, try to get in their lounge...the airport needs work, so the lounge is the best bet, though can be crowded. Their food is good, too.

I would recommend this airline - they have improved quite a bit in the past 5 years and seem to keep trying to improve. The IAD-CAS flight is great.
qwuub: For me, this is a good airline
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: At first glance the airline seems to be like any other budget airline. However, upon entering the plane and settling in the faults begin to show. First of all, some of the staff seemed unaware of regular airline procedures, which being a nervous flyer did not put me at ease. Furthermore, what was very evident was the state of the planes they were either rather old or just rarely cleaned (thoroughly at least). To really top it off was the loss of our luggage, which we are still waiting to be found. This has put us in a difficult position, having to buy new clothes etc with no offer of compensation or help from the airline. In fact, they were rather nonchalant about bordering on dismissive. However, it must be said there are some features that set it apart from the regular budget airlines. We received an inflight meal, albeit it being rather tasteless and leg room was more than the likes of easyJet, Ryanair, Jet2 etc. Overall, I would However, not recommend using this airline if possible.

Title:
-The girl at the check-in counter for Royal Air Maroc airline at Casablanca airport (June 13 between 2:30-3pm) was absolutely rude!! (After keeping me in line for a while and then finally realizing I was anxious to check in my flight, she told me I was too late, and then simply gave me a big rolling-eye and basically asked me to go away from the counter). Then the woman at the airport agency (on the first desk next to the entrance, June 13 around 3pm) to change ticket was even more terrible and had a very bad attitude. She kept repeating "it's your problem that you missed the flight" when what I needed was only just some kind, comforting words because I just missed the flight!-- I told her I was delayed by my taxi driver who intentionally delayed my trip to the airport simply because I had not enough tips for him (my hotel agreed with him on 360 but he kept asking for 400 on our way, and then he stopped at a gas station to bargain with someone for 15 mins and then left without gas and drove at 30-40 mph toward the airport). Maroc or the airport should fire these staff. The airline crew was ok. But I can't believe they hire such rude, unqualified and impolite staff to work in the airport counter and ticket agency. These people successfully made my impression of Morocco one of the worst after traveling so many countries. Not a single chance I will come back ever, or let my family or friends ever travel to this country.
-Finally, I spent almost 3 hours in line to check in at the customs at the Casablanca airport, terrible experience! It's not a long line and I had no idea what they were doing. I saw there was no respect of the value of time, care, and kindness.

Title:
This is by far the worst airline I could have picked. The airline wasn’t even able to combine my two reservations for the same day connecting via Casablanca. The excuse they gave me was “ Our system does not allow that”. You’ve got to be kidding me! My flight from Porto to Casablanca was booked separately and the one from Casablanca to Washington had a separate confirmation #. Three days prior to my departure they sent an email stating that due to a time zone change, the flight from Washington would be departing 1 hour early at 3:30 PM instead of 4:30 PM. Time zone change in June? Seriously? So that reduced the time between my connections from 2.25 hours to 1.25 hours!
They did not check in my bag all the way to Portugal. I was told to go thru baggage claim at Casablanca and recheck my bag there.
Since I only had 1 hour between the flights, there was no way I could have made it happen and so I had no time to reclaim my luggage.
I have complained to the airline the same day about my lost luggage when I landed and have yet to hear back from them.
Moreover, the food sucked on the airline, some of the toilets didn’t even have toilet paper, some didn’t even work!
Please look for an alternate airline. That’s my recommendation.

Title:
We circled for over an hour and a half on our approach to JFK. Finally the FA (flight attendant) announced there was a lot of incoming traffic and "please be patient". After more circling, the FA got on to tell us the weather in NYC was "very bad" and we would be landing in Philadelphia. Way passed the time it would have taken to land in Philly I asked the FA where we were going, and he said "Philadelphia". It did no good to tell him we were way beyond that destination. Finally someone got on the PA and said we were landing at Washington's Dulles airport. I don't know how old any of the readers of TA are, but this was beginning to sound like the movie "Airport" where the gate keeps changing.
We land in DC. The FA announces that we have to stay on the plane because JFK is now open and we'll be taking off in an emphatic "one hour". One hour comes and goes. No information. They keep us , like hostages, on the plane in an airless cabin for four hours. Four hours. There is no information despite many of us asking. The FA were brusque and downright rude. It was very uncomfortable on the plane with no air. The woman in back of me threw up. I had to go to first class where the FA was sitting with another FA, just schmoozing, to inform them they had to attend to the sick passenger.
The bathrooms were not usable.
After four hours they told us a bus would come and take us to the terminal (as we were located at a re-fueling station). The bus came and we were let out at the main terminal where Air Maroc disappeared. No staff, nobody. An entire plane was left to their own devices after midnight to figure out how they would get to their destinations. There was a very pregnant woman, women in wheel chairs, children.
Ultimately we made a reservation on Amtrak for 5:30 am, leaving the airport at 3am and taking a cab for $100 to Union Station.
Apparently Air Maroc bears no responsibility for getting folks to their destinations since this flight was diverted due to weather, as opposed to a mechanical problem with the plane.
I get that this airline flies direct to Casablanca from JFK and it's only a 6 hour flight, but if I ever went back to Morocco again, I'd rather fly to Europe and take another carrier. There was no excuse for the surliness of the flight attendants, the complete lack of information, the disinformation, and total lack of concern for the passengers.
The following small detail recedes in light of all this but it is ironic that when we got to the airport in Casablanca in plenty of time for this flight, we were told that the plane was boarding "now". Due to Ramadan, which had not even begun yet, the time had changed to an hour earlier. We were aware of this, but our flight was for 3;30. We got no notification from RAM that the flight would be leaving at 2:30 - so that was two hours earlier than expected.It is ironic because we were seated in a row 3 seats across. The third person must not have known about the time change and missed the flight. We would have been better off if we did also.
crvsd: lynn l wrote a review Jun 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
