Title: Good start to flight with ground staff giving  me an exit row seat for a bit of extra comfort for which I was truly grateful until sat next to a 'gentleman' whose aim it seems was to use all the available space not just for his seat but for mine as well. Boarding was efficient and cannot fault the Heathrow based ground staff in any way.  Boarding once on the plane was chaotic and unstructured with flight crew standing round watching and occasionally pointing, to little effect. Seats were generally comfortable for economy and well padded. They do not include any kind of in seat entertainment except for in my case the incessant elbowing of the adjacent passenger. No TV screens, but moreover no USB chargers for individual electronic devices. The seat arm on my particular chair had fallen apart. There were no extendable headrests and the feel of the plane overall was one of a slightly down at heel coach that you might have experienced in the early 80's whilst stuck on a motorway on a bank holiday. So onto Dinner. The main course was bog standard boiled beef and rice, but with the addition of 3 small prunes, to give a vague tagine-ness to the proceedings. The famous chef and writer Robert Carrier once described Moroccan cuisine as one of the world's greats. This meal was not what Mr Carrier could have been opining on. The most interesting part of the meal was a small postage stamp sized piece of Cold Smoked Atlas trout fillet. This had a hint of dill and was as tasty as it was chewy. A vaguely pleasant plain set yogurt served as a dessert along with a plastic encased blob of cream cheese.  Fortunately RAM is not a dry airline so a small 25cl can of Flag Speciale was provided, albeit somewhat grudgingly. Unfortunately the beer was lightweight, Luke warm and with a distinctly unpleasant chemical aftertaste. The coffee when obtained from the steward who walked past without offering any was robust enough to take away any trace of the beer along with the top of my mouth.
crvsd: Jim H wrote a review Jun 2018
qwuub: Coach trip but on a plane
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
To copy from Jane Austen, "it is a truth, universally acknowledged, that a passenger flying coach will have mostly a ah-so-so flight" .
Truth be told, in the era of mass transportation and commodity - fication, most passengers are just thankful to get to their destination on time, with their luggage intact, and safely. most of the international carriers fit this bill admirably, thank to rigorous training of crew, high safety expectations and accountability, and infusion of technology at all levels of the airline operations.
In the commercial arena each player wants to sell a "brand". My experience with RAM in the air and ground made me think about branding.
RAM delivered my wife and I with no real hiccups from IAD to CMN and then onwards to FCO and then back with a layover in CMN on the return leg as the CMN-IAD flight is only 3x weekly.
Having flown across the globe many times, and recently on one of the ME3 carriers, the flights on RAM were an anomaly. I did not feel the cabin crew connecting with me on a person to person basis, they did not seem to reach out to the individual, unlike the other carriers i am used to. Upon landing at IAD we took the mobile lounge to Immigration and the crew cabin and cockpit were seated/standing just round us. I chatted briefly with the lady flight attendant next to me and also thanked the captain who piloted the Dreamliner across the pond handling the aircraft through several moderate turbulence. All of the staff had a very low key body language, and even today my image of them is that their heads are partly bowed. A dreamliner captain has a very significant responsibility and it comes with authority, however the RAM captain body language and demeanor conveyed very little of it, and if so was very muted. In the end RAM is ROYAL (air maroc) and maybe that explains it all? Living in the western world we are used to a different system that is palbable across many aspects of our lives.
crvsd: Adesh S wrote a review Jun 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We flew from Marrakech to Barcelona through Casablanca. I had heard horror stories about Royal Air Maroc and that luggage is often lost when you transfer through Casablanca but happily we had no problems. The flights left on time and our luggage arrived with us in Barcelona thankfully.

The airport in Marrakech is beautiful and although there were several lines we had to pass through for security, passports, etc, it all went well. The airport in Casablanca however is terrible - it is not very attractive and the area where we had to wait for the connecting flight to Barcelona was terrible - uncomfortable, small and a blaring overhead announcement every 2 minutes. We had to be taken by bus out to the plane and did have to sit in the hot bus for 10+ minutes which was annoying - some passengers were very upset about this. The Casablance airport really should be upgraded.

The 2 flights were problem free and comfortable. I would consider flying with Royal Air Maroc again and chose them b/c they appear to be more reliable than Ryan Air who often cancel flights.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: This was my very first trip to Morocco.  After a near perfect, wonderful flight from Amsterdam to Casablanca, my return trip would not go as well.  My departure time was CHANGED days in advance without informing me from 12:25 PM to 11:25 AM.  I was staying in Tangier (four hours away), and had already arranged a private taxi which had to be adjusted after I doublechecked my departure time and called their 1-800 number to verify (the operator spoke English and was very helpful).   Then after leaving at the crack of dawn to make my new flight departure, our flight was suddenly delayed and delayed due to "technical issues".  The gate agents nor anyone else knew nothing about why or when we would board.  We were scared to leave our grate for fear it would board any time after standing there for TWO HOURS past our boarding time.  Nothing was said in English to us which left us completely scared and frustrated.  Finally, a little over two hours from our scheduled boarding time, we boarded and were bussed to get onto a new plane.The service on board and the members of the staff were all excellent.  No complaints with leg room, food, and the cleanliness of the plane.  I did enjoy the Moroccan touches on board (food, music, smell).  Most importantly they got us their safely albeit over two hours late in Amsterdam.

Title: This was an interesting experience.  For vacation, my wife and I booked round-trip through Expedia for Doha-Madrid with a connection in Casablanca on Royal Air Maroc.  A week after booking, Expedia emailed me that RAM changed the return flight and to contact them.  Unable to sort it out via email or online, a 30 minute international long distance call later - RAM changed their flight schedule to being an hour later (it still showed as being unchanged online for new bookings btw) and wanted to reschedule us later or another day.  Expedia talked to them, booked us the next day same time and a two hour layover for the connecting RAM flight back to Doha.  Then the connecting flight time changed and had a five hour layover.  Well, on checkin in Madrid, the customer service gave us a new way back - Madrid to Casablanca to Marrakech to Doha!  Surprise!  New layover times too.  Changed again, without any warning at all.  Customer service agent only spoke Spanish or Arabic and was completely unable to, or more likely unwilling to get anyone who spoke: English, Turkish, German, Russian, Scots-Gaelic or Japanese for us.  Sorry, but my Spanish es muy malo... tres anos en escuela, pero hace anos trenty quatro..In addition, the -printed Expedia tickets- listing a check bag weight of 25kg was refused by the agent who had ya remove 2kg each for our carryons because he wanted a 23kg limit.Exit rows not available.  Upgrade not available.  (Now using Google translate for one way talking to the guy.). No lounges available (a good rewards tier on one of their partners.)We board - the flight is almost empty.  No one in business, and 80% of economy is empty.  The snack onboard the flight was very good and delivered hot.  The side wasn’t my taste but nice.  The coffee was hot, the beer, soda and water however were normal room temperature. I am currently sitting in the Qatar Airways lounge in Casablanca waiting for the QA flight to Marrakech connecting to Doha... the QA counter MUCH more helpful and far more fluent.

Title: The ground transit staff in Morocco are very unfriendly and 80% don't speak English! The lay-over in Morocco is almost a whole day and they are supposed to offer complimentary hotel accommodation; but they abandon you with the excuse that hotel rooms are no more available. Then you end up either roaming the airport or sleeping on one of the uncomfortable airport seats until your flight is ready for boarding. However, I usually fly this airline because it is cost-effective and they are generous with the Frequent Flyer program.. In addition, I am not a lover of direct flights lasting more than 6-7 hours in the air, so I consider this airline as the most appropriate for my travels to the UK and the USA. Casablanca to London is about 3 hours while to New York is about 6 hours 35 mins. This is perfect for someone who does not like staying in the air for very long hours.

Title:
I bought a JFK-MAD with connection in CMN, booking reference OCSIW2.
The first flight AT 203 was supposed to leave from JFK at 16:50 on April 15. The connecting flight, AT 972 was supposed to land in MAD on April, 16 at 10:50. Flight AT 203 was delayed.

The passengers were not informed and we had to wait for almost 4 hours before boarding, and about an hour inside the plane. We landed in CMN around 8 am. I had my boarding pass for the connecting flight. NO ONE in the plane or in the control informed me about the status of my boarding pass. I arrived at the gate. Boarding was starting and there was a line. I was on the line and on time for the flight and I was denied boarding without any explanation.
That was probably an overbooked flight I was not allowed to get into the plane. I went to the management office and the only solution they could offer was to reschedule my flight. ROYAL AIR MAROC put me in their next flight, leaving from CMN at 15.45, almost 8 hours after my scheduled flight. They gave me a ticket for lunch -only to be redeemed in the unhealthiest restaurant -food stored without lids, and no appropriate health measures- and refused to answer my questions or to give me a justification of the delay. I even ask them to put me in an earlier Iberia flight, leaving at 11 am, but they literally laughed at me.

I put a claim on April 17 and I have called ROYAL AIR MAROC several times and sent about 10 emails but no one has replied. I have contacted the company regarding this claim and regarding a confirmation of the flight delay.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Absolutely DIABOLICAL service! I've never met such a rude group of people ever. From the check in staff, to the air staff, to the staff at the boarding gate. There's no relief from the extremely disrespectful, embarrassing and down right cruel treatment you receive from the staff.
The company staff unpacked a box of biscuits I had bought from Morocco. The package had been vert well wrapped to prevent the box spilling out.
I had absolutely no issue with this as I am totally aware of the threat to security we face.
When the package was opened I asked if it was possible to get some tape to re wrap it, the staff refused. I asked if I could ask the manager if it was possible who also refused very abruptly.
At this point I was quite confused as I couldn't understand what the big issue was. I then asked the lady who had unpacked my biscuits and I realised that the man had told all 5 of the staff members to ignore me. They stood up against the window with heir hands behind their back and TOTALLY IGNORED my pleas for tape.
I was soooooooo embarrassed and literally burst into tears! The manager still had no compassion at this point and everyone continued to ignore me.
AND there is no real complains procedure which is even more disappointing because the staff totally get away with their behaviour.

Title:
Generally, the flights were what you would expect on any national airline.
-- Online check-in has the usual glitches.
-- Aircraft that have sometimes seen better days.
-- Reasonable food.
-- Customer service at Moroccan airports - taken with a pinch of salt.

So, the detail -
Online check-in went smoothly. We were allowed to select our seats, which was a bonus. One less thing to worry about.
Arriving at Manchester airport and dropping off our luggage. This was normal. Luggage tags were placed on our bags to collect at Agadir.
Plane change at Casablanca - The chaos now begins. No real direction as to where to go. Hint look up at the ceiling. The signs are small but marked -- local transfers. Unfortunately no real queuing system. Everyone seems to be in a rush and tries to fit through a very small narrow corridor. Passports and tickets checked. Any hand luggage goes through a scanner. Transfer is via a bus to the plane. Good news a small but newish plane.

Arrival at Agadir. We were the only flight at approx. 10:00pm so the airport was have asleep. Reminder -- Collect a landing card and complete per person before proceeding to the immigration. Only 3 desks were open, then 4, then 5 and about 10 mins later up to 14 desks had opened. A slow process but the good news we had arrived in Agadir.

NIGHTMARE TIME!!!!!!!
Our luggage had not arrived and no one spoke enough good English to assist. Eventually we were told that it had not been transferred to our plane in Casablanca. All the missing luggage approx. 80 people had been located and would be on the next flight into Agadir. Thankfully, this was in about 50 mins time. We asked if the luggage could be transferred to our hotel. Unfortunately, the airport did not have any such facility so this was not possible. The only option was to wait. Not long to go, but a 50 min wait felt like years with tired children. Eventually the luggage arrived. Now we just had to face the flight back in a few weeks.

The return flight thankfully all went well.

Service and food on all four flights was ok. Kids enjoyed that fact that the drinks were the standard 330ml size and not the tiny cans that they serve on some flights.
qwuub: outbound - luggage did not arrive. Inbound all went well
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Do not fly with Royal Air Maroc. Arrived at Marrakech airport for a 10am flight arriving the recommended 3 hours prior to flight to Malaga, Spain, allowing over 3 hours at Casablanca before connecting flight to Malaga, Spain. Told at 10 o'clock that there was a technical problem that would be 10 minutes, over 3 hours later flight departed. No other information was given. Missed connecting flight, very difficult to obtain any information/help at Casablanca, put up in a sub standard hotel for the night with no luggage, promised shuttle to airport at 11am for 2pm flight. Shuttle finally arrived and got to airport half hour before departure. Flight finally departed 2.5 hours late, absolutely no information as to why or when flight was to go, so another day lost. Two days of my life totally lost plus cost of shuttle and accommodation in Malaga, Spain.
Apparently this is a very common occurrence. Also information at the airports is totally non existent.

Do not fly with Royal Air Maroc

Title:
I was flying back to Sao Paulo from Casablanca airport and initially the flight was delayed a couple of hours for no apparent reason. Then people from Royal Air Moroc said that the flight was cancelled and we would be flying the next day. Updates came completely unorganized and spread like gossips. Staff could barely speak English, or pretended so.
While a crowd was being guided to leave the airport, someone else started to shout stating that the flight would not be cancelled anymore, and would leave in some more hours.
And we were back to the gate. For some extra hours of waiting. At least it departed.

The plane was a brand new 787, but R.A.M. opted for a cheap entertainment package, which offered limited options of movies, series, etc.

Service was not very good either. I have no particular complaint, but I could notice that the crew was not exactly willing to help other travellers.

Title: I have to admit, I gulped when I saw that the plane was a vintage 747, but needs must. The skill of the pilot mattered, and he took his old bird over the Pyrenees and landed it safely in a wicked crosswind at Mohammed V Airport. Title:
Royal Air Maroc is a stunning example of how not to run an airline.

Buckle up—you're not going to believe the experience my husband and I had using this airline. Now we know why all the locals in Morocco never fly with Royal air Marco. As the owner of our riad said, you only have to fly with them once to know why you will never fly with them again.

My husband and I traveled from JFK in New York to Casablanca with a connection to Marrakech in Morocco. Royal Air Maroc is the only airline that goes directly from JFK to Casablanca. We thought this would be best to avoid a layover in Europe. Wanting a morning flight, we originally booked for Friday, April 13 at 7:30 am from JFK to Casablanca. About a month before the trip, we get an email saying that flight was cancelled and we had been rebooked for a flight that same night. They neglected to also reschedule our connection to Marrakech. Okay, no big deal at this point. I called to get a Sunday morning 7:30 am flight instead with a connection.

Less than 24 hours before we were set to fly out, I get another email stating that our flight to Casablanca had been delayed. Take off was now at 4:50 pm. Great, there goes our morning flights.

We get to JFK at noon that Sunday, and check in is not open yet. Royal Air Maroc must rent out space from Korean Air for check in as they do not have their own counters. The Royal Air Marco staff took their time to slowly set up their borrowed counters, while chit-chatting, talking on their cell phones, etc. Meanwhile, the line to checkin gets longer and longer as they go 45 minutes past the scheduled time checkin was supposed to open before they actually start seeing people.

We get our tickets, go through security, and head to the gate. Long story short, we do not end up taking off until 8:30 pm. The whole time people were wondering what was causing the delay and the Royal Air Maroc staff were not forthcoming with any information whatsoever. Getting frustrated at this point but at least we were on our way to the destination. And luckily we would still make our 10 am connection to Marrakech.

Wait a minute—not so fast. That connection flight to Marrakech? Royal Air Maroc is again late with scanning boarding passes and getting everyone onto the bus on the tarmac that takes passengers to the plane. We wait on the bus 10 minutes when all of the sudden one of the staff comes out and tells everyone to come back inside the airport. The plane was not even there yet. Getting really frustrated at this point because we are tired and just want to get to Marrakech. My husband checked his phone for the flight status and saw that the connection had been cancelled. He showed this to the staff, who had absolutely no idea this was the case. Yes, the Royal Air Maroc staff learned their own flight was cancelled from the flight status on the phone of a would-be passenger.

Panic among the staff and passengers ensues as everyone tries to figure out a solution other than waiting for the next flight to Marrakech 12 hours later. Passengers start yelling and venting their frustration. The staff says they will put everyone on a bus and that one is waiting outside the airport. Guess what? No bus. After three hours of waiting and trying to pry information about what is going on and no bus anywhere in sight, my husband and I decide to split a taxi ride to Marrakech with two other people who were also going there. 150 Euros total for the ride. Good thing we thought to bring lots of Euros with us as well. At this point I would have been quite angry were I not slightly delirious with sleep deprivation.

On the way back home we decided to hire a cab to drive us back to Casablanca as we do not trust Royal Air Maroc to actually get us there on time to catch the transatlantic flight. We go to check in only to find we had been completely bumped from our flight to JFK because we did not show up at the airport in Marrakech for the first flight. They had given our seats away now we had no place on the plane. Okay, so we should have called in advance to explain that we were not taking that flight.

However, the way the staff handled the situation was not exactly professional. We were bounced back and forth between the ticketing office and the checkin counters several times. The woman in the ticketing office actually said to us in a nasty tone, "I don't understand how this is my problem," before saying that if they could not get us on this flight it would not be until Tuesday before they could get us back out. We asked if they would pay for a hotel if this would be the case—nope.

After an hour of this we finally found a kind and helpful (by Royal Air Maroc standards...) staff member who went back to speak with the woman at the ticketing office to get us on the waitlist. Thanks to her efforts and my husband's persistence, we made it on the flight after all. By the grace of God we took off on time, too.

The only thing that impressed me about this airline was that the planes were brand new, and the pilots were extremely competent. I guess if I want anyone to be competent, it's the pilot. They were all clean-cut guys who looked like they knew what they were doing. Landings were flawless and you could barely tell when the wheels of the plane actually hit the ground.

Customer service, timeliness, accuracy, and reputation mean nothing to this airline. I have no idea how they have survived and stayed in business since 1957. Next time we fly to Morocco, we'll take a layover in Europe with a different airline to avoid the headache that is Royal Air Maroc.
crvsd: Elyse S wrote a review Apr 2018

Title:
This has to be one of the worst airline experiences of my life. We were suppose to fly out of Rio on Friday 20th 2018. Once we were all checked in we went to the gate only to be told that there would be a 30 minute delay. This 30 minute delay turned into 90 minutes, with the airline finally cancelling the flight. The transportation from the airport to the hotel was a shamble. No coordination what so ever. So people like us opted just to take a cab to the suggested hotel. Once there we discover after waiting for an hour that they did not have enough rooms for everyone. So we took a second cab to the next suggested hotel. We got a room there. The following day evening was picked up by coach and we were told that our flight would be at 6pm. Again, all checked in, went to the gate and they repeated the same rubbish as the night before, cancelled our flight. Why bring everyone to the airport only to cancel their flight again. Everyone was clearly and justifiably annoyed. They had hardly any staff and no sense of direction. When asked if we would be refunded our money if we book with another airline we could not get a clear answer from them.
The second nights hotel was aweful, some nasty place in town. We still have no idea if we will be flying today or not.
This has to be the worst airline I have ever flown with, and I fly a lot. Please pay extra and get a more reputable airline and avoid this nightmare that all of us have had to endure.
Also, RAM does not have a office, a desk or even any representatives in Rio. So if you get stuck then you are pretty much on your own. Also, there website for handling claims is an absolute joke. If we pay for our own tickets back to London it will cost £1200 each with no guarantee of us ever seeing a penny of that again.
AVOID AVOID AVOID

Title: We've travelled in Morocco for 9 days in late Dec 2017 and had booked a flight with Royal Air Moroc ("RAM") on 31st Dec to Casablanca, and then fly back to Hong Kong via another airline.  We had a tremendous disappointing experience with RAM!!!  First of all, we were only informed of the flight cancellation when we got to the airport at around 9:45am on 31st Dec.  (we had done online checkin within 48 hours of the flight's departure, and the flight was supposed to take off at 11:55am and arrive at Casablanca at 12:45pm)!  There were passengers arguing and complaining against the RAM staff as they didn't give prior notification to us, and most of them needed to take a connecting flight back to their respective home countries.  However, the RAM staff was rude and unfriendly.  They even asked us to call the police!After much hassle, the RAM staff managed to arrange coaches for the passengers to get to the Casablanca Airport.  They also assured us that we could definitely catch our connecting flight which departed at 2:00 pm at Casablanca (as this was not their first time to have flight cancellation, and passengers needed to take connecting flights).  Even so, we needed to spend a lot of waiting time at the coach for other passengers to come on board, and the RAM staff just put on a "couldn't care less" attitude!When we reached the Casablanca Airport, it's already passed 1:30 pm, the check-in counter for our connecting flight had already closed!  The four of us just ran around the airport to seek help like crazy people, and we needed to pay an extra huge amount of money to buy 4 single tickets back to Hong Kong.We've only managed to claim 1/4 of our money spent from our insurance company recently.  We strongly strongly advise you not to take this airline anymore.  It's not trustworthy and the staff there was rude, and at one point they even accused us for not speaking proper English!May and family

Title:

Title: I was trying to think of what the equivalent of our experience would be in the US. Say you booked a flight to Chicago from Houston which had a layover in Dallas. Royal Air Maroc cancels your flight to Dallas and instead of booking you on a different flight they try to get you on a bus to Dallas.  You say no I don't want to go to Dallas I'm trying to get to Chicago. There are direct flights from this airport to your destination.  They also have the same flight tomorrow So they yes we are taking you to a flight to Chicago. You go through security and before you exit the airport the group as a whole refuses to leave because we do not want to be on a bus. The guy at the door says yes you are going to a flight. Once you are out they say yep it really is a bus ride we're putting you on but it's only an hour and a half ride.  The next person says it's 2-3 hours.  You know from Google maps that it is actually a 4-5   hour ride.   Unhappy you say again I do not want to go on this bus ride.  Why can't we book a flight from this airport.  Earlier on we tried to go to the ticket counter and they pulled us away. Back to the buses. I speak to one guy who says he is not responsible and runs away.  I speak to a second guy who points to the guy walking away and says he is responsible. I say I just talked to that guy and he said he is not. Second guy assures me he is.  I tell second guy I don't need to go to Casablanca and want to go to Lisbon.  He says don't worry there are 2 flights to Lisbon one in the morning and one in the afternoon and we will get there today.  I show him my ticket and say I was booked on the afternoon flight at 2:50 and since it is 1:30 We will not make it in time.  He says oh there are actually 3 flights and I will make it in time.  He even tells me that someone from the airport will be traveling with us to make sure things go smoothly and points to the person he says will be traveling with us. Satisfied I get on the bus. Once we are all settled in on the bus another person from airport gets on and says people going to France will have a flight today and everyone else will fly tomorrow.  Grrr we leave for Casablanca.  No one has been given an opportunity to use the bathroom, there is no bathroom or A.C. on the bus. We stop for water and a bathroom break after 20 min.  After an hour the bus breaks down and we sit on the side of the road for an hour and a half.  Some passengers choose to hitch hike.   Another bus picks us up and after 20 min we stop because the bus driver is worries about the same problem we had with the first bus.  It turns out it's okay and we reach Casablanca finally after 6 1/2 hours of travel.  No one traveled with us, there is no one to greet us. Confused we go  to the terminal we are dropped at. It's not the correct terminal.  I ask Air Maroc to please take us to the correct place. They ask us to leave and say it's not their problem we should go to the  international terminal. They refuse to walk us to the correct place.  We ask for a manager so we can see about a refund for the flight we didn't get and are told there isn't one.   We go to the  office we are told to go to.  The office says we need to go to the ticket booth. We got to the ticket booth and are told there is only one flight and it is in the afternoon the next day. We go back and forth, at this point I don't  believe anything I'm told and they show me on their screen that there is only one flight. We take the flight. I ask about a refund for the Marrakech to Casablanca flight.  I am told that the problem with our flight was solved, they got us a solution and there is no problem.  I ask to speak to a manager. He points to another guy. I speak to that guy and he says he is not responsible he just does our accommodations.  He points me back to the first guy and says he can call a manager.  I go back to the first guy and he says he refuses to call a manager, not his responsibility he just books flights,  and I should talk to the office.  I find out he has told someone that he will give them a refund form.  I ask for the same form.  He says he will get it for me and several other passengers.  Time passes he tells us we need to go to the office to get the form.  We mention how we have been lied to and do not believe him.  He is offended when I tell him I think he is lying to me.   We go to the office.  There is no form, he was lying. We are told we must go online to fill out a form to complain. We say we do not want to complain we want our money back.  He tells us to do the form online.  I tell him his colleague said there was a paper form and ask if if his colleague lied.  He says yes he lied. They put us up in a hotel. ask for 2 rooms since we had 2 tickets. He changes it to 2 rooms.  He misspelled one of our names.  I ask him to reprint it with the correct name in case this causes problems.  He refuses. Much arguing happens and after Andrew asks more nicely he finally prints it. I feel like this is subpar service.  Though we were assured everything was great and we were taken care of. :(

Title: If you’re like me - you take online reviews with a grain of salt. Also, air travel is often unpleasant, so how bad can one airline be? Well the answer is bad, extremely bad. So TERRIBLY bad that it makes you write your first online review. If you enjoy multiple cancellations, no information, refusal to assist and ticket agents purposefully providing incorrect information - then this airline is for you! And for a fun bonus, if you ask enough questions about ridiculous things such as “flight information” and “boarding times” etc, the check-in agent will tell you your first flight leg is cancelled - when in fact - you’ve been on the flight all along and there’s no cancellation. This airline also provides the opportunity to wait on a bus for an indefinite amount of time to travel to a local airport hotel, thus forcing you to seek your own accommodations. I would pay good money to avoid this airline and never have to utter its name again. Stay tuned to see if we ever leave - entering hour 20. Food on first flight kind of good though.
crvsd: Kelly M wrote a review Apr 2018
qwuub: Do NOT book, don’t even think about it.

Title: The outbound trip was almost text book except for a delay, in Manchester, due to French Air Traffic Control but luckily we were able to connect with our ongoing flight to Casablanca. The return was a different story. We were informed that we could collect our bags for the 14 hour layover in Casablanca. We were refused access to iur bags as they had been deemed 'in transit' and we would have to wait until Manchester. We then decided to go to the Private Lounge but when we spoke to the P.R.office we were informed that without boarding passes we were not allowed to the 'airside' and as were classed as 'domestic' passengers that would not be possible until 9 am the following morning. This airline is being badly let down by its ground staff. When I returned home I found my bag completely covered in 'clingfilm'. I now understand why I was not allowed access to my case. The bottom of my case had been dropped on the floor creating a hole I could get my fist in resulting in having only 1 usable wheel. I have taken the matter up with this airline but, no doubt, they will do ... all to rectify it.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We were skeptical about taking RAM based on so many negative reviews, but the opportunity to fly directly from Washington to Casablanca made us take the risk.  Overall, we were quite impressed.The plane was relatively new and comfortable.  The entertainment system was adequate - nothing special, but enough to keep us occupied.  The food was plentiful and quite good.  The staff wasn't terribly attentive, and we had to often hunt them down for water, but they didn't have any issue with us serving ourselves in the galley.  This is probably my biggest complaint because per Moroccan law, no liquids of any sort (even sealed bottles of water) are allowed on the plane besides what fit in a quart sized bag.  We were quite thirsty and it took a long time for the staff to bring drinks.We'd definitely fly RAM again.  I've experienced worse on domestic carriers.  I say take the chance and give RAM a shot.

Title:

Title: My husband and I just returned from two weeks in Morocco. Flying from Los Angeles we wanted as few plane changes as possible.  Every other route we looked at required us to stop in Europe and most required stops in New York and in Europe. Royal Air Moroc flies directly to Casa Blanca from JFK.  The flights were on time and the food was better than most airplane food.  The movie choices were fine. The Business Class is small and we flew economy which was slightly better than some American economy seats.  The flight attendants were helpful and friendly. There was a problem on the outgoing flight where the back exit door was not working and there fore, people sitting in the last rows had to be booked on other flights. However, we traveled with a group in Morocco and on the return, several of our fellow travelers had to switch to Royal Air Moroc when Air France went on strike. They all said that Air Moroc was extremely accomodating. It may not be the luxury airline that many European airlines are, but they got us there and back safely and on time. I would take them again without hesitation.

Title:
Royal Air Maroc nearly ruined my entire vacation. I have never experienced such a poorly run and staffed airline in my entire life. We booked a round-trip fight from NYC to Lisbon, with a 1.5 hour layover in Casablanca on the way there. Two days before my flight, I received an email from Royal Air Maroc stating that my second flight (Casablanca - Lisbon) had been moved UP an hour, and our layover would only be 30 minutes. I thought it would be ok as they did not advise anything about the connection and made no other contact. Then, the morning of my flight (around 8am) they called and told us that we would not be able to make our connection and they would therefore be bumping us from our second flight. They said they would not be able to get us on another flight from Casablanca to Lisbon for THREE DAYS - effectively leaving us stranded in Casablanca for three days of our planned week-long vacation. We said this was not acceptable, and they must get us to Lisbon on the same day we had planned. The customer service agent said he would need to speak with his manager and asked us to call back later. This was the beginning of an HOURS long fight with their customer service agents. We called back 20 minutes later, had to re-explain the entire situation to a new agent across language barriers, and again were told we would need to call back in "a few minutes". 20 minutes later we called back and were again offered the three day wait in Casablanca. We explained the situation and again were told to call back in a few minutes. (This calling and waiting 20 minutes happened several times I don't even know how many times we ended up calling them. Another 20 minutes later we called back again and this time the agent told us that they would reach out to TAP Portugal and try to get us on their non-stop to Lisbon also leaving that night. She said she would need to call back in a few minutes to see if that would work. I asked how long a few minutes would be, and got the answer "I don't know - a few minutes".

Several rounds of waiting 20 minutes and calling back later, we decided that we had had it. The agents were all rude, unhelpful, not-understanding of why we were upset, and one actually laughed on the phone at us when we tried to explain why we were not happy. We decided that we could not play phone tag any longer and decided to head to the airport several hours early to deal with Royal Air Maroc in person. During the 40-minute ride, we called a couple times and were told both times they were still waiting to hear from TAP Portugal and they did not yet know if they could get us on their flight. When we finally arrived at JFK, we found the 10-person Royal Air Maroc counter to be COMPLETELY EMPTY. Not one Royal Air Maroc employee was present. We panicked and asked a nearby JFK employee who advised us that they would be back in around an hour to two hours. In the meantime, we kept calling customer service. Finally, they said that they would be unable to get us on the TAP Portugal flight. Two hours later, when the airline employees finally arrived we asked to speak to a supervisor right away. We explained the whole situation. He took us to the ticketing counter and tried to help us figure out a solution. It was there that we were told that we actually WERE able to get ticketed for the TAP Portugal flight, and that customer service had just either completely lied or had the wrong information. The supervisor tried to get in touch with TAP Portugal, and finally found out that that flight was 22 people overbooked and would be hopeless.

We asked if we could simply be refunded for our flight and figured we could book our own flight for that day or the next on a different airline. They said our flights were non-refundable. We asked if we could be ticketed via their airline for any other flight leaving Casablanca that day for anywhere in Portugal or Spain. They told us that our flights were also non-exchangable and they could not change our second flight. We are two young women, who invested our savings in this trip, and would be totally unsafe being stranded in Morocco for three days!!!!!!! After a lot of back and forth we were basically told that our only option was to try our luck for making the 30 minute connection (really only 10 minutes because they close the gate 20 minutes early). Then if we missed that flight they would try to get us on another flight, but they could not do anything until we missed the flight. We decided we had no other option and decided to go for it. We begged for a seat as close to the front as possible so we could get off the plane ASAP. Thankfully the supervisor gave us at least that. The check-in agent was then completely rude after everything we had been through, and refused to print our second boarding pass - making us lose valuable time on the other side.

When we finally got on the plane, I found my seat to be COVERED IN BLOOD! As if everything else wasn't bad enough. They also had no working USB outlets on a 7 hour international flight, and the in-flight service was minimal and dissapointing at best. When we finally got to Morocco (thankfully we landed about 10 minutes early) we sprinted off the plane and had to go to the check in counter since our second boarding passes were not printed. The woman at the check in counter told us our flight had been closed. We showed her the time and knew we had about 10 minutes. She refused. She got a manager and they spent 5 minutes fiddling with the computer and basically were like oh its not closed but you'll have to hurry. WELL MAYBE YOU SHOULDNT HAVE SPENT THE LAST 10 MINUTES WASTING OUR TIME. We ran straight through to security, and across the airport. We made it just in time and were the last ones to board. We still couldnt believe we made it. The only thanks going to the Supervisor in NYC who gave us seats at the front - the only reason we made it.

In total, all 4 Royal Air Maroc flights we took were dirty, uncomfortable, and poorly serviced. I will never use this joke airline again.
qwuub: Worst flying experience of my life. Will never use this airline again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I took this horrible company from Rome to Rio De Janeiro with a stop over in Casablanca. We arrived in Casablanca on-time, however the plane kept on flying in the sky for unknown reasons. We landed 30 minutes late and once at the gate, although the plane was still on the ground, they told us that our tickets to Rio were CANCELLED!!! I asked to the staff on-board several times and they reassured us that the company would wait for us, but, obviously, they didn't! Fortunately, they put me on another plane the same evening and I arrived in Rio with ONLY 8 hours delay!!!! Other people had to wait in Casablanca for 2 days or fly to Sao Paolo the day after, arriving to Rio with 2 days delay! The staff on-board and on-ground was very unpleasant and unprofessional during the whole time. Planes are old and overused, so I would not recommend this company to anyone, not even my worse enemy!

Title:
Flying out to Washington was fine with the annoying exception that if you purchase RAM tickets in the US, you can't select seats online. We were told to go as early as possible to the airport. We did. Four hours before the flight was to depart we were told to go back to the counter at 5:00. At 4:45 we looked up to see swarms of people there getting served! We jumped in line and were told there were no seats left except for the horrific center aisle. The seats have zero legroom. Flight left on time and it was an uneventful flight.

HOWEVER. The return was another story. Flight scheduled to leave Casa. at 5:30 am. We arrived at airport 3:00 am. Went through three separate security stops which were fine. Then we sat in the restaurant area and waited and waited and waited. There were NO ANNOUNCEMENTS so we went to the gate. Here they SEPARATED our child to one line for more security and my husband and I into another line. When we expressed dismay, suddenly no one spoke English and they insisted we go to the line they indicated where they frisked us, went through EVERY ITEM in our bags before and made us throw away the drinks we had purchased after our first round of security. We then had to look for our daughter. Thankfully she had been able to see us the entire time. Once we found her, we found a seat on the floor (not room for half the passengers in seats) and waited and waited and waited. Not one announcement. Not sure that airport even has an intercom system. Suddenly at 6:15 a wave of people jumped up and ran for the line to board a bus for the tarmac. Apparently they made a verbal announcement just to those within hearing distance of the counter. We followed suit. Stood 15-20 minutes in disorganized lines, made it to the bus for a short ride, they then told us to get off the bus and line up outside the airplane. Only it was RAINING!! stood 5-10 minutes in pouring rain, shivered and was cold across the Atlantic. To top it off, they had only two meat dishes to eat. As vegetarians, we were starving upon landing.

Never again would I fly Royal Air Maroc. I would rather go thru a European stop on a legitimate airline.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Wonderful bookend experiences for a fabulous first time holiday to Morocco.

Title:
It's fair to say that customer service does not exist within the Royal Air Maroc. I recently took a round trip to Brazil with RAM with 2 other friends and on our way back I was denied boarding on my connecting flight from Casablanca to London. Three of us had the same tickets but my friends had to fly without me and I stayed additional day at one of the airport hotels because RAM overbooked the flight and sneakily changed my ticket without any information whatsoever and denied me boarding.
The ground crew at Casablanca Airport were not at all helpful, they quickly ignored me and did not provide any information and left me to my own devices. They put me in a poor hotel, where there was hardly anything to eat (yup no joke that unfortunately) and I had to take the flight following day.
If you can, just avoid them because if you have any problem, i.e. denied boarding, grounded, whatever, the staff are very unhelpful and literally treat you like air...
I am actually still battling RAM at the moment for compensation due to the costs I incurred because of their conduct and i am not giving up!
So yeah, the main lesson - avoid if you can because you may cause yourself a massive headache, or they will help you out.

Title:
I booked a return flight from Montreal to Marrakech with long stopovers in Casablanca. As part of our tour of Morocco, we found ourselves close to Casablanca towards the end of the trip. Perfect, we'll just cancel our flight from Marrakesh and hop on our flight from Casablanca to Montreal, right? WRONG.

I get connected with a very rude customer support representative who struggles to understand what I want to do. She constantly interrupts me when I'm explaining, and even puts me on hold while I'm talking at one point. Finally, she tells me that it cannot be done. If I don't show up for my flight from Marrakech to Casablanca, they will cancel my flight from Casablanca to Montreal!

I tell them that I don't want a refund. They can even go ahead and re-sell my ticket to someone else if they want. Nope. they won't do that. I need to be present in Marrakach for my first leg or they will cancel my entire route.

So in the end we needed to take a train from Casablanca to Marrakech, book a hotel in Marrakach, fly back to Casablanca from Marrakech the next morning, and then wait a long 7-hour stopover in the Casablanca airport. All of this was avoidable.

Besides that, even the new 787 deamliner that we took was below average. Dirty, poor service, and loud. During our overnight flight, when people were trying to sleep, the staff wouldn't stop yelling at each other. Very unprofessional.

On the way back, a fellow passenger shows me a video where the Royal Air Maroc pilot apparently forgets to check his flaps, and almost fails a takeoff of a 737. It's on Youtube if you want to check it out. Yikes...
crvsd: Steve W wrote a review Mar 2018

Title:
This flight experience is influenced by the actual experience before boarding. There are multiple levels of security with passport verification,screening and physical searches. After enduring the long lines there are numerous defending stairs before a wait to board a bus with inadequate seating . Then passport and ticket check before ascending flight of stairsin the open to board craft. This places enormous pressure on those carrying substantial bags.
The hassle is further compounding by the total ignoring of the boarding zone printed on the boarding pass.
Once on board the flight is smooth, the service excellent. However the charging ports under the seat and below the screen need to work. Sometimes the passenger announcement Apia inaudible. No wifi. Did not adjust for DST on screen and announcement.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This is my worst experience .. actually it was my sister’s.. being canadian- egyptian she (as well as myself) has been flying Montreal-cairo for 20 years now and none of us has ever experienced such a terrible experience.. my sister had to come for a family emergency.. on her 5 hours transit in casablanca on march 13th (on her trip back to Montreal) , she was shocked that the flight left earlier than she expected.. they told her that this is because of their summer sunlight saving time that was applied starting the day before.. the plane actually left 5 minutes earlier than it’s time and they never called for her.. the employee there told her that she has to pay 400$ to be allowed to go on the next flight (24 hours after) and told her that he’ll get her baggage transferred to the next flight.. she paid the 400$ and came back next day, asked about her baggage and told they were transferred.. upon arrival to Montreal she found out her baggage was lost.. i sent a message to their official twitter account and they told me that her baggage was scheduled to be sent on march 16th.. today we found out they only sent one of two bags
Really disappointing
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The way this airline treats its customers is inhumane. They do not care about your experience, they relish any issues you may encounter, and they will absolutely find ways to strip you of the money you may believe you are saving by booking with them.

PLEASE, for the love of all that is right and good in this world, DO NOT subject yourself to this company’s pathetic excuse for service.

If I could block all experiences with them from memory permanently, I would. The only reason I am leaving this review is the lingering outrage they have left us with. No one should ever be treated the way that they treated us.

Do go to Morocco. The country is beautiful, rich with culture, and has left us with unforgettable memories. Climb the Saharan dunes. Eat dates on your riad’s rooftop.

Just book your way there with someone (anyone) else. They make Spirit and RyanAir look like luxury airlines, a feat I previously thought unachievable. You (and all of humanity) deserve better!
crvsd: Sarah D wrote a review Mar 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
If you have not yet booked your flight I would seriously look for alternative carriers. If you have already booked your flights you have my sincere condolences and a suggestion that you only take cabin baggage and do not check any baggage into the hold. The probability is the airline will mislay it and cause you immense problems if you have a connecting flight.

We were booked on a connecting flight to Fez with three hours connection time. 10 minutes before the scheduled departure time the flight was cancelled! With no explanation from any staff we had to make our way back through the airport against all 'do not enter' signs to a desk where a woman told us we would be sent to a hotel in Casablanca and would be put on the next flight which was tomorrow. Our bags would follow so we would have to do without them for 24 hours.

Asking at the baggage desk brought the same response - thy directed us through customs to the accommodation office'

We were put on a minibus which did not go to a Casablanca Hotel, instead taking us all the way to Fes dropping us at 3:30 in the morning at the Fes Marriot Hotel with no bags or explanation. It would seem the airline - instead of putting passengers up in a hotel, saved a load of money by bussing us to the destination without baggage and with no system or information in place for us to get our checked-in bags.

To cut a very long story (of many attempts to resolve this by phone, and a journey to Fes Airport to get it sorted face to face) short we finally saw our bags on the third day after travelling all the way back to Casablanca airport to recover them - despite the baggage office at first denying all knowledge of them!

Having spent €150 on transport and a few essential items like toiletries and underwear, I am going to try to get some money back via the London office as the airline has responsibilities under the Montreal Convention, but don't hold your breath.

The airline is completely useless as you cannot communicate with them if you have a problem. Some phone numbers we were given were not in service, others were unanswered and we wasted two days of our trip and a substantial amount of money I would avoid them if you can.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: If I could give zero stars to this airline, I wouldn't hesitate.  I downloaded this app specifically to write this review, my very first.  Do not fly Royal Air Maroc.  I will admit that if your travel plans go smoothly you may have a passable experience.  However, pray that you will not need their laughable "customer service", where representatives seem intentionally unhelpful and speak with the thinnest of facades over roiling contempt.  We had an amazing trip to Morocco but this airline did their best to ruin it.  The inexplicable fees were infuriating, but dealing with their customer service both on the phone and at the airport was demoralizing.  Trust me, any money you may save by choosing this airline will eventually be bled from you.  Purchasing their "serenity fare" or other refundable tickets will just add to your costs; they will not honor these fare conditions.Years from now, I pray that the memory of seeing the milky way stretch across the Saharan night sky will blot out any memory of the RAM employee who refused to refund our "refundable tickets".  I hope that the back-and-forth of haggling for carpets in the Marrakech souks will erase the absolute helplessness of being told we no longer had a flight home and that, no, we couldn't use the desk phone.  The hospitality shown to us in the beautiful medina riads will, hopefully, shoulder out every interaction with RAM customer service.In short, do not fly Royal Air Maroc, but if you do, pray nothing goes wrong...
crvsd: Tom S wrote a review Mar 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title:
Flying with a colleague, we checked in together. I told the agent in Niamey that I did not have luggage, but my colleague had 2 pieces. For some reason, she still checked one of her pieces of luggage on my ticket. But she was going on a different connection to a different destination.
We discovered this in Casablanca, and tried to fix it. The Royal Air Maroc agent in Casablanca was utterly un-helpful. She claimed that it was not her fault and not her problem. It was shocking how the airline representative was not willing to take responsibility for a mistake the airline did.
At the end, we ended up with the luggage going to the wrong place.

Title:
Waited for the flight from Marrakech to Casablanca in the business class lounge (pretty far from the gate). Went to the gate at boarding time, but there was not agent anywhere. No signs, no information. Nobody near knew anything about what was going on. Finally found a flight boarding for London, where one of the agents knew that the Casablanca flight was delayed. The aircraft has not even taken off from the previous destination. It took several more hours late at night to finally take off. In the meantime, information was not available about any updates.
Missed the connection in Casablanca. Huge line at the customer service to get hotel voucher. The agent told me that there will be only 2 of us on business class to go to the hotel. But reality was, we were put on a bus with a big group. When bus finally departed, after driving around, it returned to the airport to pick up more passengers.
Reviews of the hotel they claimed was 5 star indicated differently.
I opted to leave the bus and go somewhere else.

Title: A booked flight on XL airlines had been canceled and I rebooked a business class flight on Royal Air Maroc for my Grandson who was scheduled for a study abroad program in Paris. While I do not blame Royal Air Maroc for the cancellation of the flight because that was the fault of JFK that had only cleared one runway for international flights. But Royal Air Moroc’s communication was non- exisistent. My grandson checked in one bag and proceeded to wait in the lounge (which was terrific since it was Air France’s lounge). His flight was for 8 pm and all boards said on time. Then it said delayed until after 9pm. At 9pm the terminal closed down for the night. When my grandson tried to get his luggage back the airline representative laughed and said come back tomorrow. The next day he revived a text at 10:45 am informing him that he had to be at the airport no later than 10 AM for a flight to Paris. I cancelled Royal Air Moroc and booked a flight on another airline, AirLingus.  We went to the airport and searched for his luggage for 3 hours.  Given a telephone number to call about his luggage. This number did not answer and the voice mail was full. The following day when i dropped him off for his flight on Aer Lingus I found out from another airline that I had to go to another terminal and file a lost luggage report with the contractor for lost luggage, which I did. Called Royal Air Moroc and gave them claim number. I repeatedly inquired by phone and email to no avail. 20 Days later Royal Air Moroc asking if my grandson had received his luggage. Gave me a partial refund because I cancelled the flight.  Note that XL airline gave me a full refund.

It worked perfectly all the way, Assistance waited for us at all airports, moved us between airplanes in Casablanca, arranged everything through passport checks etc so everything went fast and smoothly. On our way back we had an overnight stay in Casablanca and even with that there was no problem. They have called the Relax hotel so they were waiting for us outside with a wheelchair.
When we were going to back to the airport in Casablanca again with the shuttle from the hotel, a man has already been waiting for us outside the airport at the shuttle stop with the wheelchair again and arranged everything up to the gate and flight.
Helped us even go to tax free and shop a little.
So I think RAM should get a big applause for their service.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Two flights with RAM in two days proved to be two sides of the coin. The first a nightmare with a five hour delay as recorded previously, the second excellent in many ways including the early return arrival. Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde maybe ? Good, attentive service on the way back (OK, there were only four passengers in Business), plenty of legroom (OK, the seats are a little dated), pretty decent food (with the major bonus of a great cheese board and a delightful selection of whole fresh fruit) and drink. If there are no hiccups there is no doubt that RAM has a better offering - with a friendlier and more authentic welcome - in Business than BA, at least short haul. It's a bit old fashioned but none the worse for that. I'm glad I saw the other side.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The line is modern, comfortable, and on time. If you do have bags to check on the flight (the normal situation), be sure to seek out the little box to say how many bags you plan to check.  Otherwise you will have to buy the upgrade at check-in -- and at another counter.  Quite a hassle.

Title:
RAM turned out to be worse than BA when the operational wheels came off. Even though the airline had my contact details I was not advised there would be a significant delay (the inbound plane had not left Morocco when I checked in at Heathrow). The cause of the delay was not clear (ground staff mentioned a strike, RAM subsequently cited operational problems), the timing of the flight was not clear and whether there would be any knock on effect for the return journey was not clear. Three hours after departure time passengers were offered a GBP 10 voucher which had to be collected from the transfer desk which is hidden away (corridor near Burberry's and down one flight of stairs). Eventually, the plane departed five hours late.
To be fair to the crew they were very apologetic, the turnaround was relatively quick and the pilots pulled out all the stops to make up time, but when you get to bed in Casablanca at 3am and have to leave the hotel for work five hours later, the unnecessary delay and the stress of having incomplete and uncertain information do not make for a happy camper.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The airline seems to be very dated and there was no in flight entertainment for both of my flights from London to Casablanca and then Casablanca on to Accra.

The staff were very attentive and friendly whilst serving the food.

However, the toilets were filthy, and someone had thrown up in one of the two loos available for economy and it was not cleaned up for the entirety of the flight.

Being vegan, I understand that I may not receive gourmet food on a flight. However, on with other flight providers, such as Singapore Airlines and Etihad, I have received a genuinely good meal. I was served rice with a soggy piece of broccoli and sweet potato with no sauce, cut up peppers, dry bread and a bit of kiwi and a few grapes. It was mostly inedible and I was thoroughly disappointed when I received the exact same meal on my second flight.

Title:
I flew Royal Air Morac from Cairo to JFK with a 12 hour layover in Casablanca where our baggage was to change planes as well. I don't think my luggage ever got on the plane in Cairo. When we were checking in, the conveyer belt was broken, and all the baggage was piled in front of the check-in desk. I have lost luggage before. It happens, but not like this. It's always come home. I was told (by Royal Air Morac) that I had to wait 21 days before I could file a claim or report with the airline directly. That was in July, when my luggage was lost. By that time I had very little faith my bag would be found. So I had gathered all my receipts and documentation and was ready to go. They told me it should be settled within 30 days.

It is now almost Feb, 2018. almost 7 months. Not only have they not dealt with this in any way, but at one point when I called I was told they had closed my case! I yelled a bit and asked to speak to a manager (yes I was calling Moracco) and they reopened it. I had been calling every other week and sending email to the address provided, and on that day I was told the best way to stay in touch and reach them was through facebook messenger. REALLY??? Facebook Messenger? They asked me for the ump-teenth time for my baggage claim number. and I sent it via facebook messenger.

Every day I message them. Everyday they tell me they will pass my message to the proper department, whom I was told doesn't have a phone number or a person for me to speak with, or a direct email for me to contact. I can only respond to their email. Which STILL goes to customer service and is then sent to"the person taking care of my case"

This morning I sent a strongly worded message asking them NOT to contact "the correct department" but to contact their supervisors manager. I was told they would send an urgent message. HA!!

I DID receive an email relatively soon afterwards, asking for my baggage claim number. I lost my mind.

I sent it again, and then another email containing all the receipts and screenshots of purchases I had sent before. Just in case. That bag and its contents were worth somewhere in the area of $2500. I would rather have the contents than the money, some of it is irreplaceable. But, I am quite certain the bag walked off months ago.

The customer service is the worst I have ever experienced. They do nothing. I doubt they pass my information on to anyone. They have no information to give me. It is basically an answering service. I was traveling with my daughter and the saving grace was that her luggage and her guitar DID make it back. My suitcase was packed with most of what we had bought after traveling 3 countries before checking my bag and never seeing it again.

If you MUST travel this airline, do NOT check your bag.
crvsd: Shari W wrote a review Jan 2018
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The flight was from London to Sao Paulo with a connection in Casblanca. The flight left two hours late from London but I was assured by staff that the connecting flight would also be late. We missed the flight in Casablanca and were told initially we couldn't get another for three days. We were then told to collect our bags before we could receive a hotel voucher. After waiting for my bag for over 6 hours (without even being offered water), I decided to give up and just go to the hotel. I was hungry and exhausted and had been in tears for how I was treated. The manager took so long to help us and sent us on to other people and one of the younger managers was really scary (male). I was stranded and alone. The girls on the conveyor belt left as I was in tears (after hours of waiting for my bag).  I've traveled far and wide and my experience with Royal Air Maroc (and at Casablanca airport) was one of my worst. Another airline eventually flew us back to Rome and then Sao Paulo. The journey was 48 hours long.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
NEVER EVER FLY THIS AIRLINE, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE, BUSINESS OR ECONOMY
I need to preface this review with saying I travel a good amount internationally, mostly economy and am not a picky person but this airline was the worst I have ever had to deal with (and I have flown economy via Spirt, thai lion, Ryan Air, etc).
Myself and a coworker flew home from a business trip in Madrid, the flight had a layover in Casablanca. We flew business and checked our bags priority. During the flight from Casablanca to JFK, neither my tv nor my coworkers worked, the attendants would try and restart them every 20 mins to see if they could get them to work but the entire flight neither of our tvs worked. My coworkers chair broke twice and had to be repaired, it was not even positioned correctly for landing. We finally get off the plane to find my luggage is lost. I make a lost luggage claim and return home. My luggage contained all of my business clothes and remained lost for 2.5 weeks. I was forced to buy new clothes for work. The customer service at this airline was terrible, they were rude and they kept telling me to send an email (which never gets answered). When the bag was finally delivered it was demolished and many of the contents ruined. I called and called and emailed...No luck. I finally received an email saying that they would not replace or reimburse because the bag wasn't claimed damaged within 7 days of my flight ......THATS BECAUSE IT WAS LOST!
-3 months now and I haven't heard from them since.
NEVER EVER FLY THIS AIRLINE, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE, BUSINESS OR ECONOMY.
crvsd: Kevin A wrote a review Jan 2018
qwuub: Flew Business Class. Would have rather walked.

Title: I've traveled to many countries with several airlines, however I have never experience such poor customer service and lack of accountability like I did with AirMaroc. They initially canceled my flight from Gambia to NY due to the snow storm, however it was back to normal the very next day. I value my safety first therefore I didn't mind at all because I thought I would be on the next plane available. I was initially suppose to return on the 7th but Airmarco decided to rebook me for the 15th (8 days after) because "all flights were full" without even contacting me. The also failed to remove my bag from the flight to Morocco (connecting location) so I was left with no cloths except for what I was already wearing. It was my first time in Gambia and was super exited to be their for a wedding but they defiantly ruined the trip for me. They promised to send my luggage back to Gambia since I was  going to be there for an additional week but they later told me that my bag was accidentally sent to NY. Here I am left with no cloths and expected to stay an additional week with no where to go. They first refused to provide me a hotel but I had to go back and forth to the office before they agreed to provide me one. They also refused to provide me $ to buy new cloths or to reimburse me since they sent my bag to the wrong location. I had no choice but to go to the market and buy new cloths. Long story short, when I got to NY and asked for my bag that was sent over a week ago, THEY COULDN'T FIND MY BAG, 4 or 5 other passengers were also there looking for their lost bags. I then had to file a claim which took 4-5 days to locate and send my bag home. I understand flights get canceled and bags get misplaced but Airmarco's actions to resolved the issue was unheard of for me. Defiantly the worst airlines I have ever experienced and will NEVER fly with them again. PLEASE AVOID THIS AIRLINES SO THAT YOUR TRIP DOESN'T GET RUINED BY THEIR POOR SERVICE.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: What a disaster- our connecting flight from Casablanca to JFK ( after traveling from Dakar to Casablanca) was cancelled at the gate at 2AM after many hours delay. RAM lost our bags as they were loaded in Dakar. Writing this on 1/19 and there is no word on the 3 lost bags fro our family. We had to buy clothing and etc to make it through the say in Casablanca. RAM insists they do not give vouchers or any coverage for losses, but we have submitted a claim nonetheless. They said they could not put us on a flight to JFK until January 16 ( 10 days later.) Frustrated at both the RAM office in Casablanca and at the airport, we decided to buy new tickets home on Iberia due to job and school considerations ( we could not afford a 10 day wait for obvious reasons of employment and school). RAM refuses to reimburse for lost flight and new tickets home, hotel stay and clothing purchased. Rude and unhelpful staff at RAM office NYC saying that we should submit a claim but also that RAM does not have  policy to pay any claims as this was an " Act of God" ( weather cancellation) and we are "not unique". Then they encouraged us to make a claim on their website....really bizarre customer relations...I have they feeling no one there takes responsibility or knows what they are doing....I'll NEVER fly RAM again and will tell everyone I know to avoid this poorly run airline.

Title:
Royal is possibly the worst airline I've ever flown in my life. On my first flight with them from London to Casablanca I sat on the emergency exit. The left arm rest was cut in half and sealed with tape (as you're able to see in the attached picture). We have been sent to a hotel and have to wait for further instructions while they fix the aircraft.

Title:
I upgraded to business for the third and last leg of our trip to Marrakech, having had a long day behind us with two flights on the same day to get to Casablanca. We were expecting some comfort and perhaps a little special treatment, maybe a drink in the lounge... Got zero, nothing! The lounge was small and not particularly appealing. They had no alcohollic drinks either, so we decided to leave and go to the general cafeteria, where we bought ourselves refreshing beers. Yes, they had them! Go figure.
The worst was yet to come. There's no priority boarding, or priority anything attached to the business class, just masses welling around, everyone pushing and shoving. We ended up being the last on the plane and the last off the plane, due to the fact that the only door was at the back of the aircraft and our seats in row 1. The masses had won, they got in first (I'm not good at pushing people, even though - I must say - sometimes it's tempting!) To top it all, our priority stickered and labelled bags were the very last ones to arrive on the carousel at the other end!!! If I hadn't experienced all this, I would not have believed it possible.
The plane was one of their small propeller aircrafts (could have been exotic under different circumstances). There was no difference between business and economy seats except for the curtain in between. I wonder what purpose it had, both sides of curtain were identical, in comfort and in service.
Hand luggage shelves in the front were full when we arrived. Our seats were in the first row with emergency exit, so of course I couldn't even keep my hanbag with me. I suggested to the people behind me to take their small flat package from above and put it at their feet - general practice. I was screamed at for touching their property! Whoa. The steward rushed in and proceeded to place my handbag somewhere way back in economy side, totally out of my sight! I was so dishartened at this stage that I couln't even argue, just sat down, dazed. Luckily my partner intervened and managed to get the bag and shove it on top of some other bags above us. The steward was not a pleasant one, I'm sorry to say. While waiting to disembark, I noticed it was his extra uniform with its cap and his large bag that took a lion's share of the shelf space!
That was it. No service, no priority, nothing at all to show for the fact that I'd paid €155 extra - for the joy of getting upset?!
So if you're flying Royal Air Maroc in their small propeller aircraft, please save your money and do not be tempted to go business, you'll get absolutely nothing for your money, nothing at all. Economy is way cheaper and getting in and out of the plane gets easier the further back you sit.
qwuub: This was a very bad experience
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Our flight was delayed leaving Gatwick and landed 5 minutes before our connecting flight was due to leave. The plane did not wait and then next flight was in two days time. They put us up in a hotel that claimed it was 4* but it did not provide any drinking water or complimentary toothbrushes etc.  This was a problem because Air Maroc could not give us our bags.  For two days I kept returning to the airport to be told that they had our bags and I should wait 30 mins. I did this for about 4 or 5 hours each day and they were never able to produce our bags. They were not apologetic and they did not seems to care.  No one would talk to us about provided money for toiletries or  clothes or even laundry so we could clean  the clothes we had on. The service was appalling and the staff were unhelpful and apathetic at best.  I will NEVER fly this airline again
qwuub: Stuck in Casablanca for 2 days and they could not give us our luggage
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
7 hours went by very fast in the business class. Seats are very confortable. They lay all the way down allowing to sleep with confort. Each seat has its own flat screen with a remote. Many movies available that you can choose from but very good sound quality. Flight attendants were respectful and allows willing to help.

Average: the food is not that good considering the ticket price. The main meal was too salty. So if you have Hyper tension, good luck. Besides the food, the flight was enjoyable.

Title: We flew from JFK with a long layover in Casablanca on our way to Rome.  Very nice flight.  Seating tight as any economy class.  Our return was out of Bologna and also through Casablanca.  We were supposed to have a 2+ hour layover and then on to JFK.  I couldn't find our outbound flight listed in Casablanca to JFK and upon asking was told there were no more flights that evening.  I shared we had booked a flight 8+ months ago to JFK for that evening.  They informed me the flight was cancelled.  mmmm thanks for telling me.  They did put us up in a hotel and pay all expenses but this really hurt my plans as I had a business trip to prepare for on my return home.

Title: The flight itself was satisfactory and all the RAM staff were good.  I would take issue with the airport however.  After passing through security and emigration, we had another security check at the departure gate.  They did a spot check on passengers, examining their carry-on luggage by hand.  Very inefficient, resulting in some delay.  I would suggest that passengers take only a few items in their carry-on luggage to minimise the disruption.I have no complaints about the fare but if travelling to Morocco, people may want to note that it can be cheaper to fly to Marrakech rather than Casablanca.

Title: Having read some bad reviews we were not sure what to ecpect, but we received a good service from RAM. Check in was straight forward for both legs of our journey. The check in staff and the air stewards were professional and always helpful. The in-flight meals and snacks were adequate and filling. Overall we were happy with the service and would use again.
