Title: I flew business class from JFK to Marrakech, with a connection in Casablanca. First, we were 2 hours late from JFK so I missed my connection. I kept asking the stewardess what to do if I miss my flight and she just kept lying to me and said I would make it. After arriving very late in Casablanca I had to get moved to a later flight, and asked them twice if my bag would go on the next flight - they said yes. I arrived to Marrakech very late and no bag. I filed a lost bag request with the baggage office and he said they would call when it came - he was very rude by them way. 2 WEEKS LATER AND STILL NO BAG!! I've called and have gone to their office almost every day and nothing, and no explanation. All these inept people can say is "We don't know where it is right now". Since this happened, I've spoken to at least 15 other people who have the same problem. This is NOT OK for an airline to do this to customers who are paying them and entrusting them with their things. Royal Air Maroc are a bunch of THIEVES who take people's luggage - NEVER FLY THEM!!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I have traveled all over the world, on European, US and African airlines. Never have I received such pitiful service on an airline as Air Maroc. After losing my luggage, the airline gave me no information the entire time I was in Morrocco. Only after repeated calls on my part after I returned home, was a told that my bad was in a storage locker at Dulles airport. There was no delivery service offered. I was forced to go to the airport at my own time and expense to retrieve a completely destroyed suitcase. I tried several times to file a claim for recompense and not a single of my requests was answered. The treatment was shameful and not at all that of a professional airline. I would warn passengers against taking this airline. When there are no standards or protocols in place to deal with simple customer service issues, one can only wonder at all of the other systems that are likely broken.
qwuub: Lost and then destroyed luggage and did nothing to re-compense
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This is a sum up of several domestic flights I had with Royal Air Maroc in business class.
The good thing is that RAM brought me to where I wanted to fly and all flights were on time.
Domestic business class is a complete waste of money! The only thing one gets is priority check in and a dedicated cabin, which is no difference to economy class in ATRs, but offers better seats on E190s. And then there is this exclusive bus service at Casablanca airport is terribly run down busses. Save it, RAM! It’s nothing other airlines would dare to offer as business class product.
No lounges in most airports! Not even at RAM’s domestic hub in Casablanca! I only could use one at Tangier. Terrible displays and announcements at the airports which made me almost miss a flight because a gate change wasn’t announced and the staff only spoke Arab and French, but not English.
Inside the aircrafts, one is offered a small drink and that’s all. No meal service at all, no asking if one would like another drink. Announcements in English are terrible, not understandable, and on some flights they aren’t even made. The cabins are in poor conditions and dirty.
Don’t book business class! It only annoys you as the product is not at all worth the money!
crvsd: Holger C wrote a review Dec 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

The plain itself was nice and service on the plain was attentive. They provided good food too.

Title: First impression is a slight upgrade from budget airlines as the flight included a hot meal. While I appreciated this , the meal was awful. They ran out of chicken so I ended up with beef. The pasta was overcooked and meat looked pale and tasteless . I simply only ate the bread roll and small pot of salad which was lovely. The seating was cramped, luckily I had 2 slim people on either side of me, otherwise I wouldn't know how I would of been able to sit throughout the flight! I found it strange that your hand luggage couldn't be fitted in the overhead lockers due to people storing other bags and boxes. This chaotic process delayed the flight and I question why passengers were allowed to bring on additional bags when they should have been encouraged to check in their hand luggage ( which my return flight with BAirways was the total opposite, with so much room and the flight was surprisingly much cheaper ) Once we landed in Casablanca en route to Marrekesh it took over 30 minutes to come off the plane due to passengers trying to get their stuff out of the over head lockers. Luckily we were in time for our connecting flight to Marrekesh. While the staff were nice , the flight was pretty uncomfortably and loud with people talking so loud. Also it would have been great if the sheets for immigration would be handed on flight.  Marrekesh airport though was impressive so it made up for the poor flight service.
crvsd: sam l wrote a review Dec 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I booked a flight to travel with Royal air maroc from London to Marrakech - stopping off to change flight in Casablanca or so we thought!
There was 3 of us (adults) and 1 child (2).
Upon boarding the flight i was sweltering as it was extremely hot and the air con was just blowing out hot air it was extremely uncomfortable but little did i know this was the least of my worries.
The reason i am giving this air line 1 star is simply because our connecting flight was the last flight of the day and the flight before ours was cancelled (apparently) so they gave our seats to the passengers who was waiting before us!!! There was alot of commotion and shouting but as i do not speak to language i was not sure what was going on - it was a passenger who relayed the information to me as the staff said they do not speak english ... riiight?
To cut a lolng story short the manager on duty shut the door on me and went into her office they did not offer us any apology or any refreshments after we had been waiting over 6 hours, what they did supply however was a small mini van which infact had a slow puncture as we had to stop to pump up the wheel as it had gone completely flat which is very dangerous.
I have been trying to contact them for a refund and compensation and they are not responding, so would defo reccommend not to even bother with this air line - i have had more enjoyale experiences on Ryan Air and Easy Jet to be honest!
qwuub: The worst airline i have ever flown with - will NEVER use again!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
In General and mostly flying in an out of Africa with RAM. I notice that the Airline is not making any effort to become more client oriented. I have been a Gold card Safar Club member for the past 3 month and I do not see a great difference in service between Business and Economy.

Recently I was put in a hotel 42 km away from the Airport and was told that the service the same for all. The RAM shuttle did not pick us up at 4:00 AM in the morning and we had to rush to the airport with a last minute taxi.

Sometimes to toilet baggie in Business class, not even eye protectors or socks in economy like they did about 6 months ago.

Still OK but do not raise your expectations too high with them

Title: I visited Morocco via tour which used this airline. My flight was from İstanbul to Casablanca .The flight took 3.5 hours and it was very comfortable.Check in is very easy and it is available both in English and French. The meal that is served which is traditional Moroccan food  is very delicious,  I liked the sandwich as well.The service of the plane crew was excellent.The seats are very comfortable for me as I am a short person.Eye masks, socks and headphones are given to the passengers as a gratitude. The in-flight entertainment is sufficient which offers Hollywood films with Arabic subtitles, documentaries and various Arabic Music.The only negative thing about the airline is that it was difficult to understand the announcement of the pilots due to their pronunciation. Besides  there was too much noise in the plane because the noise of the engines was too loud.Overall I have enjoyed flying with this airlines.

Title: This was my first time flying with Royal Air Maroc. Title:
Twice a year, I take Air Maroc. The flight I take is from Kinshasa to Brussels and back, since I am a Belgian citizen working in Kinshasa. The food is pretty average. I would like to see more couscous and Moroccan food. Yesterday, they had only beef and fish. I am mostly vegetarian, so this wasn't to my taste. Why don't they have a vegetarian option? Come on, we are in the 21st century, only young children and ignorant people don't know that half of the pollution in this world is caused by the meat industry. Why serve only tasteless fish and red meat? And why do they avoid couscous? It doesn't make sense. Couscous is not only good for Moroccans, it's good for everybody!

The service is pretty efficient. If you ask for a glass of water or anything else, they won't forget you. In Casablanca, you don't necessarily have to queue. If your connecting flight is only one hour after you have arrived or even less, don't worry, the staff will let you go through the gates without queuing. It is well organized. Thumbs up!

What I don't like about this airline, or at least on my particular flight, is that they don't have TVs on board. So if you are on a ten-hour flight, you won't have much entertainment since you can't watch a movie. If you can sleep easily, that won't be a problem, but if you can't you'd better come with a good book or a good pal.

What I like about the airline is that you can buy duty free Moroccan products such as the wonderful argan oil on board. It is very convenient to make presents once you reach your destination, especially when you come from central African countries where there isn't much to buy!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I had two flights on Royal Air Maroc.. They do not coordinate with any Us carriers on their frequent flier programs. I had been flying business class but they did not offer that to us. Check in at Fes was a made scramble and the airport in Casablanca was a free for all scrum, extremely poor coordination . Service was minimal on he airline which was half full from fes to casablanca and packed going to Barcelona.They are efficient but very cheap in the foods and snacks and lack of room on the plane on both flights.  I was very happy to deplane and get more comfortable. Look for another airline if you want some comfortable seats but going to Barcelona from Casablanca it is limited.   They are very prompt however and the flight was smooth and event free.

Title: I read a lot of bad reviews about Royal Air Maroc and I can tell you that we had a very pleasant flight. The staff was very courteous and accommodating. My husband and I were separated on one flight but that was okay. We are adults and can deal with that. However, if you have children that would be a concern.The food wasn't that great but what airline food is? The airport in Morocco is lacking. It was very strange having to take a shuttle bus to the main terminal. The terminal does not have any good restaurants and just appears tired and somewhat dirty. However as far as the airline and the quality of service from their employees it really was very good. We had no problems with our luggage which I was afraid of with a layover both ways on our trip.  I would definitely fly with Royal Air Maroc again.

Title: We had a baggage handling issue - one of our bags was badly torn in transit on return flight from Marrakech.  We filed a report at the airport and used the on-line claim form as requested. The flights were good - but DON`T TRUST THEM IF ANYTHING SHOULD GO WRONG.

Title:

To sum up, AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS!

Title:
A Wonderful ' Little Dream Airline '.

The staff are Absolutley Multi-lingual they know 'at lease' 5 languages each which is Intelligent as well as Impressive and Welcoming!

The moment I went on board I was to feel Safe & Comfortable with a Peaceful Journey, Everyone is always Respectful & Well behaved.

Food is Abundant and no one is left un waited or ignored, thirsty or Hungry!

The Experience is mostly Smooth from U.K to The African Continent but know they fly all over, which is why I will choose them again.

The Captains are from all over the world which is beautiful and makes me feel Safe and Hosts/Hostesses are always polite.

The cabins are always clean and you never feel rushed or pressuerd, your holiday starts on board with them, truly:)

The Attentiveness is smashing, even in Economy class the Standard is that They give a 1st Class SERVICE who ever you are and always with a 'REAL SMILE'
I love RAM ( Royal Air Marco ) Best REAL airline in the World where everyone is on the Same Level!

'By the way' this Airline line Attracts the most INTERESTING people in the World who have very Interesting and INSPIRATIONAL lives, and you wouldn't' think so unless you flew with them!

Ive met Map makers, Astronomers, Anthropologists, Perfumists, Etc its like a MEGA Universtity in the SKY!!

Well Done!!

Title: We flew to Casablanca and back in Economy class on Royal Air Maroc.  I could not justify  paying four times as much for each of our family members for a flight under 7 hours outbound and 9 hours on the return.  I must say that I was dreading the travel part of this journey for months.  The outbound flight could not have been easier...an overnight flight that left on time with decent legroom, a clean and well-equipped Dreamliner, individual tv screens, and best of all, a chair that reclined enough so I was able to sleep through the entire flight:)  I would do it again...btw, Morocco is great!

Title:
Had a fairly smooth check in at LHR in transit.
Flight was on time and service was fair.
Deplaned at Casablanca to change flight to Cotonou.
At cotonou find bag missing.
Filed a missing bagform, was informed will arrive next day.
Was helped by a Benin army officer who was on the same flight as the clerk at counter could not speak english.
Next day checked , no bag informed will arive after 2 days but had to leave for my connection to Istanbul and Mumbai.
Even after repeated reminders on email no response from airlines in last 6 months.
Dont lose your bag on this airline, they dont even give a compensation for bag, not even money to get one change of cloth or shave.

Title:
After reading many bad reviews of RAM I️ was a little nervous to fly with them, but have to say flights were on time and smooth, hot meals served even on flights under 3 hours, bags arrived undamaged, and flight attendants were fine. There happened to be medical emergencies on two different flights I️ had with them and they handled them very attentively and professionally. RAM is really no different than any other budget carrier- you won’t get a luxurious experience, but you will get there and it will be just fine.

The issue is the Casablanca airport. I️ can’t speak for other Moroccan airports, but this one requires a ton of patience and is very dysfunctional. There are several redundant passport/bag checks and long lines. Right before boarding everything in my bag was completely inspected again- electronics all taken out and examined, etc., probably for the third time at that point. They also don’t tell you that any drinks you buy past security in the airport terminal can’t come on board. However that rule seemed to apply to me and not everyone- so there are some of those totally arbitrary security quirks that are not uncommon of other international airports of course, but are definitely a problem in Casablanca. Just beware that if you are connecting in Casablanca to flights elsewhere, give yourself lots of extra time and be attentive to everything. They don’t provide any clear instruction on their airport policies.
crvsd: Claire G wrote a review Nov 2017
qwuub: RAM isn’t the problem- it’s the Casablanca airport
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: As travelers who needed Assistance we were offered better seats at Manchester airport and were nicely surprised by a tasty meal on the way to Casablanca. The Assistance was waiting for us there but the plane wasn't ready for boarding so we were transported miles across the airport to wait with crowds of standing people for boarding to Marrakech. The plane was late one hour so it should be enough to transfer our suitcase from one plane to another. But it wasn't and we couldn't collect our luggage at Marrakech. Being naive I trusted the employee of Lost & Found that it would come on next plane in 45 minutes and I didn't request a claim protocol. When the plane landed without our suitcase the Lost&Found office was closed.It was almost midnight. A taxi waited for us 2 hours (extra night cost) and we reached hotel with no luggage. The next day another Lost&Found clerk showed me the suitcase on another flight table but he didn't seem to do anything to get the luggage as soon as possible (another cost of taxi). A long while after all the luggage of the flight were dispatched our suitcase was still unavailable. I needed to show my impatience to see any action. If you can avoid transfer at Casablanca, do it. I wonder who is responsible to compensate us additional costs of taxis ?
crvsd: Malgorzata R wrote a review Nov 2017
qwuub: RAM good airline with BAD/NO support of RAM Handling at Casablanca
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: After reading of these bad reviews. Allow me to bring some sought of balance to this discussion...  First and foremost I'm old enough to remember traveling abroad use to be a pipedream vacation. The 1-800 travel to Europe commercials with astronomical prices are no longer.  Thank goodness! today you can act as your own agent with so many sites playing host to these budget airlines.  Key word here "budget "  RAM is no different from any other airline. We are a family of four with two teenage girls.. We were able to fly to Lisbon, Madrid and Casablanca one shot all under 2k. So I had very little expectations other than transportation of getting us there. My low expectations were exceeded with great movie selections, friendly FAs and really good food. Allow me to help calm your nerves if you just booked and are scared itless reading these bad reviews.Do's- book a flight with multiple destinations with a long layover... why? RAM offers complimentary accommodations. Yes that's right free! For bookings with a 8 hour or more layover.. Get out see Casablanca and visit  the Hassan Mosque which might be one of the best landmarks in the world.. Two continents for the price of one with a free night stay. .. How is that a bad thing on any level? Don't- here's where things get messy.. Not RAM but the Casablanca airport is a nightmare. You will literally probably spend the entire time going through 50 million security checks once re-entering the airport.  So do not try to play daredevil with time.. This is where most of these bad reviews stem from, travelers visiting a country they are not familiar with playing a game of roulette with their time. I watched 10 different travelers upset because they missed their flight because they got caught on traffic.  Do not... I repeat... do not tightrope it. Casablanca traffic is like a scene on Homeland it's extremely chaotic. It's simple book a long layover or just relax until your next flight..  All in all I'm not sure what ppl expect, to each its own.. However if you are a budget traveler, this airline will work for you.  We did have a minor layover but nothing crazy..  That stuff happens on any airline especially traveling abroad.. RAM like most airlines get a bum rap because of one person bad experience.  Traveling so far away opens up so many different scenarios that can go wrong.  Do not panic you'll be fine. You are listening to a traveler that is level headed and open minded. No axe to grind, just helping my fellow travelers.  Remember if anything goes wrong you'll be taking care of.. Enjoy be smart about your time.
crvsd: Walter F wrote a review Nov 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Once through Customs, we saw the aircrew in baggage and my wife asked them if they had found a wallet.  The steward who had worked our section, said, "yes".  He even remember our seat, "You were in 26 a and c".  He then took us to the Royal MAROC rep, who returned my wallet.  I will always be grateful to the Steward and Royal Air MAROC and would definitely fly with them again.

Title:
Having read the reviews for RAM I had low expectations for my journey; worried about delays, lost luggage and on board service, I was very pleasantly surprised.

For a more affordable price and a shorter journey than other options, I flew from Montreal to Madrid with a stopover in Casablanca aboard RAM. I was allowed two checked luggage’s, given two meals and enough leg space to sit as comfortable as it gets on a plane. There was entertainment for the 6 hour flight and the plane was well kept.

Overall similar to the experience I’ve had on other, more well-know airlines transatlantic flights.

—
The downside: even though RAM is alliance partner with Iberia they could not issue the boarding pass for the second leg of the flight and this had to be obtained at a transfer desk in Casablanca, which is not the most organized airport.

Title: Needed a "day of" ticket to get back home on short notice, so purchased travel to JFK through Casablanca.  The price was good and the times fit my needs.  After purchasing the ticket, looked at some ratings and reviews of Royal Air Maroc and got a little nervous.  Fortunatley, all went well.  Flights ran on time (both left about 10 minutes early, so don't arrive at the gate at the last minute), service was ok (especially for a "low fare" carrier), and baggage arrived without damage the same time I did.  I would recommend this airline for specific needs:  low fares between major cities with low expectations for services.  Casablanca security was very slow, so I wouldn't book tight connections.  All in all, got me where I needed to be for a reasonable price and service.

Title: I flew from NY - JFK to CMN and then back 9 days later. The flight out of NY was uneventful. I tried to contact the airline a day in advance of my flight to choose a seat- only to find out the E ticket number was not in the right format. I didn't fret - I was traveling with a group of 26 others and planned to arrive at the airport 3 hours in advance in order to choose my seat. As suspected the airline chose my seat. Upon arrival to JFK I checked in and was able to change my seat to an aisle seat 4 rows form the back of the plane.  Prior to taking off I noticed that a gentleman was seated in the middle row ( 3 seats speaking with the crew) Once the pilot announced the plan was ready for take off the gentlemen moved up 2 rows to another row of empty 3 seats. A friend rushed to the last row and was told the seats are being held for the crew. My friend sat in the 2nd to last row on one aisle and I moved into the aisle seat with a space in between us. This worked out well. I noticed the crew advised passengers to use the restroom at the middle of the plane. The plane allows passengers to walk down one aisle around the back of the plane and back up the opposite aisle. I had NO idea there was a bathroom at the back of the plane until we were about to land. There was no smell AT all! The crew were ok and werent very pleasant. The food was edible and warm. I had a chicken dinner. The flight was a 9 pm take off and a 8 am arrival in CMN so we were served breakfast as well! All in all a good flight both ways. Although on my flight back - the crew separated a family of 7, luckily they had some aisle seats in an exit row and I gladly traded my seat.    PS I did read reviews about the lost luggage and decided to check 1 bag and carry on another just in case. I had no problem with lost luggage in either direction. From CMN to JFK I checked both luggages and they arrived upon my arrival in JFK.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew from Washington DC Dulles Airport to Casablanca Morocco. The aircraft was absolutely dirty and smelly. A kingdom of all sorts of germs. A tick layer of pretty old dust was sitting on the carry-on luggage compartment. The whole airplane smelled awfully like a public toilet. The lavatories were very smelly and very messy.
Only one or two crew members were more or less helpful and caring, the rest of them were extremely rude and had no patience.
The only positive thing is the job well done by their pilots. Very smooth landing and takeoff.
The only reason why I chose this company is for the convenience of a direct flight. Otherwise I would have avoided it like the plague - which I should probably start doing.
Would ABSOLUTELY NOT recommend this company to anyone. Unless you don't mind the appalling dirtiness and the rude people who work there.
Think twice!!

Title: I've bought the returned ticket from Moscow to Casablanca at Royal Air Maroc office in Moscow on May, 30th. The flight from Moscow to Casablanca was economic class on September, 20th and everything was good - registration, service at the airplane etc. But when after my trip to Marocco I arrived at Casablanca airport  two hours before my flight on September, 27th, I've been told by person from Royal Air Maroc at business class registration desk, that my family name and my ticket number were not at the airline's system and it's my problem!!! I've showed my electronic ticket but the person said me again that there were no my family name and send me to make confirmation of my ticket to the office. When I came to the office, there were 8 people, among them two Russian women. They were told exactly the same words about their tickets. It's radiculious, because we all were at the system when we flew 7-10 days before to Casablanca. It was very strange that our names have disappeared from the system. The person from the office have checked my name at his computer and I've seen that it was information about my ticket. Then he asked me what is the problem? I said that I should confirm my ticket. He has begun to phone somewhere regarding my ticket. Nobody answered for ages. When somebody had finally answered, the person has given me phone to speak but the person on line has said to me that he didn't speak English and then he's put my call on hold again. The person from the office has called again. Nobody has answered. For one hour the person has tried to call somewhere to confirm my ticket. In Moscow was night already, so Moscow Royal Air Maroc office didn't work. The same time the person at Casablanca office forced two Russian women to buy 2 business class tickets for 850 euro each. They had connection flight at Moscow to fly to Krasnodar, that was why they agreed to pay. Otherwise we all should pay for the 2 nights at the hotel, because Royal Air Maroc wouldn't do it as we were not at the system and we weren't sure that we would appear on next flight. It was women's last money. My two way ticket (one way - economy class, returned way - business class) costs only 634 euro. I was so stressed and powerless because I understood that I couldn't prove later that I came to airport on time for my flight. Now I realized the words of woman at registration desk why that's "my problem", because I couldn't do anything and I was scared. I'd tried to persuade the person at the office to but nothing had worked until I've said "I'm American citizen and will judge Air Royal Maroc company in USA" The person at office immediately has said that he found my name at the airline's system snd I could go to the registration desk to get a boarding pass. When I get into business class salon, it was full of Africans with economic class tickets. And I've realized that it was unrighteous way not to pay for the hotel for overbooked Moroccan people and chock Russian tourists to pay for the hotel by yourself or buy tickets, that brings money for the company- it's outrageous! The service was awful. The  stewardess thrown me slippers and when I asked for glass of wine or champagne, because I was very nervous, she told me, that she would bring it after taking off. She forgot to bring lamb for main course to my neighbor. I traveled around the world by different airlines and I was in more than 40 countries, but this experience was the worst in my life.

Title:
What an experience, even tough the flight went ok, I am really shocked of my journey today.

At the arrival in the terminal, a whole bunch of passengers were nearly punching each other after some of them got check-in declined due to flight overbooking. Company staff and airport representative stupidly stared at the show.

Few moment later, when I arrived at the boarding gates, I saw another group of passengers yelling that their flight to Bologna had departed too early. Some passengers were knocking the boarding gates, asking the staff to reopen them; another one was repeatedly loudly shouting "is there any manager left in this airport". Once again, the airline representatives kept quietly looking at their customers rage, while passengers waiting to board on other flight were recording the scene on their phone.

Then, we heard an alarm coming from the elevator to the RAM lounge, and the noise of someone in panic, blocked inside, knocking the elevator door. As airport representatives started to gather around the elevator, we were called for our boarding to London.

The flight itself was decent, the best part being the meal served (cold starter, hot dish, dessert, cheese, bread, free 33cl cola, coffee/tea)... until the landing... At very high speed, left wheels hardly hit the ground first (some people started to shout and remained nervous until the complete stop of the aircraft).
qwuub: You better have a very good sense of humour
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were delayed by a Royal Air Maroc x 5 hrs coming back from Casablanca, no explanation given . We missed our connector ( we had booked it separately) they said it wasn't their "issue" very unsympathetic staff who didn't care if we could afford to book another flight or
Not . Thank goodness Jet blue honoured our tickets 5.5 hrs later with a very caring staff member. After talking to other passengers this is a regular occurrence....... beware when using this airline and take your business elsewhere
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We decided to take the airline to save cost and pre-booked our flight in February to get early bird tickets. The 1st shock came in July when we randomly checked our online booking and saw that our dates had been moved forward thereby adding a 29 hour layover without any notice! We rushed to their Lagos office to sort that out.

The day before takeoff, we got an sms asking that we be at the airport at least 4 hours before takeoff - which meant at least 2am for a 6.40am flight. The onboarding from Lagos was the worst I'd ever experienced - long queues, no information provided, delayed take-off.

The other leg to New York was actually good - attentive cabin crew, good legroom etc.

Flight back to Lagos from Casablanca was a nightmare - small plane compared to the waiting passengers, shared no inflight entertainment and more importantly, cabin crew struggled to communicate in English. Only 2 toilets serving almost 120 people.

This is the only flight I've been on where there was no priority boarding for families travelling with children.

Its a 3 rating because it was low budget and the airport in Casablanca wasn't half bad.

So if you must fly RAM, (1) don't fly them in summer as they always overbook (2) If you must go in summer, periodically check your booking and be sure that its not changed (3) just assume your flight will be uncomfortable and make adequate preparations (well charged tablets/laptop, snacks for the kids, good book).
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Nonetheless all the cross-continent flights were at least 1h30 late and our luggage had no priority on the belts whatsoever.

Title:
- Check in: disorganized but reasonably ok.
- Departure: delayed 45 minutes with no explanations given. We were asked to line up for boarding and left standing for 40 minutes. No explanations were given.

Arrival: All our checked luggage, along with that of at least other 20 passengers, did not arrive. The staff had no idea what to do and did not seem to care at all. We were told to come back to the airport the following afternoon. The following morning, none of the telephones given worked and there was no way for us to check if our bags had arrived. We had asked for our bags to be forwarded to our next stop which they agreed. We continued to try to track them via phone with no luck at all. The only response we got from the airline was through Facebook!!! On our second stop and 48 hours into this odyssey, we were made to go to the local airport to pick the bags up (they simply do not deliver to your hotel like others do) where we were told that only two out of three bags had arrived. The man who was in charge only said "I am sorry, I did not loose them, this is not my problem". The only thing he managed to do was to request for the remaining bag to be forwarded to another location if found. At this point we had called several times, had done spend hours at two airports and had had our relatives call to their US office. Our tour operator was finally able to speak to someone on the phone and told us where the bag was. We were finally able to retrieve it 5 days later. When went to pick it up, it was locked and whoever had the key to the room, made us wait another hour. Of course, no one seemed to care.

I strongly advise against using this airliner on your flights to Morocco. I guess that everything goes smoothly it's ok but they clearly have a company culture that does not care about customer service or satisfaction. They will not help you if anything does not go according to plan.
qwuub: Terrible, more like non existent, customer service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Royal air Maroc is only direct flight to Montreal so we chose to  fly with them on our summer vacation for last couple of  years. This trip was a disaster,  we got email 4 hours prior to trip informing they are aircraft had a technical issue and we were not to go to airport till further notice.  Only 2 hours before the flight we get an email saying they got a replacement aircraft and we should be at airport on time .  Luckily we were close to airport other wise we would have missed.  Upon boarding we discovered that aircraft was in real bad shape.  rIt was real old one,  with no reclining seats and no form of any entertainment, no video or audio system. @ out of 3 bathrooms were out service and they crew staff were in real bad mood too.  To top it all the food was hideous and it was so obvious they were not ready for this flight. by end of flights the aircraft was so dirty , bathrooms smelled and when we complained the staff told us it is not there fault and we should complain to management. This was by far the most horrible flight i eve took and i am a heavy frequent flyer for work and pleasure and have a gold status with RAM as well. they really need to look at their strategy and upgrading their aircraft and training their staff in they want to stay and compete in the airline business!

Title: These four RAM flights were my first since 2009. I had low expectations due to experiences a decade ago, but I was very positively impressed by the current quality of service, punctuality, attentive ground service, and courtesy in resolving a baggage issue. To start at the beginning, the website is now user-friendly. Check-in at JFK was handled much better than eight years ago. It was quick and efficient. Although I had to arrive six hours early to JFK due to limited flights from my US point of origin, I could proceed directly after security to the Air France lounge until flight time.      The cabin interior has been completely refurbished, with lie-flat seats, an adequate entertainment system, and attentive service.The flight from JFK departed at 9:00 PM and dinner wasn't served until 10:15 or 10:30 at night. I chose the national dish, a cous-cous dinner with chicken. The chicken had the softness of a dish prepared for an infant and preparation could be improved. The return meal from Casablanca, and the lunches served on the short Tunis-Casablanca flights, on the other hand, were delicious and well-presented.     Transfer at CMN was effortless. I was met plane side and provided with a room at an airport hotel until my mid-afternoon departure. On my return from Tunis, I stopped over for five days in Casablanca/Rabat. My bag arrived damaged—this can happen anywhere. I am still in the process of getting reimbursed for the damaged bag, but RAM staff in Morocco and via e-mail have been courteous if slow (Qatar Airways managed a claim earlier in the year within three weeks),       RAM cost was less than half what European carriers wanted for travel to Tunis, and the quality of service provided make RAM acompetitively-priced, reliable, and comfortable choice..
qwuub: Major improvements and competitive pricing for Royal Air Maroc
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I've flown RAM multiple times (probably 10+) and it just gets worse flight by flight. Customer service is near non-existent. Should you need to call for help with your reservation -- you will wait on hold for 45+ minutes and then speak with someone who speaks too quietly, and poorly to understand what they are saying.

The planes from US to Morocco, although new, are already dirty and unkept. On our last flight, my brother sat in a seat covered in a sticky drink and a big wad of gum smushed into the belt. The steward did nothing but provide him some tissues.

The last three rows in the back of the plane were filled with junk, papers, bags of blankets and pillows, etc. The crew would not allow passengers to occupy these seats after take off. We were not offered any drinks until two hours into flight, when dinner was served. Then after falling asleep -- I woke up about half way into the flight to find THE STAFF SLEEPING IN THE THREE EMPTY ROWS. TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE!

RAM staff will tell you when flying from CMN to US that your bags will go all the way through to your final destination. THIS IS FALSE. You must collect then in JFK --the last four times I've flown, they have given me this information which is incorrect.

The plane in general is disgusting by the time it reaches Morocco or the reverse. At no point do the staff come along with bags and try to minimize the trash build up. The bathroom was flooded and floor covered with towels. By 3/4 of the flight, you'll be lucky to have toilet paper available. It's absolutely disgusting.

After my last flight, and finding the crew asleep. I'm finished with them. Spend your money with another airline. I should also add that I live in Morocco, but RAM needs to get their act together.
crvsd: Alyssa E wrote a review Aug 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We are astounded at the service we paid for. Upon arriving at the airport, we were told that our flight may be delayed or cancelled so we were going to be driven in a poorly ventilated bus to the destination airport.  When asked for a reason, the airline representative said sometimes there are too many people or maybe there's a technical problem, one of the two she assured us.  Then what was initially supposed to be a 2hr journey turned out to be a 3.5 one, the fellow 16 passengers crammed into the mini van were not impressed as everyone's connecting flight was nearing.  We finally arrived at the next airport 15minutes after our flight had started boarding. The driver just left us.  Luckily we found other passengers in the mini van on the same flight and were escorted through the airport, running to catch the plan.   I don't know how we made our connecting flight but we should not have had to been put under that stress for a service that was paid for, it was incredibly poorly planned and we will not be flying with Royal Air Maroc again.

Title: This was our first flight with this airline and we feared the worst after a number of  failed attempts to contact them prior to take off. First query related to luggage collection for a connecting flight in Casablanca.  Several emails went unanswered and we eventually resorted to Trip Advisor for information. During our holiday my wife suffered a fall that left her needing wheelchair assistance for the return flights. Our hotel staff made countless attempts to reach the airline before finally making contact with our request. Then came the good part. When we really needed them Royal Air Maroc rose to the occasion and provided us with excellent support on both our returning flights. More plus points: price-wise they were very competitive, we had four flights and all of them were bang on time and the flight attendants were pleasant  and welcoming. However, as with many other airlines, we would definitely recommend avoiding their food and on these flights we could not pre-book our flights. But the bottom line is we will be using them again in September!

Title: BUYER BEWARE. This is the WORST airline I have ever dealt with in over 100 flights, many with low cost carriers. I would spend the extra $ to be comfortable and have your luggage arrive with you. I knew it was going to be bad when the online system crashed every time we tried to pick our seats, when we finally called to have our seats set and my special meal requested it was challenging to get clear info. Then JFK to Casablanca the whole row of seats I was in on a completely full flight's entertainment systems went off during landed and never fixed. We kept asking the flight attendants who seemed to care less and I spent 8 hours next to an 11 year old whose family was spread throughout the plane with no entertainment. In addition they messed up my special meal so I couldn't eat anything. The plan itself was dirty. The leg of Casablanca to Marrakech and vice versa weren't too bad because they were shorter but somehow after requesting and confirming seats they got changed so my fiance and I were separated with no explanation as to why. The check-in process for luggage and boarding was chaotic and didn't function properly (for example one line would have 3 agents checking them in where another line would have one slow agent and they would yell at you if you tried to switch). To add to the awful experience when we got back to JFK only 1 of our 3 suitcases made it to us. A 2nd came in on the next flight, but was sent to us BY UPS not a courier so it took 3 DAYS TO ARRIVE!!! Luckily we were staying with family in New Jersey but it was ridiculous how long they took to get that suitcase to us, which is outshined only by the fact that for the first time after having flown well over 100 times my suitcase has never been returned to me. It's been over a month of calling and emailing and not getting any information while we try to get compensated for my suitcase. They barely pick up the phone and there claims service only interacts via email which they promise to respond to within 30 DAYS... That's right any email correspondence they strive to respond to within a month. Never again will I fly Royal Air Maroc.
qwuub: Terrible Experience on multiple flights (we had 4 flights on a multi-city ticket)
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Our flight was scheduled to take off at 9 pm. We boarded on time.  We ended getting off the aircraft at 1am after taxing and waiting at the terminal. Then we waited for another hour outside the boarding gate before being told to go home and come back tomorrow at 10am. We paid our own hotel and meals as well as other items as our bags were on the airplane. The next day we showed up as instructed and the airline personnel were nowhere to be seen. The counter for Air Maroc was empty but everyone showed up as instructed. Roughly around 11 am they showed up and at 3pm we were in the air. On the way back home for this 7 hour flight, they separated my wife and I where she was on one end of the aircraft and I was on the other. Speaking to other westerners who were in couples, they experienced the same. Till this day, I have not been refunded my hotel and meal expenses. I am out over $500 with lost expenses and meals for the 18 hour delay.

Title: We originally booked a direct flight from Marrakech to Munich and a week before flying we just checked out of curiosity if the flight times have changed.Thankfully we did, because we could not access our booking and kept on getting a flight cancelled message. We did not even get an email about the cancellation. It took three phone calls before we got the flight sorted and had to get a flight a day earlier as the new option will require us to spend a night in Casablanca to catch the connecting flight. We still had to fly through Casablanca instead of flying direct and to make things worse the only flight offered was a 6AM flight to Casabalanca. After a five hour wait, we were finally able to board. This airline has so much potential as the flights were both on time and the ground and cabin grew all offered great service. The food offered was delicious and sufficient. Overall, an average airline.
qwuub: Great crew and ground staff but other aspects are disappointing
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: We booked a flight, as a whole, from Brussels to Nairobi. We payed for it and we got the tickets. There it stated we had a stopover at Casablanca (1hour and 10 minutes lay over). Not a problem for us. When we tried to check in online, the evening before, we could only check in from Brussels to Casablanca. No changes in flight hours where shown. When arriving in Brussels, Zaventem airport, 3 hours in advance, they only could check us in for the flight to Casablanca (AT0839). The personel of RAM told us this was normal procedure and once we would arrive in Casablanca, we would receive our next boarding pass for the plane to Nairobi. Once arrived in Casablanca (on time, still had more than an hour to get on the other plane), the personel of RAM showed us where to obtain our other boarding passes. At this desk they suddenly told us 'Ow, that plane left more than an hour early!'. So, as our first plane was landing, the other one was already taking off! Nobody notified us, not online, no e-mail, message,... We were speechless and desperate. Together with an American couple (who also booked a direct ticket from Brussels to Nairobi), the personel told us it was no problem, they would refund our flight and that we would have to take the next flight, 2 days later! This was not an option for us, because we already booked a safari with driver and airport pick up (1500 dollar) and a hotel (50USD), all planned from the moment we would arrive in Nairobi. After 3 hours, they told us to come fast, because there was a flight to Cameroon we should be on. Then, from Cameroon, we would have to take a flight to Nairobi. Instead of arriving at 2am, we would arrive at 8 pm (losing an entire day of safari and hotel, but still less worse than losing 2). They told us it was safe to transfer at Douala. Once arrived in Douala (after a terrible night flight with stopover in Yaoundé), at 4am, the border control would not let us enter (because we had no ticket and visum), they called the police, who took our pasports and we had to sleep outside the police departement at the airport! At 8am the office of Kenya Airways opened (where we had to check in for the nex flight). But RAM had put us 2 on wrong seats! The others could board, but not the two of us... After 2 hoffiric hours, at the office of Kenya Airways, their personel managed to get us on a flight to Nairobi (not the RAM personel, who couldn't be contacted and where nowhere to be found...). Late in the evening we arrived in Nairobi, lost the money of our hotel, lost the money of our safari (our safari crew left at 8 in the morning...). We had to book it al again, terrible feeling! Completely ruined our holiday! This was our pre-honey moon! We only have 2 weeks of holiday each year and our start was completely ruined! The return flight from Nairobi to Paris (AT0262 and AT0760) was a disaster as well!  In Nairobi, the personel told us we would have to take our luggage in Casablanca (since we would spend one day at a hotel in Casablanca). In Casablance they told us they could not obtain our luggage. We had no spare clothes, toothbrush, shampoo... nothing! Our engagement rings where in those bags! Next day, arriving in Paris, one of our bags was missing.  After 2 hours of waiting, they found our bag, who was shipped in another plane. We panicked, because all our valuables where in that bag! At the RAM offices they told us we would be refunded and we must make a claim online. Heard nothing of them after 7 mails...
crvsd: Jan U wrote a review Aug 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were traveling from Madrid to Nairobi with a layover in Casablanca. Less than 24h before the flight I get a mail informing that the flight from Casablanca to Nairobi would be 1h before the scheduled. I was not worried as we had a 4h layover but even so, change the flight in such a short time is crazy. When in Casablanca we got into the plane at around 3pm (we were supposed to flight at 3:50pm) and everything seemed ok. Then we waited, and waited... And waited a bit longer. We were stuck inside the plane for 6 hours, the plane did not move and the staff was very rude. They told us it was a techincal problem. Then the nairobi airport was closed between 2am and 5am so we could not take off because there was no place to land (although the flight was originally scheduled to land at 2:25am and the return flight to take off from Nairobi at 4:45am). Then the crew needed to be replaced because they were there for too many hours, but no one knew anything about the whereabouts of the new crew. We got off the plane for one and half hour, put in a room with no exits, controlled by the police and with no answers. After more than 7 hours (let me remind the 6 of those were inside the airplane) we finally took off. In the meantine one of the stewards (male) pushed one passengers (female) who was trying to get some answers. The guy didn't hit the woman because another passenger stood in the way.

Also, the toilets are very dirty and stink!

So let me tell you: if you have already booked the flight, pray to God that it goes well. If you are thinking about booking it, think again! It's worth to pay a bit more and dont have you holidays ruined.
crvsd: Manuel P wrote a review Aug 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

their business lounge in Casablanca could also do with an upgrade.

Title: I have health issues that prevent me from flying. I contacted their customer service, the representative was incredibly rude and hung up on me. I then tried to contact them using social media. I told them if I could I'd fly but my health does not allow it. I asked for a refund or credit towards future flight. They refused abruptly with not one inch of emotion just copy-pasting "we regretfully inform you that we will apply ticket conditions. No refund. We thank you for your understanding." I understand they need to have policies in place but when someone is sick surely they can make an exception. I found them to be rude, cold hearted . I will never use them ever again. And I highly recommend to all of you to avoid this airline at all cost, don't give your money to such a company that has no regard for their customers and treat them in a rude manner.

Title: RAM and TunisAir are both geared up for the W Africa (Francophone) to Europe routes, connecting in Casa and Tunis. Both offer bargain-basement 1-way as well as rt tix. I recently went OUA-FRA on TunA and returned FRA-BKO on RAM. Their system is overnight roundtrips to W African capitals and back, easily connecting with daytime flights to/from Europe. Both airlines are much cheaper than European airlines, which only go nonstop to Paris, Brussels, or Lisbon from most W African countries, so for most destinations one still has to make a connection. My flights on RAM and TunA were uneventful. The minor delays (up to 1 hour) did not inconvenience me. Food was edible. No entertainment system (not a problem). My bag (containing no valuables) arrived on time. The majority of the passengers on RAM were West Africans making connections. There was more of a demographic mix on TunA. RAM has been struggling financially and other posters speak of lost/delayed luggage, a problem I thought RAM would have solved by now. There was some disorganization at RAM check-in in FRA, and Casa airport is a bit of a mess while it is being rebuilt. Overall, I recommend TunA over RAM for cheap flights between Europe and W Africa. It was much easier to monitor TunA flight arr/dep data than RAM, which I did for a couple weeks before each flight (TunA did pretty well). BTW, Air Algerie is also a competitor on these routes, but I avoid it because its safety record (never mind customer satisfaction) is shaky.
qwuub: RAM as an option on flights between W Africa and (mainly) Europe
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I found an awesome deal to fly from New York to Casablanca, then Casablanca to Lisbon, then Lisbon back to New York with a pit stop in Casablanca on return. The deal was $365 RT to fly mid June, so I hopped on it.  I read the reviews prior to booking and was mortified, but decided to take the risk. I was mainly concerned about lost luggage or cancelled flights. I arrived at JFK and there was a very short check in line.  I checked in, and was told we would receive dinner at the gate.  I said "You mean a snack?" No no, to break fast during Ramadan, each passenger received a box with a sandwich, drink, smoothie, cookie and date as they boarded. (Our flight departed at 9 pm).  The flight attendants were amicable, the aircraft was large, spacious and comfortable.  The usual onboard entertainment was functional.  The crew served dinner which was good. The breakfast was what is served on shorter flights (bread and cheese). That could be better. Our luggage arrived with no problem for each leg of our trip. (Although when I arrived in Morocco there was a dent in the corner of one, but I was just happy it  made it, and with everything in tact.) NegativesThe return flight to JFK was not only delayed, but they did a poor job notifying passengers of the gate change.  I did not like the fact that we had to take a shuttle from the departure gate all the way across the airport (but maybe that is not an airline issue). Lastly, on our way across the airport there were several luggages on the tarmac that had fallen off a vehicle.  There was no one making any swift attempt to gather them and unite them with the correct plane.  Those flaws brought my review down from excellent to very good.  I am still glad I took the risk and booked Royal Air Maroc.  Unfortunately I have not traveled on this airline multiple times to see consistency with service, but I sure hope my experience is an example of improvements to come.
qwuub: Blessed to have had a very good experience
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I arrived very early in the morning in Casablanca and went to the Domestic terminal . I had a very long wait and while I was there I met some persons who were on an earlier flight. I tried to get on to that flight but there was no room. I kept checking every time a flight was called.

About one hour and a half before the time the flight was supposed to leave I moved closer to the boarding gates.

I did not see any agents until about close to the time the flight was supposed to have left and I never heard the flight announced. When I approached an agent he said " Oh you are the last to be boarded- and Boarded me in the system and told me to stand at the gate for transport to take me to the plane and then not long after - deboarded me after which I had a very long ordeal- I had to pass through immigration, customs, go to the RAM agent to re-book where I was told that all flights on the next day were over-booked. I was refunded any money and had to go to take a taxi to a hotel and take a train the next day to Marrakech and then a taxi from my hotel in Marrakech to retrieve my luggage and back to the hotel..

As if that was not enough on my return trip to Casablanca, my e-ticket had my flight at 12.40 pm when I eventually reached up to the counter- the ticketing clerk almost got a fit- while my e-ticket had me leaving at 12.40 pm - the system had me leaving at 10.00 am - There were two if us like that- another person was in the system as leaving 7.00 am against an e-ticket of 12.40 pm.

I had to pay 100 US to get on the 12.40 pm flight and then there was some discrepancy since the changes were not reflected in the system and there was some difficulties in obtaining the boarding pass ( the same thing happened to the other person). Evntually I barely made it to board the flight to Casablanca.

I am a world traveller but this was my worst experience.
qwuub: Horrid Experience with Royal Air Maroc
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The flight from JFK to Casablanca was fine, a modern 787 aircraft and the standard entertainment options. Not much in the way of food or at least, very forgettable dining options. The real problem came from the trip back, I checked my bag in and wound up waiting at the bag carousel for a long time until I realized my bag was missing/didn't make the fight. First time this ever happened to me. I wasn't alone, a whole mess of people complained about not getting their bags, the guy next to me said they checked 3 bags in and only 2 came out. At the airport the staff barely look like they know what they're doing. I guess we shouldn't of expected much else, but I should of flown KLM.
qwuub: First time I ever lost a checked in bag
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Pluses:
It's a budget airline. unbeatable price.
It was a cheap way to get to South America and they include a hotel in Casablanca for overnight layovers
- the food on the flight was pretty good.
- the staff were ok, mostly friendly.
-I had no issues with luggage. they check it in for you when you transfer at Casablanca.

Minuses:
They were delayed by three hours on the way back and didn't notify us, and it meant we missed our connection (which left 20 minutes before we arrived and didn't wait for us).
-They are terrible at communicating. I only found out about my hotel because I rang up worried about where I was going to stay. I also only found out about the delay when I checked in and there was no explanation.
-There is NO entertainment on flights.
- Most staff in Casablanca don't speak English (they speak French and Arabic) and are extremely rude, unprofessional and unhelpful, and quite possibly racist and sexist. I had no problems on the way out but the group I was with was treated appallingly on the way back.
- we arrived back in London a day late. I'd rather pay less, but if you're dates are fixed don't take the risk.

Basically- Its very cheap and just like any cheap airline, it's not the best service. But much much better than American Airlines for example.
qwuub: very cheap but for a reason
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
on 7/1/2017 myself and 4 friends flew air maroc for the first time to Lagos Nigeria. We were to arrive in Nigeria on 7/2 at 3:05am. Somewhere in the neighborhood of 3:55am we landed in which we all thought was Nigeria, but as passengers started for their luggage the crew told us to stay seated. I looked at my phone to let our host know that we just landed in Nigeria safely. To be greeted with welcome to the Cameroons and the rates for using the local cellphone service. I thought nothing of that welcome message at the time but after sitting for additional hour with no information being relayed, I began to get worried. I tried looking out of the window to see, I don't know what, only to see we were in an area with no lights, no control towers, no runway lights.it was pitch black! Now my mind was now getting the best of me thinking perhaps the plane was under siege.
Finally other passengers began to demand to know where we were, but with an inaudible PA system and the person speaking so fast in Arabic when most on the plane spoke English, I got the impression they didn't want us to know what was going. after the objection of many of the passengers on comes a Soccer Team????
It appears that this flight made an unscheduled stop that made us 3.5hr late to our final destination Lagos to pick up the Soccer Team. ;-( .
Air Maroc this kind of disregard is unacceptable. this was my first time traveling and it will be my last time using this airline.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: This was my first time traveling to the continent of Africa, so I was extremely excited! My first flight was uneventful with the customer service mediocre. I then transfered to my connecting flight. What an ordeal! The flight attendants were not that pleasant.  The personal TV monitors were not working. 2 hours into the trip we finally land, only to be told we were not in Nigeria.  We questioned them several times regarding our whereabouts. They would not give us an answer.  I fell asleep and woke to find a woman yelling, demanding they tell us where we are. Another passenger stated his wife is at the Lagos airport nervous and waiting. My friend noticed her cell notification stated we were in Cameroon! This was an unscheduled stop that delayed our arrival for 4 hours! We discovered they picked up a soccer team! Our arrival to Nigeria  ended at 7am. We were scheduled to arrive at 3:05am! My return flight was chaotic with an hour and a half delay for boarding.  The attendants were very rude, giving demands while serving food and beverages. They retrieved the garbage only once, leaving the aircraft a mess! This was my first time using Royal Air Morac, and my last.

Title: My husband and I flew from CMN to JFK on our second leg journey from Porto. We are very happy with the B787 equipment and the flights was only three quarter full... a surprise given that it is the high season for transatlantic route. The customer amenities are all adequate if not remarkable. Have read many negative review on tripadvisor and elsewhere, we were pretty happy with the hard product. What ruined the trip was the cabin crew. RAM's crew training seems to value efficiency over basic sensitivity and civility. Never had we been waken up from our sleep and to hand over a tray of food. The restrooms are among some of the dirtiest I have seen toward the second half of the flight. But most seriously insult was the way my husband was treated prior to landing. All airlines and regulations asked passengers to stow away the trays and put their seat back up. Having sat on the emergency row, we had the fold away screen that must be stowed away for landing. Instead of asking us to put it away like anyone in the service industry will do, the flight attendant slammed it down and almost injured us. These monitor units are heavy and could easy cause serious injuries to small children. She was unapologetic and simply walked away.  Never had we been treated so rudely. I don't expect a warm smile nowaday on any airline but this is a very serious insult to their customers.  Yes, RAM offers attractive deal and fantastic aircraft. But if they wish to excel and attractive repeating customers, they need to put the customer first. Starting with normal civil interaction with their passengers is a good place to being.
crvsd: Aries L wrote a review Jul 2017
qwuub: Dreadful cabin crew and insensitive to their customers
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We were supposed to fly to agadir from Gatwick by Thompson, however the traffic (as usual!) Got in the way and ruined it, so we missed our flight. We had no choice but to go on lastminute.com, and we found a great deal by RAM with two stops. Looking at the reviews, I thought that the customer service and the punctuality was going to be bad.
The plane arrived 1 hour late, and boarded late too. They made sure to apologize as much as possible for the delay. We were flying a Boeing 737-800 with a fully booked flight. Upon arrival on the plane, there were Moroccan tunes playing, and the overall design of the plane was to my liking, and the staff were always with smiles on their faces. The cleanliness of the plane would've made a fussy person cringe, but I am not that fussy and found the cleanliness average. This was economy class, so I wasn't expecting total luxury. It was a 2hr50 min flight, but it went by really quickly because they served food really quickly. The food was really tasty: there was a block of smoked salmon, cream cheese with bread, yoghurt and for the main, rice with chicken or beef. I chose chicken which was really good, however my mum chose beef, and it was extremely tasty. It's perfectly spicy, and I finished it all straight away.
The only reason why I didn't add in that star is because of the punctuality and the heat and stuffiness inside the plane. Other than that, it is cheap and I would recommend it if you aren't too fussy!!
crvsd: Emanuela Bille wrote a review Jul 2017
qwuub: Unexpected last minute flight with a good outcome

Title:
I was very afraid to flight with Royal Air Maroc because almost all the reviews said bad thing about the company. But i was very surprised with my experience because it was very very good. My flight was from Barcelona to São Paulo (Brasil) with a 20 hours stopover at Casablanca. I was very afraid with the possibility to stay 20 hours at the airport, but when i arrived at Casablanca everybody was very kind to give me the support to find the company office, when i arrived at the office the employer of Royal Air Maroc gave me in 10 minutes a voucher to the hotel, transfer and the meals. I got the transfer to a nice hotel near the airport, got 3 meals voucher and the voucher to get the transfer back to the airport. The flight back from Casablanca to São Paulo was a very great experience too, we had 3 delicious meals, a lot of options of entertainment. And one more positive point is that my bags witch came direct by Barcelona, arrived in São Paulo all in perfect conditions. I had a great experience and would recommend it to others.

Thank u Royal Air Maroc.

Title:

Everything else was terrible. We had more than 6 hours delay to leave JFK and we didn't hear a single word of apology. Title:
My flight was cancelled at roughly 48 hours notice. There was an offer to reschedule my flight for later in the week but was useless as I had to be in the UK before their offered replacement. I managed to book a flight with another airline. I e-mailed saying I expected a full refund. I then received a phone call that was poorly connected and I couldn't understand what was being said. I told RAM I wanted a refund as I had made other plans. The man hung up and I received an e-mail with a re organised flight, different to the one offered in the original e-mail, that still proved useless for my travel needs. I replied again to that e-mail stating I wanted a refund and I would pursue the matter further if this was not met.
I am waiting for a response. My advice would be do NOT use this airline. Their customer service is appalling and their lack of organisation is apparent through poor communication and trying to just book you onto alternatives without consulting you first. In my many years travelling this is by far the worst customer service I have experienced. I will never book to fly with this airline again.

Title: I approached my trip on Air Maroc with a LOT of trepidation after reading reviews here. My outbound trip to Canada was OK, greatly uneventful, but I was happy I had carried a stash of snacks to subsist on. My return journey was far less sterling. The 747 craft had a massive metallic box under the seat in front of me, and I had to stretch my legs into the aisle. On my last connection, one of the flight attendants was dismissive of my requests, although I managed to get assistance from his colleague. It might be a sligth cost saving to use Air Maroc but in future I would be hesitant to spend my money on a service provider whose staff make me feel less than welcome!!!!!

qwuub: Local in-flight staff need an attitude overhaul

Title:
Booked on RAM's website, and paid for reservation 4 months before flight. Also paid for an extra piece of baggage, we were flying economy and had flown business everywhere else - so too much luggage!!. The extra piece was 42.31 Euro.

At Check-In the bag was rejected ... we would have to pay extra (55Euro) at the payments counter which was shut (of course!!)

Why was it rejected?? - It wasn't on his screen, I showed him the amount of 42.31euros on my paper copy under services - he had no idea what that was 'probably taxes' he said. I should have booked with Ryanair or anyone else for that matter.

The flight was unexceptional

Title:
I booked these flights because they were incredibly cheap, and then I read reviews that made me wonder if I'd made a mistake -- but, my experience was overwhelmingly pleasant.
Gate agents were helpful and courteous, seats were comfortable, great in flight entertainment, blankets, pillow, eye masks, socks and headphones were provided free of charge, food and drink offered multiple times each of the flights (even the 1hour from Casablanca to Lisbon).
The food was just ok. The dinner entrees I ordered were both beef, I declined to try the fish. One was a beef with potatoes and vegetables and cous cous on the side. The other was a beef curry with vegetables and lentils on the side. Those, while I imagine not everyone would love, were fine and edible. I would say, don't board the flight hungry, but you'll probably find something you can eat on the flight. Plenty of drinks (soda, coffee, water,) so you won't get thirsty - which is always a thing for me when flying.

Flying roundtrip from JFK to Lisbon, and there was a layover in Casablanca each way - it's the Moroccan airline, everything starts or ends in Morocco. In each of the layovers, we went to the Royal Air Maroc desk and were given vouchers for food (for layovers over 4 hours) and for food and lodging (for layovers over 8 hours).

Checked my luggage on the way back, and my luggage was not lost - which is one of my biggest flying fears.

The language barrier issues mentioned in other reviews are real, the translations from French to Arabic to English were not always perfect on board the flight. But, seriously, what do we expect? We're flying outside of the country, we're not entitled to have 100% of the staff fluent in our language just because we can't speak anything else. The gate agents in all locations spoke English, and when I encountered someone who was struggling to help me because of language, there was always someone close by who could help.

Many of the issues mentioned in other reviews were actually not the fault of RAM -- long customs lines, ridiculous rules about what is allowed on flights from Morocco to the U.S (thanks, Trump), but things outside of their control, just keep that in mind.

I'd certainly fly again, and the price is exceptionally right.
crvsd: Susie S wrote a review Jul 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Never again.

Title: My flight was an overnight flight from Montreal to Morocco. This was the best service I have ever had. A little extra legroom. Eye masks and slippers were distributed (no charge) as were blankets and pillows.  Access to movies and music were also at no charge.  The dinner and breakfast were served and food was plentiful. The bar was at no charge. What other airline does this these days? Service was excellent. The bonus was no flying through Europe, no layovers and no going through US customs.  If one can fly Royal Air Maroc anywhere it would be my first choice. The return flight was equally as good.

Title:
I will not fly again on RAM. 1st our flight was delayed because of break problems, when we fianlly got in, we stayed at the gate for 3 hrs. At 4 am, the pilot attempt to take of, sudden break and we returned to the gate. Orders to evacuate the planes were given in arabic only. we were sent to a hotel nearby and the flight was delayed by 24 hours. we left the next day, late again.Missed the connection in Casablanca. nobody to direct us for a re-routing. finally took our connection 12 hours later. Lost overall 2 days in airports.
this is not the end. when we returned, our plane tickets were voided because when the reissued our tickets in Montreal, they did not reissued the returned tickets. we were left by ourselves to fogure how to get new tickets on the way back, after 4 hours back and forth discussions and buying a business class tickets we were able to return to Montreal,
I will never fly again with RAM. Customer service is terrible. No consideration for customers. Awful and stressful.
I filled out a claimed, they offered me ''miles'' on RAM as a compensation !!!!
No way I will fly again on RAM.
I am used to travel for business all year long. This is the worst experience I ever got.
I will return to Morroco, But on air france or air canada. never RAM

Title: This airline was picked for our Europe package as the cheapest we could find.   I did visit their website to try to gain some knowledge and found it to be somewhat informative, but lacking in other areas.    As a group of 4 traveling together, we had hoped to sit with each other but were unable to pick our seats at any time.   Even checking in 24 hours in advance, we were told our seats would be assigned when we arrived at the airport.   This turned out to be untrue, as our seats were already assigned, and we were next to each other.  Not sure why their software would not allow better for this.Boarding was delayed, as we traveled the same day of an attack in London, so security was extra, but things did move quickly.The plane has 3 rows of 3 seats each with their own personal entertainment system and USB charging ports (some of those ports did not work though).  Our flight departed at 10PM, and within an hour after departure, we were presented with a hot meal.   It was a very good variety of items, and the hot food was HOT, and cold items cold.    A good variety of in-flight entertainment, movies, tv shows or music and even some games.   They do present you with a blanket and a mask for sleeping if you desire.  There is also a pair of socks in the bag - I suggest using them... as I believe they are made for long flights.     About an hour before arrival to Morocco, we were presented with yet another meal, again hot & cold items, very tasty.    For drinks, they offer you soda, coffee, tea, but also have available beer and wine, apparently at no charge, although not advertised.restrooms were abundant, and cleaned during the  flight.Our return flight had much of the same fare with regards to the food and entertainment.Surprisingly, their counter was open well in advance of check-in time, allowing us to rid ourselves of our checked bags.    AMAZINGLY, they allow each passenger TWO checked bags with no charge.    Very nice for overseas trips,    They were friendly and helpful at the counter.Area for improvement - communication.    The on-board announcements are I believe in 3 languages.. arabic, french, and english, however when they talk for 2 minutes in arabic, and only 10 seconds in english, you have to feel something is missed.   It was also hard to understand many announcements due to the accent.My suggestion for improvement would be to have the announcements appearing in text on the screens at each chair.The servers while at your chair are friendly, but if you want more than the provided beverage, you either get it yourself, or you have to call them, possibly more than once.   They do not make a second pass for beverage service... they are served only when meals are presented.I would use this airline again, as the items of concern are (to me) not major ones.
crvsd: Joseph Elster wrote a review Jun 2017
qwuub: a pleasant surprise... a little room for improvement
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
