Title:
Overall, a very bad experience. Prior to trip, husband received several phone calls notifying us that they changed our itinerary. He called back and requested to keep our initial departure/arrival times. Customer service reportedly made the change, but when we were getting ready to return to JFK, we learned that we were not on the initial flight back after all. A supervisor re-booked us, but she declined to allow us to sit together.

I spoke with several other travelers. Some had a good experience overall but most were disappointed (poor service, flight changes, etc). Also, most not allowed to sit together on the flight back to JFk. Interestingly, there were many open seats on our flight and it would have been easy to have people sit together. It's a risky purchase. You may have an ok experience; we didn't.
qwuub: Multiple itinerary changes, poor customer service

Title: Luggage lost on arrival in Casablance. It was difficult to find arrival service, no signs. When there, nobody to serve you. The explanation was that the sun just set (7PM), thus all employees would run off for dinner (Ramadan). When a person finally returned, we got a report filed. Our hotel for the next week in Fes. My phone number and the hotels recorded. In the following days I  called their support center every day, only French, if you ask for English, you will be transferred to the endless recording that eventually will ruin your phone bill. My hotel called each day, they spoke French. The same story always, the bag was probabely in Brussels, no definite. My wife and I needed to gradually buy replacements for almost everything. On day 5, when I asked the hotel to inform the airline that we would move to Marrakech, then they suddenly reported that the luggage was in Fes. You need to go to the airport and get it, there is NO way they will deliver. At the airport, more hassle, no key to the storage room etc.. Finally, the luggage was retrieved and my wife is happy. We have spent substantially more than Euro 1000. on emergency replacement. The luggage had a tag saying "rush to customer in Fes", the date was June 17th, so 4 days before they finally told us about it, but only because we asked them to change our address. It cannot possibly get worse???

Title: My boyfriend and I took Royal Air Maroc for a trip from Rome to NYC with a layover in Morocco. The flight we purchased had a 7 hour layover. The boarding pass that was given to us shows an entirely different flight with a 25 hour layover! We went to many different people to sort this out saying that this was not the flight that we paid for. Basically, they cancelled our booking (not our flight) and put us on the next flight to JFK the following day. When we pressed the personnel further, he said that there were 43 open seats on the flight we were supposed to be on. So we asked to put back on the flight that we originally CHOSE, BOOKED, and PAID for and they said we had to pay extra to be on that flight because it was a "different class." Imagine paying for a flight time and then finding out that they cancelled your booking without even notifying you thru text or email. We had to spend the night in Morocco without any prior notice and any of our stuff Bc we checked it all in. Then we got to NYC the following day and THEY LOST OUR LUGGAGE. It was just one thing after the other. I have never experienced a flight like this and will never fly Royal Air Maroc again. When waiting for our luggage, we talked to many people and found out that they had the same experience with Royal Air Maroc changing their flights without any notice. This is completely unprofessional and having to deal with our lost luggage was just the cherry on top of this experience.
qwuub: Cancelled our booking, lost our luggage

Title:
Very much satisfied with my experience on a recent RAM flight from Montreal to Moscow (with a layover in Casablanca) - wish I have read less those TA reviews that use too much black paint. Sure, individual experiences may vary and a lot probably depends on your destination. One thing is certain : RAM transatlantic flights are served by a brand new planes with comfortable seats, decent service, food and entertainment options. Not to mention two free pieces of baggage in economy class and a free hotel room for long layovers in Casablanca.

Yes, their in-flight services and food options are still below some other airlines (KLM, for example) but it is not something that would prevent me from fluying with RAM again.

What might contribute to someone's negative experience with RAM is an outdated airport in Casablanca, higher than average percentage of passengers flying with small children (that do cry sometimes during the flight) and an occasional language barrier (unless you speak Arabic or French).

Otherwise, a very good value for money, good experience on each of my flights with RAM (Casablanca to Moscow leg as well). Don't hesitate if you are thinking of choosing RAM!
qwuub: Much better than some reviews make you think
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I flew to Paris for 10 days on Royal Air Maroc via Casablanca.  Picked it because I'd never been to Casablanca and it was a very good deal.   Was a bit apprehensive about all the bad reviews.   First tip: MAKE SURE you get a seat as soon as seat selection is available, 48 hours before departure.  They fill up fast and you will get stuck in the middle of the middle section (like I did).  Having said that, the 787 aircraft that goes between JFK and Casablanca was very nice. Seats crammed in (but this is the way it goes, newer the plane, more crammed the seats are).  Still it wasn't bad.  The staff were nice to me, from the airport to the aircraft.  Food was good, had it several times on the trip and no food poisioning.   Flight left on time, arrived on time.    Paris/Casablanca flights on the oldest 737 i've  been in but it seemed solid and again,staff was nice, food was okay, flights were on time, no bags (checked from JFK to ORY) lost.  Orly is nicer than CDG, smaller and easier to deal with.  Flight back also was fine except for the extra hand-search of all carry-on bags, this was a pain and took a while, there is no warning as it happens at the departure gate.   YOU SHOULD KNOW YOU CANNOT BRING LAPTOPS AS CARRY ON BAGS, THEY MUST  BE CHECKED BAGGAGE.  This, of course, can hardly be held against Air Maroc as it is a USA mandate but it wasn't pleasant.  Then you had to take a bus to the aircraft, inexplicably parked at a gate at the other end of the terminal with the jetway about 8 feet from the door.  Who knows... Flight left a bit late, probably due to the search, but the flight was nice, food was good, 787 was very pleasant despite being crammed in, in-flight entertainment was very good and as a bonus will point to Mecca for those so inclined.   All in all, for the price, I considered it a good deal.  The airport in Casablanca was interesting, clearing immigration and customs is pretty standard if a bit third-world-ish but not bad.   Duty free in Casablanca has very cheap cigarettes.
qwuub: don't be afraid, it was a good deal for the money
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I have sent two complaints to RAM and I have not heard a thing back!  As I have been very dissatisfied with this substandard airline, I have therefore posted it here - and will post on other sites to warn people of my experiences.Our journey out of Doha was fine and there were no issues;once we got onto the aircraft we both slept most of the way.The return journey from Casablanca to Doha was however a little different and rather disappointing. To begin, the aircraft was dirty and the staff were very inattentive.  I pressed my call button a number of times; staff did not come and were just sat around at the back.  Nor did they attend to other passengers who also had their call lights on.  Because of this, I got up and went to the back of the aircraft myself where I found staff just sitting around chatting and 'flirting' with one another and totally disregarded me and other customers!   Eventually a young man asked me what I wanted and I requested a glass of white and red wine.  He immediately dismissed me and said he would have to check at the front of the aircraft and would bring the wine to me!  I waited... a very long time.  Probably about 45 minutes!   In the end, I went back to the rear and asked again - I chose the only steward who had been polite so far throughout the journey (who was the most accommodating on the flight) he asked me what I would like.  I replied that I would like two glasses of wine: one for myself and one for my husband.  He grudgingly said he would bring it to me in cups!  To add insult to injury, after getting off the plane, my husband found a small reddish beetle type creature crawling up the outside of his trouser leg!  He promptly killed it but on further checking - it was a bed bug! This had clearly come from the plane - it could not have been picked up anywhere else!Because of our two experiences and the lack of response from RAM regarding my complaints, we shall not be using them again! You only get what you pay for: they're cheap for a reason!.
qwuub: Don't bother!  You only get what you pay for!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This was an economy flight we got through TravelZoo. The airline was THE WORST!!

In Morocco we were held in 2 lines, men and women separately. Women were taken into a curtained cubicle and patted down, especially rubbing and feeling our breasts.

The lines and lack of staff made getting onboard a 2-3 hour ordeal.

They seem to hire 1-3 people to do all the desk work, and then the very same people are taking the tickets.

I was required to check my kindle. The pick up at JFK was crazy. We waited for close to an hour.

Another crazy thing is that it is now 3:00 am and our flight leaves at 10:00 am. What do you do when exhausted for 7 hours?

Next time I will spend the extra money and fly directly to Italy.

Title: We showed up 2.5 hours early to a flight, only to stare at at empty desk for 2.5. We missed our Tanger to Marrakech flight & paid a grand taxi 4000 Dirham (400 USD) to drive us 7 hours to Marrakech. Title: I was really nervous to fly RAM after reading a lot of mixed reviews. I was afraid the food would be awful, the bathrooms would be disgusting, and they would lose my luggage. I don't know if I would fly them again just because it did make me nervous, but for a very cheap and direct flight, it was a great option.

Title: This is a new service from manchester and i booked in the second week via lastminute.com, return tickets were £130 incl check in luggage.  We could not reserve our seats online and had boarding cards issued at check in.Have flown via easyjet (Gatwick) and Ryanair (Stanstead) but was pleasantly surprised by RAM flight.  The plane is quite large, Boeing 737 but a little dated.Going to Casa flight was 20% occupied.  Leg room in economy was good, plane was clean (unlike ryanair !) and food was served about 35-40 mins after take off.  Food was ok, beef or chicken dish with soft drinks.  Tea was also served.  Staff friendly and welcoming.  Seats were leather and comfortable.  Not much in way of in flight entertainment, some do have RAM app which you can download and then watch in flight movies, others dont, so bring something along for the journey.Change over at Casa was painless, in flight instructions are provided for transit passengers, and airport has easy to follow signs.  Was a little bit worried as it said we had to change terminals to get our connecting flight, but this was v.straight forward.  We landed, went into the terminal and through security in around 5 mins and down some steps and into a waiting area.  This had wifi, but was quite crowded.  We waited for about 35 mins and then queued to board.  Agadir flight was on the same type of plane but was full.Return journey was early (7 O'clock) and around 4 hour wait in Casa, luckily the wait is in main terminal which has charging areas for gadgets and wifi.  Connecting flight was on time and food was better on way back, fish/beef options.  Overall would recommend as it saves travelling to London airports.
crvsd: Asif A wrote a review May 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I was very worried about flying with this airline after reading all of the negative reviews.  I wouldn't have booked with them on my own, but this was the carrier that was part of a very affordable tour package, so I just crossed my fingers and hoped for the best.The aircraft was a newer Dreamliner.  The seats were just ok as far as overall comfort.  The seat back entertainment system worked well on both flights and had enough content to keep me occupied.  The flight attendants hand out amenity kits with socks and an eye mask at the beginning of the flight.  Food wasn't that great, but they did make sure to hand out special meals first (I had requested the seafood option). They could have done better as far as offering water mid-flight, but it was available upon request.  The bathrooms were clean (I noticed a flight attendant servicing one mid-flight).  As far as luggage goes, they seemed ok with carry-on luggage that was reasonable.  For size reference, my husband and I were able to fly with the ebags TLS mother load mini with no problem, at or just slightly above the 10 kg weight limit.  I also carried a small handbag.  On the way back we checked one of the bags (too many souvenirs) and it arrived at baggage claim in a timely manner and unscathed.I would fly with them again on direct flights into Casablanca, but would be hesitant to make connections with them due to other reviews (as this seems to be were the problems come in).
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: NYC-Casablanca-Madrid-Casablanca-NYC in April.       1) I was shocked how naturally, without thinking, their staff serve men first and then they might notice you if you are a woman, or they might not. I never had that experience before and this is one of the things they made me feel disgust about.       2) it's also shocking how DIRTY their planes were on Casablanca-Madrid rout and back. It's not just crumbs on your seat and sugar powder on the table, it's a years-old dark dirt on plastic panels above your head, on those fans that you are supposed to touch to turn on.       3) It's awful how unhelpful their Madrid desk was. On April 23, while every other airline had its kiosk open, RAM had a sign "will be back in 5 min". I waited for TWO HOURS - from 9:15am to about 11:30am. I had an 18 hours layover in Casablanca and was trying to find out if there is a business lounge at the airport, if the airline provides shuttle to the city, how safe is it to take a cab in the middle of the night, etc. I also tried to upgrade to business class and wasn;t even given a price - there were seats in business class available, but the person was unable to even figure out the price. I was offering to pay and they couldn't take the money. How more absurd can it get? NO was her answer to my every question. She then got really irritated and lectured me saying that they are "not obliged to know about any airports". Casablanca is their major hub. They MUST know and they MUST tell. They should have flyers with basic info on them, they should have it on their website, they should make their passengers feel comfortable, not concerned and stressed out! At 4pm, that person't shift was over and I talked to her colleague who just came in. I had the same exact experience with this other person. Are they trained that way?      4)There was a lot of nonsense - can't you people give headphones simultaneously to passengers on both sides of the plane? How come left side gets them 30 min before the right side?Why do you take headphones back more than more than 90 min before landing?!      5)Why does it take almost two hours to get luggage in JFK? and no, mine wasn't lost, it's just how long did it take for the airline to take most luggage on the transporter.
crvsd: ann o wrote a review Apr 2017
qwuub: A lot of nonsense, dirty planes, unfriendly, unhelpful staff
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have had the WORST!!! experience dealing with this airline at Casablanca airport, having missed my bag check in time by 10 minutes I was told that they won't accept my luggage on my flight but "I can leave my luggage or buy a new ticket for another flight. (No other option was offered but to pay more money.) Having spoken with the 'supervisor' at check-in desk 24 today she told me the same thing, when I was pleading with her to help me she then refused to acknowledge my existence as if I was a beggar and she was then trying to speak with other passengers whilst I'm standing at the desk trying to talk to her, when I asked for her name to put into my complaint she refused to give it to me. As a paying customer I have never dealt with with such rude unhelpful people in my life they showed no compassion or understanding. I was sent to buy a new ticket and the gentleman said your checked in go and talk with the supervisor about getting your bag on the flight which leads me to believe that the woman I dealt with refused to accept my baggage because she felt like it!!! I was then told to go back to the check in desk to get my online check in cancelled which they then told me they couldn't do as they have just started to board and I was sent back to the agency office, during this time I witnessed a female royal air Maroc staff member shouting at another colleague she then approached me shouting and waving her hand in my face in an aggressive manner asking me 'what flight am getting' which quite frankly was unnecessary i didn't understand why she approached me and I had to ask her to remove her hand away from my face....so having waited 40 minutes to change my flight to the one after I was then informed that I can't get the next flight as its too late now!!! I'm stuck at Casablanca airport till tomorrow morning all because of your staff and their unwillingness to help me find a solution, I offered to pay to put my bag on the next flight and tried to explain I wouldn't mind a delay in my bag reaching gatwick. Nobody cared to listen and I felt this airline just wanted my money they don't understand what customer service is.
My advice to you Royal Air Maroc is that if you want to accommodate international travelers then you need to train your staff so they know how to talk to international travelers and so that they have an understanding of what going the extra mile is all about that's how you will keep your customers. On every review site you have bad reviews because of the attitude of your staff and their unwillingness to help and it seems you don't want to change that or you can't be bothered which one is it? I will go with the latter....I will never travel with your airline again not even if you paid me!!!! The way I have been treated today is unacceptable and has caused me a lot of distress!! Also take a look at the stale bread I was served when I flew from Gatwick the food is nothing to brag about and you should lower your prices and forget the in-flight meals I would have rather paid for edible food like I do on other budget airlines, the price is high and the service is budget with this airline. Never Ever again will I give my hard earned money to this airline I would rather swim and drown!!!

Title: ﻿"It was a low cost flight and meals were decent and flight was fine. You have to ask for wine and beer if you want it for obvious reasons.
The female traveler did not like the attitude of the staff.

You need extra time at the Casablanca airport for three security checkpoint s and if you are flying to USA be CAREFUL the new rules will not let you bring any electronics other than cell phone. Be sure your cell phone will start up so they can look at it. No worries on your electronics though. They will require you to check them at 3rd security point at the boarding gate. No charge for checking them. They will give you a baggage claim ticket. Be prepared to package them up cameras tablets etc. At JFK they had secured the electronics and would only let you get them if you had your baggage claim ticket so what we thought was going to be lost was secure.

Wish we could say same for baggage. We lost one check in bag. We normally don't check baggage and travel light but decided to check our our dirty laundry and it was lost. About 10 others had same problem and to there were unclaimed bags on belts from previous flights. I expect they will fed ex our bag to our home in a few days.
If you can accept these warnings and the flight is cheap go for it."

Title: Do NOT rely on this airline to get around in Morocco.  Our flight from Canada to Casablanca left late and we missed our connecting flight to Marrakech, along with at least 30 other people.  No effort was made to delay the departure of the connector despite that being the only flight to Marrakech that day.  Our party of 4 was able to hire a driver, but the others were left twisting in the wind with vague promises of a bus arranged by the airline.  As we left, others were giving up and trying to find the nearby train station.  No effort was made by the airline to communicate, and every time we asked an employee, we were given different information.  An awful way to start a holiday.  Our flight home departed on time and was uneventful, but the bathrooms were like nothing I had ever seen before by the end of the flight.  I would like to go to Morocco again, but I will certainly arrange alternative transport.Do not count on them at all- the slackness and lack of responsibility was like nothing we had ever seen before.  Robbery.

Title:
We sat on the tarmac for 75 minutes in Barcelona without any announcement about why the flight was delayed. Upon arrival in Casablanca, we were put through a second security check. The metal detectors were not working and one guard was screening all the passengers while 3 guards sat around doing nothing. Finally, everybody on the Dakar flight was bumped to the front of the line, which caused a huge commotion among the passengers that had been waiting for so long. At one point, we thought that there was going to be a physical altercation. The guards continued to do nothing. Two very kind French passengers allowed us to move to the front of the line so that we could catch our connection. We were among the last 10 on the flight.

Flight from Casablanca to Dakar was very pleasant. My wife (24 weeks pregnant) was badly dehydrated by the time we boarded the plane. The flight attendants gave her a full bottle of water. Airplane was a spacious Boeing 767 with several empty seats.

Overall, Royal Air Maroc is a decent airline with reasonable prices. Unfortunately, almost all flights are routed through the Casablanca Airport, which should be shut down for inefficiency and mismanagement. I would fly the airline again but ONLY if I could avoid Casablanca.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Had to be one of the longest, most exhausting experiences flying. First off, the kiosk was not printing out my boarding pass. I had no baggage to check. And they made me wait on the line with everyone checking in luggage which took over an hour( when i literally only had 4 people in front of me). After that, we get to the boarding gate, and they make everyone step outside the area, only to wait online yet again so they can search thru every ones bags one by one. Waiting in line for another hour and a half or more. No explanation and extremely poor organization added to the time dragging on. We kept asking employees to explain, and no one could answer us.
Once we got on the plane, which was already boarding late. Bathroom line was very long, as there was only 1 bathroom on our area of the plane working, only to find out the flight attendant never checked the second bathroom until after we were all done and waited 20-30 mins in line, which was not in use, it just needed to be unlocked.
Shortage of food options, I do not eat red meat, and once they got to our row they told us they were out of chicken. I rang the notification for assistance from the flight attendant several times and not once did they come check.

Title: I was VERY apprehensive about booking with RAM after reading countless scathing reviews on this and other sites.  However, I'm happy to say that we had an excellent experience with this carrier.Granted, both our outbound and return flight were slightly delayed (less than 1 hr and 1.5hrs respectively), but otherwise we had no complaints.  Ground service was organized and friendly, in-flight service was timely and pleasant.  Food, leg room, entertainment (headrest TVs) and comfort were all typical.  We were provided with eye masks, socks, blankets and headphones.Many negative reviews highlighted issues with lost/ damaged baggage, so we opted for carry-on only.  We had 45L backpacks that fit very easily in the overhead compartments.No issues with on-line check-in while in Canada, but neither on-line or kiosk check-in would work while in Morocco.  Had to check in at airport.I would book with them again, but would stick to carry-on baggage only.

Title: On February 15 I had a flight from Casablanca to London Heathrow. Checked in my luggage and seen it even on the carts outside when boarding the plane. Upon arrival in London, my luggage was not there. It got delivered 48 hours later, in the middle of the night (3AM) to my hotel. Actually what was delivered was a small amount of my dirty laundry i had in the bag. All other items, from shoes to T-Shirts, Jackets, Pants, shirts all was missing. Even medications I could not carry in my carry-on luggage went missing! Once reported to the airline finally about 3 weeks later I received an email with the request to provide all luggage tags, paperwork and invoices which I did 24 hours later. From this point on, the airline does not respond to any correspondence, phone calls are just being interrupted by hanging off on me etc. In 27 years of traveling throughout the world, I been never treated this poorly and ignored! I still trying to wage my options legally now in NY where this airline has a hub and see if I can obtain something against them! I can only warn anyone to travel with valuable clothing! This seems like organized theft and the airline does not care about! STAY AWAY FROM THIS AIRLINE!

Title:
I bought my ticket with the company and got a confirmation, receipt and e-ticket. When managing the booking on the website the status was confirmed. In other words, nothing to worry about. But suddenly, there was a day I got an email from PayPal saying that I was refunded. Zero notifications from the company and I didnt have any IDEA about what was going on. I called the Customer Support (Maroccian number, super expensive) to listen that it was an issue with my bank account. I got embaressed at the time and just accepted. Then, I came to an obvious conclusion that it was impossible to happen as the money was already debited from my account. Then, I called for a second time and after insisting a lot to understand what was going on the lady told me it was because I didnt send them my PayPal receipt and a copy of my passport and that now it was too late - I swear she said it was 'too late'. I realized they sent me an email in FRENCH saying that I had a deadline to send them the docs until 10th. On 16th I was notified about the refund!! Six days after my ticket being cancelled!! A week before my flight!!!

HONESTLY, avoid it AT-ALL!

Title: Booked a last minute flight to Madrid with less than 7 days notice.  RAM came up cheapest and had the best times that worked for my schedule.  It was not till later that I realized the horrific reviews that RAM had and wished I paid the extra, I was quite nervous!!!  Flying out from JFK to CMN basically matches other reviews of the airline.  Horrible service, flight attendants paid no attention and acted like they do not speak any English.  Inflight entertainment did not work. The flight attendants would ignore service calls.  I would have to walk to the back to request water, They would only give a little tiny cup.  When I reached CMN and connected to my MAD connection, I was surprised with the connection.  I felt the staff was trying hard to deliver good service.  They did struggle with language barrier, but were putting efforts always smiling and pleasant.  The return flights were also about the same, the staff tried hard and mostly pleasant.  Two common things about all the flights I flew with RAM was the food and lack of customer service at checkin and gates.  The food was quite horrible and limited. The food was prepared with to much salt.  Portions were tiny and not appetizing.  All flights had same boring selections, that would stink up the cabin when they started serving. The bread was always stale.  On the customer service during check in/ gate, they were rude, would not answer basic questions such as seat assignments.  At the gate finding a RAM representative was inpossible.   I did give the airline an average rating, because they did not loose my luggage, seems that with RAM it is quite common.  Hopefully this airline will get it together soon, my impression was that they are trying but not getting there. I did recently read that Qatar  Airways is possibly taking 30% stake in the Airline, hopefully they will help make improvements if that happens.  On a positive not if you do fly RAM you will get the same similar service that American Airlines delivers (if you can consider that positive).

Title: On February 26, 2017, my husband, my daughter and I were traveling back to Algiers via Casablanca from Marrakech.  Our Flight #AT402 was scheduled to leave at 9:00.  When we arrived at the airport at 7:00 a.m., we were informed that the flight was delayed to fog.  This was understandable as there was considerable fog at that time.  Two hours after the scheduled departure time, we were told by a gate agent that the plane would be there in 10 minutes.  Another hour passed....no word on the flight.  When I noticed that the flight had been removed from the board above the check-in desk, I inquired as to the status of the flight to Casablanca.  The gate agent responded, "Cancelled"....no further explanation.  When I asked what we were supposed to do, he said "a manager is coming".  After another long waiting period, the manager arrived and we were told that we would be going by bus for a three-hour drive to Casablanca and that the bus was waiting at Arrivals.  Also, they would put us up in a hotel in Casablanca for the night.  With no explanation as to how to get back to arrivals, we headed back the way we came into the departure terminal.  At the bottom of the steps, a gentleman stopped us and after explaining our situation to him, he brought us back upstairs to the same gate we had just come from.  My husband explained to him again what we had been told by the manager.  He spoke with several employees and led us outside to an door which eventually led to Arrivals.  Once we found the bus(es), there was much confusion again as to the procedure to follow.  Some of the buses were designated for tour groups.  We eventually boarded a bus (small van) and were driven three and a half hours to the Casablanca airport.  When we arrived at the airport, the driver just put us out at the curb with our luggage...again no explanation as to what we were supposed to do.  So, we (along with four or five other vans of passengers) headed to the entrance of the airport.  We assumed at this point that we were to rebook a flight for the next day to Casablanca.  When we arrived at the Royal Air Maroc check-in desk, there was only one person who was capable of handling the situation.  Complaints were made by several of our fellow passengers, but they were told that only one agent had the "code".  Eventually, another window was opened and we were able to rebook our flight for the next day and were told to go to Accommodations to receive a hotel and food voucher.  Once that was accomplished, we headed outside to look for the hotel courtesy van.  A short ride to the Relax Hotel.  We were given two rooms - one for me and my husband, and one for our daughter.  In short, a terrible hotel....no towels in either room.  We asked for towels.  When they did not arrive by 11:00 p.m., we asked again....the desk clerk said "you have already asked" and just laughed.  The next morning (after it was too late to shower), a housekeeper knocked on the door and inquired about towels....she did not have any with her!  Dinner the night before was cold spaghetti, cold chicken slices and cold sausage links.  Breakfast was not much better.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: the services are definatelly in need of improvement and quality. Also the transit time are not good, we spend more hours waitin gin Casablanca than travelling

Title:
Flew with RAM to Brazil and back with a stopover in Casablanca.
During my stopover in Casablanca -which was essentially a whole-day which allowed me to visit the city- I was provided with a hotel which was lacking quality (including cleanliness), including bad food options. However, I do not blame RAM for this as this is a nice service they provide free of charge. One can always arrange alternative options. I did not as my arrival was late at night but would consider doing so in the future.
Planes were comfortable, especially on the long-haul flights. The state of the planes on short-haul flights was subject to improvement.
I loved the fact they offer a decent food option on the short-haul flights, free of charge. Long haul food was also good apart from the second meal (breakfast) which was basically a plain sandwich.
Baggage allowance is generous (2pcs/per person in Y for long haul flights) and bags arrived in time.
Had no hassles nor problems with this company and would recommend flying with them. I have to admit, I might be a little bit overly positive due to the bad reviews one can find here on TripAdvisors due to which I expected the worst.
Points of improvement are surely there but there are companies way worse with a better reputation here on TA.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We started our flight on 22nd of December from Washington DC (USA) to London-Gatwick (UK) with a stopover in Casablanca. Although we had paid for the tickets to London-Gatwick Royal Air Maroc changed our tickets to London-Heathrow without previous notification. We arrived a little bit late in Casablanca; however my wife and I were able to get to the London-Gatwick boarding gate on time.
There, we were informed that our tickets were no longer valid to LGW and had been changed to LHR that was the beginning of the chaos situation that Royal Air Maroc led us during the Christmas time.
We took the LHR flight 2 hours later arriving in UK on 23rd December, but our baggage remained in Casablanca. From 23rd to 27th December I called the customer service phone number hundreds of times, getting always the same answer: nobody knew where my bags were.
Since nobody from the poor customer service department called me, I had to go myself to LGW airport again and deal with the handling company. Finally I was allowed to get into the LGW baggage storage area and could pick my baggage up. Neither a call nor an email from Royal Air Maroc was received during those 4 days waiting for my cases. That’s what I called a company which doesn’t care of customers.
Royal Air Maroc messed up my wife and I Christmas vacation, losing our baggage for 4 days and falling into extra expenses to bring us from LHR to LGW airport. But the story still remains and today 2/16 I haven’t received yet a call back or an email from Royal Air Maroc letting me know the status of my claim#275187 . When calling them they hold me for an eternity running my call in circles from different departments until somebody pick it up, then the same answer: ”somebody from our customer service team will contact on you”, of course nobody call or email me
Despite Royal Air Maroc covers the extra expenses generated there is nothing they can do to relieve us about all the inconveniences caused and the poor customer service assistance we received from the staff in Casablanca airport and over the phone. This was the first and most likely the last time we use Royal air Maroc to fly from USA to Europe.

Title:
Booking with Royal Air Maroc was a terrible mistake!!!!!! Extremely disappointing...

I booked a flight from Nairobi to Sao Paulo on Expedia for Monday 5th December 2016. Everything was OK up until Saturday 3rd December 2016. Expedia sent an e-mail reminder of the upcoming trip and gave an option for online check-in. I tried this but the airline website showed that online check in was not an option from Nairobi. I informed the passenger that he had to check-in at the airport instead. Come Monday morning, the date of travel, he called me saying that his ticket had been suspended. His flight was to depart at 9:30 AM. He was at the airport more than 3 hours before his flight. There was no way he was too late for check-in!!! Furthermore, the airline's system showed no reason for the suspension. At all!! So basically, they suspended his ticket with no prior notice, no reason, and no option to book him on a later flight or refund. They asked us to contact our agent, who was Expedia. Their systems, by the way, showed that all travel details were intact. Expedia also informed us that they had no ability to suspend an airline ticket that had been issued and paid for. Both our efforts (mine and Expedia's) to try and find out from the airline the reason behind the suspended ticket were futile. All they could say is that they could not tell why it was suspended (if they can't tell us, who can???)

Up until now, we have had no response/explanation from Royal Air Maroc regarding this matter. All subsequent attempts to reach them for an explanation have ended in the same manner, with them saying that they cannot tell why the ticket was suspended and that we should contact our agent (Expedia). I have tried contacting the head office via the Nairobi office as the airline staff were witnesses to the passenger's ordeal; I assumed they would be able to help somehow.

This matter remains unresolved, but I am still pushing to find out why this happened. And the icing on the cake? They say I cannot be refunded for this ticket as it's a "lost value ticket".

Royal Air Maroc should not be able to get away with such unexplained mishaps and really really bad customer service. Not even one person took time to explain to me the reasons behind the suspension or apologize for their lack of information/comprehension of the suspended ticket.
crvsd: Skyship C wrote a review Feb 2017

Title:
After reading the revviews here, we expected to hate our lives and lose our luggage, but frankly, RAM was nicer than the US Carriers we frequent.

There was a 30 minute delay in our departure from COO Cotonou to CMN Casablanca due to thunderstorms. Given our 90 minute connection in Casablanca shrinking to 60, and our reading of the horror show that is CMN, it was a source of anxiety.

There were perhaps 20 or 30 people in our 737 departing COO, so everyone had an entire row if they wanted one. Food service was a cheese sandwich, 2 rounds of beverages, plus coffee or tea. In-flight entertainment was strange, being mostly cartoons, so we played with iPads.

The connection in CMN involves a bus from the plane to the terminal, a small security screening of our carry-on luggage, and a passport check. There are digital boards with gate assignments (contrary to one report) We took 40 minutes in total to go through formalities and make our gate. We already have Moroccan tourist IDs, having been here two months ago, so it's possible that the registration causes some people delays. There were 5 teams for immigration doing the data entry, and queue was never more than 2 people deep.

There are no "gate now boarding" announcements, and a lot of the waiting room chairs are not in view of the gate -- so pay attention. Half the plane boarded before we noticed.

CMN-BCN was another nice run. Plane was about 75% full, so nobody sat in a middle seat who didn't want to be. Food was a tagine-like beef stew, lentils, roll, and one beverage service plus coffee or tea. More strange in-flight entertainment.

Our checked bags were accounted for, which was nice since we departed in a rush and had about 2,000 EUR in cash checked -- a no-no we usually avoid. They were at the carousel before we could get there.

Staff on both flights were professional and polite.

Our backpacks which were checked definitely had a rough ride -- I had a mesh side pocket torn by the machinery. My fault, really. There is a saran-wrapping machine in COO that you should definitely use. Both bags look like they took a tumble on the tarmac, as they're dirtier than we checked them. Dinged one star for the checked bag abuse. Every other bag seemed plastic-wrapped, so this is partly us just not knowing the drill.

Overall, a very pleasant surprise, and inexpensive to boot. The planes were clean and seemed in good repair (newer 737-800 models). Would use them again if presented the opportunity. They were 1/4 of the price for other options for this strange route.
crvsd: Mike B wrote a review Jan 2017
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Do not do it!!!!!

This was my second time flying air maroc. I know, why would I do it again? I was flying with a friend to Sierra Leone (my homeland), and she wanted to kill two birds with one stone and take advantage of the 12 hour layover in Casablanca (which we did). We had a great time in Casablanca. My nightmare started at JFK, after asking several times, at booking, after booking, and the check in desk, for a bassinet for my infant, I did not get one. When I asked the flight attendant, she initially ignored me, when I persisted she indicated "I can not answer that right now". We got to Casablanca pretty smoothly. The layover hotel was okay, though we spent most of our time outside of the hotel. We headed back to the airport to board out 12am flight to FNA (Freetown National Airport). We first started getting notifications that the flight was 30 minutes delayed, then 45 minutes, then 2 hours. Passengers started asking questions, they told us the captain nor any of the flight crew had shown up. We asked how this was possible, they told us that the crew was outsourced and it was possible that they missed their flight. All passengers demanded more information, when the managers and other staff came they indicated to us they would take us to a hotel 15 minutes away and we would be flying at 7 am the next morning. The bus took us to a hotel an hour away and literally dumped us there. When we got there (at this point at around 2:30 am), the hotel staff indicated we needed vouchers and they did not have any record for us to stay in the hotel. He indicated that they would "try to get us a room", he was processing everyone manually, people were calling RAM on personal phones, it was a mess! At this point we made a decision to go back to the airport. It was already 3 am, and we figured how much sleep would we really get if the flight was taking off at 7 am. We got back to the airport and met up with other passengers who either decided to do the same thing or never left the airport in the first place. Customs refused to let us through, indicating there is no scheduled flight for us! After about 4 hours of various passengers demanding answers from various managers and staff, they told us our flight would be at 9 am. I must mention that during this whole ordeal, I went up to several staff members to ask them for help since i had an infant with me, I was sometimes laughed at, or staff would say "I do not speak English" with a smirk on their face. I was waved off and dismissed. When we boarded the flight at 9 am, they did not have any seat assignments, people sat anywhere meaning families got separated. There was no space for carry on luggage and they started stacking luggage in the bathroom (there must be some safety regulation against this). We finally got to Freetown and thank God all my bags were there. Let's call a spade a spade, many parts of North Africa have a superior complex with being fairer skinned and believe they are not even African and prefer to associate themselves with the middle east. For years, RAM has not respected their West African customers. Condescending, rude remarks, disregard and disdain. I do not blame anyone but the countries for allowing this joke of an airline to continue to run in their skies, but I also blame us the consumers who continue to use this airline when for a couple of hundred more (sometimes the same price), you can use a European Carrier and at the very least be spoken to like a human being. NEVER AGAIN!
crvsd: Yanoh J wrote a review Jan 2017

Title:
This review I sent directly to the company a few months ago and their course of action was non existent, I received no compensation/incentive to fly again with them, there was a lack of a meaningful apology. Here is the story:
So, I bought four flights which were from Geneva to Casablanca then Rio Brazil and the same again returning home. **18th/19th July - 13/14th August 2016**
"All flights with your company were horrible. The staff were utterly rude. From Geneva to Casablanca, when the food were being served, it was a meat dish. I am vegetarian and since I booked my flights through a travel agent I never had the option to notify I was a vegetarian. So I tried asking the air hostess if she had any alternatives for me and she just shouted back at me in arabic. So the lady sitting beside me kindly intervened and translated. Upon translating, the air hostess says to me 'you eat this or have nothing!' and she continued to serve everyone around me and ignore my calling. I couldnt believe it. I was so hungry. I tried to speak to a male host for help and he seemed to not care at all. He didnt even look the slightest bit interested to be on this flight nor speak to me. All our staff were rude and unprofessional. They looked like they hated their job. The women in my row of seats were shocked too which made the head manager of the plane come over to assess the problem. She said she would find me a salad from business class, which she did but during that time a vegetarian hot meal appeared from another staff member, so after all that they did have food for me, they just didn't want to try or bother until the fuss was made.
Next flight, from Casa to Rio, same issue with food and this time they had nothing for me and didnt care or try to find me anything and all staff ignored me completely, leaving me hungry for 9 hours. Half way through the flight I was so thirsty and asked for water and the staff member said no and told me to wait until coffee and tea had been served. So i waited 30 minutes gasping of thirst until eventually they came around with small cups of water.

When I was flying home from Rio to Casa, I was next faced with more unprofessional staff members. I pre ordered my vegetarian meal days before after learning my lesson the time before and the woman sitting beside me on the plane pre ordered one too, but when the ''same'' meals came, mine looked different to hers. She had more vegetables and a packet of crackers and bread. I had none of that, the staff member serving the food didnt bother to add those extras onto my tray. So i rang the bell as I had butter and jam but no bread or crackers to put it on, and I cant believe it but that light bell stayed on for the remainder of the flight (3 more hours)... NO ONE CAME. Staff walked past but completely ignored. I am utterly shocked.
Lastly, one particular staff member tried speaking to me a few times during the flight; he was very forward and tried to make a pass at me several times. I told him it was my birthday on the flight so I wondered if I could order some wine or champagne, his response was waving a bottle of champagne in my face but telling me I cant have it unless I meet him in a bar in Casablanca after the plane lands. Disgusting bribery. I rejected his offer of course. "

dmrsr: Canton of Geneva - Rio de Janeiro

Title:
I was not impressed with service on this airline. The plane was delayed for about two hours, and airline staff did not deem it necessary to inform travelers as to why, or how long it would take before boarding and take-off. When asked, they were rude and unhelpful. This delay caused me to almost miss my connective flight - and when I asked for help with exiting the plane or getting to the terminal sooner (transfer was via bus service), the staff was again very unhelpful.

When I reached my destination, both my bags were missing. The rep at the airport told me they would be delivered to my home the next day. Three days later, they still have not arrived and I just learned that they were sent 'by mail', as the airline insists on doing things in the cheapest way possible. No call was made to inform me about this, and apparently bags will reach me almost a week after I reached my destination. If one wants to lodge a complaint, a letter has to be sent to a PO Box in Prague. Hm.

Food was terrible (but that's pretty normal with most airlines though), and I personally did not like that staff came through the cabin with food, drinks, duty free and so many other things for a huge chunk of the night flight. Some sleeping passengers were even woken up by the staff.

Overall, not a great experience.
crvsd: Śrīla D wrote a review Jan 2017
qwuub: Long delays with no communication, lost baggage, terrible food
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I flew coach (solo) from NYC to Marrakech and business (with adult daughter) on the return.  While the amenities and seating were obviously superior in business, I received better treatment overall in coach.   To start, an airline that gets me from Point A to Point B in one piece and without having feared for my life will earn at least a two.  With that said:  Coach:  Flight was packed with a ton of crying babies--last thing you want on a long flight, but obviously not in the airline's control.   Food was decent and service was pretty attentive.  Boarding was slow and somewhat disorganized, but not horrible.   Main issue on this flight was one member of check-in personnel.  She argued with one of the flight attendants (not sure what she was saying) then pushed by me as she departed the plane--I mean literally pushed me out of the way as she went through the aisle.  Left me with very low expectations of what was to come, but thankfully this was the worst of it.Business:  Seating is very comfortable.  As there were weather delays (we were initially rerouted to Boston), I was very happy to be in these seats.   Food was plentiful and pretty good, as were the entertainment options.   Issue here was treatment, and I'm sad to say that race definitely played a factor (I am African American).   When my daughter and I first headed toward Business, personnel on the ground said "no, no--this way" (i.e., we were directed towards Coach).   When we responded that we were in Business and showed him our tickets, he said "okay" (no apology).   When we began to climb the stairs to Business, the flight attendant said "no--you're going the wrong way."  The ground personnel then motioned to him that it was okay.   I am not one to attribute every bad experience to race, but this was clear.  I won't belabor the point, as I know people are dealing with much worse than being assumed not to possibly be able to afford Business, but I paid a lot for the experience and this definitely tainted it (service on board was fine but not as attentive as I'd expect in Business).  We'd also read reviews that Business passengers were taken to the plane in a separate van.  That did not happen (we were in a hot bus with everyone else).  Not sure what happened there (maybe reviews were wrong or I missed an announcement...).Overall, I commend the flight attendants on the flight to RAK (Coach) and the plane designers and chefs on the return (Business).   My ratings below (re legroom, food, etc) are based on Business flight.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The heading says it all.  Avoid.  Only reason I took this was relative price, and I've learnt a lesson not to do that. The food on the onward flight was barely eatable (Chicken / fish). On the return they had *only* beef - which we don't eat. Their response was basically "in your face" - don't eat then.   My regret was only packing only 1  sandwich before boarding - instead of 4.Their ground operations were a joke .. literally -  some of the security screening staff were just standing around cracking jokes with their colleagues. The check-in desk at Casa Blanca who were responsible for transiting our luggage on to Madrid messed up in front of our own eyes, and we lost a suitcase.Luckily Iberia (alliance partner to RAM) lost-luggage desk at Madrid are  way more efficient, and we got our luggage in 2 days.I give them a 3 star because they got us safely back home - there was heightened security while boarding at Cas Blanca to DC, given the recent terrorist events.  Some of the curiosity / interest I had about visiting Morocco has clearly worn off unfortunately.

Title: After a poor experience flying with Royal Air Maroc, I initiated talks with the customer service about the litigation. If they don't hang up the phone right away, they just let you wait (with some poor background music) until you hang up. This is not to mention the poor condition of planes, service, seats, cleanliness, etc in flights. A scandal from a company that claims the 4 stars from Skytrax. Avoid at all costs!

Title:
Royal Air Maroc is the worst Airline flying into and out of Sierra Leone and Africa at large. Why? They have a terrible customer service in Freetown, Lungi, in flight and on the phone in the US and Morocco. They are corrupt and their corruption starts with the Manager at Lungi. Their agents lack the simple concept of good customer service. They lack simple communication skills. Most of their air attendance cannot speak proper English and as a result are unable to make proper announcements in flights. The transit process at Casablanca's Mohammed V International Airport (CMN) is also the worse I have ever had. The agents at the airport do not communicate well, they refuse to provide passengers with accommodation and when they do, it’s a lounge at the corner of the airport that is usually over crowded, and dirty with no food or water. Casablanca's Mohammed V International Airport (CMN) Airport do not even have proper internet connection for stranded passengers to communicate. When a flight is delayed or cancelled, passengers have to figure it out themselves by checking flightstates.com. Royal Air Maroc staff do not have the simple communication skill to inform passengers about their delayed flights or cancelled flights. The Manager at Lungi International Airport is corrupt and one of the staff that should not be serving people in Sierra Leone. He will pull passengers he likes or that pays him money from the back of the queue and put them in front of others. He did this to me and when I confronted him on December 27th, he threatened to not let me fly. I stood up to him anyway. He was rude to me and other passengers, unprofessional and not fit to do business in the hospitality business. This airline should be banned from flying to Sierra Leone and Africa. Air Morocco is losing and leaving behind baggage of passengers during every flight to Sierra Leone without compensation. I do not recommend this airline to anyone flying to Sierra Leone or Africa.

My story started when my December 26th, 5:30AM flight was delayed. There was no one to communicate the information to passengers. Someone came and whispered in my air that the flight is delayed and will not arrive until 1:30PM. This person told me there is a bus outside taking passengers to the Hotel. I had to announce this information to other stranded passengers. We walked out to the bus which was also unorganized. When we arrived at the hotel, the hotel staff at Lungi Airport Hotel were incapable of handling all the passengers. They were also rude, unprofessional and not fit for purpose. They were giving rooms to people who they knew or have paid them money on the side. I spend more than 2hrs trying to get a simply room to sleep and wait. In the morning, the hotel staff tried to help us move back to the airport. They were collecting our luggage without tagging them which means, anyone can claim another person’s luggage without them knowing. I refused to let my luggage out of sight for this reason. When we arrived at Casablanca's Mohammed V International Airport (CMN) Airport around 3PM, we missed our flight to New York. We spent more than 7hours trying to fight with Air Morocco staff for accommodation. Out flight to New York was scheduled for 3:30AM on December 28th. After hours of fighting with words, the finally gave me and another person accommodation at the Airport Hotel. We went to the hotel and stood there for another 3 hours just to check into the hotel. There was no hotel attendance at the desk. We finally got a room at 11PM and slept for 2hours. On our way to New York, a passenger was serious sick. We stopped at some island in the middle of the ocean to hand the sick passenger to emergency services. We were at this island for more than three hours and during this time, none of the air attendance said a word to any of the more than 200 passengers on board. We were in the dark and did not know why we landed, were we landed, when we will depart for our final destination. No food or water was served. After hours of waiting, I asked them the question, where are we and why no one is telling us the next steps. Their response was, we will depart in 15 minutes. We eventually departed in 20 minutes. On our way to the New York, the flight attendance did not offer an apology, they did not explain why we stopped, they did not inform passengers who may have missed their transit flights what the next steps will be. We sat there and finally arrived in New York at 9:45AM.
crvsd: Tamba L wrote a review Dec 2016
qwuub: Royal Air Maroc is the worst Airline flying into and out of Sierra Leone and Africa

Title:
I went for a vacation to Morocco this thanksgiving along with six other families. While there wasn't any issue with the vacation itself ( we enjoyed it in fact thanks to the tireless efforts put in by Youssef Ouibza and team from Key Travels- separate review), the travel from Washington DC to Casablanca and back on Royal Air Maroc left an extremely bad taste. Here are a few of the observations that will hopefully be of help to any future passengers and more importantly to RAM so they could improve their service levels.

Food
Inspite of advance vegetarian meal selection there was limited to non existent vegetarian options for main meals and snacks. On our outward (AT219 IAD to CMN on Nov 17th, 2016) the snack was basically a cup of fruit. When asked if there was anything else, the cabin crew basically said that I had an option to eat meat. Last time you checked, I did not delegate my rights to the cabin crew to decide on my dietary preference. On the return leg we were given a cheese sandwich in the same container as a turkey sandwich. It's not as though Moroccan cuisine is lacking in vegetarian options, it is a simple case of faulty meal planning by RAM.

Cabin
The rest rooms aren't clean and for some reason the the deodorizer doesn't exist or isn't working. The flight from IAD to CMN or verge return isn't as long as some of the flights to the middle east the rest rooms are something that are best avoided within a few hours of flight time. Contrast that to 14 hour non stop flights like Emirates, Etihad and Qatar. The restrooms in those airlines are a lot cleaner.

Check in experience
CMN can best be described as chaotic.The signage is pretty confusing and for an English speaker, a challenge that could possibly cause you to miss your flight.The airline itself doesn't have consistent approach to check in process. Case in point, we took a connector flight from Marrakech Menara to CMN and some of my friends had used a kiosk to check in. Of the folks who took the kiosk check route, some were waved through to boarding without an issue and one friend was told that the kiosk check in would not work. He missed his flight and was told hat he had to re book on a different flight home. This is entirely arbitrary making the impression on RAM that much more negative. Overall, RAM is best avoided if you do not want to have issues with your vacation.
qwuub: My experience with Royal Air Maroc
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The flying experience was good. Food was good and even above average in my opinion, nicely spiced Moroccan food when travelling outbound from Casablanca. Legroom above average. No inflight entertainement - but well, I could read a book finally.

Two instances I want to report, one very bad, the other good, as an anecdote.

1) We had spent 3 days in Morocco on our way to Congo, when checking in the lady says that our visa is valid from the 18th of October but that we were the 17th. I said yes, we arrive on the 18th at 3am so it's ok. She says no, we cannot fly, It's the date of departure that counts. (What? Can I see a text of law please?) She confirms this with the manager. We are a family with three children aged 0-2-4. Now imagine us. I ask to speak to her manager right away. My wife who is much more diplomatic and wise than me has a 30 seconds talk with the manager, who says ok you can go. .... I let you imagine the kind of mental strain such a situation can have. You cannot do this to passengers, I kept telling myself. How can you do this.

2) When disembarking, just before doors had opened, my son walked in front of business class passengers and so I followed him to be close to him. When the door opened, the chef de cabine asked me and my son to come near them, but it was a very nice and delicate way to let business class passengers disembark first, and then me and my son, which was very fair and I thought this was so so professional of him.

Title:
Unfortunately, it was not the only time happens with this airline.
I had to use it for several years, having to travel to Morocco for work because there is no otyher fron Madrid to Casablanca. Never ever leaved on time, the treatment on the plane is bad, always leaves late and never apologize or respond for the delay.
And it was not differente on the trip to Rio de Janiero the delay was a full day, instead of going straight to Rio de Janiero as was the booking, we went to Sao Paulo and then Rio, so 4 hours more of delay and no one repond. I received my suitcase broken, full of OIL/Graza, half of my clothes were completely stains of oil; a loss about almost 500EUR only they recognized 149 of them.
the worst that is not a cheap airline, is really expensive

Title:
The company CHANGED THREE TIMES the departure time over the week before the departure date, which made my itinerary impossible as the timing for connections were not matching anymore. I reached to the customer service to find me a solution, yet they were unhelpful and were even irritated I would call for such matter.

I finally found a new itinerary myself and decided to call them so that they could make the necessary changes. They answered and did it, or claimed they did. When I arrived at the airport no changes were made and thus I was faced with either missing the flight or buying AGAIN all tickets (more than EUR 500), which I did.

When back from my trip, I filled a complaint to have them reimburse the extra costs, but after 5 emails and multiple attempts to reach the relevant service I still haven't heard from them. It is a shame that a national company behaves like that. Avoid to use this company, it will change departure time without notice, planes are poorly maintained and customer service is the worse I ever encountered. Take it from someone that flies 40-50 times a year.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
where to start...

My initial flight at 18:10 from london heathrow to casablanca was delay by 3 hours. then my connecting flight from casablanca was delayed by 10 hours. i was stuck at casablanca airport with a 13 month old baby. i went to the transit desk and had to literally beg for at least 2 hours in a room full of people who flights were also delayed or canceled. after 2 hours was given a hotel then transport to the hotel took another hour. which was very unorganized in the end had to get a taxi to the hotel. extremely terrible experience!

on the way back from agadir my original flight at 23:30 AT0482 was delayed so we were rushed on to the 20:20 which was delayed to 21:30 lucky we were at the airport early.

our connecting flight from casablanca to london heathrow was 18 hours later at 16:30 on 25/10/16 when we went to the transit desk we were told we will not get a hotel. even though before I left England i called the airline who told me the airline will provide a hotel if the lay over was over 8 hours the airline would provide a hotel which did not happen i had to pay 980 morrocan dirham for a room which i expect compensated in full. the staff at the transit desk were very rude to say the least were not interested in anything i had to say and not willing to answer any questions either we were just told 'sorry no hotel if you have any question go ask manager' however there was no manager around as other staff had told us he wasn't in for another 3 hours. we called royal air maroc when we arrived in England and were told we should have been given a hotel for the 18 hours transit! which we were refused even after 2 hours of trying to tell the staff at the Casablanca airport that we had confirmed this before we set off from London as we didn't want any stress travelling with an infant!

I missed my transfer from airport to hotel due to delays and more 13 hours of my holiday wasted due to such a terrible airline honestly the worst holiday of my life. it was my sons first flight and holiday which turned out to be a nightmare because of royal air maroc the "royal" needs to be removed from their name! if you want a trouble hassle free travel AVOID ROYAL AIR MAROC
crvsd: paul w wrote a review Oct 2016

Title:
I found myself on the evening flight from Casablanca to Abidjan recently. Both my colleague and I were travelling business. Check in was easy and we made it through the controls without too much hassle. Then we made a beeline to the RAM lounge which was nice and peaceful.

The flight was on time. We had seats in the first row which was not a good idea as the legroom is obviously restricted by the bulkhead in front. As we settled in the pre flight non alcoholic drinks were distributed. No champagne here...

The 4 hour flight was trouble free. The meal was OK - I avoided the main course which looked horrible and focused on the cheese board.

The two cabin crew who looked after us were not very communicative. They seemed to be just going through the motions. My request for a gin tonic was met with the delivery of an empty glass and a can of tonic water. And when the young stewardess was wheeling the coffee trolley around at the end of the meal she studiously neglected to offer any of the digestifs.

But what bugged me the most was the seats. They were broad enough but failed to recline more than a few inches making sleep impossible for me. And there was absolutely no entertainment provided... Wow. Despite arriving 20 minutes ahead of schedule I deplaned in a tetchy, tired mood. It was in the middle of the night after all.

This is another airline which will only get my vote if there is no other choice.
qwuub: Poor quality - how come other airlines seem to get it so right in comparison?
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Unfortunately we didn't have a lot of choice when booking our flights to Marrakech due to our dates of travel, so we rolled with it. Part of travelling with certain airlines is you will be required to travel from the gate to the aircraft (this wasn't an issue for us as much as people smoking next to the bus when there was jet fuel less than 10 metres away, that I found frightening).

Our plane we had to catch was late from wherever it flew from and therefore made us late getting into Casablanca, we had to transit there to catch our next place to Marrakech. When we arrived in Marrakech, it soon became apparent even though we had made the flight, our labelled (Short Transit) bags had not. Which meant we had to travel into the desert (for 3 days) with the clothes we had arrived in. Not ideal.

Our accommodation found luggage the following day whilst we were in transit and bags were kept at the airport until our return. Airline doesn't arrange to have your bags dropped off to your accommodation, you have to make your way back to airport at own expense to collect your bags. So this just added insult to injury. Two security checks to get to where bags were saw us both loose our sunglasses. Security personnel near lost bags were dodgy.

Staff on the return leg were very unhelpful on the return trip when trying to check in, they directed us to the wrong area and where we thought check-in was, actually was where it was.It was just a really disappointing experience. It would go a long way to improving customer service if they took care of getting lost luggage to your hotel or Riad rather than making customers (who may be tired from travelling) come and collect them from the airport.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This flight has been slated by many other reviews, as has the airline. My experience is that RAM provide an efficient, pleasant and inexpensive option from Heathrow at a peak slot time.

The 737-800 was clean and comfortable, the staff were helpful and friendly from check in, boarding, on board and on the ground at Casablanca.

The inflight food was not exceptional but I had the beef and green beans option for my main which was quite acceptable as I had not paid Michelin star prices. My smoked salmon and cream cheese starter was a delicious morsel and a yoghurt dessert rounded it off nicely with coffee

The flight was only about 30% full so it would have been better to have had a soft drink refill without asking but I guessed that was company policy rather than staff indifference as the cabin crew were friendly, talkative and even joking.

I hope my internal flight in Morocco and my return journey prove as acceptable.

Title:

then i asked for the other options and i had to take the flight for next day, confirmed my email address on the phone to send me the updated ticket then the agent put me on hold, the call lasted for 37 minutes and then told me that the shift is done and had to transfer the call to another agent.
call is transferred without explaining to the other agent who wasn't speaking english so didn't understand me and had to transfer the call to another agent who dropped the call.

no ownership at all or professional customer service that made me to regret choosing this airline.

Title: When we arrived in Casablanca we learned that because my passport had been stamped (in error) and my husband's had not, he was allowed to collect luggage and recheck it for our trip to Madrid. I could not collect my luggage or check in for our Madrid flight due to the custom agent's error in Fez. We were shuffled from one Royal Maroc agent after another being sent back and forth between several parts of the airport. Not one of them would cancel the stamp so we could proceed. Finally the customs people sent us to the office of the Royal Maroc Ticket Manager. After waiting in a long line the Manager addressed us condescendingly and dismissed us to an uncomfortable waiting area while she sat at her desk doing nothing.  At this point we were becoming concerned that we would be stranded in this airport and would miss our connecting flight while our luggage remained on the carousel in the baggage area. The Ticket Manager finally rudely and aggressively confronted us and offered no assistance. At this point we called a travel agent's emergency number even though they had not made this reservation. We returned for the fourth time to the customs department. Due to our own actions and help from the outside travel agency we solved our own problem. Royal Air Maroc did nothing to assist us. It is a risk to fly with Royal Air Maroc.
crvsd: Mary C wrote a review Sep 2016
qwuub: Alert:  Do not fly Royal Air Maroc. Stranded in Casablanca

Title:
Check in at Barcelona airport was fast and the clerks very helpful. We flew from Barcelona airport to Casablanca. Inflight service was good and the stewards and stewardesses very pleasant. Seat were fairly comfortable.
We had an 8 and a half-hour wait in Casablanca and Royal Air Maroc provided a hotel with lunch and dinner very near the airport. That sounded wonderful.
The problem was that the airport staff at Casablanca airport made us waste 3 hours sending us from one place to another. Shere incompetence!
When we eventually got to the hotel, it was too late for lunch and dinner was served after we had to take the bus back to the airport. The hotel staff kindly offered us some food before we left.
Both flights were very punctual and we got to Dakar on time. I'd heard numerous horror stories about luggage being "lost", but we recovered our suitcase and rucksack fairly quicly at Dakar airport.
So, I will definitely fly with Royal Air Maroc again as they really did everything they could to make our flights as pleasant as possible.
qwuub: Good service, long wait between connecting flights
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I took a flight from Heathrow to Agadir, with a connection in Cassablanca.
The connecting flight was delayed by four hours. When the flight finally left it tried to land at Agadir but somehow missed the runway and dramatically climbed back into the air. There was only an announcement in Arabic, but I assumed as the screams stopped, that everything was OK. An hour later we landed. Again no announcement. As if turned out we were now in Maracech.
We were made to wait in the plane for an hour. No water, no explanantion.
The doors were opened and we were told to go through immigration. It was only that there were a few helpful Moroccan travelers on the plane, that I discovered there was a bus waiting to take us to Agadir (our original destination)
The bus waited for an hour, and then headed to Agadir....again no water, no explanation.
We were dropped about 4km outside of Agadir. Thanks again for the helpful Moroccans for explaining this to me as there was no help from the staff. After 2 expensive taxi journeys and a 5 hour trip that took 27 hours I finally arrived at my destination.
I don't usually complain about things as I just take it as its all part of the experience. But this was a near death experience, with no help from any of the staff and no provisions for the basic necessities of existence such as water.
I will never fly with this company again and seriously advise any other traveler to seek other options. I consider myself fortunate that I was alone and not with a family and young kids.
Terrible terrible terrible experience. However the rest of the Moroccan experience was fantastic and I would visit again at the drop of a hat....just on a boat or with a different airline.
crvsd: Martin H wrote a review Sep 2016
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
The worst flight I have ever ever been on. Both ways!! So much so that my kids were really dreading the return flight. If I had the money, I would not have flown with them on the return leg. Where do I start... No inflight entertainment whatsoever. Nothing at at all. Traveling with two kids. Not even a must station to listen to, no colouring books, I'm just shocked beyond words. A transatlantic flight. Surely some aviation laws were broken.
Food was not fit for human consumption- truly inedible. Every the rolls we're so burnt and hard the kids couldn't manage it with the spread. Very limited alcohol as I was three rows from the front and I asked for red wine and it was finished. Just beer left I was told. We've only just boarded the plane, did they restock at all.
Coming back was same thing but even worse as I was not verbally assaulted by their engineer who decided he needed three seats so he could get some sleep and I had to move. He even physically pushed me to get me off the seat. When I complained, the stewards just spoke in Arabic to him and yet did nothing. Only when another kind gentleman offered me a seat next to him, as I didn't want to sit where I could not see my kids , did the stewardess come to express some remorse and excuse the engineers behaviour.
If I could give 0 stars I would. I've been all over the world using every imaginable airline possible but this takes the biscuit. Never again. Never ever ever. It was just too horrible to really put into words properly.
Oh yes, they lost three pieces of luggage on the way out and I was the one chasing and going to the airport everyday to check. The bags came 5 days later. I arrived on a Saturday morning and the bags on a Wednesday. Still not a peep about compensation for the items I now had to go and buy.
