Title: I travel a lot internationally and missed flights and lost baggage are just part of the game. When these incidents happen, you can learn a lot about an airline.  Most will show their true mettle and do everything in their power to fix the inevitable mishap; Royal Air Maroc airlines will not.  Every step of my journey I discovered a common theme: "I cannot help you. You will have to ask someone else." I saw this in Tunis, Casablanca, and JFK in NY from at least a dozen people so I don't think it was the case of a single disgruntled employee.  In the early morning hours on the day of my flight they mysteriously decided to delay a 1505 flight (Casablanca-JFK) until almost 2130 (I suspect they did this because they didn't have a full flight), they threw my entire itinerary off and 18 hours of travel turned into 48 to include sleeping on the floor in JFK. The highlite of the trip was when I asked for a hotel room in JFK. The agent told me that they only offer hotels if the delay is more than 8 hours.  When I informed her it was 9 hours she immediately responded with "would you like the number for our complaints department?"  The second highlife was in Casablanca when the bus driver didnt close the door and one of the passenger's bags on wheels flew right out of the bus and onto the tarmac.  We all got a good laugh out of that one.  In any case, I think this is an airline that has decayed from within and I doubt they will be troubling us for much longer.
qwuub: "Sorry Sir, you will have to ask someone else."

Title:
Flying with Royal Air Maroc was not the best experience and it started off with almost 3 hours delay at the departure in Bissau. Sitting there waiting in the night at an airport with almost nothing to offer.
The first leg of the flight from Bissau to Casablanca was fairly ok but the breakfast they offered was quite poor. Also the tray didn't look fresh/clean.

Finally at the Casablanca AIrport I realized that I had very little time to get to the connecting flight and the security check took forever and was somewhat in chaos. I even saw one woman bypassing the security check and the police just shouted at her but she didn't stop and continued into the crowd. After changing to a shorter queue I finally made my way through the security check and made it just in time to the connecting flight to Brussels.

Also the 2nd leg of the flight was a bit delayed and this time I am happy about that since I might had missed it otherwise. Onboard they offered a meal with chicken or fish and it was quite ok. Alcoholic drinks were for free in the economy class and I had some red wine that was fairly good. No entertainment at both legs of this trip made it a bit boring but I slept a bit.

Finally when reaching the final destination it just got to accept that my checked in suitcase didn't arrive. At the moment when I write this the company has called me to inform that the suitcase has not been located yet. So we will see what happens.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Traveled from Casablanca to New York with my family in August 2013 as it was the only available direct flight from the city. Had to go through the usual hassles at check in but was glad to see a huge new plane. Expected good service, a clean plane and pleasant staff. Found all of it to be missing which was sad. The plane was new but surprisingly dirty. The staff was rude and not forthcoming. Had to be requested a number of times for even a glass of water needed by the children.

Morocco is a beautiful country and the airline can play a big role in bringing more tourists to the country.

Title:
Overview:

Outbound Flight:

I asked for a drink, which took about half an hour to arrive and that was after asking two-three times. Cabin manager was very attentive on the outbound flight and the food was not appealing. Very small pieces of chicken were given to us and rice was bland. Desert was very chocolatey and quite sickening. The side dish wasn't nice and I had no idea what it was. Legroom was good for a 737. One thing that was quite unusual was the staff telling everyone that it was a full flight, but business class was completely empty. I asked if I could sit in business class, but was told that I couldn't because the flight was 'full'. We didn't even have a safety demonstration on either flights. The staff took a very long time serving meals and even longer collecting trays when everyone had finished, meaning that we couldn't get up or strech, due to the table tray obstructing the path.

Inbound Flight:

The inbound flight was better, although not perfect. Staff were more attentive, however the food was worse, with bland rice and dry, chewy meat. We went over our luggage allowance on one suitcase, however because all the other cases were below the maximum allowance, the check-in staff kindly let the suitcase through, with no extra cost. The TV's on the plane were not functioning properly and the quality was poor. The seats recline back a little bit and the arm rests can be pushed up to create more room. The seats seem to be quite a bit higher than the windows, which I thought was unsual for a 737.

Pros:

- Flights were on-time.

- Seats had good legroom.

Cons:

- Ignorant staff.

- Staff were untruthful about it being a 'full' flight.

- Bland food.

I expected more from this airline, especially as the Princess of Morocco owns it... The plane was also very dirty, as the turn-around was very quick from the previous flight, so prepare to have dirty tray tables and find rubbish around the cabin.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Let me start by saying, HORRIBLE. I flew with bad airlines before, but Royal Air Maroc is by far the WORST. From the moment I booked my ticket I knew something was wrong, the horrible customer service, the horrible Planes, The horrible service on the plane, the Horrible HORRIBLE 18 hours layover in one of the worst airports in the world , it was all Just a mess, and at the end, after bribing and paying for my “Free Hotel Room” , and complaining about the Service from the takeoff till the final landing, I got a (60 Euros Voucher to be used within a year).. As If I will ever EVER set foot on one of those planes with this horrible airlines.

I take a 7.5 hours Flight from Montreal to Morocco , My seat was BROKEN, I talked to the flight attendant and he was like “Yeah, we have a lots of seats broken”.. and THAT was it… sitting for hours on a broken seat was SO MUCH FUN, and using the disgusting filthy bathrooms ( I have photos) was another treat, the garbage can was broken, the sink wasn’t working, there was no toilet paper in two of the washrooms, it was soo dirty it was disgusting. Second flight, Morocco to Beirut,

Well.. let's just say that the trip got WAY worse… on my way back with my brother we were assured we have a hotel for our 18 hours overnight stay.. I contacted and confirmed and Got assured twice we'll be getting hotel room the airport.. Got here.. they tell us the hotel is full and they can't do anything.. then someone behind the desk told me go to the hotel and see if they can find you a room there usually is.. i get there and the guy told me yes he can get me a room and I showed him my Royal air Maroc ticket.. he made me fill up a paper and then said i had to pay 60 Euros and then discuss a refund from Air Maroc... !!!???? I was beyond exhausted at this point.. pulled my credit card.. then he objected to paying with card saying sometimes it charges sometimes it doesn't and he prefers cash cause he's DOING ME A FAVOR ;!!!?????? i said i have no cash on me but 20$ .. he said FOR 20$ HE CAN TRY THE CREDIT CARD MACHINE !!! .. he wanted to charge me 100 Canadian i said 60 eur is 87$ Canadian!??? . I ENDED UP paying 60 Euros plus the 20$ BRIBE .. To enter a HORRIBLE DISGUSTING ROOM.. Floor was sticky, the bed sheets had big brown stain.. The pillows were disgusting and one of them was WET.. There was no tv remote.. no covers.. no tissues.. No internet .. and one shared filthy washroom with NO locks (shared with all the rooms) .. ( I have pictures of all of that)
I woke up early morning to two LOUD ladies on the reception screaming at each other.. i went to talk to them and again they said talk to royal air maroc it's not our fault !!
Then, after horrible 18 hours in that airport (Broken Seats, One charging station for all airport, AC barely working, huge lineups for the washrooms), We got on the plane, which was so old, No entertainment systems, no charging plugs, Not even magazines or newspapers, all our gadgets were dead because of lack of charging stations at the airport, we decided to just get the flight over with and couldn’t WAIT to land back home in Canada.... After our meal we click the call attendant button.. No one showed up for 20 minutes until we flagged an attendant down.. asked for white wine.. he asked his colleague (Mr. YOUNES) WHO appeared to get so annoyed by the request and gave us two bottles without looking at us or turning back when we asked him for glasses or cups.. the passenger sitting next to us said (what's his Problem) and got up and got us the cups himself. 45 minutes later... About almost 4 hours into the flight.. my brother asked for wine.. the same attendant YOUNIS became So agitated, made a “Time Out” gesture with his hand and said NO.. FINISHED. And turned around... I called him immediately saying what is your problem why are you so rude he came so close up in my face and pointed at the bottles saying HOW MANY DID YOU HAVE?? i could not believe what was happening and this uncalled for rudeness and said Can you stop talking to us like we're kids?? And be polite and do your job?? We had one in 4 hours and you're not allowed to point your fingers and talk to us like we're BOTHERING YOU... And i asked for his name and he said it hesitantly.. His colleague. Or manager (very nice guy who seemed like supervisor or manager) told him to go get wine.. after that.. he didn't even PASS BY OUR ISLE once.... and kept avoiding me for the rest of the flight.
I work for the Government of Canada,..I travel between 10 and 25 times a YEAR.. I've been on bad flights before but these flights combined have been nothing but horrible.. and the lack of respect and tact at the last flight just made it worse... Right after being stuck in broken seat.. been asked to bribe everywhere in the airport.. told there are no hotel rooms and didn't get air maroc hotel voucher although there were few empty ones that i had to bribe to get AND pay for… And at the end, after filing few complaints and talking to agents and emailing Air Maroc, they offer me a voucher for 60 Euros to be used within a Year.. No real compensation, No real apology, No explanations for their horrible airlines and horrible service…

Title:
Avoid at all prices this ''company''. Attracted by the low prices to fly to Rio, I decided to give RAM a try. I am flying around 10 times a year between Latin America and Europe for working reasons and that was definitely my last time with RAM !

- Very unprofessional staff. During the whole flight, some people were walking around, staying so much time in the place where food is stocked, talking loudly, etc., while the staff would never do anything about it. Even during turbulence's. Incredible.
- Worst was to come when arriving in Rio. ALL passengers that had a stop in Casablanca from Europe either lost their bags or got stolen some things. We were more than 10 people to be complaining ! A Brazilian had his bag opened and all his valuables/papers stolen.
- It was even worse for me and a few other tourists: our bags did not make it !
In fact, I did my 3 first days in Rio without my bag full of clothes. Horrible situation and super annoying. Then my bag arrived in my place, 3 days after making it to Brazil...
- As told by the crew in Rio, I went to buy some clothes and sent a receipt / proof to the Customer Service of Air Maroc. They NEVER answered me ! I sent around 10 emails. They were so fast at answering me when I had questions about buying a ticket but not so much now.

I wonder if they will manage to avoid an accident before going bankrupt. If the pilots are as professional as the rest of the Staff........... :/
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Flew from Marrakech in May 2014. My agent had pre ordered veg meals for two of our party which is confirmed on the paperwork. When the air host brought the food he accused us of not ordering it and said 'not my problem'. He became aggressive and pointed in my face saying 'I am not your slave in the sky'. I was polite and calm at all points during the confrontation but he was clearly trying to provoke me.
My 1 year old daughter was not given a meal as she was 'too young' to qualify. I kindly asked for them to give my meal which I did not take due to being meat, but was refused until I explained there were two meals not used by our party.
On my return I decided to make a formal complaint as the experience was so bad. Unfortunately this is where it got worse!
Having searched for some time I finally found an email address to send a complaint to. After no response for sometime I decided to call the numbers on the sites but they were only sales offices and could not help. I decide to contact the UK office who gave me the details for head office and the name of the CEO.
Immediatly I was contacted by the Manager of Customer Service & Quality Control, Maryam El Boury, who called me to apologise for the experience onboard and the compalint. She assured me that the air host was reprimand and dealt with. I explained I was not so sure as I was not asked to give further information or names of the witnesses I collected from around me. How can you reprimand without getting statements?
Maryam El Boury said that she would like to convince me to use the airline again and offered air miles as compensation. I asked if the miles offered would cover me and my family to make the round trip to Marrakech again, to which she said yes. I asked again for clarity.
Maryam told me that she will email me the details in the next day. After a few days I chased this up and received an email about air miles. It did not make much sense to I replied asking again for clarity that this allowed me and my family fly return to Marrakech... no response. I emailed again, this time I got a message saying the information is in the letter and print. I explained that it did not make sense, but still no clarity of confirmation.
I called a few days later and was told that I was misunderstood and in fact the air miles allowed me alone to fly a sort distance alone, but only after booking and paying for a return flight for the family!! I was furious but told nothing more can be done.
We spoke to the PA to the President, Ms. Soubaa who was also very apologetic. She asked for this in writing and we followed up weeks later only to be told that it was already dealt with and that is the end of the matter. We asked to speak to the CEO and refused... we asked for an email address and refused. We asked how to send an email to him and she replied to send it to her, but she stated it would not be passed on.
I decided to entertain my complain via social media and put the complaint on twitter... I received an immediate response saying they will look into the matter. This has gone on for months and overtime I chase it up the response it almost automated "we apologise for the delay but head office are looking into the matter and will respond soon', but soon never comes.
I look back and think to how things may have been much worse if the air host had succeeded in antagonising me.. I guess it would have been me in great trouble.
Disgusting airline, service and behaviour and advise anyone to avoid them. I feel for the staff associated that genuinely do offer a good service, if there are any?
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: RAM seems to be one of the better choices for getting to small African countries, via Casablanca.  The aircraft was clean and the cabin crew efficient (though lacking a little in friendliness).  The on-board food was OK (usual choice of chicken mush or beef sludge with associated pots of salad and undefined sweet goo).  The transfer at Casablanca is surprisingly easy and the airport there relatively efficient.  The problem with many such flights is often not the airline or crew but the other passengers who may not be used to flying and break the carefully crafted etiquette of international air travel (standing up, pressing the call button, snoring, kicking the seats).
qwuub: A reasonable way to get to Africa

Title: My trip on Royal Air Maroc from JFK to Casablanca was a nightmare.  The plane was filthy (it was the same plane in both directions--maybe they only have one plane for this route).  Flight attendants were all but absent--people dropped food in the aisles and it remained there for the whole flight.  I had my call light on for 25 minutes when I finally got up and looked for someone so I could get a glass of water.  I found four male attendants in the back just sitting around talking with one another.  When I asked for some water they pointed me toward a bottle of it.  No interest whatsoever.  I never saw a smile or heard a kind comment from any of the flight attendants. I also have never been on a flight with so many children and screaming babies.  Neither the parents or flight attendants tried to help or distract the children.  It was complete chaos.The food was awful.  For an airline that originates from the Middle East they actually served ham (forbidden by Islam) and cheese on a stale roll for our breakfast.  The "dinner" had mystery meats, which were supposed to be chicken or beef--neither my husband or I could eat our meals.  The tray tables were broken, the seats would not recline--the selections of films or TV were ancient or just plain silly.On our return trip from Casablanca our luggage went through an x-ray machine when we came into the terminal, then we went through normal security lines, and THEN, we had to wait on-line at our gate while indifferent agents opened every one of our already cleared bags again, tossing and churning the contents of every handbag, carryon, and/or computer case.  We were then all subjected to a thorough pat-down--men out in the open and women put into a little booth that looked like the old-fashioned photo booths with black curtains.  The flight takeoff was delayed for over a half an hour while this nonsense played out.  There was no one at the gate to explain what was going on--all they did was shove us through like cattle.I will NEVER fly another Royal ("royal" what a laugh) Air Maroc flight again.
qwuub: One of the dirtiest planes in the air
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The airplane was not the newest but it was clean and comfortable. The stewards (only men this time) were very friendly, polite and very patient with some travellers! The meals at Royal Air Maroc were delicious and rich. They served couscous with meat, a salad, a sandwich with cheese, a desert and coffee/tea plus the additional beverages. Compared to the German airlines or the possibility to fly with Ryan Air, i would prefer to fly with Royal Air Maroc again!

Title:
We used it for a return flight Amsterdam - Casablanca. Quite a good choice. The first flight got cancelled 2 weeks in advance, and we were rescheduled for a flight 2h later on the same day. They sent me both sms and mail to advise, and the day before they even called me, to be sure I knew. A bit surprisingly, the service was speaking only French. I was fine in understanding French, but a bit weird for such a company.
In the check-in online you can select your seat for free (nowadays you cannot anymore with alitalia!). Allowed luggage weight is pretty high. Meal on the flight was OK (we like Moroccan food!). No entertainment, but it's still a pretty short time.
All in all, I would use it again.
qwuub: Good way to get to Morocco
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title:
I took this flight due to the price and wasn't disappointed.
It was a 3hr flight from London to Casablanca, a 6 hour layover followed by a 4 hour flight to Accra - both flights were on 737-700s.
I'm not the tallest (5"10) but was very comfortable legroom wise on both flights.
The service wasn't the friendliest I have ever experienced but everything was done with a smile and the crew were helpful enough.
The food was, again, not stellar but very acceptable. You'll get a hot meal at the very least as well as a full drinks service and teas and coffees.
Don't let any potential long layover put you off, there are places to sit, eat and shop in the airport as well as a transit hotel (-€40 for a short stay). There is very strong, quite fast free wifi for 3 hours per device so you can easily pass the time.
Overall, I was very pleased with the experience, not 5 star but you are paying 3 star prices.
crvsd: Kobi A wrote a review Aug 2016
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Couldn't fly from southern Spain (malaga) to Casablanca without connecting through barcelona or Madrid and burning up a lot of time and more money.  It happened that Avis allowed me to drop the rental car off in Gibraltar and I wanted to see it anyway so I booked a flight from there.  Cost was about 1/3 of those out of Malaga. Originally had planned to take a ferry from Tarifa, then train to Casablanca.  Would have had to drop car in Malaga, bus to Tarifa, ferry to Tangier then train to Casablanca and then all taxi fares in between.  The entire trip only took about 1.5hrs with a short stop in Tangier and then a train directly from the airport to downtown Casablanca.  Airplane was almost empty and service and friendliness was good.
qwuub: FLIGHT ON TIME, REASONABLE PRICE, PLANE ALMOST EMPTY

Title:
I called the customer service of royal air maroc for a simple question and the lady on phone was just so rude I had to write this review. All I was asking for was a basic information I needed before booking my flight , I was not calling to complain or to demand anything.
When I checked online travel websites the cheapest flight to my destination had a 20h layover, the information about transit visas is not very clear on their website and all i wanted to know was if i could get a transit visa at the airport that would allow me
to leave the airport during that period or I needed to get a visa from the consulate before flying.
I wasn't asking any favors just information so that i didn't end up having to sleep at the airport.
The woman I talked to after listening to the initial request put me on hold while she asked the question probably to someone else but when she got back on the phone was not clear in her answer to my initial question and just talked super rudely without letting me speak so that i couold clarify my request , it's not like i expected her to do anyting and than at the end she just hung up on me.
I did finally find out no thanks to her that no you can not get a visa on arrival for my nationality as i'm not european so i guess i'm flying another airlines.
I mean even if you have a negative answer to someone's question , it's just information and you can use a more polite tone of voice !
They really need to train their personel better before losing more customers !!

Title:
Recently travelled to Benin, West Africa to meet client and I had to use Expedia for flight booking as the Royal Air Maroc site is so difficult to make and confirm a booking!

The flight itself from London Gatwick to Cotonou with a 5 hour wait in Casablanca then onto Cotonou was okay, service was reasonable and I would say that overall I would use the airline again.

Seat was roomy although it only reclined a little making it difficult to sleep.

The food selection was pretty good too and the staff were for the most part friendly although not all of them.

My suitcase was badly damaged on the outbound flight from LGW to Cotonou and when I tried to report it in Benin no-one wanted to assist, language was also a problem as no-one appeared to speak English though that is not their fault, when I landed back in Gatwick I tried to report the damage however again no-one wanted to help, even the agent at LGW, GBS (Global Baggage Services) told me to go online and 'fill in a form'

Overall good value with reasonably good service from staff in the air, however ground staff not particularly helpful in any country.
crvsd: Rob B wrote a review Jul 2016
qwuub: West Africa via Casablanca, not great but not bad

Title:
I booked this mission trip to Liberia before reading all the worrying reviews online. Of course, I was nervous on reading what others have said, especially when we couldn't check in online - presumably due to a technical glitch since all went smoothly from our arrival at Heathrow onwards. In fact, for our part, we couldn't fault the service. Unlike our dreadful experience when flying to the same destination with Air France a few years ago (all four separately checked in suitcases lost in Casablanca), there was no lost luggage, friendly check in desks and flight attendants, decent food (the veggie dinners were cold on the outbound flight, but at least we GOT them, unlike the unforgettable Air France experience).

When we had to change our return flights subject to a delay in receiving our mission goods at customs, their office in central Monrovia was very helpful, especially Zoe M Nuinoe who found us the best price for our return journey.

All in all, the flights themselves were perfect, and we were seated next to the lovely UK Ambassador for Liberia on our outbound journey. If it's good enough for him, it's good enough for us!

I would have given Air Maroc five stars, but for the technical glitches. Not only is it difficult if not impossible to check in online at times, but even signing up for their loyalty card is so frustrating that most people give up.
qwuub: Feared the worst, yet got the best
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I flew with Royal Air Maroc from Nairobi to London, via Casablanca in April 2016. I spent a lot of time emailing them before to ensure that the meal I paid for would be something that I could eat (I am a Vegan) After much discussion as they didnt know what a vegan was (!) They agreed to the meal. On both flights they didnt have any dietry requirements recorded for me! The staff on board did the best they could to gather me bits to eat, however for such long flights it just wasnt enough. On my return I emailed their customer service team, who eventually gave me the contact details for their complaint department, who after I have emailed about 4 time, I still have had no reply. I have also contacted them on twitter and facebook, still with no reply. Absolutely disgraceful customer service. If you have a food allergy or dietry requirement, I would avoid flying with this airline!
qwuub: Terrible Customer Service, If you have a food allergy do not risk flying with these!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Travelled from Rio de Janeiro to Casablanca. When I got on the aircraft I thought the aircraft had actually just arrived from Morocco. Turns out it had just come from Sao Paulo, an hour's flight. Entering the cabin one could be forgiven for thinking that there had been a wild party. Pillows were lying in the aisles, on the floor, squashed into the seats, and blankets were lying allover the place, with plastic cups and other trash stuck here and there, and used head sets thrown about. Disgusting......did it ever occur to anyone to clean the aircraft?
When most people had boarded, there was an announcement that everyone should take their bags from the overhead compartments. Most people had no idea what was being said as the announcement was in Arabic and French. Apparently another passenger had forgotten a bag, so the cabin crew was looking for it. They found one that nobody claimed, and a stewardess was taking it away when a Moroccan guy said it was his. She let fly at him verbally like I have never seen anyone and was shouting and ranting at him.
The food was appalling. The bread roll was hard, the margarine tasted like industrial chemical, and the coffee was nauseating. The main meal was marginally better.
Eventually the crew disappeared after the meal, and were rarely seen again unless passing into the business class cabin. Stretching my legs down the back, I spied a trolley parked in a corner with juice and water and soda and plastic cups and half opened bags of pretzels. It was self service. I was not aware of any announcement that this was available, but we did help ourselves.
The cabin crew was singularly disinterested in doing its job-it was almost as though it was a nuisance to deign to work.
Maybe these guys are poorly paid? I have no idea but I'd fire them on the spot, and give the job to some young Moroccans who would relish the opportunity of international travel. They really let the airline down, although possibly the airline has let them down.
Next day I flew to Lisbon with RAM...boarding was chaotic, and once on board, there was a technical problem, and the AC was turned off. It was 38c outside, and within a minute people were calling for the AC to be turned on. The crew ignored everyone,until people got up, whereupon they opened the rear and front doors to allow a draught through.The also began to offer people cups of water. There was one particular steward, who when asked something in Portuguese by a passenger replied in an angry tone" Talk English I don't talk Portuguese". The passenger shook his head, and the steward muttered a profanity as he glanced at the guy. Incredible! Again, if you don't like your job, quit. Having said that, the head cabin crew member was incredibly courteous and attentive-a passenger in my row was acting strangely(stress?) aad she gently asked him if he was alright, and she watched him each time she passed by. The second male flight attendant was very pleasant and courteous.
I wonder if a national airline is reflective of the country that owns it? Very possibly, but someone seriously needs to teach many of the cabin crew how to deal with the public. With the exception of 2 staff, the others really let the airline down...but then,does the airline support the staff?
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Nowadays, there aren't many options to travel from London to Sierra Leone with a decent level of comfort for a reasonable price.

Royal Air Maroc flies on convenient times (although the four hour lay-over in Casablanca is not ideal) from both Gatwick and London Heathrow.

The booking platform on the website, and subsequent online check in is actually very convenient and gets you ready for your trip in no-time (loved the option to add your boarding pass to Apple Wallet).

I'd say, that's where the experience stops. We've had to call customer service to change our flight and the person we spoke to was plain rude.

The planes are old (to say the least) and the staff's English leaves a lot to be desired. The plane smelled like it had been smoked in when we got on board. Food onboard is terrible, so I've decided to skip.

The Casablanca airport is not great (rest rooms are shocking), but the Paul's restaurant is a good spot to spend your time waiting (with decent WiFi for aprox. 1.5 hrs).

Upon arrival at the Freetown Lungi airport, one of my bags turned out to be missing. It arrived the next day. According to the officials this happens all the time, so make sure to pack some clothing and toiletries in your hand luggage.
qwuub: Nothing royal, but gets you there.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I have to fly this airline due to the city I have to travel several times this year.   I needed assistance due to recent knee replacements.  Do not fly this airline if you need assistance.  I had to walk to the airplane on a few trips and climb the stairs without help even though I was told when I booked the flight I would have help.  One trip the toilet over flowed with water running down the aisle.  The cabin crew just relaxed and ate doing nothing about the situation.  I am giving this airline two stars because it has always took off and arrived on time.  Also, except for the one flight the cabin crew have been outstanding trying to help me and were very kind.  I would not fly this airline if I had a choice.  Lack of security is also a big concern I have concerning the airline.

Title: flying to Dahkla  is not something many people from outside the area do. I had a unique experience with Air Maroc what I was taken to task by a young male flight attendant for fastening my seatbelt prior to my being instructed to do so. it was painfully obvious I had far more experience flying than he had. the training he had received was clearly inadequate and he as a young man insisted on asserting himself in a situation he was clearly unfamiliar with heaven forbid that he had to actually perform in the event of an emergency I returned to Madrid on Air maroc which was significantly better  but domestic service in morocco is as bad as it gets

Title:
We arrived at Casablanca airport 2 hours before our flight was due to leave, only to be told that it had already left, because it had been changed to an hour earlier. No one had contacted us telling us this was the case. Many others were in the same position. Our flights were then transferred to the next flight, which was in 6 hours time.

Obviously, we thought the least the airline could do was give us access to the VIP lounge area, considering they'd completely stuffed up.

We inquired with a male manager at the check in desk, who literally put up his hand, said 'shh' and proceeded to text his friend on Viber. When we told him what we sought, he just said, 'no, it is impossible'.

We then found a female manager who was much more gracious and competent. She arranged for us to get access to the lounge, and had our special case entered into the airport's online system so that our position could be verified at the lounge front desk.

When we arrived at the lounge front desk, the woman waved us away saying, 'only business class, not you'. We explained our situation. She cut us off, telling us 'no'. She told us to 'go away' and proceeded to politely serve everyone but us. We literally had to stand there, being blatantly ignored, as the 'worthy' people were seen to.

We stressed that we had been granted access to the lounge because of a major imposition at the airline's fault. She once again, incredibly rudely, told us that we could not come in and that we had to leave. Finally, after we refused to leave, she called the manager to whom we had referred this entire time, who told her that yes- of course we had access- it was detailed on our ticket information on the online system, as we had said.

When the lady realized she was wrong, she literally threw our tickets at us, and said 'you can go in'. She was truly horrible.

We are incredibly unimpressed, and will never be flying with Royal Air Maroc again.
crvsd: Maddy G wrote a review Jul 2016
qwuub: Truly awful, rude and incompetent service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: Tragic folks, the Royal Air Morocco people are and it's a shame because Morocco is such a beautiful country with so many beautiful people! Along with passport control (I am an American citizen) in the chaotic Casablanca Airport, they basically kept me from boarding my plane even though I was early to the airport and on time for the plane (the plane itself was even 30 minutes late in departing..). Then they promised me a replacement flight for the next day and hotel accommodations overnight. They came through for neither, trapped me in their airport for about 24 hours and then finally made me purchase the replacement ticket at three times the original price. It was the worst travel experience I have ever had; not surprised that it comes from just about the most polluting industry on the planet!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
T4 at LHR was great - really empty. Check-in was slow but eventually seen then found a business lounge air side which was great. Flight to Casablanca was OK - got an aisle seat. Bag wait and passport queue at Casablanca was not good but expected. Not run well - worse to come on the return.
Way back - totally pants from start to finish. Big shoving queue to enter the terminal where only travelers are allowed in - not a bad idea but not good when they surround the entrance and prevent travelers getting in. One Xray machine = long queue and lots of bad people pushing in thinking they are somebody special. Nearly had to tell a guy off who kept ramming his trolley into my legs. Two stern looks put him off eventually.
Check-in - totally dreadful - slow and at front of queue with one hour left and needing the loo. Billie-no-stars on check-in did not know his job and just took ages over everything. Eventually done and off to security and passports - passports seen 4 times, all separately. That took ages. Then finally into T2. needed the loo but, get this, only 2 toilets in the whole of that terminal and a queue. Another 15 minute wait with crossed legs. By the time I had had my pee (just two cubicles available, no urinals... and very unpleasant) the flight was boarding but bused to the plane. All in all avoid this airport. Worse than Charles de Gaul if that is possible. Flight back good, T4 again fine.
crvsd: Julien K wrote a review Jun 2016
qwuub: London Heathrow T4 great but Casablanca the worst airport possibly... in the world
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
ROYAL AIR MAROC
Pilots are allowed to smoke all they want on board the flight in the cockpit, and they keep the cockpit door open, to share the 2nd hand smoke.
It's a 4am flight. We have not slept all night. Every time I try to sleep I'm awakened by a sharp headache, and the inability to breathe
I'm allergic to smoke. Cigarette Smoke gives me headaches, my eyes burn and tear, my throat hurts, and I can't breathe. I suffer!!
The crew, with the exception of one, don't even apologize or do anything. They just say, he's the captain, and there is nothing to be done.
Go ahead and suffer... He's the God on this flight...
So the passengers can suffer, because the captain had to have his smokes!!!
qwuub: the CAPTAIN SMOKED DURING THE FLIGHT!!!!

Title:
Good airline connecting NY to Morocco. The seats were comfortable and the entertainment onboard good. Food was average and didn't have vegetarian offering. But cannot complain, since they let us checkin 2-bags and didn't charge for seats selection or meals.
Would fly again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: The flight was overall satisfactory.  As far as I know, it is the only non-stop flight from Morocco to the USA.  I would take this flight again for this reason.  There are several problems with Royal Air Maroc. (1) The website is totally inadequate.  You cannot check your reservation or change it. (2) There are no special meals, e.g., gluten free.  I could not eat the food since I have an allergy to gluten. (3) You cannot check in online.  (4) The information on the boards at the airport was wrong -- wrong gate.  They knew this & did not change it.  (5) The WIFI did not work in the VIP lounge.  (6) The speakers were very loud in the VIP lounge and in the main terminal. It was unpleasant. (7) On a flight to the USA they had no newspapers in English.  (8) The security process at Casablanca was uncomfortable, crowded, and inadequate. (9) The Business Class seat was not comfortable & was much inferior to a regular Business seat on a main airline. (10) The seat belt was too short.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I usually do not write reviews but this has to be the worst service.  They have left my luggage twice now and recently my luggage has been delayed  4 days after I arrived at my destination. Title: Warning, flight was late leaving Agadir, entry gate and airport spotty security, but ticket agent was good to excellent. They wanted E 50 for third bag, so instead of check we carried in aboard. Good thing, got to Casablanca late, us and about 12 other people, we got off plane, bussed to terminal, then down to gate, back by bus which they had held, back to same plane.You guessed right, bags could have stayed on plane but were brought to terminal baggage claim we left . Got to Tanger, Tangers, either spelling and no big bags. told they would call be in probably on last flight , midnight, no call, we called next day, spoke same guy had not located bags.  Talked to another passenger he knows airport personnel, this happens to him so often that he has become "friend".  Called in Afternoon had located bags, same drill, next day that's 3 now, bags are coming, we called next day bags are there, but no delivery, have to make arrangements, or wait.  Hired transport, for large bags and selves, took paperwork, passports, claim tags, and went on day trip to airport. Cost normally 500 MAD.Got to airport, security problem, no airplane ticket except used one, and baggage claim, passports. Then only wanted to let wife go, for two big bags , one was mine, finally waived me thru, no one around, so whole staff of security knew we were coming, baggage claim agent not at office now 4 in afternoon on 4th day.  Security and others now knew our mission, second security check point called baggage office, no answer, security then went to get keys for our baggage prisoners, got bags, sent bags thru x-ray on way out, no flights, so out gate close, then security opened it.  Our transport had waited, paid the parking fee and we fled.
qwuub: Pack as if your bags will be lost

Title:
flew twice internationally to Casablanca - both time my luggage had been lost. First time it had arrived next day apparently, but for the week afterwards I could not get it - because the representatives of the airline could not locate it! When I got ballistic finally and decided to file a claim, I had been admitted to some manager, who had immediately located my suitcase - it had been on the shelf all that time!
Next time I had been travelling to Laayoune with a stop in Casablanca for a day. Despite all international rules my bag had not been issued to me to pass the Customs in Casa - it had been delivered with my next flight right to Laayoune - where there is no Customs...
My Moroccan colleague also avoids flying this airline - essentially for the same reason.

Title:
On Feb 12th, I was booked to travel to Marrakech under Samuel Springer. I was awaiting an appointment with USCIS for my US Citizenship of Naturalization. The date was unknown, so the flight was booked at the going affordable price. After acquiring my US Citizenship of Naturalization, my name was changed to Samuel Fitzgerald, which was reflected in my new US passport. Expedia was unable to change my last name on the ticket without approval from Royal Air Maroc (RAM).

RAM communicated that providing satisfactory proof of my name change on the day of the flight would have allowed me to board the plane. However, at JFK airport, RAM reviewed my identification documents confirming my legal name change but still insisted that Expedia updated my ticket to match my passport.

However, RAM refused to cooperate after Expedia continuously requested the authorization necessary to refresh the ticket. I was then forced to cancel the ticket with no refund, and purchase a new ticket for USD $1,204.11.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I prayed for the first time in a flight. I needed a short flight to return to work in Angola and R. A. Morocco had the shortest and cheapest option.
THE STAFF: The staff was somewhat rude and had wrinkled or dirty shirts. At one moment one of them dropped the a food item he collected from us and instead of picking it up he kicked it under a seat.
THE FOOD: PASS IT! BRING YOUR OWN!
THE AIRPLANE: the airplane was OLD and had tags of the Air Italia on their seats (second hand maybe?). The sound system was faulty (very loud) and the lights would not dim during the overnight flight. There is no flight entertainment. I found an employee taping the emergency light strips to the ground when we boarded. One of the bathrooms had the doors tapped and not operational. Quite a few chairs were dirty, broken, not straight, or could not recline.
THE PILOTS: a special thank you to them for taking us to our destination safely.
I do not plan to fly with them again and DO NOT recommend it for people flying to Angola.
qwuub: Air plane was old with broken chairs and ill mannered staff
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:

Title: Not sure whether I should credit Royal Air Maroc or Boeing for this! The flights - on a 787 Dreamliner - were great. As Boeing promised there was barely any jetlag, the atmosphere seemed much more congenial, the window shading was wonderful. Must credit RAM for the generous leg room, comfortable seating and very good entertainment system (even though it was not working at my seat on the outbound flight!) Food was not gourmet but appropriate to our class of service. Ground service was good. Nice check-in people. They boarded at JFK with no reference to our row assignments but it did not seem to make much difference at all. Was not that pleased with the overbearing security people at Casablanca - happily taking the water bottle I has JUST purchased, beyond immigration, and  smashing it on the floor behind them and appropriating tiny shaver cartridges and AA batteries. But only a few days after my CMN-JFK flight  Paris happened so perhaps I should not be too critical. Back to the airline - it was all excellent or at least good. And the airline provides a pleasant and quick way to get from the US to Morocco without unnecessary layovers in Paris or London or elsewhere in Western Europe and is certainly a good choice.
qwuub: Flew from US to Morocco and back on Royal Air Maroc
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: A very short 30 minute flight, no time for services. Old plane and strange extra hassle and fuzz by the crew and fellow passagers. Did not give a very professional experience. Cultural difference?

Title: I had a very long flight with Royal Air Maroc from Montreal to Casablanca, to Dakar, back to Casablanca, then to Praia, and finally Sal, Cape Verde in January. I asked and was authorized to eliminate an unnecessary return Casablanca-Dakar portion before departure at the Dorval counter (in retrospect, I should have asked for that authorization in writing!); I was  simply told to collect my tagged luggage and check it in again in Casablanca for the last leg of my trip. Firstly, my brand new Roots bag had a cut about 3" long, clearly made deliberately with a blade in one of the side pockets, which I got no apologies , nor any offer to compensate from the Company when I showed it to them. Then, when attempting to check in again as per requested, I was told it was not allowed and I would have to buy a brand new ticket! Then,after I argued and called the supervisor, he maintained his story about my flying itinerary supposedly being illegal, but claimed that he could arrange to bypass it and issue me a boarding pass if I was prepared to pay a 'cash penalty' of first 500$, and then in the end 250$, which was to be paid in nothing else but $, and upon departure at the gate!Well, sure enough, not only did the guy catch up with me and demand the said $, but when an unaware colleague of his let me through since my boarding pass was in order, the culprit sent another attendant colleague chasing me down the stairs to the shuttle bus to press me for that $ again, until I made it clear to him that I was categorically refusing  to pay any penalty in cash without an invoice & receipt and a credit card option, to which he finally let me go... Unbelievable but true!
qwuub: Look out for bag cutting & attempted  extortion if laying over in Casablanca Marocco!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I flew 4 segments on Royal Air Maroc last december. Check-ins were fine, they did not mind about a small extra weight on the checked volumes. All flights were good, no delays and easy boarding. The problem is not the company, but the airports and their officials in Morocco, they are too slow. The first 2 flights, short hauls, had no meal, only beverages, even on business class. The medium haul with a stop in Munich was made on Embraer EMB195, a very nice brand new airplane. Food was about average on both legs.

AT469 DEC14 07:55 Casablanca (CMN) to Ouarzazate (OZZ) // AT441 DEC27 05:00 Fez (FEZ) to Casablanca (CMN) / AT220 DEC27 11:15 Casablanca (CMN) to Moscow (SVO) via Munich (MUC).

Company website is very basic and not very friendly. Could use some improvement. Connections are not easy, even when flying from major cities in the country, you need to wait 4 to 6 hours for your next flight.

Overall experience was good. A small company with a modern fleet trying to do what they can in a poor country with very little infrastructure.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
They have never let me down. On the last trip we were on time, the crew was friendly and efficient, the food had been revamped too.

The legroom was adequate, especially as I had reserved a seat on the emergency exit. However, the pitch is fine for short-haul even without that advantage.

The planes are modern 737 aircraft on most of the routes I've been on including this one.

Prices are reasonable, although they are dearer than on an LCC, of course. However, the convenience of flying out of Casablanca and into Heathrow makes up for that.

I would certainly recommend them.
